text: These savages forgot the tzatziki sauce on a delivery order for a gyro platter.  How dare you what am I some kind of animal? For shame

Walked In walked out.  Stopped by this place as I've heard people from east coast rave about the food ( name recognition ) . 
Was very excited to try it out . 
Upon arrival I noticed how dirty the seating sections were . 
The food ( tomatoes ) did not look fresh and u could tell they had been cut at the very least 1 maybe 2 days in advance. 
The gyro meat bin where they keep the meat after it's been cut and sitting to be served had almost no meat in it and what little meat there was had been sitting in a pool of oil . 
The energy of the staff was very low , I interpreted this as they could care less bout quality and cleanliness . Just there to collect a check. 
Sorry I will not be Dining here as the lack of care to food and cleanliness come through . 
The saving grace for this Resturant will be the location (heavy traffic ) and name recognition . 
Such a poor example of this type of food.

Nothing special. I was underwhelmed after all the hype. The white sauce is basically garlic sauce mixed with salad dressing, the food is decent but nothing special, and it's on the more expensive side compared to other shawarma places. Not really in a rush to go back.
Tres bon service, rapide. Super bon poulet et gyro, ils devraient juste revoir leurs portions de viande par rapport au riz et ca serai parfait
I have no idea why the staff here works so slowly. They work in slow motion. Even when there are so many people waiting. Must be a technique to get the line so long.
What's the deal it's overhyped! I have high expectations but nothing special ! It's a good try but I'm not coming back

Extremely disappointing experience.   Spent 45 minutes in line to get takeout, and was ultimately not provided with any sauce whatsoever.  The chicken was dry and completely without flavour.  The gyro was a bit better but not in the least memorable.  The portion sizes were also small compared to similar places.  

I was excited to try this place given the hype, but honestly, much better food can be found elsewhere across the city.

Went here during the soft opening and the food and service was excellent! Can't go wrong with the chicken & gyro combo with extra white sauce. This will be my new go-to spot when I'm especially hungry while on campus!
Minus the street food experience of New York,  the food was good. I had a combo plate, beef and chicken. Portion size was large. The staff was friendly and fast service. I will definitely go back.

Walked in for lunch with a friend on a late sunday afternoon and there wasn't a big line. I got the chicken platter and my friend ordered the chicken combo platter. I haven't had such worse food in a while. The chicken tasted awful, the pita was stale and the lettuce wasn't fresh at all. I  am not very picky with food, but this was the worst experience I have had so far eating middle eastern food here in the valley. My friend had the same view and we both were extremely disappointed with the food. Lucky to have not fallen sick after the meal. Definitely not coming back again.

Best gyro platter I'm town! From NY and I've been to halal guys many many times. Same great taste n so happy they are here! Easy on the red sauce cuz it's really hot. Been there 5x since they opened just a few weeks ago. Thinking bout their food is making me crave it right now! Go get you some too!

At first when I went (3-4 months ago) their portions were great. Now there's way more salad and their amazing meat is less to see in their plates. It's definitely a place to try, and a new taste compared to all the other repetitive Arab food stores nearby. Overall great service. Their larger plate is very hard to finish; if it's your first time try the smaller one. Jalapeños add a great taste to the plate too.
Very disappointed. Once you run out of the hot sauce you're basically left with a meal you can find at any cheap Greek place for half the price. The white sauce is bland. Way overrated.

Almost 10 years ago when I went to NYC, I remember being amazed that there was a halal cart on nearly every street corner. Unlike here in Toronto, back then we would have to go to a local Canadian Tire for street food. Although I've never tried 53rd & 6th, or any other location of The Halal Guys before, I did try the competing carts. The first chicken over rice with white sauce I had was so good that I had it nearly everyday that I was there. It was that addicting. I can't say the same with The Halal Guys TO.

I was in the area a few hours ago so I stopped by to get a regular combo (chicken & gyro) platter to go. I found it to be just ok. They were cooked well and I didn't find it dry. What really made it was the white sauce as it goes well with it. I also preferred the chicken over the gyro since the gyro had the taste that you would get tired of eating after 2 bites.

The portion was small and it was overpriced for the value that you get. I wouldn't go out of your way to go here as the food is ok at best.
Generous portions, good food and great value for the money! Highly recommended! I got the chicken wrap and it was filled with juicy delicious chicken! Their white sauce is phenomenal!

Great gyros and chicken! Great food and great prices! You can't beat what you get for the price. 

The white sauce is great! Always ask for extra! Now the red sauce or the hot sauce is very very hot! It is tasty but be careful it is HOT! Now understand I can take heat and this stuff is very hot!

Yes, I am an addict of gyro and halal food..that is the only reason I believe I gave Halal Guys of Montreal couple more try. I believe its their service, amount and etc you get depends on who serves...

If I get one with extra meat I can enjoy their food on lunch and leftover for dinner ($18CAD). If I get 2 regular for me and my better half for lunch, then just me for dinner.

Quality of their food gotten lot better over time. Minus 1 star for price.

Had to try this place as I am a regular at Boustan and shwarmaz. Ended up waiting in line for about 30 min which was expected as it was the second day after opening. 

I order a chicken and gyro wrap, a gyro wrap and a large chicken and gyro platter to feed 2.

Unfortunately I have to say the wraps were really a hit or miss, for $7 a wrap you would expect a pretty stuffed wrap.. Wrong I got about 1/4 of meat as expected and a whole lot of salad. Portions were very inconsistent, however the taste of the gyro meat was decent. Stick to the platters and hold off from the spicy sauce!

I'll have to stick to my shawarma special or boustan creation for a few months until the halal guys get their stuff right.
Gyro plate is delicious and not on the heavy side. Beware of the hot sauce though, it's extremely hot!

I was really excited to relive my memorable NYC experience of a few years ago. Sadly, I was extremely underwhelmed and disappointed that they don't live up to my memories.

I ordered the regular sized gyro and my boyfriend ordered the combo plate which has gyro and chicken. The plate comes with more rice and salad than meat, and some stale pieces of pita bread. The meat was tasty, but a tad on the dry side. They give you that white sauce, and a smattering of hot sauce. But neither of those were enough to add moisture to the meal. I remember the white sauce being so amazing in NYC, that someone stole a whole bottle of it right off the food cart when I ate there.

The place was packed, and the air conditioning was on full blast. My meal got cold about halfway through, due to the extreme temperature. For the price they are charging, I was expecting a mountain of meat, but I finished it all before all the rice and salad was the bulk of the plate. Iceberg lettuce and tomatoes does not a salad make.

No offense to the franchise, but the NYC food cart experience is unparalleled.

Love this place. Very simple menu but great bowls that I'd go as far to say is the tastiest I've had in AZ. Great serving size and fast prep. I did a combo of the white sauce and bbq- perfect together. I did light sauce since they tend to put a lot on (I think most people would prefer more but I'm more health conscious). Most of the excess calories and sugars come from that white sauce (but it is super yummy). I actually think the bowl without pita and light sauce is a healthy athletic option- good quality calories in a good blend of protein, carbs and fat.  EXCEPT: I wish they made the white sauce with better ingredients- if they used olive oil instead of nutritionally poor oils, I'd eat it way more often (I avoid bad fats as much as I can). 
Definitely still 5 stars and a big plus that they are open pretty late. Phoenix area just doesn't have much in the way of variety in late night food. Cheers

Okay so 

Food was 3/5
Its good but not in any definition special, but then again they market it based on their legendary popular name so that gets our hopes up, no?
So, don't be afraid to give it a try. It's quite decent except for the pita/flat bread thingy smells like plastic and a tad too soggy, but that's minor considering this is a fast food place.

Food portion 3/5 
They need to balance out the amount of lettuce n rice, mine didn't come with nearly enough rice.

Service 4/5 
Quick n courteous, just need to be a bit more clear of the procedure in the sauce section.

Packaging 0/5
My lid was loose ( I told them Togo) so use your best imagination to picture my lunch.

Price: Not cheap, but Arizona experience 25% minimum wage increase in January 2017, not their fault. 

So I probably need to comeback in a few months to give them another try once they work on the kinks.

Dissapointed. Ive seen images of the food on their insta page & looked amazing. I was sad to see how overpriced it was & food tasted blah, no seasoning on the chicken or meat. I was looking forward to this place & it let me down.

If you've never had Halal Guys before, the food is good and filling. The white sauce is delicious and the hot sauce is super spicy. Bought the regular sized mixed meal for $14 (after tax). The reason why it's only 3/5 is because I've had the original in NY. Comparing the two, the NY one is $6 (no tax but in USD) and is packed almost overflowing with food, while the one in Toronto is carefully scooped to have only a specific amount (which is a fair amount less than the one in NY has). I also miss the original lamb/beef mix but now it's just beef, which isn't as tasty.

Well where do I begin! This is not halal. They have no lamb and the food is tasteless! Being from the east coast I feel I have a vast experience with Islamic food! This fast food Islamic type of food they claim to be was so utterly disappointing! I really wouldn't waste your time!! Also, the kids they have working for them unfortunately don't have enough experience to even speak loud enough so you can hear them. I guess I have to go to ny if I want great halal!!!

We tried Halal guys the first time at the beginning of the summer in July. Wow, the flavor was amazing. My wife and I split a large combo plate of chicken and beef and ordered a side of falafel. We flew in that morning without eating breakfast so we were both pretty hungry and that platter and side filled us up, all for under $20. We loved the white sauce (I'm more of a sauce guy than my wife, so I loaded it on) and their hot sauce is very hot! I like spicy but a few drops is even pretty spicy. I preferred the beef over the chicken but my wife liked both equally and I still thought  the chicken was pretty good. The falafel were fresh and hot and very good as well. We got the platter loaded( onions, olives, and jalapenos.) The kalamata olives are excellent so I would recommend them if you like olives. The only thing I wish the platter had more was the pita bread since there was so much food and I like to make a little sandwich with the pita. The next time we ordered the exact same thing but with an extra side of pita. 

The first trip (five days) we went to halal guys twice and we made another trip two weeks later and made sure we hit halal guys again. I wanted to try the dessert but each time I was too full to  try them. We went during lunch time each time and they were not super crowded. The service was excellent and pretty speedy. I feel the value of the meals was awesome especially since it is pretty close to the strip where everything is overpriced anyway. I know on our future trips to Las Vegas we will definitely hit Halal guys.

Super friendly staff. 
Got a gyro in a bowl and while not great it was good and I would have again. Gyro was beef not lamb. Next time will need to order double meat as regular is only ok amount in my opinion. 
If I want a true gyro I would go elsewhere but for a good solid linch I would get this easily.

The chicken platter taste good, however the beef is so so. They raised their prices, but with a local discount is fine. The servers are all very nuce Nd not stingy so I would definitely come back for that!


Skip the baklava its too nutty that it is bitter  and i expect it to be sweet but there was a bitter aftertaste.

First time here with co-workers, received enlightenment that the hot sauce was too spicy so I decided to try it anyways because I like spicy, the sauce was a little bit spicy so I just got jalapeños instead. The sandwich was great and fresh! Will be back soon!!
Ok to good Food...but the lineups are long and you may have to end up waiting an hour almost on busy days.
I have a stomach ache as I'm writing this from the food I bought at this place. The food was absolutely disgusting. I was really hungry so I ate it anyways - bad decision.

Halal Guys has so much hype and it is all well deserved! I went for lunch an had the Gyro+Chicken Platter combo which comes with delicious orange-coloured rice. I asked for diced tomatoes and asked them to not include lettuce. The sauce they put is the main attraction. They have 3 options: hot sauce, white special sauce and bbq sauce. I got the whit and bbq sauce they put on top of the food. Wow was it amazing. It cost me with fountain drink around 13$. Their menu is so simplistic and i enjoyed the seating environment, it's very casual. On top of all the food halal. Quality is high and I will definitely come back. I am a believer. I hope they maintain the quality and service for years to come. Much success and hope they open another location in Scarborough. Highly recommended.

I just got back in town from Manhattan where I ate at the original Halal Guys street vendor's stand. I had to try our local spot for comparison. 

This place would get 5 stars if they seasoned the meat a lot more and were a little more generous with the size of the pita wedges. Also, the pita bread in Manhattan is served hot with a crisp bottom and soft top. Here it is served as narrow, all around doughy wedges. Everything else (aside from the price) is the same. 

It's ethnic food, go heavy on the seasoning guys! If you don't need to swish with listerine afterward, you're not doing it right! People love the original for a reason.
Just like the food from the Halal cart on 53rd and 6th Ave (Avenue of the Americas) in Midtown NY.  A little more expensive here and the portions smaller, but way cheaper than flying to NY!

I'm originally from NY so was very excited to come here.   The place is a well run machine,  always a line up (about a 5 minute wait on a Saturday) but the workers are great, have everything down, and are super quick. Very impressed since it has only been open a few weeks.  The workers were super nice and it was a great feel. 

For me it's some of the best in the GTA.  That damn sauce,  you can't beat Halal guys' sauce.  I had the falafel, it was very good...and again you can't beat the sauce.  But everything is super fresh,  very good rice.  Even the left overs tasted fresh that I had. 

So happy to see the Halal guys in Canada,  had an amazing first experience,  go go go go!

For some reason i remember this place so much better in NYC.  Also they went through 40 orders in NYC in about 30 mins where like 30 ppl took an hour to go through in Toronto.  Food is still pretty good and you get a decent plate for like 13 bucks.  Wouldnt go back again though if I had to wait more than 10 mins.  Not that muchbbetter than other places in Toronto to yam.

The service was fast, the staff were very friendly. They offered us free baklava with Yelp check in. Gyro platter was delicious but beware, the hot sauce is extremely hot! Overall, a clean and nice place for a quick delicious bite.

Firstly, parking, if you drive here from a far place like I did you want cheap parking, the street right next to this restaurant had decent priced parking 2.50 for half hour, you won't find cheaper. Next, I think this restaurant is a bit boosted due to the American locations, it was alright it wasn't the best shawarma type meal I had, you could find better this food was average. Prices are okay not too expensive, average considering plate pricing for shawarma, 3.5 stars for the food, 5 stars for friendly staff and clean environment. Which is why I averaged it at 4. I think they could have fresher vegetables and the food could be hotter then it was. Other then that it was an alright experience.
Great food for game night at home watching the Steelers.  Love the combo platters and Baklava.

As much as I really appreciate the food and sauce of the halal guys but it's really disappointing to learn that they are completely OVERPRICED! 

While in New York, it only costs usd $7 but with full platter, loads of meat and rice... here in toronto, it costs $12.95 with hst , plus it's only half of the portions compared to the New York original store. They are rather petty with its meat (and even rice).

Don't think they are going to last if they don't adjust the portions.

Service was slow because they were understaffed today. But the workers that were there were working as fast as they can and remained friendly and professional. Kudos to employees who can maintain good customer service despite the lack of resources and support! 

Food is always delicious here. My first time having their hummus and it is AMAZING. I want to order a whole jar of that stuff!

Great Egyptian/Arabic food
The food tastes great & fresh 
I had the Chicken & Gyros (Big)  plate  13.29$ you can also have a small plate for 10.99$
It was fresh came with salad, Rice & white sauce ( tahini sauce) Plz Try the spicy sauce (really hot) if you like spicy you will love it. 

I will go back for sure

I tried one at NYC, it's WAAAAYYY BETTER than this one. 

The portion is so little for the price. The meat was dry and the rice is so greasy.

One thing that I hate the most is their service. not sure because it's new, the line is moving really slow. The people who are working on the line are not paying attention to what customer said, so we have to say it 2-3 times and it yet still wrong.

Nothing to rave about. Place is mediocre. Came here during dinner time, not busy at all. Order the combo platter and hubby ordered the gyro sandwich. My combo platter was very bland, had to add a ton of white sauce to make it somewhat edible. The meat was super dry, more like dehydrated meat and the rice was hard no flavor. I have to say pictures look better then it taste. Don't be fooled!

Never posted before but felt like I needed to post about this restaurant. Save you're money, Boustan & Shawarmaz just down the street with authentic sandwiches that taste amazing. But I guess since it's a NYC joint people are excited about this place. Overpriced with no flavour. Nothing authentic about this place. Oh and no garlic sauce?!? And their spicy sauce is too spicy
Halal for life. Still not as good as the original but the employees here are nicer.

I love the food from this place!!:))
However... I have to say, the portion is too small compared to the ones in NY. I understand the CA$ + the rent would increase the price, but I really wished they'd put more rice instead of the lettuce.

I also wished they warned me about the extra charge for the sauce. I ordered to have the sauce on the side (just like how they do in NY!) and realized later that they charge $1/packet for the sauce. If I knew, I would've just had them put the sauce on my plate in store:(

This place was recommended by a friend, as a famous place from New York.   To be honest, I was not only disappointed but suffered hugely from their red sauce.  When I arrived, I noticed a group of four people eating their meal.  I asked them if the food was good. One gentlemen, whose face was reddened by the heat of the red sauce, said. food is good, but do not go near red sauce.  
I ordered combo.  I like spicy hot food and chillies,  and have taken such food all my life.  So I decided to try the hot red sauce, which was labelled such.  It did not have a label, extremely hot sauce or some other label indicating the extent of heat of sauce.   

Heading to the warning earlier on by their customer,  I took, two small drops of the red sauce on one leaf of lettuce.   Upon intake of the lettuce leaf with two drops of red sauce,  I immediately,  started to choke, started coughing, eyes started to water.   

I quickly took some water and food to neutralize this extreme physiologic response to red sauce,  but situation died down only 10%.

I was very uncomfortable throughout the meal,  infact I was coughing for upto 25 minutes after the meal.

 THIS RED SAUCE SHOULD BE LABELLED EXTREMELY HOT SAUCE, USE WITH CAUTION.  Please do not  think of it as the standard red sauce one gets in restaurant. 

Rest of food.  White sauce - great sauce.  Chicken - not great.  Beef - great.  Service - average. Cleanliness -  average.  

This is a small place, seating limited, only four table, with four chairs in each table,  barely any space to move.  Tight space.  Also,  customers could be within a few inches of your table,  while in line for food. I do not like people standing in line, almost touching the table table,  while I am partaking meal.

I am hard pressed to give a rating of two stars and this is because servers are friendly.

Finally this placed opened after months of driving by and seeing no activity!

Unfortunately, I was disappointed by the food. I have had Halal Guys numerous times on my trips to manhattan and was thrilled when i heard it was going to open up shop in T.O. but in the end the food turned out to be so-so. To me, it didnt have quite the same taste as NYC. The portions were smaller than what i used to get in NYC (skimpy on the orange glowing rice and the meat as well as I had the combo platter). The white sauce and hot sauce were as great as usual though. The rice seemed a little under cooked as it was firmer than i liked.
It was decent but for the pricing they charge ($9.99 for a small and $12.65 for a regular) there are better options elsewhere in the city. I may give it another try here but I will still seek them out whenever I hit NYC though.

TIP: I went around 2pm and there were only a couple of people in line in case you want to avoid the line ups.

This is literally some of the worst food I've had in Toronto, hands down. The chicken was tasteless, they have no toppings and the 'famous white sauce' was also pretty bland. Will never go back here, it's all hype. So many better options for middle eastern in this city.
Not as good as the NYC food truck, but good enough for me to remember the city with every bite. Love those food portions (y)

Worst Gyro ever.....just please put the name NYC away....has nothing to do with food cart on 6th Av....you guys close at 4:30 and the meat was pilling up on the grill....it's like you serving dogs....what a shame.

These have been popping up everywhere in So Cal but the lines were always way too long to try.  I accidentally ran into this location while looking for something else.  I'm glad that I saw it because it was exactly what I needed.  I got the combo and it tasted great.  Be warned, the hot sauce is crazy spicy.  The kick is real!  I do well with spicy food but I prefer to go a little mild with this dish.  The hot sauce takes all the flavor away from the food.
Pretty good. One of the better I have tasted in the Tempe area. Not quite up to par with flaming kabob, Phoenicia or hummus Express but I imagine it's good drunk college food at 2 am.

Wish this could be better. I love Mediterranean, but this simply isn't my cup of tea. Basically, you have the option of getting  beef gyros or chicken (leg meat) either in a platter (you make a salad out of it-lettuce, tomatoes, rice) or a sandwich. Hummus is offered as a side. But it's pricey. Portions are decent sized though. 

As for their vaunted sauces, the red sauce is literally fire (and figuratively too lol), but the "white sauce"? I was expecting a decent garlic sauce, or maybe a tzatziki. It's mayo based, which may be great for some folks, but I find the concept disgusting. I went straight with the red. 

The hummus gets a solid 3* too. Not too bad, but not memorable either. It's pretty sad when the best hummus in Vegas is probably at Sababa, which is an Israeli place, and their's is maybe 3.5*. 

But this is typical dining in local LV. You're in a shopping center with 6 restaurants, the arguably best one got shut down last year for almost 100 health code violations, a decent pho place, and soso Izakaya one, and of course, the de rigeur massage parlor. 

If they're going to blow up my Instagram for a month solid before opening, I expect better. Now I do admit to being a snob, and I try to be fair, but this was still a little disappointing.

Not only is the food amazing but the workers are amazingly friendly and funny. The best service hands down from any food chain. Jhonnie was very helpful and generous about the menu options and suggestions! Definitely coming back again

The Halal Guys. What can I say? Wow.
Went here for the grand opening festivities. They were giving out free Falafels for the people waiting in line while the employees came out and chatted with us. Overall, it was a pretty cool atmosphere.
The food though. I've been to the original one in New York and the newer one that opened up in Los Angeles and I can see with certainty that this one is pretty much on point. Food was fresh and delicious, restaurant was clean and tidy, and the service was amazing. Oh yeah, speaking of service, the manager there (I believe she was the manager. If she isn't, promote her), Stephanie, is an amazing individual. She goes out of her way to take care of customers and make them happy. 
10/10 would come again. FUEGO.
Not worth the money. One of the most tasteless gyro wraps I have ever eaten. The meat was dry and there was way more lettuce than there should have been. Lastly, their white sauce is nothing special.
Friendly service! I got the combo platter (half chicken, half gyro) for about $9-something, and it was a great portion of food. The meat itself was somewhat dry, but the white sauce saves it.

My girlfriend and I were excited to go to the hot new restaurant in town and when we got there we had to wait an hour just to get in the door. Yes it was opening day but in a chipotle style restaurant you expect them  to be fast. We were still excited to try it though because we had heard such good things about it and were very disappointed with the food. The white sauce was just mayonaise and they put a ton on and the hot sauce was very good but they put way too much on. The lack of pita bread was quite sad, they give you 3 little peices in their largest meal size and you really need it with food like that. I wont be going back soon anytime soon even with my half off a gyro coupon.

I've tried the combo, falafel platter, and baklava and loved them all. Really big portions so each plate was enough for two meals for me and the $1 extra to get the large is worth it. Ordering is Chipotle style so it goes by really fast. Come in with no expectations and you'll enjoy your meal more.
Don't be shy with the white sauce because each packet is only 60 calories! 
I've been craving Halal Guys often so will definitely be back.

Went on their grand opening day as I have been anticipating their arrival for a couple of years.  Like the first time I had it in NYC, it did not disappoint, absolutely loved the combo platter I got!! Customer service was awesome, food was amazing, so glad The Halal Guys are finally here in Vegas!

The place is easy to find if you're familiar with Chinatown in Vegas. I arrived and it wasn't busy at all. The people there seem to be a bit friendly. A lot of side chatter (obviously not work related) while ordering my food. I ordered a Gyro Regular platter. It was good. The lettuce was fresh and had a crunch to it. The white sauce is awesome and the red sauce is INSANELY hot but it was great. However, my Gyro meat was sitting in a nice amount of oil because it was the left overs and had to be drained a little bit and they hadn't put out the fresh made. Hopefully next time this isn't the same result...

The ordering line starts right at the door - so if there is a small line up you will have to push through people to get in line.  A single plate of either chicken or beef is almost 14$ with tax - 2-3 dollars higher than Boustan or Basha's.

The plate comes with a rice, lettuce and chicken or beef. The is completely tastless. There is absolutely no flavour to the chicken. They load it up with white sauce - so you end up eating a mixture of sauce with tasteless chicken and rice - it was disgusting. 

I rarely ever throw away food - but I took a few bites and threw away the rest. I felt sick to my stomach. 

I word of advice to the owners who are reading this. Do yourself a favour and have the original halal guys from New York come visit your place and verify every step of the your cooking. There is something wrong with your food - it is disgusting.

One of my favorite places to go for my Mediterranean food. I love getting their combination platter. They always give me an extra bit of rice since I don't eat their sliced tomatoes (I feel that tomatoes that are pre-sliced get soggy/lose their flavor so fast and then become bland). They always try to make their food as fresh as possible, which is why I don't mind waiting a few minutes for fresh chicken or beef. It's also a nice perk to get a small discount as well for being a local who buys pretty regularly.  Always enjoyable.  Also,  if you like baklava, their baklava is pretty  good according to the bf. Happy eating! :9
Great food and short wait.  I'd prefer if there were more meat considering the price, but all things considered, it tasted great!  Ordered the Combo platter and would recommend to friends.

After all of the hype, I went in with high expectations. Sadly, I walked away disappointed. The food was bland. The special white sauce was not special at all. The service was good, quick and friendly, but that didn't make up for the lackluster food. Bummer.

You get a choice of sandwich or small / regular platter, chicken / beef or combo. I picked the regular, beef platter, with a fountain drink, came to $16.36. While you do get a lot of food, Overall it was too salty / greasy for my taste.
Cheap meat, under seasoned, white sauce is in a packet - not fresh. Heed this warning, save yourself!

Growing up in Saudi Arabia, Shawarma is sacred for me. And so when I heard about Halal Guys coming to Toronto in the form of an actual restaurant, I was overjoyed. However, my experience at this shawarma place was the worst I have ever had in Toronto! The chicken was bland and felt undercooked, the bread for the sandwich was yeasty and soggy and the white sauce was watered down to the point of being bland as well! The hot sauce was distrubingly hot and the taste was nothing like any middle eastern place. With just lettuce and tomatoes as veggie options with the meat it was an insult to the delicious and well known Middle Eastern dish called 'Shawarma'. Shawarma lovers should stay away from this place at all cost!!!

Love the Halal Guys and love this new branch on St Denise! It's spacious and clean, and the staff are very friendly and accommodating! Waiting for the Halal guys to open in Ville St Laurent where I'm certain they'll be a great success!

A Taste of New York in Montreal! I had the gyro and chicken plate with salad, their signature orange rice, fluffy bread and the amazing white sauce! I loved everything, the meats were tender and juicy and portions were huge, I couldn't finish my regular size plate! The Halal Guys is a must try and definitely worth the long line which move very quickly and efficiently! Staff are very nice and helpful! Only negative thing I can mention in hopes it will improve is the messy dining area and service station where the sauces and cutlery are...it was very messy, sticky and in disarray! Also I wish they would provide small containers to put extra sauce in  instead of taking the whole bottle to the table while others are waiting for it!

Very disappointed. The new management doesn't seem to care about the staff or customers. Nobody is friendly or recognizes repeat customers.  Most if not all of the former crew and staff from when they opened are gone and now nobody really knows what they are doing. 

The one shining star at night is Alex the only person I recognized as being there a while. He deserves a promotion at least he knows the way this brand works.

Had the combo chicken platter.  The taste lived up to its expectations hence the 2 stars!. New York still wins hands down on so many levels (larger serving, free for extra white sauce to go, and way faster service)
My friend ordered a small combo platter and I ordered a regular size, yet the meat portion was the same!
Fountain drinks were flat and watered down!
Disappointing overall experience. If you're coming from new york and comparing the two, prepare to be disappointed!

Generic, low-quality, fast-food. Gyro plate was bland and very salty. Generic and tasteless rice with iceberg lettuce salad. The Famous white sauce tasted like mayo. Hummus/Garlic sauce, potatoes (actually french fries) included for extra, no taboulé! Horrible place compared to Boustan or Basha. Very disappointed after all the talk about it. I have yet to try the original location in NYC.
Quick, clean & delicious! I will definitely be coming here at least once a week  (P.S. Hot sauce is REALLY hot. Like fire in your mouth and other end hot.)

I've had the halal NYC experience and these guys are a disgrace! They not only skimp on chicken and rice but "fill up" the box with an unreal amount of salad - we're not paying for lettuce and tomatoes buddy! Secondly, they are rude and think way too much of themselves! Clearly not coming back here and sticking to my earlier choices in tempe!

Was excited because I moved here from New York and loved the original Halal Guys. Unhappy to report that it's not the same.

Firstly they give you far less meat than they do in New York. Charge me more if you need to but don't be stingy. 

Then they ask for extra money for a packet of hot sauce while allowing you to help yourself to as much hot sauce as you want from a bottle. 

Franchise businesses are not for everyone.

10/10 Would eat again. 
Had the Chicken/Gyro plate (Large)
Chicken - was a bit dry.
Gyros - perfect.
Rice - Nice, but could've gave me more
Pita - Nice.
Sauce - Good
Hot Sauce - Hot

the worst shawrma I've ever had... It's better for them to close their resturant.
I went yesterday with my husband ... we were hungry(didn't eat breakfast) and we wanted to eat our lunch. we ordered the shawerma plate combo. 
bad chicken
so bad rice
semi-good french fries
the salad is just lettuce and if you want to add onion and/or green bell pepper

the one star for the cocacola that I took it cold from the refrigerator not of course for the food

so bad don't waste your time and for sure your money

Saw that there was a lot of hype surrounding the new restaurant opening up so my friends and I decided to try it out. There wasn't a long line when we arrived so we got out food quickly.  Sadly the food DID not match the hype.  The rice like mentioned in another review was sort of stuff. I ordered the regular chicken gyro combo but half the tin was literally lettuce. Considering that you'd be paying $13 there should be more rice than lettuce.  anyways,  the gyro was comparable to the pizza sausage from Pizza Pizza and the chicken was standard. The white sauce was sort of plain like salad dressing.  You're better off going to Villa Madina, or Ali baba and even Jimmy the greek whose gyro tastes much better. The redeeming part of the meal was the spicy sauce. I would not come again but it was nice to try.

This is a prime example of why we should not be deluded by social media craze. The line that span the block, the buzz from my contemporaries, and the streams of unmistakable yellow bags all lead me into a trap. What I got was a $14 mess of flimsy lettuce, that comprised of 1/3 of my platter. Mushy, over salty gyros drenched in their 'signature' white sauce that resembles white glue. The service was quick and efficient, and for that I added an extra star. A nauseating experience.

We were so excited to eat here, waited in line for about 30 minutes. It was so packed, so as soon as a table was free, we sat our kids down and proceeded to check out. As soon as we paid, the manager told us that we couldn't do that next time.  Table reservations are NOT ALLOWED!! Unfortunately, his comments ruined our appetite and became uncomfortable after being scolded for reserving our spot! Not worth it!

Review in a couple of words: It was fine

Went here for lunch as I work just up the road and a couple of friends had been mentioning that it was open and they raved about the NYC location.

Got the small combo platter ($9.99 + tax) which came with "salad" (tomato and lettuce), rice, chicken and beef gyro. I got the white sauce and hot sauce too. 

The hot sauce was hot! I'm okay with hot sauces so I liked it but I know a lot of people wouldn't be able to handle it so order with caution! It definitely has a kick which caught me off guard on my first bite! The white sauce was great but again, pretty similar to other "white" sauces you get at gyro/shawarma places.

As for the meal as a whole, it was good, nothing mind-blowing. It is probably a little expensive compared to other similar establishments around the city. I might try it again in a few weeks, or maybe next time I've had a few beers as I can imagine this being great drunk food.

I've read some reviews about people lining up for this for 30 minutes!? I would not line up for this...

Well i have been to the NY street halaal guys and the tempe version tasted very different. 
It wasn't bad, however the white sauce tasted different ( tasted like just  mayo and ranch). NY one is much much different and yummy!. Also, tempe location do not have lamb, just chicken and beef. Hot sauce is thicker and hotter than NY version which is not necessarily a bad thing. 

Overall, it was good but don't go in with the expectation that itll be like NY.

Halal Guys may be great by New York City standards but in Toronto where the shawarma and middle eastern food game is quite intense and advanced, Halal Guys food is mediocre at best. See below for details...

- chicken is relatively unseasoned
- gyro (beef) meat was good but it's so cooked that it tastes like crispy meat bits vs meat itself (if that makes sense...)
- the only way to get any taste is to overdose on the tahini and white sauce which quite frankly defeats the purpose of the seasoned meat and rice
- rice was good (cardamom flavour)
- their hummus is average at best (nothing compared to Paramount)
- extremely limited menu
- hot sauce will give u an ulcer ... It's just way too hot! 

With some major Toronto based shawarma joints serving really good meats (kabobs and shawarma), sauces (garlic and tahini), drinks (non-alcoholic beer, juices and smoothies) AND proprietary/unique breads (I.e Me Va Me's Laffa bread and Paramount's stone baked unlimited bread), halal guys is too basic for Toronto's advanced tastes... 

They have the hype, but they need to expand their menus and make their core offerings irresistible.. hope they get better, I most probably won't go back till they do.
Got the combo platter. Meat, rice and iceberg lettuce - awful, bland and dry. Ordered a falafel on the side. Was $1 for one tiny piece. Do yourself a flavor and skip this!

The first time I had Halal Guys was at their home base in NYC and while their franchise isn't *exactly* the same as ordering fresh of the cart, it is still delicious and makes me feel like I have a piece of home nearby! Their white sauce is exactly the same, and so is their hot sauce (beware putting too much on your food if you're not a hot sauce lover, it will numb your lips lol). This place is very busy so expect a line as well, and if they are out of something- try a meat you wouldn't usually have, it's all delicious. Rice is perfect, salad is refreshing, and they have extra sauce you can grab from the back if you need more. Check it out while you're in phoenix!

Wondered what all the fuss (read: line-ups) were about - today, there was none so decided to give it try. Glad I didn't wait on line! Beef gyros sandwich: generous portion of meat & standard veg but all virtually flavourless. Way better found virtually elsewhere anywhere in Toronto. And let me tell you why there are lines - it's because their staff are either untrained or don't care to hustle or both. No line when I came in and it took 10 minutes to walk out with a sandwich (all components pre-prepared too I might add) and that was with only two people ahead of me in line. If you're smart, don't bother - unless you like standing in lines for mediocre quality - apparently some people do!

The food is spectacular, They don't skimp on the meat. It has such amazing flavors that my husband who is chef material even loved the food. He actually is willing to go back there, which is a rare thing indeed. The rice was amazing. I very rarely can have rice so it has to be spectacular for me to eat it, and I ate all of it.  The pita was also perfect size, not to much and not to little. I can't wait for them to open up more so it is not so far away from my home. It makes a great date night. I also have never had better service than I did there. The staff couldn't have made it better. They were happy and made everything seem magical. I can't wait to go and eat here  again. If I could give it 10 stars I would.

Not that great to be honest. I was really looking forward to the Halal Guys opening in Toronto after getting it time and time again every time I visited NYC. Sadly, the food here is not near as good as the carts on the streets of New York. Very disappointed.

Very excited that Halal guys opened in Vegas, being from NYC we had high expectations!! We went on opening day all though there was a line didn't wait that long but 20 mins wait in Vegas outside is long esp it's hot as hell outside! Lol 

Food was good enough! The got the combo w/ chicken and beef gyro! If u don't know the original NYC cart serves chicken and lamb you'll be amazed but since we've been eating chicken and lamb for a while know we can tell the difference. Also the rice is diff. Idk Mybe I'm just a little bias since I'm fr NYC. It's also more expensive than NYC, Combo in NYC is about $7 Mybe $8 now. In Vegas it's $10. 

It was good enough to satisfy cravings but def not NYC good hehe! Will still come back tho from time to time! 

Don't forget the white sauce! Be careful of the hot sauce coz it's very spicy!
Best food  love them so excited, reminds me of my east coast. Best Arabic food in AZ.  The employees are so nice and service was fast !

Over priced
Overhyped
Over sauced
Under seasoned

Do not waste your time. Stick to real Arabic food spots around there!

I've heard so much hype about this place in New York that we had to venture out looking for it in Vegas.  When we got there I expected a massive line, but to my surprise and relief, it was empty.  We ordered the half chicken/beef combo platter.  The chicken and beef was good, not too dry with good flavoring.  The white sauce added extra flavor.  I found the pita to be dry, a bit stale and overall subpar.  I would definitely go back for seconds.

Yes, it's as good as everyone says. Now that I live a tiny bit closer to this oasis of meat and rice my rewards card is going to get a serious workout. Whether you've come here to relive your days on the mean streets of NY or you just want to see why people are descending upon this random intersection of Las Vegas at a breakneck pace, I'd venture a guess your first visit won't be your last. 

Platter or sandwich, as long as they're putting that tender chicken or beef (or both) in it along with the veggies of your choice (lettuce, tomato, green peppers, jalapenos for the adventurous diners) it's going to be a win. The staff is super nice and does a great job of explaining what you might or might not want on your plate. The hummus is flavorful and the pitas perfectly doughy and warm. You can get their glorious white sauce on your meal or they even provide packets of it which was a wonderful surprise, cause why not hoard them and start putting that sauce on everything you put in your mouth. It's just that good. The hot sauce would likely start a fire if left unattended so heed their warning on overdoing it and ruining your tasty creation. 

It's pretty close to the strip if you're in town for debauchery and need a hearty meal but they also deliver and the food travels well. Halal Guys gets my very enthusiastic stamp of approval.

On my way to an exam last Tuesday (December 6th), around 11:30am, I saw a dude in a Halal Guys uniform go outside and then proceed to take a piss in broad daylight on Mackay street. He then ran back in the restaurant. Me and a group of people looked at each other like: ''Is this guy for real?''

I thought I'd make a Yelp account just to let people know in case they're thinking about going to this restaurant.

This is the best gyro place in town!! Make sure you got the baklava it's free if you check in with Yelp!
Linda was great!

Food is great... GET MORE PEOPLE WORKING THE LINE AT NIGHT... the line can get ridiculous and I have walked away multiple times because of how long it takes the single person working the line to get through all the orders

Me and my wife stop by and we asked what they recomend the staf says try the combo platter so me and my wife try it and she was right it was delicious the white sauce is so good but listen to Joan about the hot sauce the way she said it explosively hot she is not kidding it is extremely hot good thing she put it on the side...... thank you ladys  you made my day. I definitely come back again on this place

I was so excited that Halal guys came to Vegas! I literally had it as my last meal of 2016. I kind of regret that I did though because it was one of the worst halal guys I've had. We dropped by around 4pm to get 8 orders.

At every other Halal guys I've been to, I noticed that the meat is much fresher. Majority of the time, the meat came straight off the grill. Perhaps this place is slower than others because all of the meat was on the warmer and looked like it had been there for a while. There were even burnt, hard pieces at the bottom of the platter. They also skimp on the rice here a lot compared to others, I asked if they could fill it up more but she said that it was extra which is a little ridiculous. There was no extra rice option on the menu and I have asked before at other locations. 

Overall, portions are smaller and meat is not as fresh at this particular location. I'm sure this meal would taste better the later it gets at night. However, I wouldn't recommend eating this for a daytime meal :/

We were at a baby shower over the holiday weekend that served Halal Guys and it was delicious so we decided to have them cater an impromptu Labor Day family lunch 2 days later. Couldn't have been easier to order. It was delivered right at the time we scheduled for and came with everything we needed and didn't even know we needed like chafing dishes, sterno, serving utensils, individual food signs, lighter, and a well made instruction sheet on how to set everything up. The food was delicious and devoured. Would definitely use them again in the future!

Out of gyro at 10:10... unacceptable. I wanted a combo not just chicken and falafel is not an ok substitute for gyro... being that it is not meat. 

Employees breaking down the line as if they were closing yet you guys are open until 11. 

I've been here like 15 times since you opened and this is not how it's been. 

Almost as if the higher ups aren't around anymore and now it's just like any other fast food place where the workers and managers don't care and want to close early. Or... and more likely some higher up decided they could save money by not making more gyro an hour before they close in order to save money... well how much money are you saving when people leave and don't buy food, because there isn't any to sell?

1 star.

First timer here. Will definitely come back. I had the combo plate with jalepenos. The white sauce was great. The red sauce is ridiculously spicy! 

Overall delicious and will recommend to everyone to check out.

Would love to be able to rate, but appears they arbitrarily decide when they open and close based on the alignment of the sun and moon because every time i try to go it's closed. Advertised open until midnight and have been closed anywhere between 9-11 pm all 4 times I've tried stopping by. I'll just stick w driving to tempe and go to the one that's open at consistent times or just go to pita jingle for my fix.

Bland rice, white sauce is simply ranch dressing. Soggy tomatoes. 

Extremely unclean and unkempt. Not going back again

One of the most overhyped plates of pseudo middle eastern foods in North America, that may have at one time been worth it. Unfortunately, commercialization and franchising has turned this brand into a tourist trap that serves unrecognizable pieces of meat, accompanied by bland rice and tasteless lettuce, smothered in a highly questionable substance called 'white sauce'. If you're visiting this place, especially in Toronto, please know that there are MUCH better options for middle eastern food, within the same price range, and in the same area. Shish Kabab Express at Bay/Dundas, or even the Ali Baba location near Ryerson, to name a few. 

If you're a tourist looking for authentic middle eastern food, find some time to make your way to the stretch of Yonge between Steeles and Finch in North York - you will be spoiled for options! Even if you go to the hot food bar at Khorak Supermarket, you'll be better served.

We came back from New York in May and Halal Guys was one of our favorites so we couldn't wait until this opened. They measure their servings here. In New York they load you up so you have a full platter so for it being a little pricy they don't give you much compared to NY.  I ordered 3 combo platters and a gyro platter. I told the ladies 4 times and they still left out one combo. I ordered 2 sides of falafels at the register and the same lady yelled you should of ordered it back here. She had an attitude. Because I am comparing this to our experience in NY and how we kept craving for more I can say I probably won't crave this one which is why I gave them 2 stars.

This was my very first time trying halal guys ever, and with today's experience I honestly cannot wait to try it when I'm next in Nyc! I split a combo (chicken/beef gyro) plate with a friend, as the portion sizes are huge! The white sauce was really amazing but you are literally able to feel the kick of the red hot sauce at the back of your throat. I personally felt the orange rice was the best part; I would honestly recommend this for  everyone to try at least once. Was honestly so worth the money!

Pita Jungle has nothing to fear from these guys.

Warning signs: It's what should be prime dinner time at 6 PM and there's nobody in the place - no customers, no staff.  We go in to order take-out and it looks closed, if not abandoned, with the shawarma cooker and flat top grills both empty and cold.

A couple of staffers do appear from the back and one methodically fills a couple of $10 chicken-gyro combo platters from hotel pans without much chatter.  (In case you might have forgotten, this isn't Chipotle!)  We have to ask for garnishes, which are doled out in very small portions.  We're offered a taste of the hot sauce - it is very hot, but quite tasty - and get a garnish of babaganoush on the platter, then "famous" white sauce and a little hot.

When we got home and dug in, the finely-chopped or shredded chicken reminded me of tuna salad.  The gyro meat didn't remind me of anything.  The orange (Basmati?) rice was as flavorless as the famous white (garlic? tzatziki? diluted mayo?) sauce.  At least the hot sauce had some flavor and the pita wedges were soft.  It was filling, but nothing else.

Bottom line: We should have heeded the warning of the empty store and headed elsewhere.  For about the same price as HG we could have each gotten 3 In-n-Out double-doubles, 2 veggie-filled footlongs from Subway, or a Filiberto's combo; for a couple bucks more a signature entree from the Pita Jungle just down the street.  Too bad Khyber Halal isn't in the neighborhood.

I've heard a lot of hype about halal guys from east coast friends. I was really excited to hear that they now had one within driving distance to phoenix, az. After making a drive to Las Vegas for the weekend, we decided to save the best for last. On our drive back, we stopped at halal guys. For a place that has chicken and rice as their signature dish, I was appalled that they were out of rice when I got there. Even more, there was a "40-45 min" wait on the rice. How you don't start preparing rice ahead of time as you are getting low is beyond me. Deciding not to wait, we ended up settling on the sandwiches. The chicken was bland and the only saving grace was smothering sauce on it to add some flavor. Needless to say, the hype was not well deserved. Personally, I think that any restaurant establishment can make up for mediocre food by having good customer service. I wish I was able to say that about this halal guys. The place had 4 people behind the counter, but a single person was taking the order, making the sandwich, putting the condiments and accepting the payment. Most inefficient use of manpower I have seen. If the management doesn't take some serious steps to properly train its staff, I can't imagine this place will continue to be very successful just by relying on the popularity of the brand.
The combo platter was excellent. We were quickly greeted with warm smiles by employees more then happy to take our order. I love the fact that this place is open late and I hope to make it back so

Pros

1. Great customer service! Waitresses are really really nice and very accommodating.

Cons

1. Beef Gyro meat was comparable to the process meat the Gyro places (eg. Gyro Time).

2. Chicken was like a typical grilled chicken.

3. The place was so small that you had to eat quick for the others to be able to eat as well after ordering.

4. It was so hot in there when we went (08/15/16) and they had rental air conditioner which was not enough since their grill is open to the dining area. 


2 star tops. I had better kebabs, gyro, and shawarma elsewhere.

Halal Guys cart is always my to-go food whenever I visit New York. Now I moved here, I'm so happy that it opened their store in Tempe. Service is fast, small platter is nice portion for one (at least for me) and the white sauce is the best. I have eaten at least 3-4 times since their opening and I don't think I'm going to stop anytime soon. Chicken platter and combo platter are my favorite.

Seriously one of (if not) the best food locations in Vegas delicious food, awesome service, these guys are the best, my recommendation combo platter with some extra hummus and pita bread you can't go wrong, thanks again guys for the amazing food!

Finally visited Halal Guys in Toronto and it was great! Food was just as good as location in New York.
Prices are in line with the US considering our weak CDN $. Only thing I did not like is that they charge $1 for white sauce to go it should be free.

Will definitely be back!!

Hi Melissa,

I just wanted you to know every time I've visited this store the chicken is very dry, burnt and hard. I really love this company but I'm just really concerned on why the meat is not edible. 

Thanks so much,
Edward

I went in here only knowing that the company started as a food cart and that is got outrageously popular and I guess I can see why!!! Combo platter is fantastic! Gyro meat is absolutely delicious and I have to say that the white sauce was amazing. When I went in Victoria was the best and was super knowledgeable of the food and the background of the company. I definitely recommend.

Submitted an order through Foodora. $15 for a chicken platter. No potatoes with it, but it did come with rice and sad salad (tomatoes and iceberg). I ordered all of the fixings and got none of them, it's like they didn't even read the order. $1 each for maybe a tablespoon of hummus and a drizzle of baba ganoush (super liquidy). This the second most disappointing delivery I have ever had. Bar none this is the worst meal I've had of this kind. Maybe they are better to pick up from in person but I will never know because I will never go there.

I really want give them a 4 star at the first time. But the second visit was not good as I expected. The chicken is too dry and the rice taste not like fully cooked. 
Their service is also, not that good. :(

The food was overhyped! The portions are huge but for the price you would expect more meat. The food was just alright, nothing too special about it. I'm from Ottawa so we can get much better quality food for the same price. BTW DONT GET THE HOT SAUCE!!! It should be illegal, I put THREE small drops on my sandwich and my tongue was burning for hours.

For the price, you're better off going elsewhere for Middle Eastern food. Toronto is full of Middle Eastern food that isn't frozen or packaged. The falafels were so hard and tiny. The service wasn't that good either, considering we went on an empty day. 

Just go to another middle Eastern place if you're looking for a meal like this - something fast, cheap and filling.
Fast and nice service but the food was just a pure disappointment...haven't been to the stand in NY but in MTL i would probably not go back and return to the good old boustan
If you're looking for disappointment you've come to the right place. Service was prompt but the food is devoid of quality.

I have been to the infamous Halal Guys twice now and I am a fan. The Gyro plate is recommended, which comes with iceberg lettuce, rice and of course gyro with a side of pita bread. They give you 2 packets of the delicious white sauce and I thoroughly mix into my plate. There's hot sauce that is extremely spicy but not very flavorful as I'd like it to be.  

This chain is expanding rather quickly, and most people know the infamous Halal Guys from New York, where there is usually a long line to enjoy one of their incredible combo plates. I am sure you will enjoy this location.

What a disappointment! They got it all wrong! The food is less thank ok! Rice and meat was dry. I think they just used the name but forgot to bring the quality that should've came with it.
Staff are very friendly. Store is cheaply made and not worth hanging there. Too bad, was really looking forward to this! Embarrassed I invited colleagues from work to try it out. Would not return unfortunately :(

Not a big fan of this place. The food was just ok. What they call Shawarma is just a chicken wrap and the chicken wasn't too tasty . They don't use the authentic toum sauce and it's just a confused dish. The Babaghanoush was nothing great too. The falafel was better than the meat. We ordered 4 different items on the menu and nothing was really too yummy to mention it .

I came for opening weekend and decided to grab a bite on a Saturday night. I first had Halal Guys in NY and couldn't wait to try it again in Vegas. That white sauce! It is to die for! And that red sauce. Forget Sudafed. Just pour on some of it and it will clear your sinuses in no time! I got the combo plate which had chicken and gyro. So bomb...I can't wait to go back and get my Halal fix.

Pretty meh.  I ordered the been gyro platter.  The service was quick, but my pita was stale.  The beef gyro had good flavor, but the yellow Jasmine rice was bland.  I am not sure how they got it to be such a rich gold color, but I doubt they used saffron.  I couldn't taste any other fragrant spices in the rice either.

I probably won't be back with good choices like Even Stevens and Poke Bowl right next door.

So I've heard of this place from a few friends & family. They made it sound good so hubs & I decided to try it since we were on this side of town. I got the beef plate & hubs got chicken/beef combo plate. I do love Greek food so I had high expectations. I'm sorry to say but it wasn't all too great for us. The meat was a bit tough & rice was a little hard & tasteless. The soft pita was good tho. I tasted my hubs chicken & that tasted okay. Better than the beef. I had olives & that was super salty. Don't know if those type of olives are suppose to be that salty but the juice that was with it turned parts of my plate just really really salty. Good thing it was a small scoop of it. The white sauce made the plate taste a little better at least. The staff was really nice tho (reason why I gave 3-stars). I did a check-in on Yelp & I was able to redeem a FREE slice of baklava. That was good! It was good to try the place out but not a place where I can get a good fix for Greek food tho

Had the combo platter and it was pretty bomb. I made the mistake of adding too much hot sauce. My mouth literally felt like it was on fire! For anyone trying this for the first time, I definitely suggest tasting the hot sauce before your put it on your food because the hot sauce is literally so spicy!

Second visit already... The famous NYC gyro food cart that once began 25 years ago for the demand from cab drivers has made it's way to LV! A quaint location on Spring Mountain & Valley View -- the staff was friendly, the venue was clean & the food was savory! 

FOR HER: 
- Beef gyro
FOR HIM: 
- Half chicken & half beef combo platter

The meal was very tasty, & its true -- you cannot have too much of their "white sauce," which is just so complimentary to the meal. They also have a red explosive hot sauce, which is definitely no joke! Even as a lover of all things spicy, he said this should be used sparingly as it can be a bit overpowering. We also tried the baklava, which was truly made to perfection. The perfect sweetness & size to end the meal! 

PRO TIP: They are open until 4:00AM and are not too far from the Las Vegas strip! Which is perfect for those late night, post clubbing eats! :)
Great food! Rubby provided great customer service and was very attentive to our needs. Thanks Rubby!

This place is bomb! I drive all the way from the other side of town to go here. You cant go wrong with Lamb or Chicken. The falafel is great! Their fries are awesome. The portions are great and for what you get the price is good. This is not a sit down restaurant. They have a few chairs to sit in but its pretty small. Make sure to use very little hot sauce a little goes a long way. Their white sauce is amazing! I highly recommend Halal Guys!

This food is edible and the location is open late which is very convenient. However that's where it ends for me. There is absolutely no seasoning on any of their food making it all extremely plain. This is the most Bland gyro I've ever had and even their frozen crinkly fries lacked any sign of salt or any other flavor. The flavor god seasoning I put on at home was the best part of the whole meal. 

Also, while we're waiting for our food which we ordered to go.. the guys behind the counter decided to make himself a HUGE gyro sandwich for himself and announce that while we waited for our fries to come out of the deep fryer. Super unprofessional in my opinion. I don't plan on returning.

Got the combo platter and mixed it up. It is so good!  Exactly what I wanted it to be. Feels healthy but tastes incredible!  I haven't tried the original in New York, but I would love to the next time I'm out east after reading reviews that say the Vegas version is good but not as good as the original. 

I also tried the baba ganoush and falafel. Both were full of flavor, but not as good as the platter. I will definitely be back... Often!!

The Halal Guys opening in Montreal was so hyped there were line-up for several days. The first time I tried this place, the regular combo platter tasted great but the portion was light, as the staff sparsely filled the plate, mostly with lettuce. Several weeks later, I ordered the same meal but this time plate was more generously filled and the price had dropped; but it didn't taste as good. Serving is rather uneven, perhaps the staff was worried they may run out of food when they were too popular... I may have to go back to check. ;-) Still a decent place for fast Lebanese food, but may not live-up to the original NYC cart reputation.
Good Food but soo disappointed with the quantity. We ordered it via Uber eats and they gave us only half a box.

Stopped in for a quick lunch, and it was so good that I joined their frequent eaters club. Fast, friendly service, and best of all, the food was great!

My husband got a beef gyro, and I had the combo plate. Chicken was good (nothing special), but the beef was delicious, especially with a combo of white sauce and hot sauce. I asked for everything, and while I appreciated the green peppers and Kalamata olives, next time I think I'll skip the jalapenos.

Don't forget to ask for the locals discount. Even though the meal was inexpensive to start with, it saved us a couple more bucks!

Bomb. Combo plate allllll day. Crinkle cut fries are delicious with the tzaki sauce. Bought some hummus to go, ate it the next day with my coworkers and everyone liked it. Will definitely be back for more. Another great thing is this place is open until 4am!!! Keep it up guys!

We came here late afternoon. It wasnt a busy time. Service was fast. We ordered 2 half and half combo platters, 2 beef gyros and 1 beef combo platter. We were already enjoying our first bites when my brother felt something's really different, something really hard. He spitted it out and found a metal piece. He then told them about it and they gladly gave him a new one no questions asked. He wasn't asked to pay and they gave him a coupon but when we checked it out it was already expired sooo... haha 
I checked in too so I got one order of Baklava for free. It was my first time to try baklava and sadly i found it too sweet and too flaky. 
Their hot sauce was really HOOOT even my husband who is a spicy person found it really hooot too. White sauce and bbq sauce were good too. 
I only gave it 3 stars coz though i was satisfied with my order the fact that something not edible was in my brother's combo platter it made the experience a little less perfect.

Giving them only 3 stars mainly because I dont get the hype. It really doesnt deserve the huge lineups it gets. Maybe its better in NYC? While I dont mind the gyro at all , I dont get why they chop up the slices into ground meat. The hot sauce is very spicy so be careful. The platter doesnt seem so worth it as its just rice and a lame salad so I recommend a wrap if anything. Its worth a try if youre curious but honestly not much better than lets say a kojax gyro which is very average.
Sooooooo good! The staff is very friendly and quick!! Love it and I will definitely be eating here regularly!!
The food was amazing! And the customer service was even better. Definitely lived up to the hype
Really good food, but was very little. A combo plate didn't fill me up. But it was delicious.

Their hot sauce deserves its name and gave me a good kick. But besides that, none of the components of a gods sandwich are present. Bread, chicken, beef, lettuce. Everything is stale, without any texture or taste.

I am so glad you guys are finally in Toronto.  I used to drive 7 hours to nyc just to eat your sharma... with that being said..  I was a little disappointed with the quality. The sauces are the same but I feel that the food temperature overall was not hot enough. The chicken could stay can be grilled a bit longer as it kinda taste boiled right now. The portion is almost petty compared to new yorks...I waited about 45 min in line so its not bad at all. Hope the quality gets better because that would make me very happy!

I used UberEats. I ordered the chicken and beef platter with no lettuce and no tomatoes, I added fries. And I asked them to go easy on the sauce. When I received my order I didn't have any fries, there was lettuce and tomatoes included, and they put extra sauce. I already had to wait 40 minutes for this order. 
I called Uber eats, they processed me a refund, they told me that I could get a five dollar discount and that it would be available if I re-ordered immediately. So I did, re-ordered immediately. I waited another hour this time. And when my food came there was no sauce on the food, I still got lettuce and tomatoes instead of all rice. And I got my fries this time, but they taste like they're old, and I don't think fries are supposed to be chewy. Undercooked? It's kind of sad, because I was really looking forward to this place for months. I'm hoping they do something for me to compensate for this inconvenience.

Halal Vegas opened too soon, IMO. I came here at midnight opening day. The staff seemed bit overwhelmed and under trained. If this was a soft  opening it would have been fine, but it was grand opening and social media hyped. 3 stars for not meeting expectations and having very limited seating. 

I've had Halal guys in Socal before. It was great then. For whatever reason, the Vegas one wasn't as good. I think I expected a bigger portion with more meat! Definitely more protein and veggies. I didn't finish my plate (I put in too much red sauce), but it was 90% rice left over. 

The Red Sauce is literally fire like Indian or Thai spicy. Its hella hot. The white sauce was a bit more bland then I remember. 

For Drunk food, I'd pick Halal guys over Pho Kim Long.
Amazing food! My first time here and I enjoyed it! Service was amazing and Anthony provided us with a great smile and servixe!

Being from NJ and working in NY for over 3 years these carts were My go to lunch spot. When I heard they were opening a restaurant here I got super excited and could not wait. I tried to go to the opening day but the line was literally wrapped around the building. 

So I decided to give it a few weeks and finally went yesterday night. There was still a slight line but primarily to Monitor the crowd almost like a club with a bouncer and he also gave a good description of the food and what to expect for the newbies. The line moved quickly though and so did the food line. Which again reminded me of the fast paced NY I miss. 

The food did not disappoint at all!!! I ordered the Combo plate with chicken and gyro (pronounced Euro!!!) with the white sauce and 4 lines of the hot sauce. And trust me it was exactly like back home. The spice of the Hot sauce is not
For the weak hearted but for me it was perfect and well worth the wait. So happy to have a piece of home in the desert.
So glad this opened up in poor area! Very fresh and savory meat.  Tired the combo platter and have to come back for falafel and hummus.

not bad for a quick fix. Everything is already made and laid out. I had the beef gyro platter with a side of hummus.  He had chicken. Both were tasty. Added bbq and white sauce, but that red hot sauce was super hot! cleared my sinuses.

I came and lined up an hour before the grand opening on Friday May 5th. It was a cold, windy and rainy morning. There were at least 30 people lined up ahead of me in the rain, they probably came 1.5 hrs before the opening or maybe even earlier. The wait seemed to take forever since it was so cold and wet out. Luckily I found 1 glove inside my coat pocket and put it on the hand that I held my umbrella with. Its not their fault that their opening date happened to fall on a cold and wet day. They were nice enough to give out umbrellas to those who didnt have any! I took the day off to use as a resting day and to come to the opening since I heard good things about their NY location as well as to attend an aerial class that I would not have been able to make had I worked that day. Finally 11am arrives and I hear the DJ playing music and crowds screaming on and off. It took about an extra 20 minutes for me to get inside and order. I was excited for the chance to get a swag bag and a chance to win free food for a month. I was disappointed to see a spinning wheel of discounts, free side and such. I spun and won free baklava which seemed to be the most popular of prizes but would rather have gotten free swag bag. I ordered the chicken and gyro combo regular sized platter for almost $13 and added 2 pieces of falafal for less than $2. I got a free soft drink for signing up for the points card which they failed to mention at the cash register I had to bring it up as I read about a free drink somewhere. The food was quite good! but I cant compare it to the NY one since I have not tried that one. I love the white sauce but beware of the red sauce. They gave me a small line of the red sauce and now I know why. I asked for more hot sauce not knowing how spicy it would be and boy did it make me sweat! I ended up scraping some of it off cause I couldnt handle it. Everything was delicious and portion size to me was good but thought the price could've been a dollar or two cheaper. I was not able to finish the meal as it was quite filling I polished through about 3/4 of it and took the rest home to finish later as a snack. I definetly will come back when I'm craving it but I will not go out of my way just to go there unless I plan to buy or do something close by. It would be a good excuse to get some bubble tea afterwards since that area is lined up with Gong Cha, Cha Time, Share tea and Coco.

When this place first opened was great , but now it's my second time horrible food , and it's zero customer service from the manger as well , hoping the owner can see this comment  and change this this bad staff

Had to take a break from eating healthy to eat here and absolutely loved it! The white sauce is amazing and I love the kick from the hot sauce. Put a few dots to gauge how much hot sauce you should put in before it lights you ass on fire. I put quite a bit but I love it! The falafel was also great! I loved everything about the food. It's a little greasy but who cares, it's my cheat day LOL


Oh what did I order, I got a small combo and couldn't eat it all because it was a lot of food. The small was enough to feed me and leftovers for the hubsters. My son is 16 and killed the regular size combo. Also make sure you don't plan on eating there cause it's small. We got lucky and was able to get seats.
The cashier was friendly but the prices and amount of food was poor. The food is bland and everything is extra. Won't go again

They should have a warning label on their red sauce. My husband put too much red sauce on his plate and he hated his food. The white sauce on the other hand is delicious,and the service is very friendly. The price is affordable and the restaurant is clean. Although we enjoyed the service I doubt we'll be going back, the food was okay but not amazing.

Great food, great staff!!
Tried this place on a whim and it was just what we were looking for. Short menu which helps the decision process! Few different sauces to try. Try the falafel too!! Yum!

First I was schooled that it's not Mediterranean food it's traditional middle eastern food.......thanks.  Second if you're going to drain students trust funds by charging 10 bucks a plate for rabbit food and a small portion of protein. Can u at least spend some money on 2 ply toilet paper.  After I'm done eating said rabbit food I have to expel some waste. Unfortunately my hand was wearing most of my own waste due to cheeping out and having 1 ply.  U have ur business on a college campus with guys who like to eat and usually spend a fair amount of time ingesting garbage.  The make up of said waste will have a thick consistency. So please Nickel and dime owners invest in some upgraded products.  

Thanks

At 2pm parking was available, service was pretty good and tables to choose from! Not too bad for a late lunch. Food portions are still disappointing compared to what you get at their NYC foodcart but a bit improved from our last visit. We ordered two regular combo platters, side of hummus, and baklava. They now give you a choice of veggies to add to your platter - black olives, jalepenos, onions that I can recall as I write this. There is also now a frequent diner card you can get. The staff  may want to pay attention to their sauce availability - the white sauce containers were pretty much empty. But the sauces were still spot on ~ white sauce DELICIOUS, and red sauce HOT!

We were all so very tired after returning from the RISE festival. We didn't want to eat at any restaurants the hotel(RIO) offered and were also too lazy to go out to eat. Thank goodness for UBEREATS! Searched and found these guys, delivered curbside to our hotel-lifesaver indeed!

We ordered 3 combo plates: came with chicken, beef, lettuce, tomatoes, and pita bread. I must say the portion size is awesome!!! It was perfect for us 6 to share. The meat was tender, rice was perfectly cooked and well seasoned, and Their WHITE SAUCE is the $#!+ we all love it, it's like crack! It's good on everything!!! No lie, we ordered extra(although there was no need cause it came with plenty), had a package we didn't use, saved it in the fridge. Ordered White Castle the next day and ate it with the WHITE SAUCE. One word.....LEGIT! 

So you know how when you go to a place and you order "spicy" and then the food come out and your like..."wahhh? Where's the kick?" Well their hot sauce it also LEGIT. The mister loves spicy and can handle a lot, this is pretty comparable to when his friends make  papaya salad with +15 peppers! Definitely not for the faint at heart, Love it!

We also ordered a side of their hummus and it was delicious. The only downside to this is that it came with only one piece of pita bread......one. Definitely not enough and I would recommend ordering extra. 

To think you guys started in NY selling from a small cart on the streets.....amazing. I wish you had a location near me :( until next time.....

I do not see the hype behind this restaurant chain. The food is overpriced and extremely bland. I ordered the Falafel Platter and the falafel tasted like it was spoiled and was inedible. Not to mention, I specifically asked for there to be NO TOMATOES and EXTRA LETTUCE and go the exact opposite. I am very allergic to tomatoes and was unable to eat the food as a result. I will definitely not be ordering from this place again or recommending it to friends and family.
