Nothing special about this place but the service is the worst! The guy behind the counter doesn't stop talking amongst themselves when taking orders. 

The guy handing me the food had the food in his hand but talked to his coworker for a couple minutes before handing it to me.

I will never be back here. They have no sense of urgency or priority for their customer.

I love the kind of staff that works here. I forgot his name but that kid was simply amazing on how to treat customers. It was my first time ordering in Halal guys, he guide me all the way on which kind of food i was trying to get that moment. Will recommend and will be back here for sure!

Halal Guys is a chain known to have its start and roots as a food cart NYC in the 90s. Not knowing much else about them, I was excited to try the food here. I was surprised to find that the food is really simplified, and menu very basic - food definitely a bit blander than usual real deal halal, and I guess kind of "Americanized"?

The service was good as they were friendly enough to explain how their hot sauce works - you can ask for how many "lines" you want, as it is super spicy. They are known for the white sauce, which I found to be okay but wasn't as garlicky and developed as most other white garlic sauces I've had at other places.

All in all, if you are new to this kind of food or are looking for a quick meal late at night (they are open super late I think!), it's a decent choice, but nowadays with the ever expanding food scene, there's a good number of more authentic halal places offering those incredible flavors the cuisine is known for.

All the talk of this place made me cave in. I came in with some high expectations and was looking forward to some good food. Walking in I immediately noticed the decor, while it is not the prettiest decor it is also not the best looking decor it was mediocre, but that's not what I was there for. I got in line and was already ordering as there wasn't much of line. Will say for a regular combo platter, the amount of food was astonishing. I tried it right away and honestly be careful of the hot sauce other than that everything else was good. With good customer service and good enough food I can see myself coming back every now and again!

Went the day they opened with my son what a huge mistake. Got two orders because my son loves this type of food and made me take him. Before I get to the register I heard a customer being asked how she liked the food. She said well it was ok but the bread fell all apart so I couldn't truly enjoy my food. Instead of oh I'm sorry blah blah blah she was responded to by the owner with "well it's bread what do you expect right?"  I was shocked at the response. They had so much advertising everywhere that the first 150 "guests in line" would receive one free meal per month for the entire year. I get to the register and the cashier gets very rude and tells me I need to learn how to read that it's only for those 18 and older that she wasn't giving me one for my son. Reason I was there too btw. I said well the flyer I have says guests and not adult guests. She got upset and took me outside to show me a sign on the back of the door where they had taped a piece of paper to it saying 18 and older. Hmm why didn't their fb post say that? Hmm why didn't the radio station promoting say that? Why didn't everyone's flyers say that? They all kept repeating the first 159 guests in line. She continues to say well if you open your eyes you can read that it says it clearly right there. Talk about rude. I thought well maybe the food will be spectacular and I can forget the rude ass cashier. Nope! My 10yr old even said wow mom sorry for making you wait in line for this. The food was greasy and tasted burnt probably from being thrown back on the grill, I don't know. Not sure how they keep opening other locations unless this one is just the crap one. I really wanted to like it because my son loves this food. Service is horrible and so was the food. Definitely won't be going back. Please invest in training your staff customer service skills. Also don't false advertise!

We went on a Friday night and there wasn't a long line. We waited for less than 5 mins. Even though there were a handful of small tables inside, it was way too hot (even with the fan on) and we opted to sit outside and eat. 

For 2, we got a regular combo to share with extra white sauce and it was definitely filling. I think without the extra white sauce it might've been too bland. It was alright but I don't think this will be a dish I would crave.

Basically, street meat.  Nice and filling but a tad pricier than i remembered from NYC.

The only thing noteworthy from my visit is the fries.  It's just your regular old fries.  Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside with simple salt on it.  BUT, after suffering through the disgusting garbage that is Montreal Burnt Fries and Soggy Poutines, these freshly made fries tasted like heaven. lmao

Big DISSAPOINTMENT ! I was excited to see it opened here. I had Halal Guys NYC  by MOMa, which is 100x better than this branch. This one is nothing like the original: very skimpy in portion, cold, not fresh, hummus is extra. We arrived at around 7 pm, staff was already cleaning up the place, looks like it's going to close soon. We are not the only one thinking it's closed, as other passer by customer asked if they are closed. 
The 2 vertical meat griller was off, someone was cleaning it. Chicken was piling up on the grill table, wasn't heated up or grilled before staff served it. Beef was inside the container on the prep table, beside lettuce, and other sides. 
The overpriced platter costs $9.99 small or $12.49 large, comes with some meat, chicken or beef or both (not much here, extra for more meat), some rice, lettuce, tomato, pita bread, and sauces. 
Beware their hot sauce is super spicy! 
I could barely ate the whole plate when I had it in the original location, because the amount of food, but it was so tasty I ate almost all and wanting to have it again everytime I'm in town. So when this branch open here I got so excited, but ooh what a disappointment! Tasted awful, nothing like the original, cold, basically not a good value for your bucks. 
We got the impression staff are lazy, maybe just want to clean up and go home on time, or management doesn't want to pay extra hour for cleaning? Hence, food items are sitting on prep table, doesn't look or taste fresh. 
There are more than enough number of staff there, 7-8. They can easily do the cleaning later, and serve proper food like the original one. 
It's Halal Guys in name only, maybe they are banking on the name. 
But it's really nothing like the original. 
Forgettable and overpriced. 
Do yourself a favour don't bother coming here until they improve to match the standard  and taste of the original place. 
Do the meat correctly, turn on the vertical grills! 
There are a lot of other places around that are better, and would love to serve you food rather than cleaning the restaurant.
Tried this place for the first time and we were pleased. Love the white sauce and rice.  Would definitely eat here more often.

This place had some serious hype when it opened, so I finally tried it for the first time.

I went there today (a Sunday) around noon and it wasn't busy at all. I got a regular combo platter with white sauce, ONE line of hot sauce, a scoop of hummus and some onions.

This place definitely lives up to the hype.  Both the chicken and the beef gyro were well-seasoned and tender. Good flavor on the rice.  That white sauce set set it off, and the one line of hot sauce was all I needed!  The hummus was just as good and fresh as they described it, creamy and lemony.  Everything was pretty tasty, especially when I folded it up in the pita triangles.

I wanna go back and try a sandwich next time, and I heard the falafel's great too.  Next time!

Very disappointed. After living in the middle east for half my life and searching for good middle eastern food in Arizona, I was beyond excited when I heard that New York's beloved Halal Guys will be gracing the streets of Tempe. The meat was ok-ok and lacked flavor. The tabouleh was alright as well. There was nothing special that would want to make me dish out nearly $10 for a bowl. It's overpriced and I would much rather go spend my money for real middle eastern food at Haji Baba or Paradise.

This is my first time trying halal guys! It has always been a thing people talk about trying when in New York, but it's a great thing they expanded their territory. I've heard that it was delicious and simple and it was! I got a regular for 10.99 before tax, and it's extremely filling. I could probably portion it to 2 meals. 
Anyways, when my friends and I arrived, they told us it would be a 5-7 minute wait for chicken, which was fine because it would mean we would get chicken fresh from the grill! 
It was nice that the manager gave us free soda cups because we were waiting.

The bowl was loaded with meat, I saw the worker give each of our bowl at least 1 and a 1/2 scoops of both chicken and beef gyro. They had all the sauces on the side near the soda fountain. 
Their white sauce is as good as people say and the red sauce is as spicy as people say. Both together is a great combo, but go light on the red just to give a nice spicy kick. I noticed that the bottles have a printed label that shows when it was made and when the store should toss it. It shows that they always change the sauce bottles.

All in all, it's a nice simple meal that will fill you up. Nothing amazing to keep me craving it, but I can see why people enjoy it with its simple fresh flavors and housemade sauces!

Been here a few times so far. Before grand opening (Yelp Elite event) and also after my recent trip to NYC and trying the real deal. 

This wasn't the first brick & mortar location ive been to. The first one I went to was the first B&M one opening in Costa Mesa last year...? Overall it is similar food wise, but service upon initial opening and what not was night and day. Not sure if the hype was dead by the time it opened in vegas or what.. but vegas never got hour long lines, fortunately. Lol

Even pre-opening event with yelp, they had sufficient amount of staff to get the lines moving fairly quick. Which is great ! 

Coming here after opening, there was little to no lines, ever. During the day or even during dinner time. Prices are not as good as the NYC carts of course, nor are the portion sizes. 

At $9.99 for a combination platter, they tend to load more veggies and less rice and meat (even after requesting for less veggies and more rice). I feel like there is something missing in terms of flavor but it satisfies at least. With each order, they provide 2 packs of their signature white sauce and 1 pack of their signature red sauce. Be fore warned, if you had not been already, the red sauce is extremely spicy for most people. 

After you get your food and pay, I like to go to the sauce area and put the sauce myself from the sauce bottles. I don't believe there is a restriction saying you cant but I like saving the sauce packets for other uses. (halal guys white sauce mixed with turmeric rice from Persian food take out is good xD and the red sauce adds a great punch and spice to pasta with a red sauce)

Overall, im happy they opened a location in vegas and its kind of convenient (though parking could be a disaster). Would be nice if they can modify the portion size a bit.
Always come here. Great customer service and food! East coast favorite. Thanks for bringing it to the west! :)

At last I had Halal Guys, a place people keep on raving about, but clearly this restaurant isnt special in any way. The food is expensive for what you get. I ordered a chicken/beef mixed platter. The meat is so meh, the sauces are meh, and the taste is so meh. This place is way overhyped. Service is good, So one extra star for that, but that's all. This place is way overrated and overhyped. 

My advice, save your money and eat at Osmows, they're miles better.

The added star is because it's Halal Guys. Minus 3 stars because the service was terrible and that literally makes me NOT want to come to this location the next time.

I love Halal Guys. I grew up in OC where they also have a location and I was craving this for dinner. As I walked in, the location seemed a little small (think small taqueria/Mexican restaurant). 

So the service is really where this particular location lost stars. I waited around 10 minutes for anyone to even service me. There was only 1 person ahead of me, but the employees decided to attend to other duties before serving the customer. The manager ended up coming out to take my order but she was terrible as well.

Instead of being friendly about taking my order, she was very cold and rude, trying to tell me the price for everything even though I told her it's fine. She stopped mid order to look at the grills/clean them when the cook was already there. Complained about how he was cutting the chicken too big, grease on the floor in front of me (the customer). 

Honestly she could have waited to talk to him after she was done ringing me up instead of embarrassing the poor guy. 

Meh, won't be back to this location, but I still love Halal Guys.

I wanted a Gyro so I stopped in to visit The Halal Guys. Well the parking is bad, the place is dirty, no atmosphere, meat was cold and the pita was soggy. Vegas has so many other better places to get a Gyro. I was very unimpressed with The Halal Guys. My biggest beef is the soggy pita, this needs to be corrected asap.

The line was a bit inefficient but by the time we paid we got what we ordered. The food was great and the best part you can add as much white sauce as you want. 

Eaters BEWARE the red sauce is HOT. And don't take this as if - it's hot and a lot goes a long way.  In the end you can always add but you can't take away!  

They have phone plugs to charge food. Good stuff!!!
Really enjoy their food! Fast, delicious, well-rounded meals! And we met the General Manager the other day when we were in there and he was very courteous, making sure all the customers were pleased.

So I am in Vegas and went to visit a friend who was renting  a house.. And wanted to eat something more than the fried chicken and pizza they had. (Mind you in hanging with my brother an a bunch or men.. So there were no sides or anything just meat.. Lol) do I got on Über eats and saw this place.. Usually I look up reviews but I was so hungry I didn't... Oh how I wish I had! 

So I ordered the Falafel platter that came with rice Lettuce 2 tomatoes and pita bread with 2 'white sauce' and hot sauce.. Now is it just me or do they just call it 'white sauce' I thought it was suppose to be some type of yogurt sauce.. Now remember I said it came with 2 tomatoes, yea no it came with crushed tomatoes.. And don't get me started on the falafel.. It was just a frozen falafel that they fried too long and it just made them hard.. Plus aren't falafels round?! Well mine were roundish more round/square.. After a few bites I was over it.. They were so hard to eat and the rice OMG it was orange and smelled and tasted like mop water.. I just couldn't stomach it anymore.. I hated to throw my food away but I couldn't eat any more.. The 'white sauce made it tolerable for the few bites I did have.. But at the end of the day it was $20 right down the drain.. Dish was $12 but I used Über Eats so was lil more.. 

So if you have to order take out DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS PLACE! It was so not tasty at all! And I HATE to throw food away.. So it took a lot for me to make that decision, most times I'd suffer through it if I was hungry, but I guess I wasn't that hungry or it was just that gross!
Combo platter. For whatever reason it's just not as tasty as compared to NY. The rice was average. The meats were whatever. White sauce was good.

Food is average to subpar, not the best but not the worst. Only thing that makes the food passable is the ridiculous amounts of white sauce they put on it to mask the taste of the dry chicken. This alone would make me give it around a 3 stars, but when I went there they kept telling me to give them a 5 star yelp review for 50% off coupons. They were really aggressive on trying to get us to give 5 star review and it was really bothersome when we were just trying to enjoy our meal.

I'm sorry but this place is disgusting!! If you want some corporate ass Mediterranean food be my guest.. the hot sauce should have a warning sign because I almost choked!!  I love spicy stuff but this is whole other level hot!! Ruined my hole entire plate,the gyro meat is super salty the rice has no flavor and is sort of hard.. the babaganoush is salty as hell!! Talk about salt overdose kill me and die! Since when is okra in the damn babaganoush?? HELLLLLL NO! waste of money if you ask me! No authenticity whatsoever :( if I could give it 0 stars I would!
Went their on opening day and with this long line, they managed to serve everyone really fast. Food was awesome and everything was to perfection. I would definitely recommend this spot.
Just that best food and service I always get when I come here. I just love Hala Guys.
Love this place the good is always great.the workers are always friendly this is just too much for rating

I saw the lines when this place opened and I presumed they were popular because they had good food.  I gave it a try once the initial hype subsided. The staff were friendly and the service was quick...that's where pretty much where the positive part of my review ends. They have a very limited menu and use very few ingredients.   I assumed this meant their food was perfected and delicious.  Not the case at all.   The pitas were too thick, dry, and brittle while the filling was soaked with sauce and contained imperceptible amounts of veggies.  This is a mediocre mess of a sandwich at a steep price.  Toronto has many many shawarma places that are so much better - and cheaper .  We don't need Halal Guys here.

SYNTHETIC FOOD

How these guys have a following beats me! Thankfully didn't waste my time trying it in NYC.

It tastes as good as premium frozen meals get. 

They'll live off the NYC hype for a while, let's see if they make it past yr 2.

I haven't been to the NYC location so this was a first for me. There's a bit of a wait (out the door, no less) even though it was past lunch time at 2pm.  However, the line does move fairly quickly. 

The white sauce does not disappoint! I find myself craving for more, luckily there is a staff that came around to ask if anyone wanted extra. Yes please! 

Good portion and rice/meat ratio. I'm told the prices are more expensive than NYC but you have the option to sit down and eat, which is worth it for me.

I don't get the hype. I had the food delivered. Is this real shawarma ? Gyro? The meat tastes grilled and chopped. There was no crispy ends. No flavor. 

The combo just comes with rice, iceburg lettuce and soggy tomatoes

The rice was good. That was the only thing that was good. 

The white sauce. What is it ? Watery mayo? I was hoping for a Toum-like sauce   It has no flavor but if you read the calories. OMG no shortage of calories. 

Anyone in the area that wants shawarma or middle eastern food in the area would be better off going to Parsley. 

This was my first and last visit.

Update : the aftertaste of meat made me throw up
Nice big portions and the food is fresh. I couldn't eat it all at once but it was all damn good.

Was so excited for this place to be in Vegas.. but was sadly disappointed. Food was good but the people behind the counter did not offer me any fixings, I did not know what options I had, and felt rushed. Also portions were pretty small but white sauce was AMAZING!
We attended a Foothills Living Magazine event hosted by the Halal Guys and the food and service were phenomenal! It is such a treat to have this type of cuisine in Ahwatukee.

Got here for an early lunch. It fills up pretty quick during lunch hours and I got the beef combo with the pita and rice. Overall, I was satisfied, but it didn't compare to the street carts in NYC. The meat was cooked differently and the side of pita felt unnecessary. Also, they will offer to put spicy sauce on your plate. I would suggest to have it on the side or put it on lightly because that thing packs a punch!
Great food for vegans and regular meat eaters. Very simple menu. Quick service. Great price.

We couldn't wait till this one open since we had the best one in Los Angeles. We got here last week and it's not quite the same.  We ordered 2 gyro wrap, 1 chicken, and a combo plate. The the flavor of the meats are more on the bland side and the temperature was on the cooler side. The sauce doesn't have that extra deliciousness compared to L.A.

Definitely worth the wait. So excited that they are here in Arizona! 

The line was long ( out to the streets) for their grand opening but it moved pretty quickly. 

Pros:
+ fast and friendly
+ reasonably priced
+ the white sauceeeee yummmm 

Cons:
- the sandwich was messy and for almost the same price, it's better to stick with the plate since they over-do it with the lettuce in the sandwich 
- the tomatoes were not the freshest


The hot sauce is definitely HOT so if you're not ready for the fire don't ask for extra hot sauce like I did haha

Where do I start.... Perhaps the food so here we go , in a nutshell it's deserving of one star . Tasteless overpriced and would never eat there again . Now to the employees, just plain rude shall we say . I am disappointed as I was looking forward to a place that sells halal food , maybe I'm unimpressed because I know what middle eastern food should taste like . My wife's partially to blame because of her flavorful and authentic cooking .I don't think they will be around long , such a shame.

Went on a lunch adventure here with the family, and it was packed! My sister and aunt ended up waiting in line, ordering and getting the food for the rest of us. I gave them $60 to pay for the food and waited outside for their call for help later. No change at the end. LOL. I guess it was enough for the food and tip. My aunt and sister got falafals, and ordered 3 beef gyros for me, my dad and brother served with all inclusive toppings. 
Never got to eat the food right away 'cause it was packed there. Drove about 15 minutes to get everyone home, and when I finally got to eat my gyro... It was just alright. 
Maybe I had high expectations? Or maybe it wasn't comparable to Mediterranean restaurants I've already been to and enjoy?
My gyro was too cold for me, and the drink I got from their soda dispenser (Sprite) was messed up with something else, so I cringed when I took the sip. Eh...
My aunt and sister enjoyed their falafels though!

I'm a fan...but it's no NYC street cart. Yes the ingredients are the same, but something's different about this franchised version compared to the original food cart in NYC. I can't put my finger on it, but now that I've been to 2 franchised locations outside of NYC, I can tell that it's not quite identical.

The experience you get in NYC waiting for this delicious steaming hot platter of food- in cold or warm weather, sober or drunk, 11am or 2am- has always been positive for me. I've probably had it 7-10 times and it was always freaking delicious. Even when I picked up 4 orders and drove to Philly one weekend it was still glorious to share with friends. So why does the franchised version seem different? I can't really decide. It might be the rice, which was more dry, or the meat, which also seemed more dry and less seasoned. It might be the prepacked white sauce, which is probably now made in some commercial packing kitchen. The only consistent thing I found was the red (HOT) sauce, and the pita.

Tips: you always need more white sauce. Red sauce for spicy lovers- if a medium spicy person 6 drop of sauce will suffice. Low spice? try 2-3 drops.

This is good and will fufill a craving, but if you want the real deal, go here:
https://www.yelp.com/biz/the-halal-guys-new-york-2?osq=The+Halal+Guys

Food: We did the  typical Gyro, and the regular plate with beef. The  food was pretty good with the white sauce, however the Chili Sauce please use it sparingly! otherwise you will have dragons breath.

Ambiance: The place is still under construction, there's a failure on the air conditioner so the place is a bit hot, especially during the summer time. The restaurant is still operating at a barebones. 

Service: Service is fast food.

I got the gyro platter with white sauce only. It came with heaping serving of rice and gyro meat, lettuce, tomato, and I added green pepper and olives. It also had some pita on the side. My meal was delicious, fresh, and served fast. I will definitely be back.

Honestly the food is freakin bomb! I crave it all the time lol but only 4 stars because they literally never have enough people working so it takes foreverrrrrrrr. They need to take notes from the way chipotle works!

Now the people are nice and the food is fresh and the place looks nice, but being Halal is not enough to make this an authentic middle eastern Gyro spot. It lack authenticity and flavors with the frozen falafels. In a college town full of incredible middle eastern restaurants, I was very disappointed . I was looking forward for a long time to visit this place. The Gyro looked pre-frozen and processed meet. The chicken was shredded as it belonged to a BBQ chicken sandwich. Not good.

I ordered rice, salad, falafel, and hummus. Not only was the food very good, the staff was really friendly. I took my time since it was my first time there and they were helpful, not condescending, and warm. The manager, I believe, she was blonde with large pretty lashes and braces, was extremely kind and took in consideration many small details that you see in fine dining. There was another guy with curly short brown hair, tan skin, he was very friendly as well. 
Recommend this place based on cleanliness, quick service, and tasty food.

I live in the neighborhood and every time I passed by there would be a long line up outside on the street so I figured this place must be doing something right. Yes, long line up day after day and it's always packed inside ; you get the picture. One day I passed by and there were only 5 people waiting so I gathered today is my lucky day and I had to thank god for giving me this opportunity to order their food..... I had the beef gyros and I must say  I'm sorry I apologize to myself inside my mind. It's way too oily and salty, with a cold soft wrap. Now I understand the real meaning of "hype". This 1-star is only my opinion. Try it for yourself to be fair.

Love this place! Ever since my trip to New York, I've been craving Halal Guys. I was beyond stoked when I found out we were opening one here! And the location is pretty convenient for me! 

The line usually isn't too long. I either get the combo with chicken and beef or just the beef. I drench my plate with the infamous white sauce and about 7-8 drops of the hot sauce. Mind you, their hot sauce is intense! I would be really careful with that. The few times I had Halal Guys in New York, the pita bread was always soft and fresh. However, the pita bread here just isn't right, it's usually cold and has like a stale taste to it. 

I'm alway a happy customer when I come here because it just satisfies my craving so much! Would definitely recommend if you like these types of food.

First time here. Came in at 10pm on a Saturday night. Moderately busy, not busy enough for you to hunt for a seat. I ordered the combo chicken and beef gyro platter and a dollop of hummus for a buck. The food was great, chicken was tasty but I REALLY enjoyed the beef gyro much more. From fellow yelp recommendations I doused my platter with white sauce and dabs of hit sauce. It was bomb!!

Decided to try this place out with a friend to take our Halal Guys virginity and see what the hype was all about.

They have a pretty simple menu -- I opted for the combo platter which included chicken and beef gyro (because 2 in 1 for the same price, why not get your money's worth?) You order from the entrance side first then make your way across the assembly line to the cashier. Along the way, they ask if you'd like additional toppings, free of charge and sauces. The guy did not hear me clearly and added more of the infamous white sauce than I liked but I let it pass. I also found it hard to hear what the toppings were and could only see three toppings from the glass so he added olives and jalapeno. If he communicated that louder, I would have had that removed.

Anyways, my friend and I got our order and sat down as it wasn't too busy on a Monday afternoon. Although I got the combo, I would much rather get the chicken. The overall dish wasn't anything special. They're supposedly known for the white sauce but it didn't taste like anything. I didn't really get the hype.

I would much rather go to Ali Baba's just a little further up or down the street where you could get a bigger portion and more flavours.

Finally got a chance to try Hala Guys and it was a disappointment... it was disorganized and the food was not all that. Ran out of white sauce... the hot sauce was on point but not enough to salvage the experience and food.

I wanna start by saying I love how late this place is open, it makes it super convenient for people like me who work nights. I came here because I always see it all over my instagram, I wanted to see what the hype was about.
The service was good and prices are decent, but it just wasn't my taste. The three friends I brought with me weren't impressed either. Maybe this just wasn't our food group but I just didn't find much flavor in anything I ate. It just tasted like I was eating a chicken and beef stir fry with some pita bread slices. It wasn't bad, it just didn't live up to the hype around it.

I give this place one star. I would give it less but they did at least manage to open a restaurant and serve food. We had heard all the hype about this place "finally coming to town" so we were looking forward to trying it. We did order it through uber eats so I can't comment on service, atmosphere, or staff friendliness. I will say the order was correct and warm when it arrived so that's a plus. That's it for the pluses. Everything went downhill from there. I would describe the food as bland and flavorless. We ordered some chicken platters and some gyros. The platters were almost all lettuce not much chicken. The rest of the veggies looked sort of sad and colorless. The white sauce was fine. Not flavorful but not terrible. Just sort of there. I put in on my food to try and improve the experience. If it did nothing for flavor, at least it gave me the activity of tearing open the packets to squeeze out the product and take my mind off the food I was eating. Just packets of sauce. Nothing fancy there. 

The hot sauce? HOT. Silly hot. Not enjoyable hot. I will tell you I am not a huge fan of hot sauces in general, especially not the painful ones so maybe it's not fair for me to weigh in on it but I did. I tried to add the hot sauce to the flavorless food to help it but all it did was anger me. 

I ate the food because I was hungry and it did provide sustenance but that's it. We will not waste time with this again when there are dozens of other local places and even more chains and fast dining establishments. 


Check it out if you need Late night food but I wouldn't waste your time, money, or energy.

I've had this for dinner twice within 3 days! It's totally my kind of meal because I'm all about food being served bowl style so you can mix it together & get a little bit of everything in one bite! Mmmm! I also love that you can build your "bowl" how you'd like & add or not different toppings. If you're a fan of Greek food it's up to par! I see a lot of Halal Guys in my future!

This place is pretty good overall. I would definitely recommend getting extra hot sauce especially if you enjoy spicy food, their hot sauce is amazing! I love that's it's not just a knock off salty Tabasco sauce, it's the real deal. The restaurant was clean which was surprising considering how busy it is during lunch hour. I had the platter, which as pretty good. I even enjoyed the rice, kinda wish they had a chicken on the rocks or sticks option but pretty good overall!

LOCAL TIP: 10% off for Locals with ID
CHECK IN OFFER: Free Baklava 

Had to try this "world famous" place. The tables in the lobby were dirty but the workers were attentive. Ordered a falafel plate. They were sure to let us know that it may take about 4 minutes because they are fried fresh - NO PROB!
The falafel was excellent. 
They even have a sauce bar, I had to visit it twice because everything else was so bland. They give you soooooo much rice ( which looks like shredded cheese :/) but it's completely flavorless. Basically everything was flavorless. 
My husband was happy with the FREE baklava though.

Got the chicken platter. Loaded it up with the white and red sauce. Can't complain! I lived in Philly for a while, and would take the train to NY just to get this stuff. Couldnt resist stopping by this location during my stay in Vegas. Delicious!

I was really surprised by the quality of the food here considering that it's in a food court.  My favorite part of the chicken and gyro plate I got was the rice.  The food is tasty and affordable and it really hit the spot after walking around the strip for several hours.

This place is somewhat similar to chipotle because it's nearly just rice and choice of chicken or beef. I know it's a middle eastern style restaurant but honestly this place lacks the flavor

I got the regular platter with chicken and it was honestly not worth it. Total came out to be $9.67 and although the portion is a handful but for the taste its certainly not worth it and I'd rather eat somewhere a bit more decent.

Im sure middle eastern food lovers would definitely enjoy this place but I cant see myself eating at this place ever again. Lmao.

The best Mediterranean food in phoenix for quick eat or take out.  We visit this location and the tempe location often and the consistency is always there.  Even the owners took time to speak to us on a recent visit.  Very nice guys.

First of all, let me disclaim that I don't usually like to review restaurants if I'm going to criticize them. I'm more of a "promote what you love" person rather than "kill what you hate".

The reason why I'm giving this Halal Guys such a mediocre score is because I don't want to see the image of this chain suffer because of poor management and training of their new locations. I think it's wonderful to see Halal Guys expand and make their delicious food more accessible to people around the world. 

My previous experience with Halal Guys is the original chicken and rice in NY, and the Halal Guys near South Coast Plaza in California. 

The Halal Guys near South Coast Plaza is the model child of customer service you should train all your other Halal Guys on. The employees were smiley and friendly, great food.

This Halal Guys is not bad, but not as excellent as the South Coast Plaza one. This one cook who was cleaning the cooking counter or chopping meat, was making these EXTREMELY LOUD BANGING NOISES! I was shouting WHOOOAAAAAAA to signal how monstrously loud it was, but even that was covered up by the crazy loud banging!!! 

My boyfriend and I could not longer hear ourselves talk! 

There's also no lamb here offered here. There's also a sauce bar and two bottles of white sauce were out of sauce.

Wow! A little taste of New York in AZ! How exciting! Yes, definitely went to the grand opening. Stood in the cold for an hour...was it worth it? Yes...and no...hmmm I got the small combo platter. The chicken was delicious but the gyro was average. The white sauce was good, but I don't get the hype? Idk? Hmm I'm definitely down to come back! Don't get me wrong it was a good experience...the food was good...but maybe it was just overhyped. 

I like the freshness of the salad to cut the richness of the meal...but it's literally lettuce and diced tomatoes.... 

I would definitely come back because it's a good rice bowl to have. Can't wait to try with less wait.

The owners and the workers had great customer service.

So just tried this place based off of yelp reviews.. food was a solid four stars.. but gave it five because of service... I think it was Johnny that was helping us.. I am hella indecisive so alot of people get irritated with me to the point where I think they might spit in my food lol... but she was really helpful with a good attitude at that.. I think I've only done 2 yelp reviews before this in 10 years so she's the ishhhh.. hAd to give her a shoutout for not getting mad at me haha... deff coming back..

4 stars for the neatness and the service
3 stars at most for the food

We ordered the chicken platter, falafel platter .The food was bland and even after adding a ton of their famous sauces, it didn't taste great. Not sure about all those people who wrote the rave reviews, we are not going back.

Got a free baklava with the yelp checkin, which was good.

I couldn't think of a place that disappointed me so much off late

Let me start with positives. Clean dining area and the olives that were on our platters were very tasty. The gyro meat was over cooked and cool. The lettuce was only iceberg. The hummus had no taste. The falafel was terrible. Tasted weird and the tahini sauce that came with it was unappetizing. The pita that came with the platter was hard as a rock and cold. For as much as this dinner cost us we were sadly disappointed. We should have gone down the street to Flaming Kabob like we usually do, but wanted to try something new. Bad choice on our part.
Definitely not as good as the NYC locations. Portions are a lot smaller too. A little bit of a disappointment.

Stopped into Halal Guys at Midnight to get a bite to eat. Even though it was exceptionally late Johnathan (I hope I spelled that right) greeted us with a smile and a great attitude and helped me though ordering.

He is an exceptional employee and I hope anyone reading this knows that I will stop by again because of how great the service was the first time I came in. Thank you!

I've been hearing a lot of hype about the Halal Guys opening up a place here so I had to try it out for myself and see if they lived up to it.  I went with my brother and we both got the combo plate (beef gyro and chicken, rice, tomato, lettuce, flat bread) and it was very good!  Very impressed with how fully staffed they are.  Must have been about 12 people in the kitchen so you can imagine the wait time for our food was just non-existent.  Me not being the most patient of people absolutely loved that.  

The air conditioning wasn't working when we went today, no biggie, there were fans all over the place and they were trying to actively get it fixed. 

The staff was super friendly. 

The white sauce was endless and kept at a nice cold temperature.

My favorite thing about them is the portion size. For $10 for the combo plate, I was absolutely stuffed (and I can eat a ton). 

Definitely a must try!

Tempe location. Across from ASU and next door to Even Stevens and Ahipokibowl(coming soon!)!  Plenty of parking for now. Small store, but fast, efficient and friendly staff. Small & simple menu. Super tasty beef and rice and don't forget the WHITE SAUCE!!! Recommend: combo(beef & chicken),regular size(good portion), rice & white sauce!!! Their baklava was a plus too!
Line up took and hour and the meat was dry. 12.95 isn't a good deal for a plate of this poor quality. Overrated. It was better in NYC and only $7 US

I don't get it. 
I ordered delivery so maybe it wasn't as fresh. the
I had the falafel platter. Falafel was just okay. Rice was gross. Pita was as white and bland as any bread has ever been. And the famous white sauce... was like bad bottled caesar and nothing compared to middle eastern garlic sauce. The hot sauce was hot with no flavour.
NYC tends to have good taste in ME food so I don't know if I can blame this on Americans prefering sweeter, less crunchy food to Canadians. I can't fathom the hype.

TWO WORDS: WHITE SAUCE.

I finally tried Halal Guys after all the talk and hype build around it. When I visited during a weekday night, there was no lineup. I ordered a large platter with both beef and chicken. The platter was enormous and I got a table to eat at. The food aroma was very fragrant and the rice taste great. I thought that the dish really depended on the white sauce. If they didn't have that sauce, it would have tasted really bland. The beef and chicken were just average. That white sauce really brought the platter together. Next time, I'm going to ask them to just load the white sauce. 

In my opinion, this place is definitely hyped up and I do not like how the only thing that made the dish good was just the sauce. A sauce should not define a dish. There were a lot of different food deliver carriers that enter and exit this place. 

I was already full after finishing half the platter and had to take out the rest for later.

Given that the Opening Week crowds had subsided I thought I would try this new lunch place near work.

I ordered the small mixed plate of chicken & gyro atop a great mound of bright orange rice with a salad on the side.

Overall it was a disappointment. The gyro meat stung my mouth from the heavyhanded use of salt but the chicken was okay. You can get better chicken pretty much anywhere downtown so this particular recipe by the Halal Guys also got tossed into the category of underwhelming.

The salad was a mundane assembly of iceberg lettuce and chopped tomatoes. Its saving grace being that it countered the salt burn of the meat.

The rice - of which there was plenty - was bright orange in colour so I had to ask what it was flavoured or coloured with. I was met twice with the response:

 "It's a secret". 

This, in the food industry is probably the worst response you could give a customer, and it made me vow to never return to this restaurant chain. Well, the secrecy as well as the cuisine, that is.

I didn't finish my plate, preferring to write this review rather than finish eating their mystery food.

Portions are a lot smaller than NYC. Taste is alright but nothing too special. Service was really good though! They accidentally put white sauce on my friend's order but she didn't actually want any (they misheard her) so they redid her entire order despite the store being packed since we went on their grand opening day.

That red bottle is NOT ketchup. I have never been to the food truck but I get the hype after trying this place out. I tried the combo plate no rice no pita and got a side of spicy hummus to share with the table. I keep a Low carb/keto diet 90% of the time and this place fits the bill easily. I will be back for sure when in the area. That white sauce though....yum!

I was pretty disappointed in this place after getting excited about it from all the hype. i ordered a beef gyro platter. The meat was incredibly greasy, and the "White Sauce" they give you in a package on the side was disgusting (so, so rich). It did nothing to detract from the greasy meat like a typical cool, cucumbery Tzatziki should. They give you one little piece of pita with the giant portion of rice and meat topping. After that was gone, it was impossible to finish that oily disgusting mess. Rice wasn't too bad but the meat was supposed to be the star of the show. They get two stars because the service is fast & friendly but the food is absolutely terrible.

I wanted to love this place! I heard so many good things about the NYC location and we saw the signs coming soon so wanted to try when it opened. The line was just starting outside the door and we waited just under 15 mins. So the wait wasn't bad. 

While waiting we watched them have the grill split in 3, with raw chicken in a massive pile, semi cooked chicken and then a grill to finish it off. They were refilling the rice from the hot table with everyone's trays lined up on the counter and the condensation was dripping in everyone's dish as they removed the tray. 

The people were nice and a lot of staff were working, the place was clean and new looking so that part was good. 

I got the combo regular size which was $12.49. It said it came with with salad but it was just shredded iceberg lettered and a few diced tomatoes. There was no other things you could add in, and if completely tasteless. The rice was an orange colour and similarity not much taste. The chicken and gyros was good portion but again the chicken had no taste and the gyros was so greasy that when I moved the rice away at the bottom there was a thick layer of oil. The hot sauce was good, it was actually hot and the white sauce tasted pretty watered down. They clearly are rushing the food and not taking the time. 

I am saying this having eaten at MANY shawarma places and I can say with confidence this is by far the worst one I have had. Small food courts in malls with no name places blow this place away. Other places the sauces have lots of flavour, the meat is seasoned, they have lots of toppings and always bursting with flavour. I know this is a super negative review but I am not exaggerating as usually I give 4/5 stars for places.

Alright, I had to stop crying to write this review. I was aware of their famous white sauce and decided to go with the gyro beef platter, great choice but gimme a heads up on the frickin hot sauce Lol. The gyro was delicious and tender and the rice paired well, considering the heat from the hot sauce I now understand why they give you lettuce and tomatoes as a side. So please never complain why you got a side of salad, it's for your own safety. On a serious note, I'd probably come back despite the insane price mark ($11 for a small platter) but I know better now, The Halal Guys made me wiser. I need a fraction of that red hot crazy sauce!

This was the first place I ate at when we moved to Toronto a month or two ago.

I walked in, stood in a long but extremely quick line and ordered a mixed plate.

It came with salad, rice, chicken and beef as well as some white sauce, BBQ sauce which I didn't try because it did not seem to go with the dish and some hot sauce.

When the girl asked me if I would like it spicy I told her very spicy please and she gave me a stern warning that this is not like Popeyes Louisiana spicy sauce.

I really do eat pretty darn spicy food and I get this warning everywhere I go from Chipotle to Indian restaurants and didn't think much of it from a fast food joint.

I got home and decided to lick the sauce of the top of my lid. Welcome to flavor country my friends. . .

My gosh! I was shocked as to how spicy it was. I went over to the fridge and looked for a drink. Nothing in sight since it was our first day in our new place.

I went to look for a cup and nothing was unpacked yet.

I finally put my mouth on the tap and turned it on. 

Nothing came out . . .

Turns out that a fire hydrant outside blew and the water will be shut off for a few more hours.

Needless to say, the struggle was real and the 30 degree + weather was no help.

I have since been back 5 or 6 times and really do love the food as well as the uncensored spiciness.

Tip: Ask for spicy sauce in packets on the side if you are a first timer. If you don't like spicy food at all you can simply ask for no hot sauce!

I love The Halal Guys ever since meeting the carts first in NY. When a location came in South Bay, I was excited at the prospect of not having to travel so far for this comfort stable. Imagine my anticipation when I learned there was a location at home in the Valley!

But for me, this location felt like a Pass/Fail assignment in college. The components were all there - the meat, sauces, rice, veggies, pita. Chicken and beef tasted as I expected, as did the classic white sauce and spicy red sauce. Eating here is the classic Halal Guys flavor.

Yet with that solid foundation, it never goes further than that. Literally everywhere I've seen more fun iterations, such as a loaded fries instead of a platter. Or for the gluttons, there are more sub-upgrades within platters such as extra meat or rice that didn't break the bank. Here, what you see is what you get. 

I think if I lived on campus, this might be a solid stop. But I feel like something's wrong if at dinner time Dutch Bros. is full but this place is nearly empty. I think I can better understand the lukewarm reaction Tempe has for this spot.

Meh - Way overpriced and not sure what the hype is all about? Meat was dry and veggies not great.  Rice looks good but doesn't have any flavor. Maybe they'll tighten up and have better prices after a few months of getting acclimated.  Haji babas kills with better portions, flavor, quality and price. And many better gyro options minutes away.

Its delicious but not amazing! Definitely overhyped. Got the combo plate and the meat is the best part. People are right about the white sauce -the food wouldn't taste as good or moist without it. Drenched my plate in it. The rice didnt have flavor, but the lettuce and tomato are refreshing. Their baklava is some of the best ive had. Flaky and full of nuts.  The restaurant is small, but managed to get a table. Service was fast and friendly. The girl at the cash register gave me a hard time after asking for my ID and credit card because my drivers license had holes in because I renewed it, but she meant well. Recommend if youre in chinatown or the strip.

Usually heading here at the wee hours of dawn after a gruesome day of work. 

If you're a local, ask for the local discount ! (10% off!) 

It's always satisfying and yeah, I've had the New York original. It's NOT the same. But is it good enough to make me very happy? Ooooh yea. The white sauce and hot sauce is spot on and their rice is fantastic too. Wish they had LAMB.

COUGH COUGH MANAGEMENT COUGH COUGH 

Alright thanks halal for being that dirty (in a good way?) late night regret the next morning option  ya'll the best

I ordered 5 platters through Postmates and I live about 20 miles away so it's definitely not across the street. The postmates driver came on time but only brought 4 platters. Upon finding out that we only got four platters instead of 5, the postmates driver immediately called the halal guys store and spoke to the owner named Logan to let him know of the situation. The owner went beyond and took responsibility for the mistake and tried to get us the missing platter but unfortunately there were no postmates drivers showing in our area at this point, being that it was 2am.

The owner of halal guys in Tempe then told us that he feels really bad and drove all the way from Tempe to the east valley, about 20 miles, and delivered us the missing platter at 2:30am! That's true dedication and exceptional customer service, this owner truly cares about his business and his customers!

Late night in Chinatown and don't feel like sushi or pho? Done. 

Super fast and tasty options of plates or gyros.  Simple menu,  really friendly service,  and huge portions.  

I got the combo plate. It came with rice,  pita,  chicken,  beef,  and I added some toppings. The white sauce was highly recommended from yelpers,  so I got some extra,  but didn't need it.  You could definitely make 2 meals from one plate.  

I wouldn't say it was the BEST halal I've ever had,  but it was pretty darn good, and packed up nicely for to go.

Just like their NYC food trucks! I'm so happy to see them here in Vegas. The combo platter is so amazingly delicious with white sauce and just a few drops of hot sauce. And just like the food trucks on 53rd & 6th, there's nowhere to sit.

It's the most average middle eastern place I've ever eaten. If you want something extremely quick and have no where else to go then I'd go there, they just give way to much iceberg lettuce and mediocre meat, and on top of that you have to pay something like $3 for hummus. It's really not bad, but not amazing for sure.

This place is seriously over rated. The food is just okay tasting. I've tried this place twice and the meat lacked flavor and was dry. The only thing that made it taste better is the white sauce. There are other Mediterranean places that are better in the area. Go elsewhere!

Things I love about The Halal Guys ~

The food! I always stick to what works for me here which is a beef/gyro bowl smothered with white sauce and drizzled with BBQ sauce. When all the delicious ingredients get mixed together it's truly a bite of heaven. (Gyro meat, rice, lettuce, tomatoes, a few small slices of pita and the sauces). The rice here is the best rice I've ever had! My man always gets the gyro sandwich with the same sauce combination and he loves it. Our food has been consistent and it's one of our favorite quick meals. 

Side note ~ for all the chicken lovers like me. I'm not a fan of the chicken at all here and if you happen to be disappointed by it, you should give the beef a chance. It's AMAZING!

The cons ~ 

The service isn't consistently great but I can say that it is most of the time. The parking can be tight because this location is in a very small plaza with tons of other businesses. Small shop equals not too many tables & chairs so prepare to take yours to go occasionally. The decor is probably my least favorite part. I don't enjoy the hard & cold in winter metal chairs and I'd seriously love to give it a makeover and keep it modern but make it sleek & a little sexy. 

But even with the cons, we truly love the flavors and the meat is incredibly flavorful. It's on the higher side as far as pricing goes but you'll taste where that comes from with the fresh ingredients. Also, don't forget to check-in on Yelp for your complimentary baklava which is a very nice touch and always delicious!

Amazing! Their chicken actually tasted better than the halal guys in East Village, NY! No longer need to fly to NYC to get an awesome meal. Wishing it great success! Will be back. Always go for the combo dish. Watch out for the hot sauce..Its deadly.
Great Service!! Even better food. The combo platter is the bomb and the baklava. Don't miss this place
Poor customer service. There was no line, 3 employees, we stood there for 10 minutes and not one employee acknowledged us. No hello, or be with you in just a moment was said.

The service was on par with the original. I can't say for sure but the platter seemed to be a little smaller than the one in New York but the taste was just the same. I'm guessing they are justifing the cost increase because of the restaurant set up rather than a stall. All in all amazing experience and also comes with the extra long lines..:p just like in NYC!

Waited a few weeks to go here to wait for the crowds to die down. All in all, I don't think it was worth the hype. The food is sort of bland, the white sauce wasn't very flavorful, and the hot sauce was WAY TOO HOT, I almost couldn't finish my plate. Honestly I've had much better Mediterranean style food at other, less expensive and less busy places in Vegas. Most likely won't be returning.
I have one word for this....TRASH. I'd  only come back for their French fries and BBQ SAUCE. Id rather eat cup of noodles

I've had it at the carts years ago in NYC.  That was amazing.

This storefront Toronto location - not so much.  I got the regular chicken platter w/ hummus, extra white and hot sauce.

Sauces are nothing special to note.  Rice was meh, nothing at all distinguishable about it.  Chicken was pretty disappointing.  I'ts just average taste here, and incredibly expensive (After tax this was more than $15) 

Stick with your local toronto joint - much better taste and flavour.
Most excellent choice of food from Mediterranean region. Fresh shredded beef and chicken with rice and few pieces of naan and multiple choices of your favorite toppings. Must try it to be hooked.

Actually pretty decent. I thought I would be disappointed comparing it to the original Halal Guys on the streets of New York, however, I was surprised that this tasted pretty good. Ordered the chicken platter and it was a good late night meal. There were some completely brown rotten pieces of lettuce though, which was disgusting. The hot sauce packet that the cashier gave me was also really sticky and gross. Prices are inflated but I guess that can be expected at Caesars.

I get that this place is new-ish and exciting so it was very busy, but the service was still strange and not great. It was my first time there and even though they have a massive assembly line of workers none of them lent much info on how you're supposed to order. I ended up with a chicken wrap with just tons of crappy lettuce and tomato. The sauce, which they just called "white sauce" (which I had to ask them about twice as to what it actually was since I'm sans lactose) is a mayo based sauce with "secret spices". These secret spices didn't at all sit well with me, not my taste. I've had plenty of shawarma/Lebanese style sandwiches, but none have ever tasted like this. Hey, some people might love it, but it wasn't for me.

Food was bland. 
NYC was way better.   Had the chicken and gyro combo and the meat was bland. The sauce saved it a bit but would go elsewhere.

I'm from NJ area, so I've often had pleasure of enjoying the original location in NYC. We always get combo platters with beef and chicken, but the main ingredient that makes this place amazing is the white and red sauce. In my opinion without those sauces the food won't hold up. The white sauce is creamy and delicious, while the red sauce is extremely spicy, but in small quantity it can add more flavors. They used to keep the bottles of these sauce on side, but it seems like they know that can make more money by giving one packet per combo and then selling you extra sauce packets, which is  a bummer. But if I ran the business I would absolutely do that.  They also sell baklava, which is awesome. Yelp check-in gets you a free baklava as well.

We ate here tonight and both the food and service were good. We arrived at 9:00 and there was still a little crowd. The food is not quite as flavorful as getting it from the stands in NYC but was close enough. The white and red sauce were on point. I thought the portions were quite a bit smaller than what I was used to in NYC. You don't get much for $10. I would come back sometime and am happy to have a franchise here in Las Vegas.

I was excited to try out this place with all the hype of it coming from New York to Las Vegas. Plus , I was really craving Mediterranean food. Sadly , the food left a lot to be desired.

I got the regular sized combo platter based on suggestions. The combo platter comes with chicken , beef , rice , lettuce , tomatoes and pita. The meat (especially the chicken) and the rice was dry but the white sauce helps make it more bearable. The reason for the 2 star rating is because there was nothing really special about the food. My 3 other friends who dined in with me also got the combo platter and said the same thing too. It's eatable , but nothing really stands out or makes you really want to come back. At least it's affordable and portion size was good - I paid around 10$ for my meal and saved the other half for dinner.

For you spice lovers , get the red sauce but beware it is spicy. TRY A LITTLE BIT BEFORE YOU PUT IT ON YOUR FOOD. I would say it is spicier than habanero and closer towards ghost pepper spicy but not all the way that spicy. I put waaay too much red sauce on mine and my lips swelled up for a good hour. I also went on a day when the A/C was broken and it was super humid in there. I still wonder to this day how I even ate half of my food at that time.

I do like how the service here is fast and friendly. They are open until 4 AM and it's not too far from the Las Vegas strip (being in Chinatown). I feel that this location is great for those late night , post clubbing eats when anything sounds good haha.
The food tasted different from the one that had in New York. The portion was also different. I'd say their small size is too small.

I tried The Halal Guys for the first time in NYC and fell in love with the food so I was ecstatic to hear they were coming to Tempe, and just a few miles from my house! I finally went in for lunch on Tuesday and got a small combo (gyro & chicken) platter and it was definitely reminiscent of the food cart in New York, although it was lacking a little flavor. Not a problem for me though, I just add some extra white sauce and a tiny bit of red sauce (be careful, the red sauce is no joke) and all is good!

Forget the white sauce, their baba ghanouj is some of the best I've ever had. Also underrated: the falafel. Add on a couple pieces to your order, they're only a buck each.

Everyone seems to be eating the platters exclusively, so I started with a sandwich. The wraps are enormous- gyro meat is ground, which was not expected and isn't my preference, and wasn't my favorite meat. The chicken was nicely seasoned and robustly flavored. Unfortunately, the cold pita tore easily and just didn't taste that great, and the overall wrap needed the white sauce to keep the flavors interesting and provide moisture. 

Returned for an event and got a platter- combined the meats I loved, the chicken and falafel, with their rice, and added extra white sauce and a touch of red. This was a solid meal. Add on a piece of baklava if it's available, this version isn't drenched in honey like other places. The $10 meal will definitely have leftovers.

Service is fair- staff is friendly, line moves quick, wasn't thrilled about how my order went all the way down the line through four employees who all noticed the torn pita issue and yet none of them thought to start over with one that wasn't falling apart.

A little confused about this choice of location, which is super small and has a hectic parking lot. Proximity to the Strip makes it an easy option to Uber- plus they're open til 4AM, just like NY.
Luis gave my fiancé and I the best costumer service not to mention the amazing food!!!!
great restaurant the sauce is amazing had chicken platter the hot sauce is really hot

Great food for a great price!

I would recommend the combo platter with white and one line of red sauce. Two lines and you will be hurting. 

This place is also brand new so it's super clean and super nice compared to most surrounding places to eat that are a little run down.
This place is awesome! The portion sizes are massive so you will always have some left over for later! I hope they bring a location to the west valley ASAP because I could eat this on the regular.

So I got food from this place last night 
A combo plate 
Had it delivered by doordash 
It didn't take long but the food was cold 
Had to heat it up "wtf". How to separate hot food from the cold side to heat the food up 
After that didn't really enjoy the food...
Maybe it's hot if you eat that the place and not delivery

The food was great! Im a picky eater but I love the food here! I got the combo plate with chicken and gyro. I prefer the chicken more and so do my kids. The hot sauce is hot!!! I also enjoy the white sauce but it taste great even without any sauce. Highly reccomend this place.

Extremely disappointing. I've had better food at Montreal mall foodcourts.
I Paid $12.99? For a regular sized falafel plate with the following ingredients: Lettuce, tomato, rice and falafel.

Tahini- They don't have it, instead they use "white sauce" to save $ which is basically mayo
Hummus- $1.50 extra
Talboleh (or any other salad)- Non-existent, they serve lettuce instead.

I'm a fan of middle eastern food, but they've cut way too many corners and the price isn't reflective of the offerings.
Fast food, affordable. It's in a convenient location from uofT so I had too much of Halal guys. It's also open till late. I usually get the chicken- gyro platter with white sauce and hot sauce.

Wow! Seriously impressed by these guys! Came in not really knowing what would be good here, but the staff was wonderfully helpful. The manager with the beard was superb in guiding me through everything. I didn't even know what half the stuff on the menu was, but he walked me through it and ended up getting their spicy chicken. It was soooo yummy! I'm impressed! Even the baklava(?) I think it's called was delicious. Sweet and tasteful! Going to definitely come by here more often!

Here's yet another 5 star review of Halal Guys, like they need it, but I adore this place so I'm going to say my peace anyways. 

Being part middle eastern, I was extremely excited about this place opening. There's not enough of that genre of food in this town and I was excited for a fast food option (wish it was a little closer to my home, but maybe it's better that way!) They did not disappoint. 

The food is outstanding. And appeals to everyone being as it's just chicken, beef, and for the adventurous soul, falafel. The chipotle style of service works well for them. You can pick and chose which options you want on top of your customized platter or sandwich. Also a side of fries, falafel, or baklava can add a cherry on top of your perfect meal. 

The best thing about this place is the white sauce. Oh the white sauce. And they have giant bottles at each table so that each customer can douse their food in it, or if you are a weirdo, only have a little. 

Overall this place is amazing. Even if you haven't ever tried middle eastern cuisine, give this place a whirl. It's a great segway into that type of cuisine.
The beef gyro is awesome!  Adding the White sauce makes it even better. The HOT SAUCE will make your insides explode!

When I read positive reviews of the place, it is justified, and their restaurant and employees are somewhat new.  Thanks for giving us some of the magic that your company had from when you were in the streets of New York.

Came here on Tuesday around lunch time, first thing I noticed as soon as I arrived were multiple signs posted on the windows letting people know that their AC Unit is currently down until further notice, just a minor inconvenience , they had 3 fans set up around the restaurant, and one of them was next to the tables which blocked some of the chairs. They were giving out free Mini-Bottles of water to make up for the lack of AC I assume. 

Also as soon as you arrive, you'll be greeted by an employee telling you to watch out for the hot sauce, you'd be wise to listen to her unless you wanna spend the entire day at the soda fountain! It wasn't too busy so me and my friends got our food pretty quick, we all had the combo platter which comes with Gyro Beef, Chicken, Salad, Tomatoes, Rice, and Pita Bread.  Sauces proved were White sauce, Hell-in-a-bottle sauce, and BBQ sauce which tasted like some cheap generic kraft sauce. As far as the food quality goes, there was nothing really amazing about it, the beef and chicken left something to be desired and I was the poor unfortunate fool that got stuck with the almost stale Pita bread. According to my friends who've been to NYC, the menu is much bigger and they serve lamb as well! 

I've definitely had better Mediterranean food and probably won't be returning anytime soon unless my friends peer pressure me into going. Sorry Halal Guys, You may have 3 fans but I'm definitely not one of them!

COME because you are trendy, hyped, and want to rekindle memories of NYC.
LEAVE because you never got to board the bandwagon.

The Halal Guys leaves a bad taste in my mouth. I never tried the original in NYC so I have no baseline to compare their latest franchise location. I do, however, know good middle eastern food when I eat it. Maybe that's unfair, though. This is to middle eastern food what Cafe Rio is to Mexican food. That's too bad because its roots started legit and grew deep.

Like the food pyramid, let's start at the base: rice with chopped lettuce and tomatoes. This rice is dry in a way that makes no sense. The lettuce is some iceberg. The tomatoes - flavorless, unripe whatever. These are ingredients indiscernible from Taco Bell's production line.

Next level: the meat. It's your run of the mill crispy-ish "shawarma meat." Nothing special going on here. Seasoning is a moot point because of the next level.

Top level: the white sauce. Unless you tell them otherwise, the assumption is "I would like a gallon of sauce, please." What ever magic potion is in the sauce, it's good. If this sauce wasn't good The Halal Guys would be out of business. It covers the meat, making that crispy-warm-liquid-savory layer that gets you hooked. It's like the sauce on your all-you-can-eat sushi: the sushi roll is merely the vessel. There's a small strip of their hot sauce as well. Hot is an understatement, really. That red sauce is a fire in your mouth.

The top-top level: a few pieces of bread. It's bread.

I know, I'm coming down on The Halal Guys hard. They could have, and should have, done better. This is the age of the "open production line" restaurant. Chipotle, Cafe Rio, PizzaRev, etc. They're all efficient at what they do and designed to be inoffensive to accommodate the masses. This is what makes investors and franchisers happy and so I understand it's not going to be the finest of middle eastern culinary experiences. The let-down is the missed opportunity to upgrade the product from its lowly food cart origins where generic lettuce, tomatoes, and dry rice is acceptable - even charming! At this stage, though, there's simply better choices for your time and money.
The sauces are the best part. I ordered the platter and it was mostly rice. It was good to try and I would eat here again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

Ordered through uber eats. Food was cold and half my order was missing. Not the drivers fault. There is no flavor! The "white sauce" tastes like ranch. Very disappointed! Also I ordered a regular coke and got diet. I will never order or recommend this place.

I love this place and I make my cousin take me here as soon as I land in Vegas. The only problem is I landed at midnight and they were already closed by the time we got here. Not to worry, a few days later I made my cousin take me back again during dinner hours and I got my usual. Combo plate with falafel on the side. I don't know what it is...the combo gyro plate with white sauce allllllll over is extremely satisfying, with a small dab of burn your ass red sauce. 

BOTTOM LINE: Combo platter, white sauce all over, with 6 red dots is the perfect ratio for me. 

BONUS: they deliver through one of the local delivery services.

*Edit* - now that ive had halal guys at least twice in Montreal Im convinced the Toronto location isnt doing something right. The portion size and quality of meat is a lot better in MTL.
______

I'm not going to try to compare it to the food truck on NYC because I think somethings shouldn't be compared to the original. Where it started will always have a different appeal to it. 

Firstly I'm super thrilled Halal guys is here. I had it first in Manhattan and then in Montreal and now in Toronto. In terms of quality and taste I've found all three restaurant locations to be very comparable. Also when you douse everything in that delicious white sauce can you even taste anything else?!? Lol.

I got the combo platter with white and hot sauce. For folks who haven't been here and don't do too well with heat watch out for the hot sauce. A single serving will set your mouth on fire. But it's soooooooo good. 
When the girl behind the counter was serving the meat I did think the portion looked smaller but maybe my eyes are just greedy. Once I sat down to eat I did get a piece of meat or two in every bite. Or maybe because I got very little rice and more salad so I couldn't tell. No complaints though! 

I'll be returning and will see if they're consistently good. I'm hoping so because I'm rooting for Halal guys to be successful in Toronto!

Affordable and filling. Do not skimp with the WHITE SAUCE!
Unfortunately, my falafel was hard as nails...stick with the chicken and gyro.
Parking can be a challenge depending on the time of day.
I don't think I'd drive out here for lunch..but if I needed a quick bite after a night out, I would consider this as a good option.

A great addition to the Caesars Palace Food Court. For just $12 (platter) or $10 (sandwich), you can come away feeling full (and not entirely ripped off). 
Combo (chicken & gyro) platter was served up quickly & the portions were more than enough for a hearty meal. 

Compared to the Spring Mountain Location: I didn't see any option to add green peppers, olives, or jalapenos...but I didn't think to ask. White sauce is limited to one squeeze bottle behind the counter (I asked her to go HEAVY with the WHITE SAUCE). If you find that you don't have enough on your food, I did see other customers go back for an extra squeeze or two.

Other reviewers mentioned late night hours...although I haven't personally been, I can see myself ordering another combo platter after a night out on the Strip.

I just ordered from uber eats halal and I normally love it, but today along with my other co workers was very disappointed. We all ordered the chicken platter and all 3 of us had dry and burnt chicken. This is unacceptable that they can charge 12 +plus tax for a meal that is like eating jerky! I don't mind spending the money either, clearly I have eaten her before.... But you should never send food out of your restaurant that is not perfection!

Update:
Right after I posted this review Angela reached out to me I believe she's the GM. She apologized for the bad experience and wanted to make up for it. She offered me and my 2 co-workers a free meal next time we come in. I wasn't sure if the girls would want to order again, until I talked to them . We decided to give it a go again since every Saturday we order out as a ritual of ours (our cheat meal). I text Angela and she was so helpful and took care of the whole thing. When it arrived we were all nervous... Pleasantly surprised though! The chicken looked perfect not dry at all, we all took our first bites and agreed that this was the best we had ever received from halal!! The flavor was on point! So a big thank you to Angela for making us all believers again!!

If your looking for Shawerma or middle eastern food than this is definitely the wrong place. This place should serve hard shell tacos with the dinners and rename the place The Taco Guys because it tastes exactly like a taco salad with rice. 
Save your time, money and colon....what a disappointment. Fake hype

The amount of food you get for the price is amazing.  The special sauce is worth it.  The hot sauce is REALLY hot, beware.  The food taste is definitely above average but not a street cart in NYC, so if you've been blown away by that, don't go in here with that expectation.  But for AZ it's pretty awesome.  It's also efficient and quick which is why I gave it a perfect rating.

So I had the original halal guys in NYC... Is this the same... Sadly no. But it is cool that they are here in Vegas in a store front instead of on the open streets. Just for that alone I give them props. 

I had the beef gyro sandwich and my bf had the beef gyro platter. The sandwich was decent. I added the onions, been peppers and olives to my dish and it added more texture and flavor. On my next visits I got the platter as well and added everything in it again. The flavor is good.... Maybe it's the nostalgic memories but the flavors are great. I would recommend the platter as I think it's a better deal overall... And I would pass on the rice as I do not think that it had alot of flavor. 4/5

I would also recommend eating in instead of take out... Why? My main reason would be the sauce. When you get your items to go... They charge you extra for extra sauce BUT when your are dining in.... You can get as much sauce as you want by taking the squeeze bottles directly to your table. :) 

And the hot sauce is actually spicy so be careful! And they are stored in a cold table by the drink station so you know that the sauces are kept cold and sanitary and I appreciate it. 

Their baklava is ok... But u can't complain since it was free!! Lol 

Ambiance... It's ok... It always feels a little cold to me... But I go there for the food so I'm ok... But I think that the decor could be changed. 3/5

Service is normally? on point.  As soon as you walk in... You are greeted and if you tell them that you have never been... They explain the menu to you. 5/5

So far so good. I have not been disappointed since I've started to come here.

Rating - 3.0/5.0
 
I've been to the original food cart a few years back so I decided to check out the first franchise brick and mortar location here in Toronto that just opened recently. As expected, there were line ups even at around 2pm. However it moved relatively quickly. It took around 25 minutes to order and get my food.

Personally, the original one in New York was nothing amazing to begin with and this one here is more or less the same. I think it was more of a tourist spot than anything else. But at $6 USD back then, it was a very reasonable price, the portion was fairly substantial and it was decent overall for a quick meal.

I had the beef gyro platter as I wasn't a fan of their chicken. The white sauce was decent as usual with the beef gyro and rice. The most memorable part was definitely the hot sauce!

Overall it isn't worth lining up for especially at their price point. But feel free to check it out if it doesn't look too busy to fulfill your curiosities. I think Toronto actually has some pretty good places already for these types of dishes and at a much lower price.

Pros :

Large portion of combined gyro beef and chicken 
Nice tasting rice 
White sauce is tasty

Cons:

$17
Extra for hummus
Extra for falafel
The beef had a weird smoky aftertaste
The staff might be under instructions to sell up 
( I thought I said chicken gyro sandwich and got the combo platter)


Conclusion:

Not the best shwarma in Toronto or even in this section of the city. Try Mzaar just up Yonge or Paramount at a comparable price point.

After hearing all the hype I decided to try Halal Guys for myself! 

If you plan on eating at a curtain time or have somewhere to be, come early as the line ups can take some time. I would say that from start to finish of standing in line to actually getting your food would be about 30 minutes, give or take. This will improve with time as the staff is still being trained and isn't running 100% just yet. 

I came with a friend and we ordered two regular shawarma plates, one chicken and one gyro in order to test out the two different choices of meat. Both were amazing! We ordered white sauce on both and just a small line of hot sauce. Be carful when asking for hot sauce, a few drops is enough! If you like spicy food, ask for less hot sauce than you are used to because this one packs a punch! I think the price on a regular plate is $15. 

What really stood out to me is how the staff treated everyone! It was refreshing to see smiles on their faces. Every single staff member I talked to in the line while ordering my food wished me a good day! I was very impressed with this! It is much better service than what you see today. 

Halal Guys earned my business! I will be coming back again and again and again.
