Not good at all and overpriced. The food has very little flavor and they have very few options. Nothing was made fresh and it tasted as if it had been made the day before

Good quick food.  Ordered the plate with chicken and rice and it's all pretty good.  Get the garlic sauce and go crazy.  I didn't like the humus so I wouldn't recommend it.  Room for eating inside it was me and my little family kids enjoyed the food too.

Limited menu which made it quick and easy to order. The food was wonderful and fresh. Had the chicken and gyro combo platter with salad. Next time will get the rice only with meat. They have this red sauce that's hotter than a jalapeno so be careful if spice is not your thing which is not mine. My friend had the white and red sauce and eyes watered instantly. Will be back again soon.

It's a nice substitute for the original food cart in NY, but it's more expensive and the portion size is a bit smaller. The white sauce though is still just as good, and the hot sauce just as spicy. 

Get the combo platter, and if you've waited in line you might as well get the regular size, because the small just won't be enough for all that halal guys goodness.

The chicken is well flavoured, though it definitely didn't really taste the same as ny, but maybe thats just nostalgia talking. I preferred the beef gyro, nice texture and well spiced and flavourful. The rice was pretty much the same as ny, and a little sweet.

I was a little iffy going here. A friend had recommended it and he idea just didnt seem pleasing. Once i received my bowl the appearance was not impressive. A couple bites into and i was totally meh... i mixed it up a little more and added more white sauce.. and the more bites i took the more i fell in love! Wow. Absolute delish! 

Definitely a good spot and hopefully I'll get another chance to try it out again.

First time I went last week it was good, but man oh man even a single line of hot sauce can overcome some seasoned tastebuds. An hour ago I picked up the same item to-go, Small Beef and Chicken platter. Right off the bat I could smell something burnt but the meat looked fine. Once the taste of the sauce would drown out, I was left with a horrendous burnt taste in my mouth. My roommate had the same complaint. We think this is because they don't scrape their grill frequently, and the meat on there absorbs the charred smell. Very disappointed, and I can't even finish my food because now that the sauce is gone all I can taste is burnt beef and chicken. Not worth the hype.

This is the second location of The Halal Guys that opened last month on St-Denis. More spacious and cleaner, the staff is friendly and menu is simple -gyro sandwich-chicken, steak or falafel-8$ with tax, plates (combination of rice , salad and meat with a slice of pita bread), poutine and refillable fountain drinks! Of course we can't forget the infamous white sauce (almost like ranch dressing) and red sauce (very spicy be warned!!) that was stored in their own  cute little mini fridge!

Definitely like this location better than the first. Your  after clubbing/bar hopping food scene just got a little more comfort food!

I'm giving this place a 4 because I totally think the original halal guys cart in NY is so much better. 

I love how simple of a menu they have and you get a lot of food. The red sauce is extremely spicy..so I would totally put a dab of it on your food at first. Otherwise, I love the chicken and rice platter with LOTS of their white sauce.

I loooove Halal Guys and nothing beats the street carts of it in NY but it's nice to have some restaurants popping up in the valley. Decided to give the newest location by Christown a shot since I had a buy 1 get 1 coupon. It's a small location and weird placement of the "order here" line since it is literally right when you walk in the door so when a line form, it shakes awkwardly. There was one family in front of us and three workers behind the counter. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt since it's a new restaurant and like a month in of being open but they just didn't seem to have their flow and rhythm working. It took all three of the workers to work on the families order in front of us, and then all three of them again to work on our two platters. It was just slow and no flow behind the counter. But again, benefit of the doubt and probably working out the kinks. All in all the restaurant was clean and had good music playing and The platter of course was yummy. Hopefully they work on the hiccups behind the register, but other than that, the food was delicious and servings of gyro and chicken where plentiful in the platter....PS. I'm actually 9 weeks into a 12 week diet but had my first cheat meal today because my buy 1 get 1 coupon was about to expire. Was not disappointed with breaking my diet for the first time tonight. It was gooood and worth it.
The Halal Guys prove time and again that taste is king. The flavours of meat and rice are on point and the white sauce compliments both, although I wish the hot sauce was less spicy.

I really wanted to like this place! Being from NYC I have had this type of food many many times and was never disappointed.  I live and work nearby so I was excited to try this place as soon as it opened. I ordered a side of falafel and a combo platter.  The falafel was crispy but so bland and dry.  The combo platter was ok but nothing to write home to NY about. The staff was very nice and I assume that the restaurant will do well since they are close to ASU and open late.

Went here for the first time. The service was quick and friendly! The girl working the counter explained everything and was polite. The Gyro was excellent ! They also have a hot sauce that I didn't try... maybe next time!
This is a easy place to find and a very clean place!

My wife and I ordered our platters through ubereats and it arrived pretty quickly. I got the chicken platter and my wife got the falafel plate. She liked thr fried falafels but there were only 4 smallish chunks of it. And the rest was rice and lettuce. The white sauce does make the plate edible. So kudos for delicious white sauce. My chicken platter I would order it again, I enjoyed every bite. The portion sizes are large, I barely ate all of mine and my wife could only finish half. All in all, we probly wouldn't bother calling this places' name for dinner again.

I just had an AMAZING experience at your restaurant!!! The food was AWESOME and I love the toppings that your location added! Also, love the fact that I can put as much sauce as I want on the food because you guys have a sauce bar that allows us to have as much sauce as we want. 

On top of this I had the BEST service ever from Johnnie. She was very courteous and friendly. One of the nicest fast food employees ever--the kind of service you expect from a great restaurant, not fast food. This is definitely one of the best Halal Guys anywhere, and I will be back. Love you guys!!!

as fast as the food service was the food itself was not appealing. meat was bland as it could ever be. would not recommend coming here. it's just a bunch of poorly seasoned meats and vegetables tossed into a bowl for a somewhat reasonable price. never coming back.
The food was fresh & tasty. A lot of staff on hand. All friendly! Will diffidently go back!
Don't order through a delivery service, I have ordered twice and both times have been shorted items. Their to-go service needs improvement. I won't be back.

I've been wanting to try it after hearing my girlfriend talk about it so much after her NY trip. Finally tried it today and daaaaaaayum it was pretty bomb. Platter combo is da way to go. White sauce is awesome, but be careful of that red sauce. Don't underestimate it... I did and now I'm sitting on the Oval Office dying. Overall the food is good! Good quality and they give good portions!

Stopped by Halal Guys for dinner after visiting DaYung's Tea shop since we were in Tempe. What a good choice! The last time I had this was back in 2012 in NYC and I say, it's pretty darn close! Got the gyro and chicken combo platter with a side of falafel. The gyro was AMAZING and the white sauce was to die for. I can drink that sauce all up in a cup! The falafel was good, but not quite like how Sabuddy's used to make them, but the white sauce fixed that. My friends got French fries for the kids and honestly it was really good crispy fries. I liked the juicy flavorful gyro so much I was tempted to get a gyro platter to go since we live half hour away. Next time I'll do that for sure! Be back Guys! Two thumbs up!

Having hopped around in several halal guys locations around the US including NYC and Chicago. Montréal does not carry the same vibe! I think it is the food portions- get more meat for the buck in the US. Although, fairly put the prices are well marked due to the Canadian currency equivalent and taxes. The staff is very friendly! Long line ups of curious locals. I would find myself here if I want to kill a food craving.

Combination plate is so good I'm ordering it again the next day.. chicken was fresh, gyro was cooked perfectly and the whole meal has a good blend of flavors. Don't be stingy with the white sauce, use both packets! .. only con is I wish they would do there own delivery as Postmates doesn't have complete menu

If you've been to the halal guys on the streets of New York, then you've probably set your expectations too high.

Although this place serves the same food and has a killer hot sauce, I didn't feel like it tasted the same. The price is certainly higher and extra sauce to go will cost ya too. Back in New York, I could eat a whole bowl and each bite was delicious and strangely new. Here, I could barely finish the small sized bowl and not because the serving was too large, but because I felt a bit queasy like I had just had too much fast food.

The only thing I enjoyed was that white sauce, but warning, don't look at the nutritional information. Sad to say, I'm not craving to come back any time soon....

THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!!! Amazing food and spectacular customer service!! Marshell, Tyra , Laveine are very humble and enthusiastic about their job. They made us feel so welcomed and made our first time experience want to come back again :)

Going to Halal guys in Montreal is like playing Russian roulette. I've ate this in store and ordered it online many times. On the chance that you get lucky, you can expect great quality and value similar to their chains in NYC. However, they don't have consistency of such quality. Sometimes the vegetables taste funky as if they have been sitting around for too long. And sometimes they give miserly portions of meat making you feel cheated.

Ooo, a taste of New York in Tempe (also known as the barren wasteland for foodies... I came straight from a short stint in LA so I am a little bit spoiled) and OPEN LATE!

I got the falafel platter and loaded it up on the white and hot sauce. The boy serving me seemed incredulous when I asked for ten lines of the hot sauce. (He really asked how many lines.) Boyfriend got the combo platter.

Both platters came to be around $20 total. A little pricy, but they are in a PRIMO location across ASU so they must need to pay the rent.

The owner - I think - asked me and my boyfriend how we were doing as we stood in line. Unfortunately, I wasn't really looking at him and didn't realize he was talking to us until I noticed he was looking at my boyfriend, and even then I was assuming he was talking to the group behind. I'm a little slow, ok.

We came at Saturday morning at 1am... so basically Friday night and it was still pretty busy... but the line moved fast.

Contemplating trying to baklava next time. And I'd probably ask for even more hot and white sauce next time!

Not sure why this place has 3.5 stars. Only thing I wish was if this place was closer to Gilbert. 

Everything was good! Finally a spicy sauce that is spicy! I'll be coming back to this place a lot.

Walked by a couple of times but the line was really long so waited until today. I should have walked away when I hit the front of the line. First the guy was unwrapping the gyros and they looked they had just been defrosted. Having waited 20 minutes I had committed to this and wasn't going to leave. The second thing that came to my attention was the lack of organization. There were roughly a dozen  employees back there but the line was crawling. I don't blame them as the owner should be there to delegate and move the line along. There were delays along my entire order with literally 4 employees standing near the cashier doing nothing. They had two cashiers but were only operating one. Once again I ask the owner why not have two cashier's? I hope the owner reads this as I hope you succeed but right now I honestly believe this is just a pure hype and people seeing a line. Honestly the plate was mediocre and I've had better hummus at the supermarket. Honestly if you want a better plate go up the road to Cumberland and there is a $5 dollar shawarma plate place, pay the extra for meat and pay $2 for 4 fallafel balls and you'll still spend less than this place. Honestly I fell victim to the hype and social media.

I could never find time to stop by and try the food when in NY. I was excited to see the Halal Guys open in Tempe. We ordered a Gyro plate and a chicken plate with the famous white sauce. Loved the food and our plates were generously filled. Good Halal food is always a great find!

If you are looking for food that brings you back to that first bite of street food you had in NYC, look no further.

Just as I had remembered it, this food is incredibly delicious and flavorful. 

I took my family here for the first time and they were more than satisfied when we finished our food.

SKIP IT. Suuuuuper bland. To me, this is the poor man's Chipotle. They aren't the same cuisine, but they might as well be. 

FLAVOUR: Chipotle's chicken has more flavor packed into one bite than in an entire Halal Guys meal. Just visually, the meat looks colourless and desert dry, and not even a generous dose of their "signature sauce" - which by the way, tastes like watery mayo - can save it. 

ORDERING: They try to do the Chipotle assembly line, but it's really just "pick a protein" and "pick a sauce? Maybe pick more vegetables?" It's hard to tell because it's hidden behind a counter and unless you were tall, you wouldn't know that you can request peppers and olives and whatever else is hidden there because the staff don't tell you. 

PRICE: At $11 for a small platter - which I found sufficiently filling - it's on par with other downtown portions. However, the quality of the food makes it entirely not worth any money.

I don't know why people are complaining about the portion size. I got the regular plate with half chicken and half beef. Yes they do give you quite a bit of lettuce but even with the lettuce the amount of food was more than enough to share between two people. I was just in NYC in April and the taste of the food is pretty consistent with the food cart in Manhatten. The price is definitely cheaper in the states but I still feel you get your money's worth for what you get. I asked for lots of white sauce and they were more than happy to squeeze lots on my plate. Everyone that works there was super friendly and polite. I will be back!

First thing i ate when i came from nyc to stay over. This was super disappointing, because we paid 15$ for a platter that is 7$ in nyc. Furthermore, they charge extra for white sauce and the portions arent as packed as they do in nyc. Basically if you want to pay MORE for less, this is the place for you.

Menu is simple: either you pick a beef gyro, combo chicken and beef or a falafel.  Choice of either as a sandwich or a platter.  Some sides like fries, baba ganoush or hummus are also available.  I thought it will be like the New York food trucks.  This is actually a much better experience!  Good food , great prices!   I'm glad I tried this place!
Pretty good! Nothing beats the original but satisfies the craving when needed.

Anticipated their opening since I found out they were opening here in Tempe, AZ. 

Started following The Halal Guys on Instagram, won a contest they held, winning a free platter way before they even opened here. 

The Grand Opening was great. Busy, but definitely worth the wait. Owners outside greeting and talking to the crowd. 
But now on to the most important part of all... THE FOOD! 
Let's just speak in emojis 

The Chicken and Gyro... so moist, deliciousness bursting in your mouth. Not to mention their special white sauce .  The falafel was being given out as samples, super yummy as well. With our order we also tried the hummus and fries. 
The Halal Guys did not disappoint! #1

The first time I came here the hype was SO REAL. Everything about the food was amazing. The chicken plate I ordered in a size large was more than enough. The chicken was juicy and flavorful. The lettuce and tomatoes were crisp and fresh. The pita bread complimented everything nicely. And that white sauce. That beautiful, luscious, creamy white sauce... goes well on anything.

I am not much of a fan of the beef. I feel like the chicken is their prize winner here. 

Service is always prompt and staff are friendly.

My initial visit to The Halal Guys had me impressed and hungry for more. I was excited to indulge in their food and welcomed The Halal Guys as a potential competitor to Chipotle in the Tempe-ASU area. 

On my first visit, the lines were out the door, which left me feeling both excited for the food and irritated because I had to wait. After reaching the entrance and getting past the bouncer, I approached the friendly staff at the counter and asked for a combo plate. I glanced at the menu and looked around the store, but had to double take at the menu one more time to make sure I read the right prices. 8.99$ for a regular platter. When making my decision, I looked at the man in front of me, who opted for the costly 6.99$ wrap, and noticed his sandwich was much smaller than the menu image made it out to be. Assured that I had made the right choice, I proceeded to walk along the counter, mesmerized by the teamwork and mass production of food by the staff. The employee added two heaping spoonfuls of rice which I oddly assumed was cheese, a scoop of crunchy water (lettuce), a scoop of flavorless tomatoes, a pitiful spoonful of gyro, a lackluster spoonful of beef, and 4 mini triangular pieces of pita bread. Unbeknownst to me, you are allowed to add onions, green onions, and olives as free extras, however I was uninformed of this by the busy staff. The employee then asked me if I would like white sauce, red sauce, or barbecue sauce but I asked for all three on the side (to get more quantity). To finish it all off, the staff placed my to-go meal in a high quality yellow Halal Guys plastic bag, which felt silky smooth and amazing to touch.

When I reached home, I was eager to try the food. I opened the legendary white sauce and drizzled it over my food. SO MUCH WHITE SAUCE. I sampled the rice alone and found it excessively greasy, but satisfying. The crunchy water and flavorless tomatoes added meaningless bulk to the meal. Both of the meats, gyro and beef, tasted average and were not horrible, but were not amazing either. The flavor particularly came from the white sauce and red sauce. The legendary white sauce was creamy and delicious, tasting like ranch dressing but with less kick. However, spoon after spoon of creamy, fattening white sauce with the greasy orange rice had my taste buds begging for something new. I drizzled the red sauce over the platter and was in for a surprise. This sauce was made for Satan himself. While not adding spicy flavor to the meal, the sauce tasted extremely hot and added excitement and variety to the greasy repetitive nature of the meal. The mini pita pieces were soft and delicious (I would recommend adding an extra pita for a dollar). 

After return visits to the restaurant, I have found the food tasting dull, greasy, and flavorless, even in spite of adding the optional extras and trying their hummus. I also observed a decline in the quality of service they provide. On one visit, two of the employees looked stoned (which I do not mind), but they forgot to include my white and red sauce on the side in the bag, the very essence of Halal Guys. On two other visits, I was charged different amounts for the same combination platter I usually get. The staff is not as friendly as they initially were, and the overall food quality has declined from its initial opening. I would not expect more from a fast food restaurant but I was hoping for more.

Despite my critique of the store, I was initially astonished and satisfied by the food. For 8.99$, the quantity of food is decent and Halal Guys offers a fresh take on fast food in the Tempe-ASU area. Additionally, the hours are great, midnight on most days and 4AM on Saturday.

First off we came during Ramadan, got here at 8:20 with a line up out the door, Iftar was aylt 8:55... We didnt get to order until 9:25. 

There were 7 or 8 people working, it was unbelievably disorganized. I am a vegetarian, they have these little over fried falafals. The worst part was the hot sauce... This stuff is literally too hot for my brown friends who are used to a consistent level of spice. It was ridiculously hot. Ruined the plate, I couldn't even eat more than a few bites! 

I mean overall it was just awful. Can't stress how unorganized the staff is.

I went here after reading some reviews on Yelp. However, when I was ordering an employee came out from the back and started chatting with the person serving me. She said she couldn't wait to go home because she was sick. I almost walked out at that point but they had pretty much already made my order so I would feel bad. I didn't get sick, but that was so off putting.

I had the combo plate because I wanted to try both meats. The meats were good but not great. The flavors didn't pop as much as I thought they would. The platter is basically a few cups of rice and lettuce and then topped with a bit of meat and other vegetables like olive, tomato, onion, jalapeño. I was a bit disappointed that for $10 they didn't give many sliced olives or onion. I think I had about 4 slices of olives (like canned sliced olives). Though there was a decent amount of meat. The pita bread was soft, warm, and almost doughy. It was good bread. The white sauce is basically just spiced mayonnaise if you read the ingredients, you will see it reads like a jar of mayo. The hot sauce was good, good spiced flavor and very very hot. Actually way too hot for me so I didn't have a savory spiced sauce to use. I wish they had a mild version of this sauce.

I'd give this place 3 stars, but the comment I heard about an employee being sick ruined it all.

So glad there's a halal guys in Vegas. This location is probably better than the one on the strip. Huge shoutout to Ruby and her one other sidekick working on New Year's Eve at 4pm. The phone was going off the hook and there were so many people wanting to eat halal guys, Ruby kept her cool and she was busting her butt. I hope she gets a raise because that place gets hectic. Whoever owns this place should think about adding at least one more person to busy holiday shifts, it's definitely not fair seeing the only two running around, trying to serve 15 people not even counting the Postmates orders (about 6). Food is good, service is excellent.

So this is a gyro/chicken/falafel type place. It comes as either a platter with a bed of rice and vegetables with a piece of pita or as a gyro style wrap. The menu consists of just the items mentioned above with a few sides like fries, hummus, bakalava. It through me off  a little with how simple the menu was but it's not unlike other places like raising cane's and in and out where they just do one main item well. 

The place is fast food, so your in and out or you can dine in their dining area. The food experience was pretty good. I got the combo platter with chicken and gyro meat. They ask if you want side toppings like onions, jalapeno, olives etc. I liked the gyro meat better than the chicken personally but my girlfriend liked the chicken. The gyro meat was a little bit greasy so keep that in mind if you can't decide between the meats and grease/oil isn't your thing.Than there's their white sauce which is like the "special sauce". It's really rich and creamy with probably a mayonnaise or cream base. I was expecting a tzatziki type sauce like you find in most gyros but it was different. It's not tangy or herb tasting like tzatziki just creamy. They also have barbecue sauce which I didn't try and hot sauce. Careful, their hotsauce actually is quite spicy even for a spicy lover myself. 

Overall this is a cool place to get a quick Mediterranean/halal meal. Something different right in the center of the Asian food scene around it. Not bad, not amazing but definitely different.

I was so excited when Halal Guys finally made its way over to Las Vegas. I came here on a Friday night and there was plenty of parking. I was only ordering takeout and it was a really quick grab-and-go spot. You can also substitute falafel for one of the combo plates, which does take an extra 3 minutes to fry.  They also give you more than enough white and red sauce packets, and make you pay if you want extra. Beware with the red sauce because it is really spicy! Compared to the New York street carts, it doesn't taste exactly the same but its similar. Compared to the OC location, it's about the same to me.  It satisfies the craving but I would take New York over Vegas Halal Guys any day.

I've heard about this place for a while and was able to go try for lunch on Saturday. We ordered a regular size combo plate with some garlic sauce on the side, a 4 piece falafel, and a side of hummus. It didn't disappoint. The hummus was tangy & delicious, the garlic sauce was fabulous! It's probably my favorite garlic sauce I've had at any Mediterranean restaurant. The combo plate was enough to feed both of us... The gyro delicious, the chicken was good but nothing fabulous. Their rice was very good, and I'm not normally a rice person. The hot sauce was hot... But very very good. The falafel was crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. The pita was yummy, but nothing special. I have to say we both thoroughly enjoyed the lunch. We will definitely be back.... I'm glad it lived up to the hype.

My husband had it in NYC and he feels like the Toronto location is quite good as well. Their shawarma tastes very different from other places - meat is not oily or greasy at all, tastes like almost steamed. Half of the bowl is veggies, less than the amount of rice, so it's extremely healthy. The hot sauce is crazily spicy but somehow after I ate it my stomach was not upset, which is the first time ever for me. It feels like overall a healthier option than other shawarma places.

I appreciate the concept and the fact that its not another Amir/Basha clone for once.


The small combo plate is 11, large is 13, the beef looks like ground beef and is sitting in a mettalic tub.

The chicken is a bit better, the rice is very ordinary
And the salad is just lettuce and tomato.

The portions are much smaller than elsewhere and its $3 extra for fries.

The good is that the white sauce is unique and the bbq sauce kind of helps with the flavor.

The red sauce is pure insanity, just a smidge and it will overpower anything , use at your own risk.

The decor is very upscale for a chicken shawarma type of place, so bonus points

Ordered the combo platter and had it delivered by UberEATS. Granted I placed my order at 2:30 am (I work graveyards), the meat was cold, rice lacked flavor and I prefer to have more pita to eat the meat with. They also failed to provide silverware and napkins.

It's a no, from me.

It's tasty, but it's not as good as New York, and given that the mighty Boustan is 2 blocks away, I'd say this place won't be successful for long. Their prices are far too high. In New York, the meat is succulent, freshly grilled, and chopped up before being put on the plate. In Montreal, the employee scooped up pre-cooked meat from a heated container on the counter. Also the rice is not as good as in New York. It is undercooked. Go to NYC for the real thing. It is so good you can cry. If I'm near Concordia in Montreal, I'n going to Boustan. For 10$, you eat like a king and everything is beyond fresh. You can really tell when food is prepared with love.

Came here last night with my vegan friend.  For me, the the chicken gyro was delicious and filling, I'd say not bad for the price. 

However, NOT A VEGAN FRIENDLY RESTAURANT! Halal Guys would be a sketch. They offer falafel, which is a chickpea/ bean mixture that is fried. 

My friend and I kept watch just in case any non-vegan contamination occurred because of my friend's diet. We observed that the gentleman had grabbed a pita that was TOUCHING the pile of chicken on the grill. Not sure if that is their way of keeping the pita warm, but this did not seem sanitary or effective. 

Maybe the workers were new, but I'd hope to see (one day) that these workers will be aware of what is "vegan" and what is not. i.e their white sauce (which was almost drenched into the vegan gyro) is not vegan due to egg yolks. They do offer a different vegan sauce, so be cautious and keep watch. 

My friend and I didn't make it a big deal, but this is a warning/ lookout for other vegans in the community.

Simple menu - easy to order. Got the combo plate (beef & chicken). The beef gyro meat wasn't in slices, it was more of a crumbly texture, but still tasty good.

The chicken was outstanding (hard to find moist, flavorable chicken sometimes). No questionable parts...yay! I'm a stickler for not having skin or fat in chopped/sliced chicken prepared by others, so I was pleasantly surprised by the quality in addition to the flavor.

Only down side was that we got there after they first opened up for the day, and they didn't have all of their items ready in order to have a plate, just a sandwich...but it was worth the 10 minute wait.

And beware the red sauce...it IS spicy.

I've always had a good experience at Halal guys, easy to order and fast service. Although this time was different. Walked in there was no menu anywhere. Asked for the menu and they handed me a piece of tiny paper with the items to order from. Not convenient at all. 

We also a some loyalty cards with a free item,which they refused to take it because they claimed that they stopped using it since 2017. (Which isn't true considering I came in January and someone to stamp my card).
I understand they stopped using that card but they could have still given us our free item or atleast transferred the point to the new card. Instead of making us waste it.(Felt like a scam). Really disappointed. 

I gave a 2 star because the food is still good.
Updating my review because I've returned consistently and have dealt with amazing staff and generous portions. Plus can't beat the free baklava on check in. :)

I've been hearing great things about this place and finally they open one in Arizona! The set up in here is very quick. I asked the girl to explain the menu and how things works there and she seemed very helpful since I'm a new customer. But the food was not what I expected. I got the regular combo which has chicken and gyro over rice with four pieces of pita bread. 

Honestly everything tasted so bland.. Chicken was dry, gyro was so oily, rice was hard and too bland. There was no special taste to the platter. I added the white sauce and that is basically what makes the platter taste very good, without it the dish is very plain and bland. 

Kudos to them for opening very late and right next to a university. Service was nice and helpful. I would definitely be back to try other dishes but I wouldn't get the platter again. (:

Like many others reviewing this place, I have also been to the NYC original location many times in my years living there. It was our usual late night spot. But Toronto's location is not worth the wait and the quality and taste is poor/average at best. The food doesn't taste very good, bland meat splashed with lots of sauce. I cannot even finish the small platter lying in front of me, which makes me feel slightly sick. Chicken is rubbery and the amount of lettuce and tomato is about half the bowl. I'm surprised it was a disappointment given the hype and line ups. I don't see this place lasting too long - perhaps people who don't know good food will keep it alive!

I love the beef gyro !!
and the falafal is the best in Tempe!!!

They've got customer service and cleanliness. One of the staff was seen walking around with a cleansing spray and paper towels cleaning up the surfaces. Washrooms were nice as well.

However, the food itself wasn't too interesting. For $14 + tax, I got a regular platter with chicken/beef gyro combo. They offer hummus for an extra dollar, which I declined.

I found the food quite greasy. I like that there's fresh lettuce and tomatoes to balance things out a bit, but the rice was just really oily. The meat didn't stand out either in terms of flavor.

One thing that was particularly disappointing was the amount of sauce they add. I'm the type of person that eats salad without any dressing, but I figured hey why not if this is how they recommend the dish to be eaten, then I'll have some sauce.

I looked at the cover photos posted by the business and they had nice thin streaks of sauce just lightly drizzed in a zig-zagging pattern across the food, but they just covered the entire bowl in sauce. Looking at other photos, it looks like this is just how they do things here.

It is disappointing that they are covering up the flavors of the food with ridiculous amounts of sauce, and the sauce wasn't that interesting either. Maybe try a squeeze bottle with a smaller hole, or perhaps start with a small amount before ramping it up to the max. It was hard to determine whether the flavor came from the sauce or the meat/rice.

For the record, I enjoyed the hot sauce more than the white sauce.
Very dry beef gyro meat. Tasted like an old left over. Very disappointing. Typical middle eastern restaurant. Second time bad experience. Not coming back

I came 45 minutes before the opening time, and that was a great decision, right after the line started to pile up. 

When I went in, the staff was friendly, the service was really fast, like less then 4 minutes, but I wouldn't say 1 min. I took the combo platter, as they recommend. They poured the white sauce over, I was worried there wouldn't be enough sauce, but no worries, there's a guy who pass trough all he customers to ask if they want more sauce xD i had some hot sauce on the side. And yes, their hot sauce is the kind which is slow and steady, just a a few drop, mix it up and you'll feel it. 
The platter was full of rice, tomatoes, freshly cut lettuce, beef and chicken and 4 piece of naan - i think it was naan . I ordered a regular, but I wasn't able to finish so i took what's left home. And I think they know it because it's served in a aluminum plate and put in a plastic bag. 

Ps: they had a lucky wheel and I won the one week free food :))

Came here on their opening weekend not knowing what to expect at all.  The menu is very small but that is good if everything is great.  I got a combo plate with chicken and gyro and it was delicious.  The white sauce is amazing and I drenched my plate in it several times and could've done so a few more.  The hot sauce is extremely hot so be careful as a few drops will do ya!  The only thing I didn't like was the falafel.  This was my first time trying falafel so maybe I just don't like them but they were really dry and tasteless which was a complete turn around from the rest of my meal.  

The food was great but the restaurant needs some work.  We came on opening weekend in the summer and the air was broken, which is understandable but still sucked.  The restaurant is so tiny too with maybe four tables and 3 bar stools which is not ideal for how packed this place was or plans to be.  For that reason and because it is far from me, I was not interested in coming back although the food was good.  I didn't want to get it to go and have it be cold when I got home.  That being said, I have actually craved it once or twice more since then and may have to venture out there again at some point.
Really awful customer service. The white guy their was so rude. Ended going somewhere else to eat.
Great food and friendly staff!   And they are not allowed to accept tips!??  The management should change that.  Great service deserves to be recognized by their customers ;)
The food was good but honestly not worth 15$ and its not hot its just warm however the customer service is A1 they should win an award honestly they were so nice
Not bad, but I've had much better. The menu is extremely small and a little confusing. The place itself is also very small and extremely loud.

They kicked everyone out of the restaurant at 10:59 am when they open at 11 and didn't let anyone in till 11:03. When they opened "late" they were still not ready and scrambling to get their food on the line. Staff was completely clueless when they told me they had no lettuce and her co worker had to tell her they do. Not worth it. Go to Oliveos down the street
One of my favorite food in New York but Halal guys food is not even close to the streets of New York
Probably the best Halal Location me and my boyfriend have been to. Super friendly staff and quick service!

I've heard all the hype from Halal Guys in NYC but waited a few weeks for the hype to die down at this location. Upon first entering, I noticed a giant fan on and sweltering heat inside. I was sweating within the 10 minutes I was inside waiting for my food. We ordered a large gyro platter with extra of their famous white sauce. We found a bench around the block to eat on because it was way too hot inside. 

This food itself was good, but not great. I can see why the hype is there for the white sauce but it probably has some change in ingredients because I've heard from everyone that it's not as good as the original. However, as a standard shawarma meat plate, it's still better than most places. I don't know if I'll go back, but if you don't try this place you're not necessarily missing out on much.

Hit the spot! Not as great as the streets of NYC but nothing compares to that. CAUTION- the HOT sauce is HOTTTTTTT. This definitely hit the spot I will be back!!!! The AC was broken today hopefully they get that fixed soon. Lacks seating so it's a more of a take out place. Love the fact that they open till 4am

I was super excited to check this place out and went for lunch with a few co workers the other day and we were all underwhelmed at best. The line wasn't too bad, but it was really warm on the restaurant  and very limited seating and waited 5 min or so with our food for a table. We all got the combo plate and both meats were flat, little seasoning and low quality. The white sauce had no flavor and the hot sauce is way too spicy and all of us agreed it just adds no flavor since it is so hot. I would not go back here and wouldn't recommend anyone waste time and money going here either.

On UBER Eats!

Getting in and out of the Vegas strip is a nightmare at any hour of the day. I was so happy when I found Halal Guys on UBER Eats.

I had Halal Guys in the original NYC street cart a few months back and I was craving the incredible white sauce again. Although not the same as eating it from the street cart in NYC, I was very satisfied with my Halal Guys order in Vegas.

My only issue was that it was more expensive than the street cart in NYC.

-- 
taste / 5
aesthetics / 3
vibe / N/A
service / N/A
price for quality / 2
OVERALL / 3.3

So I have been back few times since the Yelp event. The biggest thing is the quality of the food or the experience has been just as fabulous. Sometimes coming back after a Yelp event for regular service can be hit or miss. The Halal Guys first thing off the top nice see got the air conditioning working. Not that it bothered me because pre opening there lot of things that can go wrong. The food has been consistent from my first visit to my recent visit (third). I know should have ordered something different but fan of the combo platter. I got the same thing all three times. 

The things I enjoy about the combo platter are the portion size, freshness, and can do double of one protein if craving just one. The protein with the combo chicken and gyro it nice scoop of each. No matter if you get the regular or large size. The same goes with the rice as the base or the sides of fresh chopped lettuce and diced tomato. It steal of deal. The only way I finish is if am starving because its all carbs and protein. I did mixed it up one visit. I tried the baklava. It was very good. It was nice buttery with lots of layers. The price of one piece might be little pricey. I was happy I tried one just to say had one. Really the star of the show is the combo platter or the same ingredients in burrito style. 

The chicken and gyro. The chicken like the fact all the meat is hand picked and shredded chicken. It can be dried out because they keep everything in steam table. The same goes with the falafel or the gyro meat. My experience never had problem with either one of the meats being dried out. I think the flavor is solid. The meat by itself is nothing that going blow you away just the honest truth. I feel it simple food nothing fancy. Just sticks to the history starting as food vendor on the streets of NYC. They just keep everything in steam tables and all about quick in and out or to go style. The white sauce not only is it addicting. It really is the ideal sauce with any one of the proteins. The white sauce feels like cheese Alfredo sauce. It not quite as thick of white sauce but the flavor is similar. The HOT sauce that just no joke. I would recommend put little spot taste before you go crazy with it. Once you drop whole bunch on top basically ruined it if not fan of the heat. 

The service has always been awesome every visit. Each visit been different staff but each visit everyone smiling, enthusiastic, friendly, and awesome. 

The restaurant is super small but again the whole concept is more to go then sit down. They do have couple tables and counter area. One of the best things about the hours stay open till 4am. So if you ever need The Halal Guys fix got you covered. I am happy brought some of that NYC to Vegas!!!

I was very disappointed after all the hypes. Server was extremely slow and food was dry, felt old and uncooked. I went three different occasions to make sure it wasn't one time fluke (bad chef day). I tried both Sandwiches and Platter. Each time, the meat was very dry and the lettuce seemed very old and soggy. 

There are much better middle eastern restaurants and this wouldn't fall above mid tier for me.

I remember seeing massive lineups outside this place when it first opened, so I decided to drop in one evening for a shwarma wrap. I was really underwhelmed. The food was just very meh...nothing to write home about at all. 

What killed it for me though was that I asked for "a bit" of sauce, which somehow meant that it would be absolutely drenched in white sauce. I actually took a napkin and tried wiping some of the sauce off because everything was just swimming in sauce! If you need to put a half litre of sauce on your food to make it taste good, then the food itself can't be all that great. 

I've had MUCH better shwarma elsewhere in the area and for the same price if not less, so I won't be back here.

What a sad, underwhelming experience. I came here today in the rain and cold to line up for the grand opening promotion and I highly regret it. 

Not only was the promotional effort weak (spinning a wheel and having a mere CHANCE at winning a decent coupon), the food was subpar (odd mushy texture for the gyro), the portions were lacking (why is half my box just lettuce and why is there so little meat?), AND the price point was unreasonably high for a fast food joint ($14.11 after tax for a regular platter).

I'm pretty disappointed by this Toronto chain and I would not come back. I also wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.. you're better off eating at Ali Baba's if you're looking for other Halal options.
Maybe it's my fault but I was expecting a lot more than that. The rice was crunchy and the meal was nothing to brag about. Simple concept and friendly staff is what's getting them 3 stars.

Literally stumbled upon this location on its grand opening night, and SO GLAD I DID!!! It's now 5am and I'm laying in bed dreaming about it! I had the chicken and rice plate which doesn't sound special but boy is it ever!!! The tender chopped chicken is both juicy and flavorful, and the rice is nothing short of miraculous! They provide a deliciously cold chopped salad on the side that pairs PERFECTLY with the meal making this my new FAVORITE restaurant to round out 2017!

I really wanted to like this location after going to the original location in NY on 53rd & 6th Ave but the food was not quite what I remembered. It's been over 6 years since I had food from the street cart over there but it seems like the portions here are smaller than what I remember and the chicken meat was more dry than I expected. I still had a great meal though but unfortunately it doesn't compare to the NY location.

Still plan on giving this place another visit because I really like the food and especially the white sauce!

After being tortured with pics for months, I was so excited to finally get to try The Halal Guys. I went on opening day, around 3 pm, hoping to beat the crowds. I lucked out! Found a parking spot easily, and only had about a 5 minute wait before getting to go inside and place my order. While waiting outside, employees passed out bottles of water and gave us copies of the menu, which was nice. 

I ordered a beef gyro sandwich, 2 falafel on the side, 2 combination platters, and 2 pieces of baklava. 

The gyro was very good- both the pita and the meat had a good texture, in fact the pita was pretty much perfect. I wish I had known I could have gotten toppings on the gyro like jalapeños and olives, but it was their first day being open to the public, and that didn't negate my experience.

The platters I took home for dinner. I made the rookie mistake of getting the large size, so much food! The rice was great, that white sauce lives up to the hype, the red sauce was too much for me. We liked the chicken, the beef, and the falafel, though my husband thought the falafel was a little dry. On the flip side, he loved the baklava and I thought it was a little dry....just a matter of preferences. 

This is a bit of a drive for us, but we agreed we would both return here for weekend lunch, or a quick dinner.

Since I haven't been to the New York to try these guys, happy to see they had a branch in Vegas when we were in town. Went in and had no trouble with parking. The line just happened to be short that day. Got the combo plate and it was awesome with that white sauce.

I'm from the Bronx, you can't play me like this. I can't blame these people because they're just doing their job. However, being a real New Yorker, this sad plate falafel hurt my soul. There were 6 tiny balls of falafel in a giant plate. They only gave me a packet of hot sauce. I can handle heat like bruh. Definitely a lot worse than New York, but it's to be expected.

First and foremost, other than the packets of sauce (of which we received one after paying for 4 extra - Uber Eats), this is NOTHING like NYC.  I should have known and expected that going in to it but I was so excited about that white sauce (which again, I paid for and did not receive after TWO Uber Eats attempts).  

Anyways long story short, we have a newborn, can't really leave house, got excited for Halal Guys, ordered through Uber Eats, paid for extra sauce, didn't get ANY sauce.  Called Uber, they came again and still shorted us the sauce that we PAID for.  Then the food was garbage.  Halal guys as a franchisor should be ashamed and seriously guy's (Tempe store) if you can't figure out delivery just opt out.  You guys are terrible and you can't even answer your phone line.  Total bummer.

Was eager to try this place with all the hype of it coming to Vegas and the story behind it, but was kind of bummed about the food. Dry is the best word for it.

Got chicken and gyro combo platters.  The portion is huge for the regular which is $1 more than the small. Yay for leftovers!  

The meat (chicken especially) was dry and the rice as well.  Not much else to say....dry is dry is dry.

I was real curious to try the white sauce that is raved about.  It is like a mayonnaise based version of tzatziki. The red sauce is like the ghost pepper sauce of HEAT! (Never had ghost peppers, but I would imagine this is how it would burn...haha). Tasty, but it will have you sweating with a runny nose! 

The staff was super nice and cheery in their cute, yellow shirts.  The food was just okay though.

Finally got my fix. The lamb and rice platter still taste like your on 5th ave in NYC. The Only difference is the price but I guess you get what you pay for because now the assurance of cleanliness is clear. You arent in the middle of the street anymore with everyone breathing over the food. And you get all the white sauce you want when you use the bottles thats sitting out for customers.

I used to live in NYC and would frequent the original cart a lot, so coming here to try the store was a must. I went on a weekday, around 2pm - there was a lineup, but maybe for only 15-20 minutes.

Honestly, the cart is miles better than what they're serving at the store. But with that being said, the regular combo platter is a generous portion of chicken, gyro, rice and salad and you really can't go wrong. Even the small size can fill you up.

And, as always, the white sauce is where it's at.

I waited at least 45 minutes and the lineup was around the corner. I ended up ordering the combo platter. Which comes with both chicken and Gyro. 

They are very generous with the white sauce and the hot sauce is pretty fire as well. Be careful. I went into this meal not knowing what to expect. However - all the taste were familiar to me. The best way to explain would be that it tasted a LOT like taco bell burrito's BUT served in a bowl. I asked other people if I was right in my statement- they agreed as well.

Overall- it was on my bucket list as it seems as the  social media line ups from the NYC food stands crossed my timeline's quite a lot. However it did not have any distinct "street food" taste nor was it that distinct or foreign to me. Seemed like a decent meal comparable to already the already established Osmow's brand we have in the GTA.

I don't know whats better the food or the customer service!! They are both great! The Ladies are  amazing n foods extraordinary! Best greek food in Vegas!
Thanks!!

I love the Halal Guys only because of their spicy red sauce. I get the gyro plate (often with double meat) and put around three to four packets of the spicy red sauce and one packet of the white sauce. I like my food drenched in sauce.

For me it lived up to the hype that came from NYC. Every time I visit NYC , I make sure to have Halal guys. The only downside is that the Toronto price is significantly higher than the NYC prices. However, that probably comes from the higher over head from a store versus a food cart.

However, if you aren't a sauce person then I would stay away from this place. The food is extremely bland without their signature sauces.

Also, I've had friends who have had bad experiences as the food can be quite salty for some people. It's a very hate it or love it type of place from all the comments my friends have made about this place.

I got Halal Guys around this time where they have their soft opening. The location is great because it is near both Ryerson, UofT, and Eaton Centre. I had a regular platter with both chicken and gyro over rice with lettuce and salsa. The platters are served with rice, pita, lettuce and tomatoes. You can also get the platters with their famous hot or white sauce and the choice of toppings. The pita was super good to balance out with their hot sauce because it definitely is spicy for me but not overly spicy where you cannot enjoy the dish. Their famous white and hot sauce is also delicious, no wonder they don't reveal the recipe.

Service was quick, I will be returning!

Note: Halal Guys tastes best right when it is served but even after a couple hours when you heat it up, it still tastes good.
The service is A+ but the food is just ok. I got the combo plate and I swear I don't know what was chicken and what was gyro meat.

This was a terrible expensive meal. The staff was chopping meat so loud they couldn't even hear to take my order. I had a Yelp check in for a free dessert, but they would not honor it. Said it was expired however they hadn't taken it off Yelp. The food had no flavor, the hummus was hard and stiff and all of the bottles of sauce at the sauce station were dated two days prior and still sitting there. We won't be back

I was pretty excited to see these guys open up. Stopped in and got a combo plate. Everything tasted great and fresh. It was plenty for one person and I even had some left to share. I will definitely be going back.

Reminds me exactly of the carts in midtown... Overall amazing, great food!!! Staff is always nice and accommodating! Truly go here like 2/3 times a week... Guilty! Reminds me of being on the East Coast

I eat here too often. The food is incredibly flavorful and comforting. I always get a gyro platter. Just a warning the red hot sauce is pretty spicy. Start with one line and then add more if you want it. Actually I would recommend adding it yourself after you get your food. Some of the people are a little more free with the sauce than others and you might end up with more spice than you intend.

I came here for the first time with my husband when I was pregnant and we've been going back at least once a month ever since! 
I started out with trying their combo plate of chicken and gyro but the chicken was a bit too dry for me. It tasted great with EXTRA EXTRA white sauce, but I can't begin to imagine how many calories are in it, so I choose to stick with just 1 Extra White sauce and all gyro. Granted the calories in the whole meal is going to be astronomical, I got to find a way to cut small corners, right? 
The staff is always great but can be a bit slow at times. However I can't complain because I can only imagine what the wait is for the original halal guys in NYC.

My review is mainly for people reading the earlier reviews which are more critical / negative and are a bit put off.

1) I've been to the original food cart in NYC. Of course it's outstanding, but you have to remember the NYC cart is not using Canadian products - meat, veggies, etc, so the taste will be different even slightly. It's also very hard to compete with the original and the charm that it comes with.

2) The lines are long of course because it recently opened, had a huge hype from all the craze that it has in NYC, and so you have to expect the lines to be long for quite some time. Frankly, this seems fairly obvious. As well as key times for lunch and dinner. I went on a Thursday around 6:30 PM and the line was only slightly out the door, but wasn't going around the building as it's been, and everyone seemed fairly content with it. It wasn't until around 7:00 that the line started to really get going.

3) I've never had the actual shwarama or falafel, so I can't speak yet to how good those are, but the platter is what Halal Guys is known for. One user commented that the salad was basic - shredded lettuce and some tomatoes. Consider that it's like that as cooling foods, because of how crazy spicy the hot sauce is. Granted, it probably could be better, but they're not advertising the salad much so it's a bit unrealistic to expect it.

IMO, it's the next best thing. The platter is comparable to Osmows or Lazeez, and that's fine. Everyone has their preferences. My own personal taste, I think it's a bit higher quality and I'm definitely coming back. However, I'd say give it a few months for the hype to get settled and the staff to come together more, get the cooking right, and see then. 

I will give my one critique which is why I can't give this 5 stars: I thought it could be a little cheaper, and the beef tasted a bit generic. I've definitely had the same quality of beef at another shwarama place, but the chicken is good.

It isn't the original NYC cart, but I'm happy with it. Just take the few things in mind and then see.

I was very disappointed with my visit.   Meats are essentially flavorless.  Pita is dry and stale.   And I am not sure I have ever been to a Mediterranean place that does not have actual tzatziki sauce.   They serve some type of crappy mayo based substitute.  This was my first and last time at this place.

I've driven past the New York stand about a hundred times in a taxi but never had the urge to wait in it. Went in on a Monday evening and the line was outside but took only about 15 mins. They are very quick and efficient here. We got 2 regular sized chicken and gyro combo platters. The portions were huge! Everything was delicious however I'm not sure it constitutes such long lineups. Also, the hot sauce is very very hot (nothing like Franks) so take their advice and keep it in one corner if you must try it.

So I don't typically review restaurants when they first open because I like to give them time to work through kinks (I've opened several stores myself). But I had a pretty good experience for my first visit here. If you don't know these guy's story, they started off as a hot dog cart in NYC in the early 90's. Because of the diversity there, they started selling Gyro's and Falafel to better serve the Muslim community. Now they have grown to several locations across the US and AZ now has their second location. The Tempe location is in the perfect spot because there are a lot of Middle Eastern restaurants nearby and they fit in perfectly. I'm curious to see how they will do in Ahwatukee being that it is a smaller town and they aren't known for late night eateries (Halal Guys opens till midnight). The restaurant itself is pretty spacious and clean. I love the simplicity of the menu - a couple sandwich choices, platters and some sides. I was greeted by a very friendly staff and ordered their Falafel platter. You have the option of adding several condiment choices like olives, jalapenos, onions and of course their infamous white and red sauces. The red sauce is a real kicker and I love to douse my entree with it. My only bummer is that they have a cool rewards program which wasn't up and running quite yet. But I'm happy to have Halal Guys here in town and hope they do well.

I'll keep my review short because I don't have much to say. I was looking forward to try The Halal Guys because my husband told me they're really big in NYC. I ordered the chicken platter. The chicken was so bland. I couldn't taste any spices at all. The rice was also very bland. My son ordered chicken gyro and my husband ordered lamb. They were both very bland, as well. The falafel was way too over cooked and dry. Sadly, I was very disappointed, as I walked in expecting more. I'm never going back.

Worst Mediterranean food ever!  I would eat Mediterranean food ANYWHERE ELSE but here.  My friend and I both ordered a platter each and some hummus,  everything was dry and not tasty.   We left disappointed and angry at how bad the food was.

Very dry beef. Chicken tastes better. Not a clean place either. 

The staff are polite and friendly. The portion of the food for small plate and 9.99 is decent. The hot sauce they have is very hot, not your average siriracha.

I recommend trying it once, but there is absolutely nothing special place about it, other shawarma places with their choices of salads and flafel might be even better.

Not authentic or nutritious. I give this place a 1 star just for their sauces. First, if you know anything about Gyro, Shwarma or Döner kebabs they are made on a spit grill that turns and in the process the fat gets extracted at the bottom of the pan. These guys just put all the meet on a large industrial fryer and the meet is soaked and drenched with oil! Furthermore, this meet is ground-meet and tastes like spicy hamburger or Chopli kabob from Pakistan or India. The servers are nice people but have absolutely no knowledge of the type of food they are serving! If you like  minced spicy hamburger meet drenched in fat and oil with some mayo and hot sauce this may be the right place. It was worth trying once, but I will not go back and won't recommend this place until the food is made the authentic way!

Just like the original in NYC! I go to the original cart whenever I'm in NYC and this Vegas location has definitely met my expectations. Great flavor and quality ingredients as well as generous portion size. Love that white sauce... but definitely take it easy on the hot sauce... a little goes a long way! Also enjoyed friendly service from the staff here. All around great experience.

Simply amazing!! Thank you for the delicious food and the trip down memory lane-  of my many cold, late night trips to the food cart on 53rd waiting on that long line!! I it!! The food was absolutely incredible!! Literally tastes exactly like the food cart I grew up with! 
Thanks for opening up so close to my new home! Moved from the east coast about 3 years ago, and that was one of a few things I missed!

I stopped here on the way home from work. Place is clean, service was quick but I have to say the food was just ok. The pita is super thick & so dry that is cracked when I tried to bite into it. Would have been really good if not for the cold dried out pita. There a way better gyros out there than this....won't be back.

Decided to eat before we tackle the Boxing Day. I ate here, when it opened at first place. I heard mix reviews; and after eating there, I wasn't impressed. It was over priced, the food tasted very bland. 

My sister wanted to try, therefore I decided to go again and give a chance. The service was mediocre. The background music was way too loud; I had hard time to order; I had to yell. I asked for chicken sandwich; they ran out of hot sauce. We were the first customer; they are already missing ingredients. My sister's and my sandwiches were really below average. The sodas from the fountains were completely flat and warm.

It's so cold outside; you would except some warmth  inside but it was freezing cold.  

Sadly, it was disappointing my second outing here.

Halal guys was a pretty decent quick and cheap spots to grab a meal at when I first visited New York, so I'm pretty hyped up that they're finally here in Vegas. 

What's even better is that they're located right in the grand busy sector of china town, which is pretty much where I go when I'm drunk and on the roam for food haha

I always pick their combo bowl and get the chicken, which has a good amount of seasoning and flavor, and the lamb which is a definite choice for myself any time I get shwarmas or any type of halal food. The combo goes great over the warm bed of rice and soft hot pita bread pieces you get. Oh! And don't forget to get extra white sauce packets!! 

Um for the red hot sauce, I suggest going easy on it. I made the dire mistake of using too much once and I couldn't taste much that day other than fire and death in my mouth.. Worth it, but seriously go easy there on it buddy!

The meal itself is also pretty cheap, roughly about 9 bucks so you can't complain that you're paying too much considering the portion sizes come in ranges of moderate to fatass level. Thanks for bringing some east coast goodness to Vegas halal guys!!

But uhh where's the lamb at? The Las Vegas location is lacking it, and the menu is rather small and lacking :(

Halal guys is no fancy diner but it is what it is, cheap vendor food, that's filling and quick. And when you're wanting cheap and quick vendor food, halal is pretty decent. I just don't feel the appeal though as much with it being a restaurant style, kinda like turning an ice cream truck into a walk-in diner; it loses the appeal to an extent.

Im from NY and was happy to see that there is cartoon food here! Tried The Halal Guys in Tempe and was not that happy with it. So now that I see there is one closer, I decided to try... OMG just like home! And the girl serving was a joy! Great service and great food. Thank you I will be back!!

My friend and I, decided to brave the lines on a Friday night. The line up was out the door and there was about an hour wait. 

We ordered the combo platter which is chicken, gyros, rice and salad. The white sauce was pretty good but too much of it made me sick. And the hot sauce was super spicy - like burned my mouth spicy. Overall, the dish itself was just okay. It was good but not great. 

Also the restaurant itself was pretty small and since it was busy there were zero places to sit. Luckily, my friend and I managed to grab a table after waiting a little while. 
My friend got up to go to the bathroom and these two women were already eyeing our table. I heard one saying to the other woman, "sorry, we were waiting for this table first". 

Ummmmm....we didn't even finish eating and we were pretty much getting vultured. 

Never again. I'll stick to my local Osmows which tastes 10x better than this place.
Amazing place with some good chicken. I've tasted their Chicken gyro and fry platter . They are open late on the weekends (: Come check the out for Sure!

I cannot even begin to describe how disappointed I was with this place.

I was a regular at the Halal Guys food cart when I lived in New York and found myself craving food from there from time to time.

I was super excited about them opening up a location in Toronto. However the combo was disappointing. It lacked the flavor that made the Halal Guys in New York so good. It made me even wonder if this was the same place as the one in New York? 

I would definitely not come back.

This place just opened up and was nearby so we gave it a try. It's a tiny little storefront, bare bones unless you count the patio out front on the sidewalk. The menu isn't simple which might be OK for some people, but the beef gyro meat was bland and tasteless. Bleah! The platter salad was just chopped iceberg lettuce and tomatoes with two tiny wedges of pita bread. Needless to say, I wasn't impressed. This is just another one of those places that wants to make a quick buck without giving much in return or doing anything to stand out to deserve your business. King of Gyros on Elliott is a bit further for us, but it's far better and well worth the extra drive with better food, better gyros, and a much larger menu.

My first experience of The Halal Guys came from downtown Montreal... I never thought I would say that. NYC Halal Guys is still on my bucket list but this will have to do for now!

As for the food, it was prepared very quickly so the wait you endured lining up will be better once you order. I'm liking the small cut styled shawarma compared to Montreal's. You can even mix it all together Chipotle style (close the container and shake it up). Go for extra white sauce and be careful with the red sauce!

This is an updated review...

Our first time to The Halal Guys was about a month ago and the experience we had then is totally different than what we had today, hence the update.

We ordered a chicken platter and a combo chicken/gyro platter. The rice was nice and fluffy, and the meats were hot and moist. The pita had been steamed over the hot chicken cooking on the flat top and was soft and pliable with chicken juices. The self serve sauce bar was being constantly checked and refilled (BEWARE that hot sauce! It's not for the faint of heart.) and it was decently busy when we arrived.

The customer service here was and is attentive and consistently good. 

Would I come back? Sure. If The Halal Guys can deliver a consistent good experience like this one, I'll be back as a regular customer...especially when I have late night/early morning cravings for that white sauce!

Disappointed by the food here. Ordered several platters. all we're mediocre. The hummus and baba ganoush we're very blah. Even the baklava wasn't very good. I wouldn't come here again for sure and may not go to any other halal guys location based on this experience. The falafel itself was ok though.
Car runs a red light and nearly slams into us at 2 AM. Luckily, Halal Guys was nearby to save us with a great late-night meal. Thanks, Halal Guys.

The food was very tasty, but they lose stars for trying to make their gyro look like it was full of meat when it was full of lettuce.  I get that they are in a casino and are probably paying a premium for rent, but please don't try to fool me with lettuce, that stuff drives me nuts.  Also, let me add my own Tahini, garlic sauce, whatever. Controlling the sauce and adding a little tiny line of sauce does not make me happy.
Food tastes as good as in NYC, but the service speed is very very slow compare to those in NYC. 9 people working behind the counter and they can't make the line move.

I went here to see what the hype was all about but was sadly disappointed. Food was dry, I see employees making meals in front of the trash can and honestly feel like I was unwelcomed. I don't think I'll be eating here again

Finally, The Halal Guys are here in AZ.  This place has just opened across from ASU.  It's def tasty and the staff are super friendly.   Def come and check this out.  The hot sauce is super spicy but addicting.

Went in for just a salad.. didn't see it on the board but asked.. awesome lady made me a platter with beef and chicken, lettuce, tomatoes and jalapenos. Had her go light on the ginger rice.. (it's awesome)
Best low carb salad I've found in Vegas.
Will return for sure.

I appreciate u guys for coming west. People want to be "foodies" when they don't even know the heart and soul of the Halal TRUCK. This food has gotten me back from many of hangovers, broke times and even made me feel like I made a very healthy choice at that price(because we all know $5 can't go far ESPECIALLY in New York City) I was born and raised there and when I left, my heart broke when I realized I was leaving my beloved trucks. I gave a 4 because though the food is awesome, I think it's missing that food truck authenticity (since its now its a store front lol)and I didn't get as much white sauce as I expected...it might be because I asked my brother to get it for it me  but good luck guys, tell your Jamaica Ave truck keep up the good work I'll be coming back!!!
:( they where closed I got there around 11:30p sighn on door said open till 4am and it said the same on their website. call before.

Always looking for a good gyro. Given that Halal Guys is buzzy new addition to the Phoenix area, I wanted to give it a try. There are several places to get a solid gyro in the S Tempe, W Chandler, Ahwatukee area, so how'd they stack up?

Poorly. I ordered the simply gyro sandwich. Unfortunately, the amount of meat they put on is pitiful. It really looked pathetic. I went with traditional toppings - tomatoes and onions. I went with their white sauce. The majority of the sandwich was comprised of the fluffy pita.

The meat itself wasn't bad. But it was lost in a mouthful of pita. It seemed like ordered pita with a small side of meat. So any goodness from the meat just got drowned out.

Considering the cost of the gyro, I was quite disappointed with Halal Guys. I'll be sticking with the local King for gyros...

I believe that food got lost in the mass production and chain game. This is an overpriced version of subway. Tonight it served a quick bite to eat in between errands but we were left hungry. Even an added order of the cafeteria style fries and babaganoush didn't fill us up. Flavors were bland, except for the hot sauce (definitely delicious), the white sauce tasted like yogurt only. Sad to say, we won't be returning to this franchise.

Oooohhhh how I love this place!!! So many gluten-free options, not to mention it's delicious! The Manger is so helpful  and his team were  on point with their customer service!!  Will definitely be back

I give The Halal Guys a lot of credit for opening directly across the street from ASU. Smart!  AND, they're open until 4 in the morning, on Thursday thru Saturday's. Real smart!

When I worked in the WTC in New York, there were a bunch of Middle Eastern food trucks on Broadway, near the old Merrill building at One Liberty.  There was always a Kabob truck, a Falafel truck and Gyro truck.  Oh yeah, and a Sabrett's Hot Dog stand. LOL 

The Halal Guys were a midtown operation, but very similar.  "Halal meats that are seasoned to perfection and a melting pot of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean flavors that are sure to delight."

You should know, that Halal, Halaal, or  food is not the same as Greek food. It's middle eastern in origins, but tastes subtly different. You'll find no Kronos lamb spinning here either. 

They serve their food steamed (photos), not fried -- on a plate with chicken or beef type gyro meat(photo), over rice and bed of iceberg lettuce, covered in their proprietary (creamy mayo) White Sauce. 

We really liked our food. We ordered the combo plater of beef and chicken; with a sides four falafel balls with tahini sauce and a small bowl of humus. We also grabbed a beef gyro to go. LOL

The rice was very tasty and we found the meat to be slightly bland, but their sauce made up for it. If you enjoy heat, you'll have to try their chili paste based Hot Sauce. I loved it, a 8/10 alarm'er. 

So Three Stars, "A-Okay".

This place died down faster than I expected. When they opened about a month ago, the wait was almost 15-20 minutes outside in the heat but the last I went, we were 2 out of the 7 customers that were there. 

Their potions are very generous, in my opinion, especially when I asked them to exclude the veggies from my plate. The chicken is my favorite and you can never have enough of that white sauce. 

One star off because it seemed like some workers were just standing around while some workers were constantly moving. Maybe I'm being a little judgmental but the worker at the register was literally leaning on the counter with her elbows and staring off into space. 

Also, during their opening, their AC was broken so I was sweating in there but I didn't mind because it was packed. The last time I was there, the AC was blasting almost to the point where it seemed over exaggerated because it was already cool outside. It was just overall uncomfortable in there. Hopefully a happy medium next time.

We went to visit for dinner before heading back to home to Cali. I must say I wasn't as impressed as I was when I had the plates my sister brought home from their original stand in NYC. I thought I was going to be blown away as I originally was when I tasted their plate from NYC but found it mediocre. Still love it though in spite of. The sauces are the delicious. The spicy hummus is okay. The meat and chicken were cooked okay. Overall, not too bad.
This place has good price and portions, restaurant is clean and convenient. People work here are super nice, we will definitely come back!

Service has always been good
Food quality is the same as NYC but the quantity is less and it has increased in cost with more popularity. I like that it's close but don't necessarily have cravings for it anymore. 

Mediterranean style chicken, rice, lettuce and tomatoes with small pieces of pita. 
Addicting white sauce and really spicy hot sauce which has a thick paste like consistency. 

Not something I would go to often, too many other places to go nowadays. But like I said great service and reminds me of being in college again!

First time visit to "The Halal Guys" this evening for a snack before the movies. Centrally located in China Town next to Krung Siam on Spring Mountain and Valley View. Always happy to see a freebies upon Yelp check in! Today we each got a baklava.

The wife and I ordered a platter and a sandwich so we could share. She ordered the combo platter with chicken and gyro. It came with rice, lettuce, pita bread, and your choice of a number of items including, onions, peppers, tomato, jalapeños, olives and a white tahini sauce. Very filling plate and delicious 4/5. I had the chicken sandwich which is loaded with as much chicken as they can fit in the bread, topped off with peppers, jalapeños, kalamata olives and white sauce. Huge, messy and delicious to the last bite! 4/5. We tried the other sauces available next to the drink tower: hot sauce FIRE in a bottle (sriracha got nothing on this sauce) and the bbq sauce. Good variety and worth trying each or a mixture. 

For dessert we enjoyed the baklava which hit he spot and attempted to put the fire out from that hot sauce. Two sprite refills and a baklava later, lips still tingled. Overall a nice quick meal with the wife.

This place doesn't compare with their NY original carts.  I guess the NY carts are so busy that the meats are fresh and the food is hot.  This place had oily rice and the food doesn't taste very good.  The white sauce is similar and the hot sauce was super spicy.  Service was slow and not very friendly.  I would not go back.
Great to see the Halal guys spreading west! The same great schwarma, rice, veggies and pita. Make sure to top it with the white and hot sauce
Went on the soft opening for a family night, good food, good company, and great hospitality. Overall a wonderful experience for my family.

You either love it, or you feel, just "eh" about The Halal Guys. It's not like it's hit or miss, because it's pretty much the same, every time. There are minimal options, and you most likely know what you are going to order before you arrive. I personally love the combo platter, which is grilled chicken, beef, lettuce, tomatoes, rice, and pita bread. I add two white sauce packets and one hot sauce packet. YES, the hot sauce IS HOT. BUT, if you like spicy, and you mix it all together, it compliments the meat and white sauce perfectly and leaves just the right amount of linger on your tongue. I love it! You can also order falafel if you don't do meat. Or a Gyro sandwich on fresh pita. 
The location is a decent size with about 4 tables. But it's really meant to be just like NY, grab and go. See a long line, don't stress, it moves SO FAST!  
I had The Halal Guys off a truck in NY, and to me, it taste the exact same! I have read some reviews about it being different but I did not notice. This place has been open less than a month and I have already been here 4 times! My kid likes it, my boyfriend likes it, and even when I brought my best friend a plate, she killed it. 
Sure, it's basic. But to me, it hits the spot every time. Good, fresh food, nice people, good prices. The crack sauce, I mean white sauce that is so DAM addicting. If you haven't stepped out of your pizza and burger comfort zone lately, take a leap and do it here!
