This place is a little overrated, in my opinion. It was so hyped up, so we ordered early everything on the menu and it was terrible. The rice was dry, the meat seemed like it was from last week, the baklava was frozen. Just all around weird, unappetizing and just flat out not good.

three people working!!!
one putting my order together!!
all three having an in depth conversation & the one putting my order together is moving in slow motion because she's talking to the supervisor & the other worker. the other two are watching while the one is slowly moving. 
stop talking & put my stuff together. 
as far as i'm concerned, its the super who blew this review. 
wtf

Came in today to try the infamous Halal Guys. They were pretty busy since it's only the 2nd day of being open. There are only a few tables as the restaurant is pretty small. The service was decent considering they were pretty busy. 

The AC isn't working yet, so be prepared to be toasty if you come in during the first week of opening. They have free water and coolers running which does help. 

As for the food, the small combo platter was a perfect size for me. The meat and rice is flavorful, the white sauce is so delicious, that hot sauce is HOT! I read the warnings but didn't believe them. Start with a little and add more if it's not enough. It is very hot! 

Overall, I would definitely come back again. I'll give it a few months when it's less busy. Great addition to the Chinatown area!
Omg. The food here is so good! The line looked a lot longer than it actually was. The service was fast and friendly. It's a little pricey but totally with it. I'll be back before we leave Vegas!!

I ordered delivery and they were out of poutine so they called me to ask if they could send me something else, which was fine. However, when the food arrived it was cold and soggy, also the sauces they gave me had a best before date of a month ago. I tried to call the restaurant to let them know they were serving expired food, but no one answered even though the restaurant was still open.

I've only every other takeout from this pace and the food is just big just like all New York food ought to be. The flavors, the hot sauce and the white sauce are fatty and fantastic. Highly recommend you pair your bowl of whatever you buy with baklava. I wish you good luck with your food.

Yay! The Halal Guys are in town!

I didn't know they had opened shop, so it was a pleasant surprise to come across their open door. There was momentarily no line-up, so we decided to try it for dinner.

We ordered a Chicken plate and a Gyro plate, with white sauce. The workers were so efficient, I barely had the time to find my wallet that the food was ready. The meat was tender and succulent, and generously seasoned. It was actually a bit salty, but it went well with the generous portion of rice. Everything was very good and fresh. I had no complaint, appart from the price. I find that 10.99$ for a small place is a bit expensive, but they can probably pull it off given the food quality. 

When we were leaving, the line-up was out of the door again - good thing they work fast.
A new, very competitive addition to the Concordia neighbourhood!

Yes, halal guys I one of those places that gets me excited. Specially the fact that this store is open late at night as well. If you're going to compare the food sold here from the New York stall, please save your breath. It isn't and will never be that. Go fly to New York if you're really that keen to talk about it.

I always order the combo platter since that's the dish that started it all from the original stall by time square. It's fast, its easy and really yummy as well. They even hooked it up with a yummy dessert just for checking in on yelp yelp.

The place was really nice. I think the location was brand new. Very well kept as well. Would definitely come back and eat here again.

Thank you so much for reading my review. I hope this helps with your decision making experience. Enjoy your awesome yelptastic day!

Just went earlier today, it's my second time eating here and I like it. Really tasty and the white sauce is delicious.  I did have to wait in line for a while even though there was only 1 person in front of me. There were 4 people behind the counter. Aside from waiting, I'll keep coming back for more.

Ive eaten at the one in NY, LA and now here in Vegas.
I have to say a big, thumbs down.
Went here first on a Wednesday night around 5, super long line, but the food was hot and not dried out. Food was being cut from the rotisserie and fresh
The next time I went here, my hubby and I were craving it on a Friday night (2/18/17). Went here around 10pm ( and keep in mind- this place is open until 2am)
We ordered 2 gyro platters ($8.99)- combo of rice, iceberg lettuce, chopped tomato, gyro meat
- side toppings include: jalapeño and onions
Michelle checked us out and helped us. 
NOTHiNG looked (or tasted) fresh: tomatoes were all pre chopped and super dried out- you know where the skin is all wrinkled and dehydrated, the meat was all cut up into little small pieces not in larger chunks (like how it usually it's when it is cut fresh from the rotisserie)- super oily as it had been sitting in the heating bin for a while, the pita was served cold- I watched as another girl put it on the grill for about 20-30 seconds, the rice- that was the worst part! The rice had this deep orange tint to it- not the usual yellow tint I'm used to- and it had def been sitting there for a while and not fresh- because the rice as it went into our mouths were super rock hard like little bee bee pellets. The only fresh thing was the salad (iceberg). And the worst was the large chunks of white onion. They put so much on and it was super spicy and sulfur tasting. 
In general, the restaurant is very small and has about 5 tables. Can maybe sit about 20 people. The weirdest is the table right near the door ( so awkward). 
Overall, I think the owner sold out. The quality has decreased significantly. The sauce packets of the white sauce and red sauce don't taste the same and the percentage of saturated fat in 1 white sauce packet alone is a whopping- 53%!!
I know that lamb/beef gyro meat isn't the healthiest but dayum- 2 packets of white sauce will put u over the recommended daily saturated fat intake! 
I'm am sad to say, after my experience here last night, the quality of the food made me not want to crave it anymore.
I would give this 1 star, but I know the food could be so much better! 

****Yelp Check in!!: FREE Bahklava- crunch layers of filo dough with butter, sugar syrup, pistachios and nuts: Really delicious and great for breakfast or after snack ( doesn't need to be refrigerated)

Their food is complete shit. I have never had worse Middle Eastern food. It's like they ate crappy Middle Eastern food, and then shat it out into the tray that they served us. Their white sauce is total crap. It's mayonnaise. Why not just call it mayonnaise so we don't get our hopes up that it might be tzatziki? I enjoy hot sauce, even siracha and habanero hot sauce, but the red sauce was completely inedible. Obscenely high in calories and fat (330 calories and 36g fat per pack of white sauce). Complete waste of money.

Not recommending. Getting 2 stars for customer service and clean store. Food was not very good. Ordered the combo gyro and chicken platter. Chicken was shredded/chopped and dry the gyro tasted fried and no flavor what so ever. The meat may have been sliced at one point then they chop it to very little pieces. Pile of rice which was okay. Olives were the best tasting on the platter. The white sauce was not good either. Mayo based, way too much put on the platter and again, no flavor even though it's compared to  tzatziki sauce. I didn't taste any cucumber or onion what-so ever. Also tried the hummus which maybe since I make my own was not very good. The pita should have been at least thrown on the grill to warm up and toast a little which didn't happen so basically was pulled out of the bag and rolled in tin foil. And yes we are in but food was not very warm. Not a place I'd go back to.

Got the combo platter with a side of falafel, extra white sauce, couple dots of red.  The combo platter was great.  Falafel was terrible, hard as rock.  Couldn't finish one.  Service was friendly.  Came during the grand opening and the line moved quick.  There was an issue because I didn't have id but they let me slide.  Thanks guys!  Location and parking sucks.  But what are you gonna do?  Better than being on the strip I guess.

Easy peazy lemon squeezy. Easy menu. Crunchy lettuce. Chicken and gyro meat are pretty dry on their own. You need lots of sauce to meld everything together, but once you've done like 3-4 zig zag patterns and 15-20 dots of hot sauce, you're golden.

When I found out Vegas was finally getting our very own Halal Guys I was giddy as giddy can be! But when I took my very first bite I was sadly disappointed. I stopped going here for months to give them time to sort their shit out. 

Surprise surprise. They really turned themselves around since the grand opening days. I'm really glad I gave them another shot since the taste and quality of their food got much better.

The first few times I came here, everything was bland, they skimped out on meat and were sloppy and not consistent with their plating. Now they have everything down to a science and starting to almost taste like like their big brother in New York (alas it will never be the same as a gritty grill cart on the street) but it will satisfy the urge. Plus it's more convenient than a flight to NYC.

The beef gyro here is my favorite! However, for first timers, why not sample everything to see what your favorite is? I recommend trying the Halal Classic (mix combo platter): chicken & beef gyro, yellow rice and a simple side salad. I always ask them to add olives and onions as well. "The perfect bite" is with a little bit of protein, rice, salad - make sure it's all sauced up! A bite with the salad adds a crisp texture and also the pita triangles are fabulously soft and so fluffy - mix it all up and dig in! It's an explosion of flavor! If you still don't want to take the plunge to try the beef gyro, the chicken & rice is decent. I just love the beef gyro though.

Their babaganoush isn't shabby and I also like their falafels, if I am in the mood. 

Make sure to try their 4 different sauces: 

1. Creamy white sauce - Don't be shy and drizzle a good amount of their "crack" sauce! 2 and a half sauce packets (or more) will do the trick. It really takes the food to delicious heights and adds a wonderful creaminess. Less is more doesn't apply to this. More is MORE!!!

2. BBQ sauce - I know, don't let that weird you out! Drizzle a little over your platter, mix it in and go from there. It adds the perfect sweetness to the food, balances everything out, without weighing down the dish. Love it!

3. Hot sauce - That Red Devil Sauce. Swell up your tongue and face type of situation. I love the hot sauce because it's unique to Halal Guys and it has bold flavor. It heats up every morsel and really brings the dish to life! Just make sure to use it sparingly (start with a dot and work your way up from there) 

4. Tahini - Toasted ground hulled sesame seed sauce. It has a rich nutty flavor and pairs nicely with the falafels. 

I won't say this location will blow your socks off like the cart did to me in NYC. But the flight to NYC is a further reach than dealing with the differences here. Dig in!

After coming here a few times and giving them several tries, I realized I really just don't like their food. I was very disappointed. Their rice and falafels are always so dry and I feel like in order to enjoy their food you have to drench it in their sauce. 
I'm a sauce girl, and I have to say I wasn't even impressed with their white sauce. In fact the only thing that kept me coming back was their insane hot sauce which I fell in love with.

Just opened up in Caesar's palace food court. Glad we saw this. My wife and I have to drive pretty far for Halal Guys. Since we were in Vegas for vacation why not! Love this stuff! Combo Platter All day with white sauce! Basically a mini Halal Guys. Staff is nice. Got our food really quick. Happy to know they have this in Caesars! Open til 4:30 am I believe!

I wanted to check out for myself what the hype was all about and they didnt fail me good food,  friendly crew and clean restroom what else can you ask for.  Oh and the white sauce is the bomb.  Will definitely come back

I really wanted to love this place. I go to the Massage Envy in the same strip mall once a week, and the scent of the food wafting out of Halal Guys smelled irresistible.... Too bad they drowned our meals in thick, heavy sauces. My husband's chicken and gyro bowl was literally inundated with a mayo-based sauce. The proportion of sauce to actual food was serious overkill. #FoodCrime. If you eat here, skip the sauce so you can actually taste your food.

We have eaten here several times and really enjoyed the food. Tonight, we stopped by and ended up not eating. We expected that they would be understaffed, though the two employees were not prepared for how busy it was. While ordering, they must have thought the customer behind me was there with me, she took his order at the same time and had him pay before me. She already missed half of what I ordered, even though I repeated myself 2 or 3 times. I was already watching closely because I watched the guy at the cash register start handling food after taking money from another customer without washing his hands or at least changing his gloves. The person making my food did the same thing, took cash and then started to make the rest of the order, without washing her hands or changing gloves and had touched all of the bread that was being kept warm on the grill. At that point I was done and we walked out.

3.5 Stars.
I feel like this place was a bit overhyped. The portions are huge and the service is very good but it's pricey and the sauces aren't anything special.

I tried the sandwich and the plate. 

The plate was mostly rice, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. A small part of it was actually meat. It was disappointing given the price.

The sandwich was better but their meat is seasoned in a way that made me tired of eating after a while. 

Overall ok but wouldn't be my first choice. It looks better than it tastes.

Visited the original when I was in NYC - glad they finally opened one in Vegas! The food was delicious and the red sauce is still as hot as hell. Service was even better - Johnnie was the bomb and went out of her way to help us! Any time you hit Halal Guys - look for Johnnie and give her a shout out.

Just ate form this spot, it was amazing! Best gyro I've ever had! You guys keep doing your thing. I'm definitely going to be a regular. 
Ps the hot sauce is HOT!

After the anticipated opening of Halal Guys, of course I had to attend the soft opening and it did not disappoint! We ordered 6 platters of the chicken and gyro mix and drowned them in the white sauce. Two sizes are available- small and large- and the small was more than enough. It contains rice, salad, beef gyro, chicken and pita slices. Food was awesome, the service was great and efficient. Only complaint was the price. I did expect New York quantity for around the same price of $7. The small platter was about $11-12. 
Overall, I'd definitely recommend and will be back! And beware of the hot sauce! Couple drops was more than enough for me.

No joke...I'm addicted to the combo platter. The heaping portion of gyro meat and chopped grilled chicken is very satisfying to your hunger pains. Mix on the the rice, lettuce, diced tomato, and the Halal guys famous white sauce. Two packs of white sauce with half a packet of the TASTE BUD SEARING red sauce. Careful use sparingly or you will pay the price later.  

The falafel platter is amazing also. Beautiful crunch on the outside and a light green hue on the inside. YUM!  We had an order of fries which were fresh and made to order and seasoned proper.  

The seating area is somewhat small with 25 seats max. The line moves pretty fast during peak business so don't be discouraged if you have to wait a short while.

Enjoy!

I am a proud sheeple (sheeperson? sheep?) 

I've heard all the hype surrounding the Halal Guys and saw the long lineup so OF COURSE I had to check it out. 

I split the combo platter with my boyfriend. Total cost was $14, which, to be honest is kinda expen$ive. Anyway, first impressions: that is the most photogenic shawarma plate I have ever seen. Ever. Unfortunately, I didn't take a picture since I was too hungry (classic first world problem), but go take a look at the pictures other Yelpers have posted and you will understand. 

The secret is in the sauce. The food gets drenched in this white sauce and it is the perfect addition. You can also add spicy sauce. They'll only put a very small line and at first you'll be confused because that seems like nothing but TRUST ME (and the other reviewers) that's more than enough.

The meat felt very light (although, let's be honest, it's probably like a bajillion calories), so I guess that's a good thing.

Overall, a decent meal and a decent experience. I think some of the low reviews it's been getting are a little unfair. Will I ever come back? It's kind of out of the way, so probably not. But! If I happen to be in the area and am willing to shell out the money, I'll give it another try.

We couldn't wait until they opened close to our house, but what a disappointment. Hardly any menu items and the price is high. The food tasted like it had been sitting out all day. The pita bread was dry and crimping when trying to eat it with the hummus. They advertise their specials but don't have any. They say it's past- my question why keep advertising of you don't have the items anymore. Don't think this place would be worth trying unless your desperate. I'd have to say the two employees upfront were nice but the manager would even acknowledge any of the customers. More worried about telling the other employees what they need to clean.

Compared to any others the service here is abysmal.  Asked For a falafel platter still got a mixed.  They need to mention on their site or Uber eats that their gyro is beef and not lamb.  This is crucial due to religious purposes. Horrific service. Won't be ordering again. I'll stick to it whenever I go back to nyc where at least they pride themselves in the service.

This is the best option at the food court! Great food and excellent service!i had the hummus and falafel sandwich with the best French fries ever! The staff is really friendly and generous with the white sauce ! And I am very picky so everything looks clean and fresh! Good addition at the Caesars palace
So bomb. Don't underestimate the hot sauce!

Super pumped that these guys have a "Brick & Mortar" resto in Vegas now. I lived in Manhattan and ate the Chicken Rice plates with the "White Sauce" all the time. Now I don't have to stand up and eat it. I can finally sit down lol #MustTry

Halal Guys has been the talk of the town these past couple of weeks. I'm sad to say it was not worth my 20 minute wait.

I ordered the regular combo platter with chicken and gyro. The platter was topped with a layer of white sauce, along with balanced servings of meat, lettuce and rice. The sauces definitely made up the stars in this review. The white sauce was oh so lovely but oh so bad for you. Their red sauce had a great kick (be warned, you will likely finish your meal with a lingering burn on your mouth).

In terms of actual food, I thought the gyro meat's texture was a bit mushy, and the chicken was alright.

This area offers plenty of options for a quick bite, so I probably won't be revisiting on my own accord.

Simple food done right. I've always somehow missed my opportunities to pick something up from their cart in New York, so I bookmarked this spot to check out. I met up with my bf's extended family here - met for the first time, laughed, learned a little about each other, all over delicious chicken and rice. We ate at a BIG variety of food while we were in Vegas and the Halal Guys is among the top of my list. I can't wait for them to open in Atlanta later this year/early next year!

Probably the best place in the food court. It's open late, and for $9.99 you get so much! I could only eat half of my bowl! I got the combo bowl which throws in beef, chicken, rice, salad, bread, white sauce and a strand of spicy sauce. I love spicy and I  was a little thrown off when I only got a small strip of  spicy but I was pleasantly surprised with the level of kick! Rice is full of flavor, salad is crisp, cheap, quick, ample and delicious!!

They could've come up with a better name than white sauce ... lol

There's a lot of hype with Halal Guys. But don't get it twisted, this is not NYC. It's so much better in New York. 

It's still good, but is a bit pricey for fast food - $12.49 + tax for a chicken and gyro platter. The portion isn't as big either. 

It's not officially open until May 5th. It's a soft opening, they're still training staff. 

The hot sauce is crazy spicy. It tastes like burning 
https://youtu.be/z0kVbXvId3A

Maybe because it was too busy when I was in there. Hard to get a seat. This felt like the Subway Sandwich assembly line of Middle Eastern fare. Food was okay, but I've had tastier. If we were just judging hot sauce, they would get 5 stars though. That stuff is pure fuego, and you'll want some of that white sauce to survive.

When we visited New York in 2012 our cousin introduced us to this amazing dish on the streets of New York from the Halal guys. It was our first experience and the food was Yummy! Since then we wanted to eat it again. We are happy to hear that they've opened one up in Las Vegas. We ordered the beef gyro & combo plate to share and of course can't forget about the white sauce dressing. Everything was delicious, flavorful and satisfied our long awaited craving... Will definitely be back again.  Thanks Halal guys!!

WOOOOWWW. This place is literally amazing.

Chipotle + Mediterranean Food + Better Deserts than Chipotle (being that they have some) = Halal Guys. I will literally wait in line for however long it takes, because I love this place so much. I first had it in NYC, and it was great then, and it's even better now because I don't have to go all the way to NYC to get it. There's also usually cute dogs on their patio outside so what is not to love?
Gross parsley's is way better...I'm so disappointed. You're doing New Yorkso so wrong ugh. Only good thing is locals get a discount. However is is worth it? No!
I loved everything about this place! The food was awesome, the service was great! Nothing else to say..

Warning the hot sauce ruins the food. Who needs to burn the s*** out of their mouth eating this? The food is not as good as I had hoped. The white sauce everyone raves about tastes like mayonnaise. I don't get the appeal. I wanted to like it much more than I did based on all the great review. But it's not worth the 10 bucks.

I went in with high expectations since I've heard there famous. Boy was I disappointed. The lettuce they put in the platters is disgusting low grade iceberg white lettuce. And the meat is a little dry. This would have been okay had I not asked for the hot sauce. They asked if I wanted the hot sauce I said yeah and she asked how many lines. I usually love hot sauce and eat it on everything but this was not hot sauce, this was fire sauce. It was so hot I literally could not even finish my food. My mouth, lips and nose were burning and you can't fast any flavor other than hot. You should really warn people that the hot sauce is this hot or not even offer it to be put on. It's ridiculously hot. It's not even remotely tasty. It took an hour of me drinking ice cold water for my lips to stop burning. Ridiculous!!

When news hit that The Halal Guys were gonna open up in Vegas, everybody was excited including me. Ironically, I was in New York the same week they opened. Of course I got my Halal fix while I was there and when I get back home to Vegas, I was definitely gonna hit this place up for its that good.

Located in the same plaza as the Thai restaurant Krung Siam, these guys are basically on the corner of Spring Mountain and Valley View. The place is kind of small so good luck in finding a table at peak hours. I came in on a late tuesday evening around 9 pm. Im glad they close late for I was starving and was looking forward to another experience like I did just weeks before.

Unfortunately, it was no where near what I came to expect. The first thing that stuck out like a sore thumb was the giant portable air conditioner in the middle of the restaurant. Not only was it loud, but I dont think it was sufficient enough to keep the place cool for it was still pretty warm in there. Now if they were trying to simulate the hot outdoor weather of New York since its a food cart well then they kind of succeeded. You just dont have the humidity part. I still dont know how you New Yorkers get accustomed to that sticky feeling on your skin.

Anyways, I got the regular size Gyro Combo ($9.99) which was only a dollar more than the small combo. This consisted of shredded chicken, beef, a salad mix, some rice, and slices of pita bread. 

This is the part that is very disappointing. Both meats were dry! I threw some white sauce on there and it only helped it a little bit. For those of you that are not familiar with their sauces, their main one is what people describe as a spiced up mayo/ranch sauce. Only this sauce seemed more watered down and I could hardly taste any spices. They also have a hot sauce that is a legit make you cry steam coming from your head type of spicy in which you should only put a little bit first just to see if you can handle the heat.

I hate to say it but this is where the "chain" restaurant label comes in meaning that the food is nothing like its original location. Thats the best way I can describe it. In my opinion, the food carts they have in New York, the reason why they have really long lines and its not dry is because the food is cooked fresh. This location it looks like they cook everything in mass quantities and then put them in food trays. So by the time you get your food, its been sitting in the trays for a little bit.

So in closing, I am very disappointed. Im definitley not gonna be craving this type of cuisine any time soon and if I do, it will be somewhere else. My experience was not good to the point that it was laughable because of the hype that came with this opening. If anybody asks me about these guys I will refer them to this review. Im not saying for them not to go but if they come back and tell me it was laughable as well, then I will have no choice but to call these guys "The Ha!Lol Guys"

Yelp 2016 Review #50 
623 overall
Had the chicken and beef gyro combo. The rice was dry, the pita bread wasn't heated up and the tomatoes were unripe. Would not come back.
Ordered the Beef Gyro sandwich and the meat and ingredients were really great!!! The pita bread that it came with was really dry and not great. I should have ordered the platter. Next time...
The food here is pretty good! There aren't too many options but the flavor of everything makes up for it :) Beware of the hot sauce though, it's really spicy!

delicious 
The platters are a lot, could easily feed two. yummy and get speedy service

Definitely smelt like New York street meat. So I was reminiscent of back home immediately. Staff was the coolest. Up sold me on the hummus for a dollar more. We laughed cause she was a true salesperson. Told her that her confidence should be in timeshares with me. 
Falafel sandwich was good and not overcooked. Price wasn't too over the top. Next time I will get the platter and bring my son to see what he thinks about it since he's not eating meat this month.
Happy to have food venues from the east coast other than pizza here in Vegas.
Excellent food at great price... nice orderly service to get you faster through than Chipotle...gyro meat is the best but beware of red sauce since it's extra hot

I don't get the hype. The hummus was ok. The falafel was ok. The gyro (beef only) was almost like a ground beef it was chopped so finely. The chicken is also shredded. It's ok. The white sauce is a seasoned mayo basically. I was expecting and hoping for tzatziki. The hot sauce is extremely hot, as they warn you, but not a flavorful or good hot. Nothing here was awful, nothing was remarkable or worth a second trip. Try it when the novelty fades so you can find a place to sit while you eat your mediocre food.

Halal Guys is one of my FAVORITE places in Tempe! The menu is simple and delicious. 
Yesterday I visited in the afternoon with my boyfriend. It was pretty busy, but the staff was so efficient that we barely had to wait. I got the gyro sandwich with white sauce and 3 lines of hot sauce. It is super hot but the sauce is amazing and gives so much flavor! I also got hummus and pita on the side. My boyfriend got the combo platter with a side of french fries. Both of our meals were amazing and we left so happy! I would highly recommend this for high quality, fast, fresh food!

Got the food through UberEATS. The food was delivered on time. 

We had ordered two platters plus two extra hot sauces . The platters are supposed to come with two white sauces(4) and 1 red sauce(2). When we got the order we only had three white sauces and 2 hot sauce and 2 were missing. I called and they apologized but they can't refund because it was through UberEATS.

The food quality is average at best. The rice has no flavor. The white sauce is mayo based nothing to rave about. The hot sauce might be just bit too hot. The meats are ok

I would stick to places like Baiz or haji baba!!!

Sadly won't be coming again anytime soon.

I wish I could give The Halal Guys (Toronto) more stars, but I just can't. While the experience wasn't horrible, it just wasn't the same as Halal Guys in NYC. 

My visit here was around noon on a weekday. That was the mistake because the lineup was all the way around the building almost to the Wellesley Station entrance. Luckily, I had a friend who got there just as rush was starting and was at the front of the line who ordered food for the two of us. (Thank you Erica U.).

If you've ever been to the NYC street cart chain, you wait because the carts are small and can only cook so much food at a time, so the lineup was justified. This Toronto location is an actual restaurant with sit down areas and all, cooking surfaces are at least 2x the size, so you'd think the food comes quicker. Kind of, but because they take debit and credit as well as cash, line up takes a while. 

I feel the restaurant regulates serving sizes because I got the same combo plate as the last time I visited NYC and NYC combo plate was much more full, whereas the one we got this time, it was more rationed. The taste is fairly close.

If the lineup continues to stay this long, I think I'll just wait until the next time I get back to NYC for my next Halal Guys fix.

So what can I say it's the Halal guys the food of course was delicious as always and the quality was definitely on point. I was kind of worried about taking my husband there because he had never tried it and I wasn't sure if it would live up to the hype. It's in the heart of downtown so that's really nice we did have some trouble finding parking but that's typical of anything in downtown. Once we got there thankfully there was not much of a line and we were able to order but it was really really hot inside the restaurant and they actually had one of those humongous commercial fans blowing towards everyone. We got our food and even ordered some falafel. We were able to get a table easily and sat down to eat. Since they are cooking the food right then and there behind the line where you order it just gets really incredibly hot and extremely noisy especially when they're chopping up the chicken all you hear is really loud middle bringing together which is what we heard for about 20 minutes or so. We got lucky because as soon as we sat down and started eating the line got really long and went out the door but they were serving people pretty quickly. Everybody was in search of a table though so it became a little bit rushed and then of course it was really hot in there so I just felt like there was too much going on. A homeless guy came in and literally went through the entire restaurant asking people for money but not one person noticed he even asked people in the line where people were ordering the food and again not one employee noticed or asked him to leave. This was quite bizarre because he's literally asking one person away from the cashier and every other person in line as they order food but they really had no clue or care as to what was going on inside the restaurant! Again the food was good but I would say the falafel was the biggest hit of the night which I'm really glad my husband ordered. I still don't think that "fast food" for two people that are eating two small entrées plus a drink and falafel should cost 30 bucks though!

so glad these guys came here. I had halal guys last time I was in NYC off a food truck and it was very good then, STILL AS GOOD The only thing  is always packed and and no place to sit and eat but bring memories back..

Upon entering the store we weren't greeted or acknowledged. Ordering was a bit confusing and the worker wasn't much help. Although the veggies in my sandwich were very yummy and fresh, the chicken was WAY too dry and over cooked and ruined it for me. Unfortunately will not be returning to try anything else.

I am not drinking the same koolaid or "white sauce" that everyone else is. The tbl next to me put it best, This is not really worth $9-10 as I can get similar and even better food for less.

The falafel itself was crunchy and moist inside, however it lacked the flavor punch I am used to. The rice was fine nothing special same for the iceburg lettuce and tomato "salad"  a few soft peta points and that is a platter. They offer two sauces, White some may like dressing, and hot which truly is hot. However no tahini.

Sure it may have been on TV but you cant state what you see on tv.

Note for the Vegetarians out there, their normal pitas are warmed and flavored over the meat, if you ask they will make a vegetarian non meat warmed pita. 

As for the food I was not impressed. The flafel was dense and not that flavorful,

The hummus is quite good but you do not get that much of it.

The rice is, yellow but it is just rice.

The "salad" us just iceberg and tomato, quite weak.

Their special sauce is just a salad dressing, not the type of sauce you would expect to have with middle eastern food.

From Wikipedia: "The Halal Guys is a halal fast casual restaurant franchise that began as a food cart on the south-east corner of 53rd Street and Sixth Avenue in the borough of Manhattan in New York City." 

I love that fact about this place. Been wanting to try them out, ever since the location in Tempe opened up. 

This new location is on the NE corner of Stapley and Baseline, where the old Eklectic Pie was. 

I grabbed the combo platter. It comes with some beef gyro, chicken, basmati rice, and lettuce and tomato. There are a few toppings you can have them add, such as onions, and peppers. The "famous" white sauce doesn't cost extra, but garlic spread does. I tried a splash of their hot sauce. They weren't kidding when they say it's 20 times hotter than a jalapeno. Lastly, I got side of hummus and some baklava as well. 

Over all, everything was good and tasted fresh. Both meats had good flavor. I really liked the light crispiness of the gyro. Baklava was really good. I wasn't a fan of the hummus.  It was a little heavy with tahini for my liking, but it didn't taste bad. I wasn't a fan of the whole pita either. There was something that I didn't like about the texture, but the cut up pieces that they use, were good. 

Staff was really friendly, and the place is open late. Worth a try, in my opinion. I will be back.

Excellent and very strategic location in the Caesar's Palace Forum shops! We went here after the Britney concert for some late night food (it's open until 4 am). 

I've had Halal Guys in many places around the country including the original NY location. Food was on point (gyro over rice)! Service was friendly and quick! There is plenty of seating in the Forum food court as well for you to sit and eat. 

A very safe and reliable option for a late night or really any time of day in LV!

tldr

Got:
-half chicken/half beef combo platter; the meat was fresh and flavorful but once mixed together with the white sauce and hot sauce everything just clicked. I disliked the pita bread a lot, it wasn't up to par with the rest of the meal.

Protip: use half of a white sauce pack and only use the hot sauce sparingly; its wicked hot dude.

Great NYC style street meat rice. For those who are complaining about too much salad, you have to tell them to give you more rice or no salad at all if that's what you want, and they won't load up with veggies. 

Still does not compare to the original 53rd and 6th Halal Guys in NYC, but it's still different from eating the repetitive shawarma and shish taouk in the city.

Food was not good and could not finish 60% of my sandwich just went to trash.
Other friends did not like it either.
May be the chicken shawarma was not from the rolling stick but from a left over.
Fries not a good kind of fries.
Food Quality and Hospitality was great , chicken and Gyro Test so good , whit sauce amazing!!!

Great food! The staff are friendly and the portions are large. You could easily share them. 

My go to order is the chicken-gyro combo platter, love it!

I have heard about the New York Halal Guys so often, I can't believe they are now opening in Montreal! Today was he grand opening so there was a huge line up. I waited ohtside for 30 minutes , but it was totally worth it. There has been so much hype about the chicken and gyro platter and HG' white sauce that my expectation built up pretty high. I was also curious since they say their food tastes different, but I've had chicken and beef platter at other places like Shawarmaz and Kojax and they taste pretty similar...BUT HG is truly different.

I ordered the regular chicken and gyro platter with extra white sauce. The white sauce is soooo gooood and goes so well with the other ingredients. Unlike the meat I have eaten in similar resto, HG's chicken and gyro was not dry and hard at all. The pita was fluffy. Everything was just perfect. 

The price might be a little high compared to the 7$ platter HG offer at their food cart in NYC, but their price is reasonable compared to similar platter offered at Montreal.

I will be back for sure, hopefully there won't be a lineup next time I come.

Excellent food and excellent service best food in Vegas. I come to Vegas 2 times a year and the food in Vegas is overpriced. You want to keep your stomach full and keep your wallet full 
The Halal Guys is the spot.
I would say my favorite  is the regular gyro platter. I always come here if I get off early from work. And the good thing is this place is open till 4.

Came back last night at midnight because the owner reached out to me to apologize for my first experience. This experience was a lot better, the employees were more interactive and provided great customer service.

Service is 5 stars, we were helped by a very kind lady who really went above and beyond to make sure that I had everything I needed. 
The yelp check-in Baklava reward bugged out and she still gave it to me and made sure to give me one from the fridge and not the one sitting outside.

Food is 4 stars, about the same compared to other locations but it's a franchise, so it's expected.

I've eaten this on the streets in New York and was pretty excited to see it here in Vegas.  Unfortunately the restaurant version is not good - at all. Not one of the ingredients in the combo bowl was worth eating; not the rice, not the lettuce, not the tomatoes, not the onions, not the olives, not the jalapenos, not the pita and for sure not the "beef" or chicken. I don't know how you can screw any or all of that up. Literally the only redeeming thing there was the white sauce and the spicy red sauce. Too bad that copious amounts of both couldn't mask the unacceptable level of quality of everything else. I think one of two things is happening here, 1) the Halal vendor carts in NY actually serve better food, or 2) food generally tastes better when you're tired and hungry from walking the streets all day or you've been out late, you're starving and it's the only thing you can find. Neither of which is the case if you drive over and hit this place for lunch in Vegas. The good news is - Parsley sells similar food that is high quality and delicious only 5 minutes away. The staff was friendly, if that counts for anything...
Delicious! Meals are big enough to share. It taste almost as good as the one in New York. My favorite is the combo platter.

Oh boy, I love me some Halal! I've been to the originals in NY (my hometown) and I have to say that they're the next best thing. I went their opening week. Any time you go to a restaurant's grand opening day or grand opening week it's expected to come across some confusion or problems. It's understandable. But I was pleased to have an amazing experience there!

The decor was fabulous, it reminded me of New York, it even had a New York mural on the wall. Options on the menu were very simple and to the point. All of the food is fresh, and their signature sauces are within reach on ice by the soda machines. I got a falafel platter, generous servings,  really good, and I drowned them in their amazing white sauce. My husband got one of the meat platter combos, that was great too! 

We'll be back! I love the late hours! Perfect for Vegas!

I go to halal guys in NYC every day I'm there when I visit cause it's just that good!

Unfortunately, the vegas one doesn't even come close...the rice seemed under cooked or dry and bland. And the white sauce wasn't as good. I'd say skip it and save it for when you're in NYC.

Vegas #3 meal, another disappointment.

Reading some of these reviews, I can not speak of or relate to the OG spot in NY, but what I can say though is that this spot was consistent in taste compared to the LA locations. The wait wasn't bad on grand opening day and they also handed out some appetizers for those in line. Also service was great, I think her name was Stephanie who was the one that went above and beyond for us. Aside from that I would definitely be back because the food is FUEGO!
Not worth it. Air conditioning system is missing. Customer service is rude. Food is over priced. Nine dollars for a Gyro and three dollars for a soda. Also there is no lamb only Beef Gyros

Gross gross gross!!!!  If you want authentic Mediterranean food this is NOT the place. This is the chipotle of middle eastern (and not in a good way). I got the combo plate for $10. I was the second customer of the day my gyro meat was dry and chicken was cold.  Don't be fooled with the white sauce. It's not a cool refreshing yogurt based Tzatziki sauce you might expect.  It's some house sauce that left a greasy film on the roof of my mouth.   Like I ate a spoonful of mayonnaise. 
#notmygyro.  Ha. 
I'm giving it 2 stars because the produce was fresh and the restaurant was clean.   Never again !
If you want something to eat. Come here you won't regret it. By far the best food I've ever had in my life.
I was super disappointed with this place. Been wanting to come for a long time. Ordered beef gyro and the beef was really dry. Service was good but good nothing to be excited about.

I remember waiting in line at the Halal guys in New York and ordering my chicken and rice with extra white sauce. I think I cried because of how much it changed my life so when I heard Halal guys were coming to Montreal, it was priority on my "to eat" list. 

I ordered chicken and rice. To my disappointment, the halal guys in Montreal are ruining the Halal guys name. The chicken is dry, rice isnt as flavourful, & the prices are ridiculously high ($13 +tax for plate) compared to the one in NYC. The red sauce is a numbing burning spice making it very unpleasant to eat (NYC's red sauce is heat and flavour). I eat EXTREMELY spicy and I did not enjoy it at all. 

Overall, it's alright but I would not recommend. If its your first time trying Halal guys, DO NOT try the one in Montreal. Do it right and go to New York City, it's 100000% better than this one.

An unfortunate let-down as everything just seemed saturated and un-fresh, and a bit expensive for what I got. The pita and tomatoes were the winners of my combo plate, but that's a far cry from a compliment as it's the entirety of the meal I should be touting. 

-Gyro meat was too strongly seasoned, overly wet with juices
-Chicken was chunky and fatty, not nicely chopped or shredded
-White sauce was alright but nothing signaturely fresh and clean
-Baklava costs $2.00 for the BITE portion I got...don't get me wrong, I don't mind the portion but TWO DOLLARS for something less than tomorrow gourmet...?! Please! 

Service: Lastly, I actually entered the establishment twice and wasn't acknowledged the first time within the 2 minutes I reviewed the menu, so I went to check out another establishment. 30 minutes later I came back and it took, again, over a minute to even be greeted. I will not be back, and unfortunately, given the entire experience, I've got a less than pleasant taste in my mouth for The Halal Guys.

Stopped by for lunch. Amazing food, clean pleasant environment, and friendly smiles all around. My first time, Angela the manager was a great help and fun to talk with. Will come again soon and bring my family.
Not as good as NYC but the white sauce. OMG yum. The spice is spicy and the food is tasty.

Dat hot sauce tho. It's probably the second hottest hot sauce I've had, but, unlike the first, it was very tasty...which is a trap. I'm used to heat, so the mouth feel was fun to deal with. The G. I. feel from ingesting all that heat was not fun, and I only have myself to blame. I actually think I had a headache the next day because of it. 

Besides that, it's exactly what their website or any picture will show you. A gyro or a gyro bowl. Unless you have no place to store it, go with the large bowl. It's much better bang for your buck. The regular looks like a small next to the large and it's only a dollar more.

It's good food, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend going out of your way to get it. If you're in the area, stop by and you won't be disappointed. But don't expect this to be your new favorite place.

Meh...Friendly Service, but below average food and strange banging

I went here on Friday night with my wife, but I should have taken a closer look at the reviews before doing so.  The basic set up is a bit strange when you first walk in, but the setup is basically like Chipotle or Cafe Rio with premade food that they put into a container for you.  In this context, we opted for the combo (chicken and beef) and the beef platters.  

First, the platter is primarily salad.  Second, the rice in the platter is overcooked and bland.  Third, the overly chopped nature of the beef and chicken are likely on purpose to hide poor quality meat.  Anyway, the platter was underwhelming.  The sauces that they offer aren't really that great, even the famous white sauce, and the hot one must be habanero based and will set your mouth on fire.  Either way, I won't be eating here again.  I will just go to the Great Greek Mediterranean Grill on Blue Diamond that is vastly superior to the food offered at Halal Guys.  The beef gyro just looks sad at Halal Guys.  

Finally, this place has strange, loud banging.  I think the employees must be "chopping" the meat on the steel countertops, which causes a super loud, obnoxious banging noise that goes on for at least 15 minutes.  It is super distracting.  As to the NYC comparison, I have actually eaten at the one in Mid Town since it was part of a walking food tour.  I haven't eaten there in about seven years, but there is no comparison.  If you're lucky to eat at the one in NYC, and you don't want to opt for the tremendous amount of other options, then you should try the one there.  Just be ready for a long line and to eat while standing.

Walked in expecting great food but also received really great service. Greeted as soon as I walked in through the door with my brothers and it nothing but great customer service. Food was served hot and with the urgency as if there was a rush. Will be back for the good food and great experience I had. I believed the employee's name was Tyra according to my receipt and I didn't get the other lady's name but she made my fries and let me know about the wait for the fries which was nice of her and gave me a notice before I finalized my order. Will be coming back for sure.

I had the chicken "sandwich", I'd call it a wrap and be warned it's mainly dark meat. It's plentiful and the wrap is delicious fluffy bread. The veggies were fresh and their hummus will not disappoint!  I practically licked the container clean. Hummus was definitely the high point. 

Tough that they will compete with all the pita places down the road. But it's quick and filling.

We checked it out   We tried the combo was ok not that impressive. The baklava was very good. The service everyone was very helpful and friendly and offered recommendations. Portion size is very good. I am not sure but something seemed to be missing.

Awesome to have this as an option in Ahwatukee! Definitely give it a try... the combo platter was delicious and the signature white sauce didn't disappoint. The red sauce is seriously HOT! The staff was incredibly friendly and it's a definite plus that there is ample parking available.

My first time eating at this chain, and was very disappointed. I don't plan on returning. The food was bland and a bit dry, what a shame. There's a good chance this restaurant won't be around for long if their cooking doesn't improve --the service was very friendly however.
All of the employees were very nice and attentive. I ordered the falafel platter,&  it was absolutely delicious!! I highly recommend it!

I've enjoyed a platter of Halal Guys in 5 different states, the first being New York, followed by Texas, California, Virginia, and now Arizona. If you don't already know, Halal Guys is famous for its standard "chicken/lamb over rice" platter and duo of sauces ("white sauce" and "red sauce") that add all the flavor. No matter which Halal Guys you go to, you're going to be met with these basic options. Yet, every Halal Guys around the U.S. still manages to offer a slightly different taste and overall experience. 

At this particular Halal Guys, I recommend the gyro platter over the chicken -- the gyro is plentiful in flavor where the chicken lacks. I also recommend checking the Hooked App before making your purchase, they frequently offer coupons that could score you a discount on your meal and sometimes free baklava, fries, and a drink. If you are going to choose between fries and baklava, I say go for the baklava. Halal Guys offers crinkle-cut fries, a fry that proves time and time again to be a disappointment. Their crisp-to-fluff ratio is nothing short of absurd.  

It's not all bad here though, in fact the service here is quite speedy, the location is directly across from ASU, and there is plenty of parking and seating inside. Don't expect it to live up to the hype of NYC Halal Cart, but don't be bummed either --- this location is better than many of the other chains sprouting up around the West Coast.

Portions are small, I ordered a regular plate and the guy gave me the same portion as someone who ordered a small plate. Rice had a weird plastic taste, chicken and rice was warm at best. Nothing like nyc and definitely doesn't live up to its name.

I've just experienced another great visit to this new location. on the VIP NIGHT before opening...the new location is spacious and clean and well decorated the food was sooo good agin the combo platter and loaded fries white sauce yumm the chicken is sooo flavorful and even tho most the staff is training it was still a really good visit .. I love this chain
I love this place .. i LOVE the food and I'm always happy with the people and the service it's very clean and inviting I tell everyone about this new location 100% satisfied

Hands down the best Mediterranean food in Las Vegas!!!  

Service:  10/10 The staff was incredibly friendly and prompt making the food.  The restaurant is very clean and welcoming.  The staff actually chatted and joked with us the whole time.  They were great.  

The food is incredible.  Three of us ordered combo platters with beef and chicken and all of us thought it was amazing. Each platter comes with a  generous portion of meat, rice, pita bread, and you have to load up on the white sauce!

Halal guys is a staple for me and I will definitely be coming back frequently.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND CHECKING THEM OUT!!

Stopped in on a Saturday night around 10pm... Not crowded.. Fast and friendly service

Food: I had the chicken combo platter which was delicious... Loved the white sauce. Rice was okay... Sampled the red sauce... Not for me... Really hot!

Overall enjoyed the meal and will be back if I'm in the area again.

Located in the food court in Cesars.   Anytime I can eat at Halal Guys I'm In! Best place in the Vegas touristy area to get some quick, good, real food at a reasonably price. Hubby and I shared a rice plate and we were both full. My only complaint was it was 4.79 for a fountain soda. Only one huge size available . Only Pepsi products. Not there fault. This is the only option throughout Cesars.

Ordered the beef gyro sandwich & it was definitely worth what I paid for! Also got the falafel platter. It's probably the best I've had. Service was superb! The young black lady was super kind as well!

Food: 
(+) Combo Plate - The chicken and beef were being made right when I walked in so I got lucky. Folks here don't skimp out on the portions! The meats were fresh and weren't dry like my experiences in the past. The sauces were out and you could add as much as you wanted to without asking the staff to get the bottles. A hardy meal for under $10 bucks! Get the regular size, it is a dollar extra! 

Vibes: It was late and there was surprisingly not a lot of people inside so not bad at all. 

Service: Staff was friendly and patient because it took my friends and I a while to order so I appreciate your patients!
The falafel tasted on point, it just looked strange. If you're looking for authentic Mediterranean food you're not going to find it here. They've operationalized the process... it's fast food.

When a middle eastern family walked in and left immediately we should have taken it as a sign to leave. We ordered the combo small and large plates. A new girl working started preparing the small plate and gave minute portions. There was a customer that came after us and colleen gave huge potions too. We decided to ask for the same and still got a little food. When I asked to give us a little more they said she is training. But thank goodness she gave us a little rice because it was hard and uncooked. The food was served cold. Do not recommend this location. Ive had halal guys in nyc and socal and this is by far the worst ive ever had. Save yourself the time of driving to spring mtn. This was gross.

We got a quick snack from here while we waited for our food from the place next to it.
So the service was slow and the people who were there at the time were getting easily annoyed by the people in front of me who asked questions about the food. 
All I wanted was hummus and bread.... that took about 10 minutes because instead of just getting it and paying, I had to wait until these ladies got their special ordered food while 3 employees just kinda stood around.
The hummus was good but could have used a little more seasoning. Made me a little frustrated I wasted 10 minutes and over 5 bucks to have meh hummus.

Quick service and decent fresh food. Good value for the price in the casino. I ordered beef gyro sandwich  (really a wrap) for $10 and it came with a good amount of meat with fresh veggies. The beef was a bit greasy for my liking so I'd recommend getting the chicken instead.
So experience was awesome. Great food and fantastic service. I recommend the night crew if you ever get a chance to stop by, you won't be disappointed.

Loved it! The service was great the line moved fast. I had the combo plate. The meat had great flavor and was great with the white sauce. I dared to try the hot sauce - the flavor was wonderful but couldn't handle the heat, be careful! Looking forward to trying the sandwich and if I got a plate again I would do all gyro. It was really nice to dine with  a great diverse group of people enjoying world food.

Nothing stood out to me, I ordered a chicken sandwich with fries and it was just an average sandwich but it wasn't bad, my brother ordered the regular chicken platter with fries and he told me it's really filling which is always good, but We both ordered a side of fries and they were the saltiest fries I've ever had and they were a little dry, they have nice customer service
Yesterday late night visit.got beef gyro platter not a good choice food was greasy blend and too much white sauce. Only thing i like is hummas.

The Halal Guys is one of our favorite NYC stops.  Being from California, were excited to see this company expand into the West.  On short visit to Phoenix we stopped in to get the Halal we've come to love.  Short story: We got it.  We loved the food.  On a scale of 10, this place in Tempe is a solid 9 compared to the Manhattan Halal Guys.  I think there was less meat on my plate than the NY joints.  We didn't try the baklava or the falafels, but the gyro, chicken, rice, and french fries were perfectly prepared.  The white sauce is what makes the dish, don't skip it.  I got two rows of hot sauce but could have used a third.  I love it. 

I have to mention my interactions with the manager. Nidal is amazing.  This GM will take this restaurant to heights unknown.  After chatting a bit, it was clear that his mission is customer service.  His goal is to perfect this restaurant.  HALAL GUYS - Nidal is your guy!  

On food alone, I would leave a strong 4 star review, but because of the management, it is a 5 star restaurant.  Wish I lived closer to enjoy more frequent visits.  Well done Halal Guys.

Staff was very accommodating and knowledgeable when I asked if they had any vegan options. There's only one - the falafel which didn't disappoint. Perfectly fried NOT greasy, crispy on the outside with flavorful chickpea filling.

First time in here and their AC is broken. Its a really small place so its very crowded since they are busy. They offer free bottled water. 

The lady that was taking the trash out and cleaning table is VERY friendly (African American). She was so helpful letting us know what to try and to slow down with the hot sauce cause its very hot. 

I ordered the combo and its pretty good! I put a lot of white sauce to make it better and the veggies on the side helps to balanced out the taste. Overall its good but I think its just hype

Went there opening day, it smelled good from the outside while we were waiting. Getting in was disappointing because the only options were tomatoes, iceberg lettuce, chicken, gyro, and rice with a small assortment of sauces. I have allergies so I couldn't have their white sauce and got hummus instead, which they didnt tell me was extra! The food was overall bland and just a small amount of the hot sauce made the dish almost inedible. I'd rather go to Hummus Xpress where they give you an entire pita with your bowl, not three measly cut up pieces

Only a little more than other Reviewers to contribute.

Yes, the "regular" Combo Plate (pictured) portion (mostly rice & iceberg) is large, the service was fast & friendly and they're open late, but other than that ... meh?  The very bright orange rice and chicken & gyro meats were a dry and the overall flavor (including that of the iceberg and diced tomatoes) was bland.  The "White Sauce" (pictured) did add some flavor.  By the admission of one female Employee, it's very similar (but more liquid-y) to mayonnaise.  Personally, I'm not a big fan of mayo on gyro meat, rice or salad fixings.

I also ordered French Fries (pictured).  Again, the portion size was large and they were served hot, but lacked ANY salt for flavor.  Had the male Employee who made them bothered to wash his hands after handling a broom (and possibly other cleaning chemicals / supplies), I may have been more comfortable eating them.

The price was a little on the high side.  The Combo Platter with French Fries (but no drink) plus tax was over $12.  This part of town (and others) has too much competition for Middle Eastern food to price it as such, especially considering the food quality and handling / sanitation concerns.

In sum, ok, but there is plenty of room for improvement.

Heard a lot of hype about the expansion to AZ... was able to have my order delivered via UberEats.  We ordered the falafel sandwich, combo platter, and hummus to try a little bit of everything they offer.  Falafel was great, super crispy.  Everything was good, but I feel like we have better local Mediterranean restaurants here.  Will most likely reorder delivery for convenience.

Wanted a late night snack after work. Great customer service! Decided to get the combo plate.  The only thing I ate prior was wing stop and that never disappoints.  The combo at halal was not that good. Nothing special.  The next day I felt sick and couldn't keep anything down! First time I ever got food poisoning. Nightmare! I'm avoiding this place. Hope it was just me and nobody else.  The hummus was very good and the pita I'm not too picky about.

Great look and a very friendly staff! Got the combo plate and a side of hummus that I thought was just okay. I expected this food to be a healthier option than it actually was. Everything was made with soy bean oil, but overall it was delicious!

Okay let's get to the point. It was alright not worth the hype and price honestly. I was introduced to halal guys just from watching videos on it and a close friend who lives in NY telling me it is cheap and the lamb is a must have. Tried it on the grand opening for the first ever and it was pricy. $10 for a platter when at the cart I saw it was ranging $7-$8 plus I got charged to have sauce when i wanted to stay and eat. Total bill was about $12 a platter At the moment I was pretty astonished on why it costed so much. Overall the food was dry. The sauce was really good and was the only thing that kept the whole platter alive. The meat was pretty bland too. I was pretty disappointed for my first experience but I thought it just because of the grand opening. I went again 2 days after the grand opening to see if any thing had changed. The combo plate was a little bit better than it was the first day. Rice was dry and the meat was decent. Probably my last time coming to halal guys honestly. Not worth the price honestly

Very disappointing. don't waste your time and money. The portion is smaller and in the combo platter, the meat is beef not lamb like the original. Most importantly, the meal was pretty bland and unseasoned (including the rice). The white sauce was the only thing that made it decent. I would say, they could make the right adjustments and this place would be much better, but for now, I get the sense that whoever is cooking, really couldn't care less.

Today i went to halal guys in china town Las Vegas this restaurant super tinny and fly welcome me,when I saw Fly i was going to walk out before order something but I wanna to give it try because of Mediterranean and Middle Eastern food but I couldn't find anything in menu middle eastern or Mediterranean not even any similar dish .when I placed my order my wife showed me another Fly.i ordered more than 3 dishes they were all so salty.My food was so salty rice wasn't cooked good .this is another junk food restaurant like others fast food restaurants.i wouldn't waste my time and money again.thanks halal guys keeping too many flies in the restaurant ???

When I heard Halal Guys was coming to town, I was excited. I talked it up for weeks to my husband. I told him about their reputation, the food was great and they had this "crack sauce." I was so excited, it got him excited. 

Our first visit, not long after their opening, was a COMPLETE disappointment. The chicken was dry and not tasty. The rice was flavorless and the "crack sauce" was like watery ranch. 

I made excuses to my husband and told him they had to work out their kinks, maybe the workers needed better training. We left and forgot about the Halal Guys. Fast forward over a year later.. plenty of time for them to work out their issues, right? NO. The second visit was worse than the first. Actually, it was really the same issues as the last visit except this time, the rice was crunchy. Really dry and hard.  I ordered the bowl and had mixed the rice in, so the hard rice was in every bite.

Halal guys is NOT okie dokie. I say avoid it... unless you enjoy crunchy rice.
Very fast and was delicious. Food was great and fresh. Employees were very friendly as well.

This place was pretty average. I ordered the beef gyro platter. It was a decent amount of food for around $10, but nothing about it really stood out. I have had more flavorful gyro meat at other fast dining places, such as Hummus Xpress. The white sauce was also nothing special. The pita triangles were served cold. I'm not sure if that's how they regularly come here, but pitas should be warm.

The staff was friendly and seemed to be trained well. I also appreciate that when they say "hot sauce," they mean it. I usually scoff at people who say that their restaurant's sauce is really hot, and I'm usually right (I've done the Blazin' Challenge twice). This time, I decided to take their advice and just put a little on the side. I'm glad I did. Respect to them for providing a serious hot sauce!
Ordered from uber eats. Forgot part of my order. Falafel is dry. Combo plate is also dry. The sauce that comes with the falafel tastes like tahini, but with garlic. Will never order from here again.

I had heard so much about these guys and finally they're here in Toronto. I was beyond excited to try eating animal that was alive and healthy at the time of slaughter and all blood was drained from the carcass.

I had high anticipation of meat tasting so much yummier if a muslim had performed the slaughter in a ritual manner with the animal facing mecca.

The food was quite disappointing and oily and heavy. Even the meat was not that great which was surprising because apparently when a throat is cut by a sharp knife severing the carotid artery, jugular vein and windpipe in a single swipe, it's supposed to make the dish so much better. After hearing so many good storied about Halal guys New York location, this was a really disappointing experience.

The is generic Greek food. They give you chicken (mostly dark meat) lettuce & tomatoes. Wow. 

Also their white sauce is basically mayonnaise.

But if you're looking for a quick fix Greek food meal here ya go.

Being from ny/nj this was probaby the biggest disappointment ive encountered in vegas. Portion is way less, flavor is off, ingredients are pre made and they charge way too much. They also charge $1 for additional white sauce.
Decent late night food. Good customer service even though we ordered at the last few minutes. The combo platter and baklava is definitely worth it!

I absolutely love this place! I usually order via Uber Eats, and this was my first time eating at the location. Service was great, food tasted yummy, and it was quick and easy!  I usually order the beef gyro and it was amazing delicious... the white sauce and hot sauce is so tasty!

Awful Awful Awful. This place shouldn't be able to call themselves "The Halal Guys". I've been reading reviews from this place and it seems like nothing has changed since day 1. The gyro meat tasted and looked like one batch was prepared in the AM and was left sitting out until around 8:30pm. It was tiny, greasy, rock hard pebble like pieces of beef. The rice was so dry and crunchy that it may have been prepared the day before(or a couple days before.) 

I grew up with Halal Guys and I love the food but this location is awful!! 

Aside from the piss poor quality of the food($20+ for shit) the kid behind the counter helped us out at the register. He kept his same food service gloves on while he handled our cash the proceeded to go back to prepping the meals of the customer behind us without changing his gloves!! That should be an obvious violation of food safety standards.

I contacted the franchise owner and I was given the same response that she gave a month ago. That she would look into and take it seriously, well obviously that is not the case because nothing has changed!!! Halal Guys LLC needs to rethink this location because it is ruining the Halal Guys name.

I really liked this place for a good lunch at a decent price near campus. It's within walking distance from ASU but I'm sure it gets crowded with students during peak times. We scored...it's spring break so lines were not long.

The menu is simple and ordering is easy. There was only one person prepping food. It would have been a bit faster had there been two people working the station, but no major complaint. The line stilled moved quickly.  

I had the regular size falafel meal.  I could not finish it. The falafel was tasty as was the rice. The side salad was fresh and was delicious with their special white sauce. (The sauce was actually lightly poured on everything and I loved it.)  Their hot sauce is super spicy and tasty. It's hotter than sriracha so watch out. I got a slow burn in my tummy about 15 minutes later, but nothing that diet coke couldn't cure. Yup, it's that hot. 

Seating is close together inside and kind of sparse outside. I wouldn't expect to get a table during prime times, so you may want to plan to get it to go. 

Service was good--- friendly and efficient staff and the it's clean too. My only teeny tiny criticism is that the fork handles are short. I had to maneuver my fork in the bowl to get at the good bits. If my only complaint is short fork handles, you know this place is good! I'll be back!

I had really high expectations for this place after hearing all the raving reviews. I wasn't blown away but I also wasn't disappointed.

It's a chipotle style concept. I tried the combo plate with chicken & gyro meat. It was decent! I skipped the hot sauce though after a warning from the employees.

I'm sure I'll be back if I'm looking to grab a fast food option.
The best Middle-Eastern food in Arizona! Fresh and delicious flavor overall. Be sure to try the combo platter with falafel, humus, and their signature 'white sauce'

My coworker and I came for lunch around 1 pm. She order the gyro and chicken regular size combo and I ordered the chicken regular. Did not enjoy, will not come back. Here's why: 

-chicken was unseasoned and tasted like nothing 
-apparently the beef tasted not like beef but actually just tasted super strange. 
-rice had a cardamom flavour but nothing else
-white sauce was watered down ranch, no garlic flavor whatsoever
-hot sauce was spicy but not flavorful (just nuked the food) 
-I had to use the washroom the next day and it was NOT pleasant. (Didn't eat anything else that day due to the large nature of the food) 

However, the portion size was decent for the money, and the lettuce and tomato was fresh.

Me and all my friends got intense diarrhea from this place. The hot sauce is too hot and the food was extremely over hyped. 

I'm very upset, had to put my review out there. Sorry halal guys, I wanna love you but I'm 1000% sure this was from you. 

Over all I give this place a 2/10. One point for the creative business and venue and 1 point for  trying on the food.

If you're ordering the falafel please do not waste your time. It comes on top of a pita with only shreds of ice berg lettuce and diced tomatoes (which oddly tasted like Taco Bell..?) The white sauce they offer is completely flavorless and bitter, and as for the hot sauce, be aware, it's so so so hot. We were so bummed, but at least the fries were good.

Great customer service. 

They have someone at the line so they can explain how things work. 

Food was okay. Got the combo with chicken and gyro meat. White sauce has a strong mayonnaise flavor. Not your normal white sauce, but I can see why people love it. Red sauce is smoking hot. Only a tiny bit needed. The extra pita bread is $1 and smells weird since it sits on top of the meat from the grill. Probably wouldn't order again. You can get ones that aren't on top of the meat as I was told later by the nice lady at the front. 

Fries were delicious and made when you place your order so they are very crispy and tasty. 

Not sure if I would go back. But it's definitely worth a first try for someone who hasn't been there.
No flavor what so ever. Not worth the price at all, it was shockingly bad. The staff was nice however they didn't understand the menu and couldn't even make recommendations.

This place is delicious. I can guarantee the low stars are for the line out the door. The food is great quality and delicious. The line only took 10 minutes from web we got to the line all the way to paying for our food. DONT LET THIS DETER YOU! As far as middle easter fast food, this is the best I've had in Tempe. No, it's not EXACTLY the same as super authentic cuisine in the ME. No one's grandma is in the back cooking, but if you just accept the food for what it is? It's so good.

This place sucks. The "white sauce" there isn't fresh made delicious tzatziki. It's pretty much packets of ranch dressing. Also 2 packs of sauce contain 660 calories and over 100% DV of fat. Very disappointed

For almost $15 for the 'regular' platter, you certainly don't get much more than the $9.99 plus tax 'small' platter. You do get extra bland lettuce (filling up half the dish) and lots more rice, but the meat quantity is pretty much the same. I watched them scoop pretty much the same amount into each container, just spread out more to cover the larger dish.

The meat flavour is pretty good and the sauce is just as I remember but the canadian price jack is just too much. This stuff sells for $7 in NYC. There are cheaper and just as good halal joints downtown.

Two words: white sauce! I don't know what makes it so addictive but it is amazing. Really adds creaminess to the dish and helps with the spiciness. And speaking about spicy; that hot sauce is hot! I'm a fan of hot sauce and put El Yucateco on tons of my food but their hot sauce really kicked my butt! 

Big portions, good food, what's not to love? 4/5 for me!

Very delicious and generous portions. White sauce on everything! Hot sauce is seriously hot...as it should be. Do yourself a favor - eat in and enjoy all all the sauces in unlimited quantities. 

Minus one star for visiting during a slow time. If the meats have been sitting they can get a little dry. They still have the flavor you love, but become a little "chewy", but nothing more sauce can't help.

I've been a huge fan of the chicken on rice platter ("extra white sauce...some more please") from The Halal Guys NYC cart for years so I was super excited when The Halal Guys announced they'd be coming to Toronto. I've gone several times since they opened and am pretty satisfied with my experiences. The food taste is true to the quality of the original cart, and service in terms of time/customer has been quick. The price is higher, but that's to be expected at a brick & mortar location.
Absolutely best Gyro, Chicken in Las Vegas. My husband and I got the Gyro and Chicken plate. Very delicious!

My first halal guys experience was the New York food stand so this one was rather disappointing. First of all, the prices here are much higher, which makes sense because they have a physical location and usd to cnd makes up for some of the difference. But cmon, halal guys was supposed to be a late night craving cheap eats kind of deal. 
I got the chicken and gyro plate, which had all the elements. Chicken, gyro, the coloured rice, salad, and pita bread. Food was delicious, but the gyro was too salty. Portion size is also comparable to NYC, but I feel like the pita bread was much smaller. Not a concern though. 
Lastly, I got this for delivery and they were doing a "12 days of EATSmas". Basically, I got the plate for $5! Obviously I write reviews based on their regular price but I highly encourage people to make the most out of promotions.
Food was good, but most likely won't go again.

I love this place! I always get the combo platter with white sauce, a scoop of hummus and a red sauce packet. It's simple but always delicious. Keep in mind the red sauce is HOTTTTT. My first time there, I was wondering why they didn't spread that sauce all around my platter and then I tasted the sauce and my mouth was on  with just one little taste. The employees are always super nice and efficient. The dining areas are clean. Everyone is always working and there's something about that makes me feel like this place really has a good system going. Only thing I wish would improve is the falafel. It's pretty hard on the outside and not always warm. All in all I'm a happy customer and I go probably once a week to satisfy my cravings!!

5 Star Service, 2.5 Star Food, 1 Star Baklava! Get Out Of Line And Save Your Money!

The service here is outstanding. All of the staff were friendly and welcoming! 

The food was pretty bland.... I got the combo platter... the meat was decent but not much flavor... the spicy sauce is horrid with spice but no flavor.... 

The unbelievable part is that for the first time in my life baklava was not good! It tasted like cardboard and stale! I've never not enjoyed baklava, but I couldn't even finish my first piece, I threw piece the number 2 away. 

Baklava is -1 star!
Meal is 3 stars
Service 5 stars
Hot sauce is -1 stars

I don't imagine I will be coming back here again. I don't see what the hype was about at all. 

There are better halal food sources in the area.... 

How can baklava be bad? But it is soooo bad!

It truly pains me to write this review as I was so incredibly excited for this place to open. I went to NYC for the first time last year and ate at some of the Halal carts there and their gyros were unlike any gyro I've ever had. I never visited THE Halal Guys and had heard they were the best of the best. When I heard they were opening a location here I freaked out, I couldn't wait!

We went last night around 9 pm, it wasn't that busy. I mean it was full and there was a line but I was expecting it to be outside wrapped around the building. In all it only took about five minutes from the time we walked in until we left with our order.

I ordered the chicken and gyro combo plate with the white and red sauces on the side. I tasted the white sauce before I put it on my food thankfully because it's revolting.
