I assumed it would be like a tzatziki but it was basically liquid mayo. I ended up adding half the packet of the red sauce which gave it a nice heat. Unfortunately the hot sauce was the only great thing about this meal.

The gyro meat was more like ground lamb than sliced gyro meat like how I had it in New York, and the meat itself was very tasteless. The chicken was ok, it wasn't dry, but again it was lacking in flavor. The rice was extremely bland as well, all the food pretty much tasted like red sauce and had no flavor of its own.

It wasn't a terrible meal it was just extremely underwhelming and disappointment. The Halal Guys came very hyped by everyone and unfortunately the dish did not come close to delivering. If I'm ever drunk in China town maybe I'll stop by again, but there are way better gyros elsewhere in Vegas to scratch that itch.

I went to California recently and was so happy to see they had Hala restaurants...I was looking for Hala Guys restaurants because on the website the food looks so good couldnt find one in Anaheim,Ca but a few days later just driving I was so excited to see a Hala Guys in Las Vegas been a week and been there 2x already the food is awesome and the customer service is Great!!! I am and will be a returning customer...PBTA!!!

The first time I tried Halal guys (originally from NY) was in Long Beach, CA, and it was unlike anything I've ever tasted. That orange rice, chicken, gyro, lettuce, and tomato, drizzled with that white and red sauce, all mixed together...Mmmmm...The hype was real, and I wanted to go back the next day! 

When I heard that they were opening a Halal guys in Vegas, I was ecstatic, and I was dying to have it again. However, for some particular reason, it just wasn't as good as the first time I've had it in Cali. I've been to this location twice now, and the ingredients don't seem as fresh; the meats were really dry as well. The white sauce is as good as I remember it to be, and I think the red sauce is a little tamer here (warning: it'll still burn your insides out if you consume too much). I got to try their crinkle cut fries this last time, and it was surprisingly good. Hot, fresh, crispy, and crunchy. Also, if you're gonna get the platter, go with the large, because it is significantly larger than the regular size for just $1 more. 

The service has always been good. Overall I would give this place a 3.5 rating, but due to the friendly and helpful staff, I am bumping them up to a 4.

Been to the original cart on 53rd & 6th and I've been counting down the days for them to open here in Vegas.  Sure it's not the same as the cart in NYC, but I'm sure that the original McDonalds was way better than the 100,000's of franchises around the world.

Food of tasty.  The white and hot sauce are as good as the cart.

The only complaint I have is the portion size.  They're a little stingy and inconsistent on portions.

Thanks to Savannah for the free gyro sandwich! I accidentally put too much hot sauce didn't realize that it was too spicy!!! So she gave me another one. Definitely gonna recommend! Look for Savannah! She's very accomodating and excellent customer service!

Trying out gyros with beef.  They give you a lot for the Sandwich and it will be enough to fill you up. The taste is good but the restaurant is too noisy at times when that are chopping he meat. Otherwise it is a good place for a quick bite.

This place was good for the most part as far as their food is concerned. Their customer service wasn't very good, nobody seemed to really know what was going on and it took awhile to order. 

I also do wish that Halal Guys had more options other than chicken and gyro (i.e. lamb).

Overall a somewhat decent Halal spot.

Very mediocre. Dry food that definitely needed some sort of sauce. I ordered two sandwiches and my girlfriend ordered a small plate with a side of hummus. All very underwhelming. If they simply added sauce and didn't cook the food to well done then it would be great.

Good food, though a bit expensive compared to other places. I would rename it The Halal Gals though lol. A few ladies totally ran this place when we came, and did a good job for sure. They were professional, and answered any questions my wife had.

Good food, overpriced. Not worth the hype. 
Had it twice and I don't feel the need to ever go back

I was walking around here on a Saturday at 2PM and saw that the line was quite short so I decided to give it a go. The line was about 5-10 minutes and getting my food was very fast. There are only four or so choices for food; I got the platter with chicken and gyro. Preparation was super fast, and I got to choose from three different sauces: barbecue, white sauce, hot sauce. The food was delicious but I found the meats a bit too greasy. The portion was large and there were a lot of veggies. Would definitely come back again if the line were shorter during regular lunch / dinner hours. Delicious!

Went for lunch. Lined up. Took about 20 minutes and the line seemed to move very slowly. Service was fine.

The food in NYC seemed to be better, but maybe that's because that was the first time I've ever had Halal Guys. Plus I was eating it in the middle of beautiful Central Park and not at my desk in Toronto. This food here in Toronto is nothing to write home about. I can count many places that have better shawarma than Halal Guys within arms reach. Which is disappointing. Dry, bland, and cold. Smells good though. Plus that red sauce is crazy spicy, if that is what you're into.

And the wait? Not worth it. Give me no-line and remove $5 from the cost. Then I'll bump this up to a 3/5.

I had to run errands in the area and decided to stop by. First and foremost, the workers here were awesome. They were extremely friendly and took the time to explain everything to us because it was our first time. The establishment itself looked pretty clean and well kept. The sauces were all labeled with the day that they were made, which was reassuring. 

Overall, the food quality was not bad but nothing amazing. The chicken was middle of the road. Not super tender and not too dry. The gyro meat was pretty damn salty. After I started eating my plate, I realized that I needed to pretty much empty half a bottle of white sauce to mask the saltiness. I'm sure that much sauce can't be too good for you, but I'm sure I've done worse to my body. The Baklava they gave us with the yelp check in was BOMB! Hands down the best part of the meal. 

I kept reading about how spicy the red sauce was so I really wanted to try for myself. Let me preface this by mentioning that I am Korean. I love eating food that makes my lips go numb and makes me break out in sweats. I started off by drizzling a small amount of sauce over my plate, but ended up dumping a ton of red sauce halfway through my meal. The red sauce definitely lived up to the hype and I loved how much it hurt. I'm definitely going to be shooting fire out my ass tomorrow, but it was worth it. 

The portion size is quite generous. Two regular size combo's was more than enough to fill us up. Pricing here was $8.49 + tax each and I think it's a fair price to ask for. This place offers decently good value for your money, but is nothing spectacular. Imagine a mediterranean version of chipotle. Would I drive out from henderson to come here? Probably not. If I was in the area, would I try it again? Sure.

Excited that the Halal Guys are here in Vegas. Being from the east coast, not the same as back home. Prices are a little high. Order a chicken gyro and drink and cost me around $11 and some change. I even had to ask the server put more meat on the pita bread. Over all, not getting the value for money especially that it's in the Chinatown district, you'd expect more bang for your buck. Most likely won't repeat.
It was very decent! The experience in NY was much better! Meat was very moist. Salad was very moist. Bread was very moist. Come eat!
Wasn't even that good. More like drunk good food late at night. New York must have something better than this stuff. I think people would be more satisfied with a Taco Bell 5$ box.

Too much hype but disappointing at the end. The food was bland including the famed white sauce. The only exception was the falafel, which was exceptionally good. It was crisp and dark on the outside and green on the inside due to the generous use of fresh cilantro. If I go again, I would order it. Nothing else's was interesting on the limited menu.

Doesn't get much better as far as gyros. I typically enjoy the slices better Than the chunks, but Halal Guys is on point nonetheless. The infamous white sauce has great tasty kick and the addition of hot sauce makes for a fire sandwich. Throw on some tomato and lettuce on think pita and you got a great lunch. At $8.75 it is steep, but I think it's worth it every once in a while if you're craving spicy and are tired of the typical chipotle or panera lunch options.

So ordered through Uber eats and read disclaimer on the hot sauce and basically disregarded it since I  love spicy stuff. However I am very pleased that this sauce kicked my ass I just want to thank them for creating it

So many mediocre reviews. So many people love to pick on the place like they can tell the difference between this and the nyc carts. Yes I too have eaten at the nyc carts many times and yes this food is comparable. Tasted the same to me (especially the sauces). 

You're not being edgy by criticizing the best of street food in the US. 

The food is great,the price is great and now the location is great. All the haters are just butthurt because now they can't brag that they alone have eaten the famous halal guys.

I'm giving it 5 because of the service I got from them, the cleanliness of the place in spite of location, and since I'm comparing it to another branch in California. The vegas franchise, of course, it's the original 53rd & 6th--but it will do for someone who lives in Vegas, and to not be ungrateful for having it in town. Combo is the only way to go for me even back in New York, even late at night or after club hours! Beware of the red sauce, you are now warned. It will generate a love-hate relationship with your food, but it is so goddamn good with the white sauce that they have. 
Altogether, I know I will be back. They are not stingy with their white sauce at all, they give you 2 packets (unlike the one in California) and they have table-extras if you decide to eat in house. 
I'm sure there are other places to get your halal fix, but trust me--this is different.

I was pretty excited to try Halal Guys . We went for an early dinner so the line wasn't to bad and even when their was a line, it moved fairly quickly. The menu is pretty simple. Either order a gyro or a platter. I opted to try the chicken and gyro platter which came with rice, lettuce, tomatoes, pita bread and the two meats. Definitely get the white sauce and it you like spicy , try the red sauce too. I usually like my food spicy so I got some more red sauce on the side. My mouth was on fire  and I regretted putting more red sauce in my food. 
I thought the meats had good flavor (esp the beef)
And the price was reasonable.
I liked that it was fast and quick and I enjoyed my meal :)

I love the simplicity of this place. You can either order a plate combo or a gyro. I personally love to order the combo platter with all the fixings (jalapeño, green pepper & olives). Top it off with their white sauce  so good!! I also love anything spicy and their red sauce is no joke. When I first came, I made the mistake of putting a bunch of red sauce thinking it wouldn't be spicy. I was totally wrong and it was so hot that I did not enjoy my meal. So I suggest getting the red sauce on the side .

Came in at 2 AM Monday night looking for something other than the typical China town/sushi/ramen spot ... I was so happy to find this place open! Came in and everything was clean and the place had a great atmosphere, credit going to Johnnie who really nice and helpful. I got the combo platter and a side of extra pita bread, hehe, and everything was amazing. I got all the extra toppings as well. It's so fresh and cooked perfectly.  They keep sauces in the bottles by the drink fountain, I like that too. Will be back many many times

Miss Halal Guys since I first had it in NYC Summer last year. One of the most anticipated places to visit this year. The long 50 minutes wait in line plus 10 minutes walk from the car on Grand Opening day was all worth it! Both the service and food were great, friendly, quick and tasty. I just wished that they're more generous with the sauce, both white and red sauce, pretty stingy compare to NYC ones. Tried the baklava in NYC, not here but assumed tastes the same, it's way too sweet for my taste. Cannot wait for HG to open one on the West side.

Rating of 3.5 stars. 

Cant really compare it to the NY carts on 53rd and 6th, but overall the food was good. Its awesome AZ finally has a "CnR."
Pretty consistent food.  Try the falafel.  It's good too.  Chicken is a a little dry.  Staff is super friendly.  Tyra is super nice and cool.

This place smelled soooo good once I walked into the store. I couldn't decide what to get, it was between a platter or a Gyro, So my girlfriend suggested if I was hungry, I should get the Regular size platter. Now on to the second decision, what kind of meat...beef or chicken? I couldn't decide, then the guy asked if I wanted to try the proteins. My eye lit up. I was so happy!! The Asian in me was so happy for samples. I was glad he gave me a sample it help me determine on which proteins to get. Overall great service and good food!

Quick service and food was good! I had the regular sized beef plate with just rice lettuce and the white sauce they give. It was my first time trying and it was noting too spectacular but satisfied my hunger. The pita bread they give you with the plate is a little smaller than I'd hoped. Next time I'll try to order another piece because I found myself trying to ration it with the rest of my food. Overall was tasty though and I wouldn't mind going back.

My hubby and I were super excited when this place opened. We had heard all the rave about it from our fellow Yankee friends and could not wait to try it out.

As soon as I entered the place, I was not impressed by the interior nor the attitude of the staff. My husband went for a mixed plate and just watching it being made, it put me off and I did not continue with my order. I found there would be more freshness or something unique about this place but it reminded me of similar shish taouk/Lebanese fast-food chains that in my opinion, look much more appealing. 

I watched as our server loaded up the plate with heaps of rice and salad then finally topped it off with a ridiculously small portion of meat & chicken. Lastly went on the famous 'secret' white sauce, which just made it look pretty but did not enhance the taste. 
I was not impressed by the flavours or quality and very quickly, we were just left eating rice as the ratio of rice to protein was about 5:1.

NOT worth the hype, would not go again.

I've actually been here during their grand opening. I was a little skeptical about trying this place since I know the real taste of New York halal guys. I actually thought the one here is similar. I thought the food tasted the same but their cut of meat is way different. I feel they really mince their meat. I think I'll try this place out again because it's really good during those late nights.
I ordered delivery and the food never came.  I called them a few times and no answer.  Luckily I ordered thru grunhub and they gave said they will refund me.  0000.00000 stars

Tried this place for the first time last night. Was very satisfied. I ordered the combo plate with chicken and gyro and it was very flavorful. I definitely recommend getting this as well as a lot of the white sauce as they call it!

The folks who are familiar with The Halal Guys in New York City will be pleased with the experience at the Yonge/Wellesley Toronto location. However, I can't help but feel that the experience is slightly watered-down compared to what I had in its American counterpart. It just doesn't have the same energy, as terrible and vague of a criticism that might be.

You can get a plate of chicken shawarma, the signature orange rice, salad, and enough white sauce to swim in for a reasonable $12. With the slew of new bars that popped up around the Yonge/Wellesley area, The Halal Guys is a very strong "drunk-eats" option.

I ordered a gyro sandwich tonight from The Halal Guys. My gyro arrived overlooked, with the gyro meat actually breaking one of my teeth due to it being overcooked. In addition, I asked for hot sauce and did not receive any, on my sandwich or on the side. Negligence on the part of such a successful business should not be overlooked. I'm a loyal customer strongly reconsidering my loyalty.

This place is fantastic.  I had the combo with chicken and gyro and it was just what the doctor ordered after a couple hard nights in Vegas. The meat is tender and juicy and their white sauce is delicious. The ratio of may to veggies is perfect.

The baklava left me yearning for something less sweet and more tender. 

Overall, I enjoyed the meal and will be back.

Avoid this place. Food over priced and rewards program a joke. Got run around with rewards program and they are just too greedy and don't care to help, spoke to and emailed them.  I already cut up my rewards card and encourage everyone to do the same, I will never go here again, these people are very greedy and don't care.

I've had halal on the streets of NYC and honestly this place does a decent job.  However, it can never compare to the Halal street cart!

Needless to say, this smorgasbord of food is worth the try and is welcoming to have something new in the valley.  The plates itself were pretty affordable; $7.95 and up is not a bad deal.  I do remember eating like so as a younger man, but I tell I can only handle these kinds of meals once in a year maybe!

I ordered a larger halal plate as it came with some basmati rice, beef, chicken, iceberg, falafel, and topped with their special mayo-like white sauce.  I added a small dip of their spicy sauce on the side; and I'm glad I did so cause man that sauce was too spicy for me!  Overall, the lettuce and falafel helped with the texture providing a subtle crunch.  The chicken and beef was uber tender and soft to the bite.  The mayo sauce is what makes this dish pop!  However, it definitely was nothing like compared to what I had in NYC; not trying to knock it,but just based on shear experience having to hold a warm plate of food eating on the street corners of NYC.  Something about it, but maybe it's just in my head too!

In the end, The Halal Guys is worth the try since it's definitely affordable for a big plate of food and just something different! - Enjoy!

PURE TRASH! And the owners know it!! No Wonder why they deleted the Review section on the Halal Guys page on Facebook LOL! So Overpriced for what it is too much oil the salad is not fresh from the day and it is noticable, rice is hard like rocks, chicken is dry .. White sauce tasted like Mayo I'm not sure if they get it, its supposed to be " tahine" anyways..  I'm really not the type complaining but for the price we pay this is way too much!.. You wouldn't even pay 5$ to go there. nothing to do with the U.S halal guys!
Halal guys Montréal doesnt have the same taste as NYC ones. Its much greasy than any other halal plates. However its pretty good.

It's still good but if you're expecting the same flavor as that of the original NYC Halal Guys you'll be disappointed. A bit on the pricey side as well. White sauce tastes like it is mayo based. Good customer service; a little tricky to find parking.
This is my favorite place! Food is amazing, healthy, fresh. Customer service is superb, fast and friendly. Open late too!

Born and raised New Yorker here so I was super excited when the Halal Guys and opened in Las Gaygas. It was good but as so many other reviews stated, it was not quite the same. 

First time we had it, we ordered from Uber Eats. Hubby has never been to NY so I was excited to have him try it. Needless to say, he loved it but I still can't wait for him to try the legit thing. 

Second time was today and we're still waiting for the food we ordered almost 45 minutes ago. First, they ran out of chicken so we had to wait for that. Then, when the chicken was finally ready, they realized they didn't have enough rice. The girl behind the counter subbed the rice for fries and kindly refunded one of the platters we offered. Hubby was disappointed since he had ordered extra rice because he liked it so much. 

3 stars because it doesn't quite taste the same and for the slow service. Maybe I'm just used to how speedy the carts were in NY and that was with lines that wrapped around the block sometimes.

Good spot and had a large crowd at lunch but the line moved quickly.  We had chicken pitas and they were great... fresh vegetables and lots of chicken.  The house sauce is really good but I would ask them to go light.  Platters also looked really good and fairly priced.  Will definitely go back!
So glad they made the expansion out to Arizona! It obviously cannot measure up to the original stand on the streets of New York City, but it's still got the same, famously great flavors.
Food is not great. When I went there late one night on the weekend, the meat was already there warming up. It wasn't fresh.

This is a good place to go for Middle Eastern comfort food -- and plenty of it.  Service was fast, but there aren't a lot of tables.  

The menu is pretty simple.  My son and I chose the chicken and gyro combo, which came with plenty of both.  The rice was very good, there was a small salad of lettuce and tomatoes, and the extras of onion, green peppers, and olives added a lot of flavor -- especially those olives. 

On the sauces, unless someone is adventurous or likes things pretty spicy, I'd advise sticking to the white sauce.  It's a spiced up yogurt blend that I think of as Ranch Jr.  When the server asks if you want more, say yes because the usual portion isn't enough.  

Two sizes are offered.  The large is only $1 more than the small and a lot bigger.  Both my son and I couldn't finish ours, so took them home for another meal.  I also bought a 2-piece box of baklava, thinking we could have it later.  But my son declined -- and yay! to that.  It was excellent.

Way too overhyped. Perhaps the NYC cart tastes better which I will definitely visit someday. 
The portions are pretty big but instead of salad they should have potatoes instead. The plate itself was not bad but missable and also expensive!
I personally think Boustan is way better and in a city where Boustan, Basha, and other middle eastern style/gyro cuisine exists plentifully, which, are also priced way better.

Very mediocre food at unreasonable prices. One would presume that a restaurant so close to the university would have better food with more affordable pricing but this is just not it. Moreover, they're very stingy with the food.

2 experiences both 5 star. Ordered From UberEats and got the food hot, correct, and delicious. Came in today because we were in the area and had a couple combo platters. The chicken was just coming off the grill and was tender, juicy, and perfectly seasoned. The 2 employees Rylin and Jody were friendly and had great suggestions. The hot sauce is as advertised. HOT! But Rylin made sure we knew that and gave a small tester before we made the decision to use more. Will 100% continue coming back here or atleast order from here. Restaurant was clean and everything you would expect from a new spot. Keep it up guys!

Had to check it out since people rave about it coming from NY.

Nothing SPECIAL. It was good, but I'm not going to make the extra trip out.

Had the combo, small. Falafel was a bit small and on the hard side.

They were quick, but it's a busy location- especially the parking.

I didn't know this place existed until last week.  I've had the one in NYC and absolutely LOVED the food. It was my go to cart every time I visited. Now, This one in Tempe is pretty darn close. The portion sizes are good (not as big as NYC plates) and service is also great. We always seem to get there are the perfect time with no wait but it's usually pretty busy. The white sauce and the pita bread ROCK!

Finally! Welcome to Vegas. I've had Halal Guys 3 times since its soft opening already. It never disappoints with their combo plate. The hummus is okay, nothing special. I enjoy their pita bread, white sauce, and hot sauce (be careful & cautious!). It's a light yummy but filling meal. The only negatives I experienced so far were their AC being broken, they forgot my to go hot sauce and white sauce, & their condiment bottles were all empty at the stand. There's a dozen or so employees helping but the sauces got overlooked. That's the best part! Hope to come back with these first bumps in the road resolved.

It's just HYPE guys! 

If you've never had the real thing in NY then maybe... But then again, there are so many better place in Vegas to spend your hard earned money on. 

Pros: staff was friendly, sauces are readily available by the soda machine, the food was ok

Cons:  parking was a little difficult, price is high for what it is, menu is small, the only thing that reminds you of NY is the name - otherwise just looks like a random fast food joint 

Wish I could give a higher rating because I love the NY guys, but this was pretty disappointing.

The food is very different compare with the original in NYC... 
The place is very small and they don't understand how to work as a productive chain.  As consequence, you have to wait at least 20-30 minutes once you're in the door of the resturant.  They're very very slow...

I wish I can give no stars. This place is a joke, the chicken has no flavor, the beef, well I'm not sure what the hell it is, condiments are cold tomatoes & lettuce & they have this nasty extremely hot sauce that makes no sense & they put a glop of this white sauce on it & there rice had stale pieces in it. There is no way in hell this place is gonna last. I guess it started out as a cab stand & should've stayed a cab stand. Marketing does wonders I guess. Worst wannabe middle eastern I ever had.

I was expecting something fabulous from all the hype, but to me everything was so bland. Yes, the ghost pepper sauce will give you heat, but the beef and chicken isn't flavorful to begin with. I understand the original NYC locations featured LAMB, which would totally step up the flavor quotient. This loose beef doesn't cut it, and the white sauce adds nothing but moisture (which is good, as everything is desert dry) but again not much taste. Sorry, Guys, wanted to love you.

The portion is so little for something that is over $10.  The amount of rice they put in is so little even for a large order.  If you're used to eating at the location in  NY 53rd and 6th you'll be really disappointed.

Very friendly girl at counter.  Beef and chicken were plentiful and flavorful. The pita bread was hard, seemed old, was gross. The hummus was good but we couldn't eat it since the pita bread it came with was old and gross. I don't think pitas are supposed to fall apart and crumble. Prices are a bit high if you compare to fast food,  but this is a category above so prices are average.

Service is fast and staff are nice but the food just isn't up to par. A block away there is Boustan which is far superior in taste.

They have an amazing white sauce and a super spicy sauce but no garlic sauce 

Also the value isn't there in terms of portions.

My only real complain is the chicken, once I saw it in the kitchen, I changed my order.
Also the bread was wet
Portions too small for the price get amir or  basha etc for cheaper price and same quality and bigger portion

Tried this joint for the first time today! I've never had the NYC version but I'd like to try it some day.

Came by for a late lunch. Shared a regular chicken and beef platter. I enjoyed the mix of flavours in the platter, and it was a decently sized portion for the price you pay. The sauces complimented each other very well, and the hot sauce is spicier than you think! The rice was alright, a little on the bland side but not too terrible. I enjoyed both meats - and there was a large quantity of both of them.

I suggest you try asking them for more sauce when they are making your order for you. Relative to the other pictures posted by others, our platter did not appear to have as much sauce. As well, if you want more afterwards, you're going to have to pay for a packet.

Overall, I enjoyed the meal. I'd like to come back to try their gyros!

Had this place back in Chicago and in LA.  Still good here.  Had the Combo Platter.   Wasn't busy at all for a friday night.  Ample parking.  Will always be back.  Not sure if it's as good as New York, but I still like it.
Didn't meat the expectations, we ordered beef gyro and falafel sandwich. You can barley see and taste the meat, the falafel was ok.

We went to Halal Guys for dinner last night and I was very disappointed. 

We were really excited to try it out since there has been so much hype leading up to their opening. Also, as a Middle Eastern food lover, I was excited for a new concept to come to the valley. However, I'm not sure that you could really call this Middle Eastern or Mediterranean food.

They only have two options on their menu: a pita wrap/sandwich, or a platter. Then you have your choice of meat: chicken, gyro, or falafel.

I ordered the platter which automatically comes with shredded iceberg lettuce, chopped tomatoes, and yellow rice. Then they top that with the meat(s) of your choice and a few slices of pita. They serve average pita like the type you could get at the grocery store. Their sauce options include white sauce, which is a mayo-based sauce, spicy sauce, or tahini, although you have to specifically request tahini. 

Their food is extremely bland, and it is severely lacking something fresh - which may sound strange because half of my plate was shredded lettuce, but it lacks some type of vinegar - whether it's pickles, olives, or some type of dressing. Also, their hot sauce is so spicy that you can't even enjoy it, I'm not sure why they bother making it. It would be nice if they had a few different types of hot sauce, maybe something along the lines of a mild herb-based sauce, a medium sauce, and then their extraordinarily hot sauce. 

All in all, I won't be back. I'd rather go elsewhere and spend less for more flavor and more authentic food.

My first time here! Even though everyone recommends the combo plate I was just really craving a sandwich. It did not disappoint. I rarely eat a whole gyro, but I couldn't stop with this one.  The red sauce was good, but I liked the white sauce much better. Too fattening to eat on the regular, but I will definitely be back to try the combo plate.
Very disappointed bad food this is not a middle eastern food I'm not going back again

No long review here... now I've been to all the Halal Guys in the desert. A Halal Trifecta!
The employees were pretty awesome. Best of the three joints. They hollar "hello!!" And "goodbye" to everyone that comes in. 
The food was consistent.  Thank you!

These combo platters are serious business!
Best 9 dollars spent on food ever!
The meats have good flavor and the sauces are awesome.  This is a tone of good food and the management staff seem pretty awesome. 
This place is always busy but never a really long wait.

Finally open in chandler!!
These combo platters are serious business!
Best 9 dollars spent on food ever!
The meats have good flavor and the sauces are awesome.  This is a tone of good food and the management staff seem pretty awesome. 
This place is always busy but never a really long wait.

Came in around 12:30am last night. I don't understand why the food was a bit colder than room temperature. They were suppose to be open til 4am but they seemed like they were about to close. It's definitely a fast food joint. The white sauce people were raving about was very bland and the hot sauce wasn't to my liking either. It could be just me so still give it a shot. They got 2 stars cause of their hummus and pita. It was fairly good and they give you a good amount for $5. We ordered the combo plater with falafel then a side of hummus just so we can try most of what they had. If this was my first time trying middle eastern food,I would probably never try Middle Eastern food again.

One of the better valued restaurants inside the Caesars Palace Food Court. For around $10-$12 a plate, I was pretty stuffed with my chicken and gyro platter. Compared to other restaurants in this food court, Halal Guys give a pretty decent portion.

The Halal Guys saved my stomach at 2AM in the morning! Unfortunately they were limited to one squeeze of white sauce, but the white sauce is one of the best dressings ever!

I only know of their other location; which is in Spring Mountain. Tastes the same as that one.

So simple, so easy to order, so delicious. Those red and white sauces are cracktastic. It is good food fast so don't go in there expecting fine dining like some of these people writing reviews. The guys working there are courteous. They fry those french fries up on demand and I LOVE some good hot crinkle cut fries.

I am an avid Halal Guys fan! I used to frequent the street cart in NYC when I lived there - it easily became one of those meals that I craved weekly! 

I just had my first meal combo plate at this location and it did not disappoint. Before posting this, i saw a review from someone complaining about the food being cooked ahead of time and it sitting until it's served - clearly that person doesn't get out much. You ever been to a chipotle? It's the same concept. And, with how busy their locations are, the food won't have much of a chance to sit for long - those lines won't stop! It's sad that someone like that rated them so negatively at the beginning. 

Back to the food; be careful with the red sauce! If you haven't had it before, taste a little bit on your finger before adding it to your dish - you'll thank me later! The white sauce is where it's at. It's like ranch and tzatziki made a love-child. The lettuce and tomato help cool the heat from the red inferno! 

The location is small, but coming from a cart on the street where you had to eat your meal standing up in 5 degree weather in the snow and wind...I think this is a huge step up! I love that feeling of standing and eating my meal at their locations. It's just one of their "things." If you're going to complain that you don't have a seat to put your butt, bring a fold-up chair in your car (or eat in your car) and save the complaint. 

The A/C wasn't working, but they haven't really opened yet. These types of things are expected. They had fans and cooling units inside to help - we appreciated that. The owners were great! Very nice guys! They even gave us (2) free entrees for a future visit. The staff were all very friendly and I saw lots of smiles (not something I'm used to at the street cart lol)!

Eating here is an experience & you should look at it like that! You will likely have a challenge finding parking. You may wait in line when the weather is not so great. If you come here with those expectations, you'll enjoy your meal even more (especially late night after some cocktails)! Well done, Halal Guys!
Best customer service Angel does a good job on greeting the customers very clean store

AMAZING. I've heard great things from friends in NYC but I had to experience it myself. Well worth the wait. Hope they open one in Scottsdale.


Ps order the red sauce on the side. Extremely spicy.
Cool place, good food, and the staff was really nice! Thanks for staying open late and helping me when I'm craving a falafel!
Nice staff, good food, open late. Where else can you get something like this late night? Ignore Matt, he's fat.. the portions are perfect ;)

I was so excited to try the falafel and Gyro's at this place 
because I heard a lot of the good things about it!!! But after I try it I wasn't worth it the money I have spent on this food!! Not enough falafel, very little Gyro's, chicken wasn't cooked very good !!!!. Never again .

Glad there wasn't a line up when I went! Prob would've been disappointed if having to wait 30 minutes for it.

I've never had this in the states so I can't compare but for the price ... it doesn't seem to be worth it. There are many mom and pop shops in Toronto that make better gyros than here.

I got the combo platter (reg) and it came to be around $14 for it. The portion is decent but feels like something that should be $10. 

It's definitely a good alternative to other quick bites in the area but I wouldn't come here just for the sake of eating it.

Halal Guys has probably been the only restaurant I've been excited about this whole year. I can remember my first time like it was yesterday (it was really only 6 months ago), it had just finished snowing, the cold winds were relentless, and I proceeded optimistically cautious to the famous food cart (see my NYC location review for details on orgasm). I swore to myself that one day I'll have another bite of its yellow rice, chicken, gyro meat, and white sauce. Thankfully THG has become a multi-million dollar company and expanded its white sauce deliciousness to the west coast (and even the Philippines).

The combo plate has not yet failed me (with only two visits how could it?). My only recommendation is extra white sauce, easy on the red sauce, and BBQ sauce if they have it. I could on about its buttery rice and moist chicken, but I'm sure the other (soon to be hundreds) of reviews will do that. 

What is the appeal you ask? Perhaps its legendary name, the white sauce, or that tasty cheap eats are always on its own pedestal above all others, the only way to know for sure if THG is for you is to try.

 Is it as good as the NYC locations? I don't think so and I don't know why. In NYC you are tasting the decades of grinding on the streets and hard work while in Vegas its the byproduct of that (flavors of The American Dream can be noted). 

At least it fits my macros though. 

50P/86C/30F for the combo platter with white sauce
0P/0C/10F per 2oz of WHITE SAUCEEE

Great food and quick service. Prices are reasonable for high quality food. Beware of the red sauce, it is liquid lava. The white sauce is fantastic though! If you get there at 11:30 you will beat the lunch rush!

Driving around the ASU area of Tempe and made an executive decision to stop by my old neck of the woods! I was very surprised to see this location across the street from my old apartment complexes back in my college days. I recently tasted the food from the yelp Halloween event at the Arizona center, so this motivated me to trying it out. I like the simplicity of the menu and have the option of a small or regular plate for $7.95. I went ahead and had the chicken/gyro combo, combined with tomatoes, lettuce , yellow rice , topped with the meats. My toppings included onions, peppers, olives and some white sauce I forgot how to pronounce . The pieces of pita was a nice compliment and overall the food was okay, not the best but good tasting meal for a quick grab n go!

I love that this place is open until around 3 or 4am. Working in the industry and you get off late it's a perfect place to stop and grab food on the way home. Always friendly staff and always in and out of there quickly. Don't forget your rewards card!

Edit: I believe the new hours only stay open till 2am
It is good for what it is, which is chipotle style mediterranean food.  The felafel was good, but not a huge fan of their mayonnaise sauce

Food was decent. Nothing to rave about. Think there was more hype than taste here. It was a little crowded with no place to sit... Might be a good place to eat after going out since it's open till 4am and the service was fast. But if taste and quality is what you want, not a place to spend your money.

I had been wanting to check out The Halal Guys ever since they opened up in my area, so on a night I didn't feel like cooking dinner I headed on over!

Arrived a little before 5pm, it wasn't too busy, leaned you can either get a sandwich or a platter, I went with the chicken sandwich and ordered a side of falafel.

The chicken sandwich came on a nice warm pita, the chicken was tender and juicy had nice flavor to it, the sandwich had lettuce and it comes with a white sauce & and I also asked for the hot sauce too. This was a messy sandwich, but ooohhh sooo good!

I have to say though I was surprise with the side of falafel, there are 4 pieces of nicely fried falafel, but it did not come with any sauce, which I guess I expected it to, so by themselves with no sauce, they were little dry. Next time order a side of sauce or just make it a falafel sandwich. 

Glad The Halal Guys are in the neighborhood and I'm sure I will be back soon.

Probably the blandest shawarma that I've ever eaten. The meat was pretty much tasteless and there really wasn't all that much to choose from for toppings (no pickled turnips at all). The price was average for what you would normally find at a shawarma shop.
Do yourself a favour if you're in the mood for shawarma.... Walk up Yonge street at little further and give the Falafel House a visit. They've been my go-to for years now

Wow... Talk about flavorful!

Their combo meat (chicken & gyro is soooo tasty).

Their pita is super soft & yummy.

Falafel, just okay.

Baklava, perfectly sweetened & delicious.

Their red sauce is sooooo hot, a few drops is enough for a platter.

Their white sauce... OMG, the best!!! I generously poured it all over my platter! Hahaha

I like the simplicity of their menu, generous serving sizes (the platter was 2 meals for me) & reasonable prices.

The only negative is the limited seating & parking. 
Other than that, it's definitely worth checking out.. And they're even open til late!

When I went to New York City everyone told me I needed to go to Halal Guys before leaving. I loved it then and I love that it is now in Las Vegas! Of course it is not the same as the little cart in New York but it was pretty good regardless. 

I went there and got a gyro and it was massive I had to take the rest to go. The meat was full of flavor but the only thing I didn't like very much was the pita bread they used. The bread was very thick making it difficult to eat the gyro because I felt like I was eating more pita than anything else. 

Like I said, it is definitely not the same as the one in NYC but it was still pretty tasty. Also, if you are a local you get 10% off !!!

I had also fallen into the PR trap from Halal Guys for their grand opening and waited in line, in the cold rainy Friday for about 45 minutes to spin a wheel for a mere 30% off one item. 

I must also mention I haven't tried the Halal Guys in New York but since #whitesauce was all the rage all over my Facebook newsfeed, why not? 

The food was sub par and over priced for the quality. Not a lot of meat/gyro but a lot of veggies so at least you know you're getting in your servings. About $12 for a small platter and it felt a bit unfair. 

The employees I found were really nice and cheery though, even for the hordes of people that kept coming in.

There are many other options around the area to get really great halal food WITH great sauce as well. If I'm just craving something similar, I would say Lazeez on Harbord or for great greasy fast food, Messini's all the way.

In my opinion, not worth it, and definitely not worth the wait.

A poor homage to the original one on 53rd and 6th in NYC.  Having had the original countless times before, this one seems skimpier on the portions, overcooked on the meats and rice, and more expensive than the original.  Major props to their expansion across the US, but this feels more like a copycat than the real deal.

For those of you who "thought" that this location is anything like the ones in New York, you are absolutely wrong. First of all I know it a new place and it still trying to establish itself but you can tell the whomever owns this is a rookie. The owner charges for literally everything. One packet of White sauce- $1
Extra meat (Since they barely put meat)- $4
To top it off it's close to $10 bucks while New York has there menu at $7 for the regular size bowl.

This place is Awesome! The food is delicious! The new management has really turn this place around!!  I spoke to the manager Vanessa about catering for my companies next business meeting. She answered all my question and helped me get it all set up! Just AWESOME!!

Not near as good as in NY. This visit was below my expectations. The meats were dry as well as the rice. The food was so dry I could feel it getting stuck in my throat. The pita bread also had a strange taste to it, not sure what was going on with it. In NY they are making it fresh on the carts...maybe that was the difference? My husband and I wanted to control the amount of red sauce on it when we got home to eat, so we asked for togo packets of the red sauce. Beware---they charge a bunch for the togo sauce, but if you dine in, you get unlimited free sauce...Wish we would have stayed to eat as my food was so dry that I wish I could have added a TON more white sauce to help. Very bummed about this whole experience, just going to stick to the real deal when we go to NY.

The Halal guys hype is the reason I went in... The pictures look so amazing, the reviews are great, so I needed a taste! While I seldom choose a meat options, I went with traditional gyro meat in the platter. 

Well... when I first looked at my platter, I was thinking to myself that the meat looked extremely greasy. It made me a bit nervous. 

If you are dining in, they have bottles of the famous sauces you can bring to the table. 

White Sauce- I was kind of let down because I expected some super tasty garlic-y sauce, but it tasted like plain ranch dressing.

Red Sauce- HOT! They give fair warning! I am a heat connoisseur who orders an 8 at Thai restaurants... This stood up very well. Its HOT HOT HOT, but still tasty. Just eat it on the side or only start with a tiny drizzle!

They have Tahini sauce as well. Tasted pretty traditional & up to par.

So anyway- Once you get the whole bowl rockin with sauces and toppings, the greasiness of the meat leveled out. The pita they serve with it was also kind of greasy but oh so delicious. 

They are open late, its clean inside, and I would definitely recommend it or eat it again.

Tried this place out with my friend on Friday night. It was busy with no place to sit and and their AC wasn't working as well. Besides that, I'm thinking "whatever, I came here for the food". 

I ordered the Pita wrap combo with a side order of rice and it was so bland and tasteless. The pita was thick and doughy. The meat almost had no seasoning whatsoever. Rice was was tasteless. The veggies were fresh, but again tasteless. Even just a tad of cilantro and lime would've helped. If it wasn't for the white sauce and hot sauce (that was pretty okay), I wouldn't have finished my meal. 

I really wanted to like this place, but I can't. It's just another New York chain to pop off in the LV that has yet to impress me.

I was very excited to finally have The Halal Guys in Toronto! (See my NYC review).

- Meh food. The combo platter comes with orange rice, chopped iceberg lettuce, diced tomatoes, two small pita pieces, and two meats.
- The chicken and gyro meats were honestly very dry, so it's soaked in white sauce.
- They give you very little salad.
- Their famous hot sauce is SUPER HOT. IT BURNS.
- Overpriced ($14 CAD for a platter)
- This place closes at 11, the Halal guys in NYC is the go-to spot for super late nights.

Overall - Disappointed... Unfortunately I don't see myself coming back. It was not worth the time or money.
There are cheaper and better shawarma/gyro places in Toronto.

5/5 Kudos to the staff for working the nonstop crazy lineups!

Just the taste I remembered back on 53rd and 6th! Although the portion was a bit less than in NYC and a couple dollars more, it's still the best I ever have. 
Don't forget to add that famous white sauce along with bbq sauce, and if you like spicy, just squeeze a bit from the hot sauce bottle because it is extremely hot! 


They also serve additional side dishes (hummus, and baba ganuosh) and baklava. Yum! 

Easy to park, the restaurant is clean and the staff are friendly!

TIL that the white sauce contains mayo, hence why they keep it over ice with an expiration date - which may also explain why it's so tasty and addictive. 

After a weekend of excess in Las Vegas, I finally realize why Halal Guys is the perfect anytime food for Vegas. Halal guys is good for:

* A cheap lunch. Less than $10 per plate (before taxes). Compared to my other meals on the strip, this was a steal. A drink at the taco bell cantina sets you back $10. 
* An afternoon snack. Plates come in two sizes - small and large. Go small for snack time. 
* A quick dinner. No one hour waits here as the food is made pretty and served pretty quickly. 
* After a night out. Opened late and just enough protein, carbs, flavor, and a bit of grease to hit the spot (and slow down the absorption of alcohol) without being too greasy. Ask for more rice and less lettuce if you need more carbs. 
* After a weekend of excessive eating. Everything is pretty fresh and the bit of lettuce and tomato help to lighten the meal. 

I got the combo meal, which is my usual go to at halal carts. The meat was in bigger chunks than I expected, but tasty and not too dry. The rice was flavorful and fluffy. The pita was alright, but I don't usually care for the pita anyway. I did make the mistake of putting on too much red sauce and had to make multiple trips to the soda fountain for more water. 

It's not an exact replica in tastes and experience of the original Halal Guys and cart on a street corner in NYC, but I guess that's what happens when you can't port the water and years of flavor built up on the cart across the country. It's close enough and a great addition to the Vegas food scene.

Best Late Night Grub Ever! Can never go wrong with a combo platter and douse it with White Sauce/Tahini...dab a lil Red sauce too to add spice in your life! Unless yer adventurous like me. Luv my food spiiiiiice-yaaay wootwoot!

The service is awesome always, thanks Tyra!

If you've tried the holy grail of halal guys in nyc - this is not the same. You don't have to fly over to nyc to get an idea of what it's like. Appreciate this food offering for what it is - that way you can say, make a fare comparison to similar food in the city.  

I ordered the combo platter. I don't really see the point of a size choice. That's new. The are more expensive than nyc maybe it's our taxes and health care but it's much more is all I have to say.

Alrighty, I'll be honest I spend a lot of time in nyc and I get dragged to the halal guys as a go to and it wasn't my favourite then and it isn't my favourite now.

It's not bad but I've had better in this city regardless of the infamous  white sauce. Both the chicken, beef and rice were dry.  That's going to happen when is meat is diced and heating. 

The tomatoes were nice as something that tasted fresh but lettuce, iceberg lettuce it's just a silly addition in anything. I call it filling.

I can't say I'd eat here again but I'm glad my curiosity was filled.

I will say it's a very clean space.

TWO WORDS; NEVER AGAIN. 

The Halal Guys is considered a staple for Halal Fast Food in New York City. I think it was about a year ago when they finally opened the doors to the Toronto location. I was so excited to finally give them a try. When they first opened up the lines were pretty outrageous, so I patiently waited.  

They have a great location! Steps away from the subway station and right on Yonge St. There was a bit of a wait, it was around lunch time which is normal for the city. 

I ordered the signature item. The Combo Chicken and Gyro Platter with White Sauce. WOW. What a disappointment. So let me start off by telling you what's in the platter. 

Lettuce, Tomatoes, Orange Rice, Chicken, Gyro (which is greek, so kinda confusing as to why they are serving that) tons of white sauce (not sure what it is) and the HOTTEST hot sauce. 

The rice is so bland and definitely needed more cooking. The Chicken and Gyro were also very bland. That white sauce was so salty and completely took away from everything. The hot sauce was so fucking spicy. If you look at my picture, there's only a bit. 

Here's my theory, people might be confusing the taste of the food with the actual taste of the hot sauce. It's very spicy and takes over everything. 

NEVER AGAIN. 

keep eating (but not here), 

Angela

I've eaten here about 10 times now and I'm still unsure of the place. The food is decent, the service is okay, but nothing "wows" me. Halal Guys usually has a short line but the ordering process seems to take longer than most fast food restaurants. I would classify this restaurant as fast casual.

Dining inside is a bit of a nightmare as there's no good seating anywhere. However, they do have plenty of it. There's modular tables so they can stack next to each other for up to I'd say 8 people before it encroaches into the ordering line.

If you order a gyro style sandwich, you have to pay a lot more for rice than if you order a combo. It's a big difference too, like $3 or something like that. Makes no sense to me. That's literally my biggest gripe with this place is the clear overcharging for a side of rice.

As far as loyalty rewards they sometimes have a locals discount, but at other times I'm not sure they have had it. It's something I heard about while sitting in line. Also make you carry the rewards card around. Time to get with the digital age and either do an app or use my phone number like everyone else!
Being from NY I was looking forward to having halal guys come here. The service was great and the food was good. We will be back
I had this place in NYC so I was stoked to see it opening here. But it was a huge let down. Won't be going back to this location

Firstly, I was very impressed with their bathrooms. Very clean despite a lot of people coming through.

We got a combo with chicken and beef and a beef shawarma. Together with a fountain pop, it came up to around $26.

I really liked the beef and pita. The beef was flavourful and pita was super soft. They packed the ingredients so it was super filling. The chicken was ok. It didn't have as much flavour as the beef. The hot sauce was very hot and the white sauce was not overpowering with garlic.
Ordered for the first time via Uber Eats and it was pretty good. We ordered the combo platter and the baklava for dessert. I most say that the food portions are big. Can feed two people!

First time I went it was pretty good. I don't think it compares to the NYC one.
Second time, the food tasted a little different, a little "weird." I won't come back again, maybe it was a hit but it left me with a weird taste. 

Also, the white sauce is amazing, a bit loaded on the calories.

The 2nd star is purely for fantastic service. The staff is friendly and very efficient. If you want to try it, get extra tahini. In fact, dip your meal in the white sauce and it might work. 

I've had their food in new york and so, my friend and I decided to try it. Luckily we got there before noon for lunch and so didn't have to wait in line. The food was edible but, my friend didn't even bother finishing her meal. The rice had no flavor whatsoever. I like simple menus, but this place has 2 things on their menu. Such a bummer.

Yeah, I just had to go to The Halal Guys in Vegas.  It's probably one of the best spots to grab some late night grub, especially since they're open till 4am.  So after finishing up at the bars one night, I stopped over at 2am for a regular combo platter.

Regular Combo Platter -- http://bit.ly/2iqpy8u
Best thing to eat at 2am in Vegas, or anywhere!  One aluminum pan loaded with chicken, gyro, rice, salad, and pita bread.  I could've opted for the Large size, but this was plenty of food for me.  And oh yeah, you gotta have them smother it with their white sauce!

Granted, it's not the same experience as the outdoor carts in NYC.  It's more expensive and there's no real rush from ordering, at least when I went.  But it's still worth it!

Vegas and Halal Guys definitely go hand in hand.  It's such a satisfying plate of meat and rice that just hits the spot late at night after having drinks on the Strip.  And they're not too far away from the Strip, just a short drive or cab ride away.  Definitely hit them up when you have a chance!

Well, I wanted to like this place a lot more, but... It was ok..

I had the falafel bowl thing. One of my dinner guests asked for well done lamb (just toss it back on the grill bro) they were clueless. Someone else asked for grilled onions, and again I can see the grill right there behind you... toss them on there bud, but nope.. So, I was not impressed with the level of service.

I thought it was a bit pricy to be honest. However, they stay open really late. So if you go out to the clubs then you can come here after (as if, I'm in bed by 10) for that much needed alcohol sponge. 

Lower your expectations, and you will be just fine.
I love it here just hate that charge for everything lol even a side of hot sauce, but the food is great

Updating the review because while the chicken is HORRIBLE, just terribly dry with zero seasoning, the beef gyros platter is actually pretty good and well seasoned. Actually really enjoyed the beef gyros with the white sauce and orange rice. A far better experience with the beef gyros. They should just cut chicken off the menu if they're going to put little to no effort making it taste good.

The place is decent for food. I like falafel, so it cant really go wrong for me. I mean their falafel is ok, but the quantity could use some work. Ive noticed that meat portions are huge while falafel is small compared to it. Although the quantity is probably small due to it having to be prepped or something.

Yeah the food is okay, but I really dig the customer service. The people are nice and are always greeting me, telling me stuff, and the fact that twins work together here is pretty great.

I've only had the falafel gyros and the regular platter. Their falafel tastes good, its crunchy, but its pretty dry. To make up for the dryness of the falafel, I drown it in white sauce. I put a good amount on my gyro and then add one strip of their hot sauce. Their hot sauce is hot enough for one strip to make me sweat a bit. It's a good amount of spice to the point where I can actually taste everything else.

So the falafel dishes are okay, but the customer service is better.

Nothing impressive lol, just a breakfast place with no AC "for now"! Food is not bad, but no good either ! FAST service ( well deserved 2nd star). I would give them another shot, because of the big advertisement their doing..

If it's your first time here, order the Combo (chicken and beef gyro meat) Platter. That is what they are famous for! Also like I mentioned in my tip, SMOTHER that shit in more white sauce. And even if it looks like enough, NO you are wrong. Smother that shit some more until your whole platter is basically swimming in it. And I guess you can add a dot of hot sauce. Unless you wanna take a fireball dump in the morning I suggest listening to everyone else's warning about how hot it is. It's no joke! That hot sauce could burn through my soul. 

It's located on Valley View & Spring Mtn, you can't miss those lovely red letters! The space is tiny but has a few tables and also some seating by the walls. Workers were suuuuper nice and even offered us free mini bottles of water. 

Again, extra white sauce, hot sauce and BBQ sauce is located by the soda machines. You already know. USE IT WELL. 

The platter itself was bomb. I am devouring my leftovers as I write this and it is still bomb as a leftover! It comes with rice, few slices of pita and some lettuce and tomato. Of course the one in New York will always be the very best, but this will satisfy the cravings until I can go back again :) 

And another great thing about this place is that it's open until 4am. YAAS for one of the best drunk foods!
Food wasn't that good and wasn't hot (maybe because it was after 11pm but they're open til 4am.

Stopped by for a quick lunch, left a tad disappointed. The service is good, the food is mediocre. I got the falafel sandwich, and it was bland. 7 dollars for a falafel sandwich with only 3 small pieces of falafel is a ripoff. My first few bites into it were just bread and sauce, that should give you an idea of how small they are.

Hmmmm. This is a tuff one because I don't like to give bad reviews, buuuut:  The buzz about this place doesn't live up to the quality of food served.  I ordered the large mixed platter ($9.99), a side of hummus ($4.99) and medium drink (a whopping $2.50), w/tax..I'm in for $19 (for lunch).
 When you think Gyro, Pita pocket, hummus, etc, you want a true Mediterranean flare...it didn't happen.  The "beef" gyro wasn't flavorful.  The chicken...bland.   The hummus had way too much paprika and oil on it...plus it was pre-made (or bought) and didn't have a good, smooth texture.  We also had Babagonush, which way to smokey flavored  (almost artificial) and lacked a decent texture.   The killer was the single pita they gave you with the side order was pre-wrapped in foil and left in the steam tray to keep warm....the result....sauggy pita. .  

The set up was similar to the ever so popular Chipotle style open kitchen.   The staff was nice but had no real knowledge if the food they were serving, nor the history of why this place was made famous in NYC.

This place was ok. Places with small menus should really nail what they do, and unfortunately this place missed that mark. Had the chicken platter and a beef gyro sandwich, and nothing about either really stood out. The pita bread wasn't great, the beef was better than the chicken, the rice was...rice. The garlic sauce is pretty good though, and it was pretty reasonably priced. If I do go back it won't be in the summer though - it's sweltering inside.
If you haven't had the experience of The Halal Guys in New York Cory, you must come here!!!  So delicious!!!
Not even close as compared to NYC halal, $7.99 for a small serving chicken halal rice is dissapointing. Wont go for the second time!!!

Changing my 3 stars to 2 because I just looked at the other reviews.  All of the 5 star reviews were given by people that attended their VIP/friends & family soft launch.  If I was given free or discounted food with a smile, I might give a higher score than it deserved.

This was my experience on my first visit...

Me surveying the menu:  I have never eaten here before.
Employee:  I can help you decide what to get.  [Proceeds to explain options]
Me:  can I sample the rice?
Employee:  sorry, I can't.
Me looking at a stack of empty 2oz portion cups:  just a taste?  I've never eaten anything from here before and I am not sure if I want to get the rice.
Employee:  you just need to buy the platter if you want to try some rice.
Me:  ....nevermind....I'll just take a sandwich to go.

The sandwich was okay.  I guess in Germany I was spoiled, eating doner kebabs topped with curry served hot and fresh from street corner vendors.
Great food! Even better service, thank you for making it an enjoyable experience! Chicken gyro is what i regularly order and it is delicious!
This place is delicious! As busy as it is! The service was great and quick! The food was juicy and tasty. I would come back! I recommend this!

Never tried them in the states but heard lots of good things...definitely over hyped because there is a lack of flavor.  If anything the chicken was decent but as a whole it's definitely missing something.  One star may seems harsh but I'm looking at it as a whole for price and taste.  I got the small platter which was $10 and my co-worker got the large platter $14, plus $2 for the "combo" which is just chicken and gyro, no drink. So for $16 you'd expect a pretty big "platter" right? Wrong, portions were just average, smaller than those Asian take out 3 part containers. It's an OK portion but if you're hungry and have a big appetite, don't expect it to fill you.  As others have mentioned, humus is extra $0.99, where as anywhere else you go it's free. So add humus to your meal plus a drink and your bill is over $20.  Maybe some people like the small orange rice; however I was not a fan. Not just the texture but the overall flavor of it was lacking and to me, the second most important thing besides the chicken (protein) is the rice in a meal/platter, I prefer basmati. I was not a fan and would honestly not recommend anyone try it, considering the price tag.

I did not try the wrap, perhaps that might've been better as the chicken was decent so I can only comment on the platter.  Seems a lot of new people came in to buy the regular combo platter only to realize it did not include a drink and it only meant "chicken and gyro".

I absolutely love this place! My fiancé and I eat here on a regular basis. The Halal Guys offer the best customer service that I've ever witnessed, aside from amazing food! If I could give them 10 stars I would!

I don't understand the few poor reviews. This place is fantastic as the long lines would indicate. Everything is fresh and delicious. Especially the pita bread. I had the falafel plate and it was the best falafel I have ever had in AZ. The service was great too.

I love Mediterranean food because of their "Spiciness!" They have a limited amount of selections on the menu so it's much easier to order what you want.  First, You can choose from either a platter or a pita bread sandwich that already comes equipped with lettuce and tomato or you can tell them to hold the veggies. After that, you select your meats (chicken, beef gyro, combo, or falafel). Finally, you have additional toppings to choose (jalapeños, pitted black olives, and peppers). Oh yeah, I can't forget the sauces! They top your item off with a creamy white sauce.

If you're like me and dip food into a sauce after every bite, they have it next to the drink dispensary for people to grab. 

Btw, the two other sauces provided are BBQ sauce and HOT sauce (literally hot). I don't know what peppers they used but it's flaming. I guess that's why they have the white sauce displayed for your own protection lol

Today I preferred the beef gyro sandwich because I had to order to go and I can eat this using my hands. It cost me only $8.99 with a drink $2.49

P.s. if you check in, you get a free Baklava dessert! Trust me it's really good!

Favorite chicken and rice restaurant!   I've had it at a couple of other locations in the west coast, but this one is probably the most similar to the one in New York.  

The chicken is really tasty and well marinated.  Perfect combination of rice, salad, and meat.  But most importantly the red and white sauce.  Definitely recommend trying the red sauce for all spicy food lovers!  It's really spicy, but so addicting.  

Customer service was surprisingly catering for a fast food restaurant.  

Would definitely recommend eating here if you don't feel like dressing up.  Great for late night munching.

The only thing I liked here was the rice. It was fantastic! I got a gyro plate with rice, a Greek salad, and a side of fries. The meat was bland. The pita was tough. The fries were boring. The salad was a small pile of lettuce with a piece of tomato. There was no dressing, no olive, no feta! How is that a salad? We had one plate between the 3 of us, and we threw away most of it, with the exception of the rice, because it was just not good. It was way too much money for the quality and quantity. I shop here every weekend and was excited for a nice Gyro place. This is not it!

I adore the staff here. They've always been and welcoming!!!! The food is delish, I get the chicken platter every time with extra lettuce to make it kinda more like a salad, and that white sauce though....amazing!!

Middle Eastern comfort food with meat, rice and salad. My gyro meat was dark, over cooked  and chewy...didn't look anything like gyro meat. A little bland. The olives helped, but the food could use a little more spice and vinegar. I really like my middle eastern food tangy. I'd love it if they offered middle eastern pickles or a simple vinegarette for the salad.  I'll give it another chance... Gave it another chance... Went back a second time. Gyro meat was dark and chewy again. I don't think I'll be coming back, sadly. I really wanted to like this place. I will say, you do get a lot of food for the price. Unfortunately it's lots of bland chewy food.

The food is delicious and the service is great. The staff are pleasant, helpful and very nice. I had the combo sandwich with lots of white sauce. Was amazing. Be careful though, the hot sauce is really hot. What a kick.
You definitely can feel a very positive energy in this place.
This is going to be my favorite spot from now on every time I'm in town.
Great service, good food, and awesome location... thank you for great service tonight Jesus .

Great food... patient employees.. and great service...
Thanks Angel G and Tiara! Will be back soon

Not one for giving bad reviews but my friend and I were really excited to try this place out and are very disappointed. The only option you had to choose from was the meat and if you wanted sauce or not (your choices are a sauce that is "mayo based with spices" , BBQ, or hot sauce). We found the service to be hasty and unfriendly. Felt pushy if you will. Once we got our food it was flavorless despite that or bowls were doused in sauces. If you want to pay 9$ for a bowl of shredded iceberg lettuce, diced tomatoes, rice and bland meat try it, but I would not recommend.

Hmmm, what is the hype about??? The place is small with no seats, food is less than ordinary, service is just ok - nothing special. Menu is limited youd think they would specialize in what they serve? Nope! Wont be coming back!

The fact they are open hella late gives them four stars, dank hummus but unfortunately the quality of chicken and falafel wasn't as good as hoped, but if your looking for late night now that Oliveos is closed in the neighborhood it works

I was so excited to try this place but when I actually tried it I was so disappointed. I feel bad but I really could not even finish the food and my stomach hurt. It had no flavor, the white sauce is gross and the hot sauce is like fire with no taste.
Hard to find. I waled for an hour but couldn't find it in the location they mentioned.
Really good! The gyro is better than the chicken IMO. Also less is more with the hot sauce so be careful lol.
Always a great experience! Love that white sauce.  And locals get a discount. It's great that they are a bit far away from where I live because otherwise I'll be there everyday

Nothing really special. I heard so much about their famous white sauce. But their platters with chicken and kebab/gyros is like any other shawarma restaurant. It does not stand out and the it isn't cheap either. I don't understand the long lines at this place.

One of our favorite spots! Originally located on 56th & 6th in the heart of Manhattan-its all about the WHITE SAUCE! Get extra, you're welcome. 

Always consistently yummy! The yellow/orange rice is delicious. I skip the veggies because it is just lettuce and tomato. Some people like it, though. They have platters in two sizes. You can also get a combo. I love the falafel and chicken. Again, extra white sauce! It's cheap and the service is fast as well-extra bonuses. 

If you give them a 5 star   review, you get free fries and a drink! Whoo!! 

P.S. We stood in line on opening night for 45 min and met the owner the night before when my Nee Yorker bf "had to have it" and he is a super nice guy! 

Awesome place! Awesome food! Awesome people! 
5 stars in my opinion

So pleased that it has arrived in LV!  Red and white sauce just as good as NY. Good atmosphere. Gyro combo was the way to go - served nice and hot, no sitting around. Falafel was decent but not the reason to come.

Like many others pointed out, the service is great, nothing at all wrong on that end. Now the food... All you get is your meat which is honestly sub par at best and you get rice and salad which is just a handful of lettuce... They give you an option for hot sauce and white sauce. The hot sauce is the only good thing they have going for them because I love spicy food and the hot sauce here is comparable to the Buffalo Wild Wings blazing sauce, perhaps even
Hotter. Too bad the food here isn't worth it. The white sauce is some kind of mayo dressing that's loaded with fat. Literally not kidding, one packet of white sauce dressing has 33grams of fat! If you're watching your macros skip the white sauce, I see that many people enjoy it and drench their bowls with it, but I wonder if they know the facts. Anyways as far as improvements, if they want to compete with real Mediterranean joints then I suggest making veggie options and better overall quality food. For the price I'll stick to Hummus Xpress on Hardy & University, as they give you much better flavourful food which includes: real salad, very good humus, better meat, and hot veggies (Fried eggplant, glazed carrots,Lemon pepper broccoli etc.), not just lettuce, and a variety of toppings you can add for free.

VERY tender gyro platter.  Most tender we have EVER had.  Very large portion.  Fresh lettuce & tomato to build my own.  Love the 2 packs of white sauce that's given.  Enjoyed the take out.  Will order again.

I've been waiting to have some New York style halal food come to Vegas. Finally it's here. I love it. Keep it coming, I'm a fan. I haaate people that go on Yelp and hate and give bad reviews. So yeah good job guys

Great food and great service 

It stays open late too, until 4 am on weekends 

I recommend the combo platter which allows you to taste both meats available 

Thumbs up!

The food Was amazing

The plates and sandwiches tasted the same as in nyc

You don't feel bloated with carbs or leave with a garlic breath after eating here like amir or boustan
First time here! This is a new location and the Beef Platter was awesome. Will be back!

Sorry guys - no bueno. The Halal Guys cart in NYC is an occasional guilty pleasure for me when I'm over there, but the new Las Vegas location just does not do the name any justice.

$9.99 for a "large" combo plate that doesn't even fill the container, was mostly lettuce anyway (literally more lettuce than rice), with meat that was lukewarm (and technically probably not even room temperature as the A/C in the place isn't even working - it's 100°+ out today, for goodness' sakes), and the pita was cold and hard. No wonder there is literally no line. (Well, at least I didn't have to wait to be disappointed.)

I don't expect a carbon copy of the greatness of their NYC cart, but they will have to get a LOT closer to what's at 53rd and 6th to get me to come back.

Halal guys has to be one of he best things I have ever eaten. When you come here go big or go home always get the regular combo platter with extra meat and white sauce. You will not regret it. 
The restaurant itself was very nice and clean and the staff were very friendly and quick to serve. I have no complaints about this halal guys or the food.

I have heard a lot about this place from many people and we wanted to give it a try. After evening show at the movies, we landed up going to this place for dinner around 10:30. 

The place looks like any fast food chain, we ordered chicken platter. The rice they add is really good and thats the only thing which i liked. The chicken was too bland and didn't find it fresh. My bowl was filled with lettuce . The sauce was good but its like any other Mediterranean sauce. 

I was not impressed and did not like the food, does not look like any picture or video that ran on television in the restaurant. Price is reasonable

Don't believe the hype. 

If you want Halal Guys, save it for the next time you're in NYC. 

Was there at 9pm. Ordered a chicken Shawarma pita. Chicken was all chopped up sitting in a metal warming tray. Upon entry into my mouth, my tongue became depressed. My tongue literally wanted to cry. 

This was not the experience, flavours and deliciousness I was hoping for. I've had better Shawarma's at some really crappy Shawarma joints in Toronto. 

Boo!

Being a super cheap place in Vegas it was packed. Their AC doesn't work. It's vegas, 30 people inside. You get the picture. My 2 friends enjoyed their meal I think. I am just not into halal guys. I've had once in NYC. It was okay. Never understood why people talk so much about them. I'm a foodie and this is definitely not my standard. I ordered the gyro. The pita was soaking wet and fell apart. It was worse than McDonald. I only went there because all the other restaurants were closed. My advice, look for 7eleven and buy a cold cut sandwich over this.

"It's the best Jerry! The best!!" I will be here every week, I guarantee it.  The parking sucks, but that's probably because of the Grand Opening, not to mention it's next to a Starbucks and other restaurant I believe.  Other than that the service is great and very fast.  I was in and out in 5 minutes.  I actually spent more time trying to find a place to park lol.  There's not very many tables to sit inside, but that doesn't bother me since I always take my food to go. Either way, the food delicious and cooked to perfection; not dry at all.  And the white sauce...let's just say I could drink it from that pack.  Lol, that's how good it is.  Besides Hot 'N Juicy, Halal is the best thing that's happened to Chinatown.  #TheHypeIsReal

got a free meal due to the cutest & loviest worker! coolest management  I honestly love halal guys the food is absolutely immaculate, i tried it once and actually crave it a LOT. bigger than the tempe one too :)

The staff and Vanessa the manager were so friendly and welcoming. This is my first time here so they explained everything on the menu to me. The service was really quick and the food was delicious. The BBQ and white sauce combo was the bomb!

Dry chicken sandwich.
Dry pita bread.
Hot sauce tastes like it should be on a burrito not a gyro place.  sandwich was $8 fries were another $3. Bland and gross. The Tahini served with the Falafel was also extremely flavorless.
Who rates this place 5stars? World famous? Horrible.

Amazing service with great food first time trying this delishness and has the combo bowl with beef,chicken, rice and veggies.  A great inexpensive lunch for me and Be careful with the hot sauce as it is super spicy!
Go there. Now. Get the combo platter. LOAD IT UP WITH WHITE SAUCE. Add in a little hot sauce. You're lucky there is a Halal Guys near you.
I had the Chicken platter. Regular spicy middle eastern food. ...You can actually find it in many smaller eateries in Toronto. A tad pricey too. Wouldn't line up again.
Still can't beat the NYC experience but so glad to have this place in town. Love the chicken platter with lots of white sauce, raw onions and jalapeño peppers. Great halal restaurant
