I normally only post reviews that are good.  However, this was terrible.  I ordered the Gyro combo plate.  Once I got home I noticed that there was no pita bread.  Also, their "white sauce" is nothing more than ranch dressing.  Not the bright lemon cucumber yogurt sauce you would expect.  It didn't come with a red sauce either.  For $10 you are better off going to one of the local restaurants to get authentic greek, lebanese or middle-eastern cuisine.

Heard a lot about Halal Guys, so when I was driving past Christown Mall and saw the sign, I had to stop and give them a try. They are located in the SW corner of the parking lot, across from Target and next to Chase Bank. 

I ordered a gyro and chicken combo. 

The gyro and chicken meat were both good. Nicely seasoned, hot and fresh, without being dried out. The rice was okay. Not exceptionally good or bad. The salad was a little boring. I appreciated the kalamata olives, but some sliced cucumber would make it perfect. I wasn't crazy about the pita bread. It was grilled on the flat top and then sliced, but it seemed a little soggy. I also got some white sauce on the side. I asked the girl working if it's like tzatziki, and she said yeah it was. It's sort of like tzatziki flavored ranch. 

Overall, the food was pretty good. I would go back. But I wouldn't go out of my way for it. For Middle Eastern food, it's nothing special. But the quick service is nice.

I've lived in NJ the past 13 years and during my time at college I'd take the train up to visit NYC and get food at The Halal Guys. From what I remember the food was good for its price at the time. When I heard it was coming to Vegas I went on opening day.

Result: The food was not as I had remembered it. Back then it used to be around $5 a plate which made it a bargain. Also, the food is very bland and compared to the other Greek/Mediterranean places at 9 dollars a plate it's not worth it anymore. The sauce is what makes the food but I'd rather not have to lather up my food with that. (considering extra sauce was $1.00 extra)

One big noticeable difference is in NYC you can stand in line for 15-20 minutes but you don't have to worry about parking just finding a sidewalk to sit on. Whereas at this location you have to drive to this spot and here you have to compete with the Asian stores nearby or sit in your car until a space opens up. Therefore, I'd rather drive to a better Greek/Mediterranean place and pay the same amount elsewhere.

Thanks to Yelp for the invitations! i went yesterday friday afternoon in their grand opening, since i was in the area & starving! So i ordered the combo plate with Beef Gyro & chicken both were tender & flavorful! You will get a lot for $9.99. Put some white sauce & a bit of their super spicy hot sauce (caution) and its party in my mouth! :) The place is quite small & at the hidden corner of Spring mountain near starbucks drive-thru but a great location tho. Definitely a must have complete protein meal when u're in Vegas :)

I'd actually give it a 3.5 but I'll round up... the costumer service is really good and the staff is nice and helpful. The place is decorated nicely as well. As well as the food goes... I have definitely had better gyros and shawarmas around the area. The food is okay, nothing too special. I really wish the sauce was better since for me that makes or breaks the wraps and I find it really lacks flavor.  I will be back here though  just because there are not lots of Halal places near ASU.

I wouldnt even call this Mediterranean food. Your choices are lettuce, tomato, rice, chicken, falafel, gyro and sauces. That is it. Nothing else. They marketed the crap out of this plave online and I was thoroughly disappointed. 

There is one thing I pat them on the back for, and that is their hot sauce. They are not joking when they say it is hot. Got one tiny squirt on my food and I couldnt even finish. Neither could my companion. In fact I made him stop at the nearest gas station so I could buy a bottle of chocolate milk to make the pain go away. 

Completely regret going here but their sauce is nuts. Burns coming out too. If spice is your thing they are worth checking out for the hot sauce. Too bad they don't have anything palatable for you to put it on.

My boyfriend and I came here 15 minutes before they close and Tiara was very friendly and welcoming! She went an extra mile to make our visit worth it! 

Shout out to Tiara! Thank you for providing us a great customer service experience!!!!

3.5 stars! My husband got two combo platters and a chicken shawarma for take out the other week since we were curious about whether the hype was well deserved. 

First, the combo platter (mix of beef and chicken) was a great portion - good for two moderately hungry people. It also still managed to look great by the time he brought it home a bit over an hour later. It definitely tastes different from regular shawarma places but that's not a bad thing. I liked that this version of "chicken/beef on the rocks" included a mix of beef and chicken, as well as veggies along with the usual garlic and hot sauces. The veggies (lettuce and tomatoes) balanced the spice level of the hot sauce (that small amount packs a lot of heat!) and it's tasty when everything is mixed together. The downside is that it's around $14 with tax for this platter.

The chicken shawarma was just okay. It probably would have tasted better to me if I hadn't tried the combo platter first. It just didn't seem to have as much flavour as the combo platter and the portion was enough for me but definitely wouldn't be enough for someone who's super hungry and eats a lot more. There are better chicken shawarmas out there so I wouldn't recommended getting that from here - you're better off with the platter even though it costs a bit more. 

Overall, this place was worth trying! I would return again sometime in the future if in the area but likely just for the combo platter.
I ate here and was sick within 20 minutes of leaving. Had to miss work, and almost crashed my car trying to get out of traffic due to the fact I got sick while driving.

I, like probably many others, was really excited to try out this place. But oh boy what was I disappointed. I had read all the great reviews about this place and was expecting the food to taste like I had tasted it in some countries around the Mediterranean Sea. It was like one reviewer described very BLAND. Nothing worth to make the trip back to this place. There are several places in Tempe that have the same kind of food which come closer to the taste profile of how this kind of food should taste. 

However two positive things that are an important part of the whole dining experience is the level of customer service and the cleanliness of the place. This place excelled in both. That's why I gave them 2 stars. Unfortunately the food makes up the greatest part of giving them 3 less stars than what they could have gotten......

In my travels I've eaten Mediterranean food frequently from all over. Eating from this restaurant left me feeling dissatisfied with the food quality. The service was good and the restaurant was clean. The food however was unsavory and lacked flavor. They do not carry tzatzki sauce because they tout an "American Style" of halals. I would not recommend this restaurant because it's less than mediocre.

A bit overhyped, but i guess it still looks like halal guys. Hands down, the NYC food truck is tons better. Perhaps its because I went right when it first opened so things were not really in tip top order yet but not sure if things are fixed yet. The restaurant itself is nice and spacious so its quite comfortable to dine in if you're not too busy. Parking is steep though so make sure you take public transit!

Went here first time today. Arrived 11:30am. Only two people in front of me. Zero diners seated. I ordered a regular sized combo plate for here. Clueless employees could not figure out how to finish prior person's transaction on cash register. 3 employees & nobody bothered caring several food orders were sitting getting cold, including mine. At 11:48am I walked out & let them keep my cold meal still sitting on their side. TRAIN YOUR EMPLOYEES & MANAGEMENT PLEASE, Or you won't be in business long.

Trying this restaurant for the first time. 
The halal chicken is imported from Minnesota.
The halal gyro beaf is imported from New York.
This chicken sandwich is delicious.
Always put the white secret sauce in your meal.

The staff are really nice and they do a great job.
Worth trying. Worth every penny.

The place was pretty good! I had gyro a couple of times from gyro time in baker. And the place was way better. I had the combo plate., hummus, and the baklava. Everything was great the prices aren't bad. Worth the wait!

Menu is basic and easy - you go down the line as they put together a bowl . It's a ver healthy portion , like the size of a pie . White sauce is delicious as well as the bowl . You must love hot hot hot sauce to have it slathered on the bowl . If you're not sure ask for it on the side - it is hot ! Also ordered the hummus ..delicious ! 

They are a few tables inside and out . When I went it was constantly packed . It's open late too for those late night munchies . I'd definitely be back ! 

Staff was very nice and willing to explain the bowl,etc. if you are unfamiliar with this type of food .
Super yummy fresh food, employees were very friendly! Love that they stay open so darn late!!! Hot sauce is damn HOT tho!

We decided to try this place after seeing so many good reviews and plus it's right next starbucks. I got the combo platter which comes with chicken, Gyro, red rice,salad and Naan. The meats were juicy however the rice was sort of dry. Only reason why I'm givin9 g them 4 stars is because when we went we spent almost our lunch break waiting for food and didnt have tine to eat. There was only 3 people working and the inside was pretty packed. Tables were dirty since nobody had time to clean. Would go again, probably not during lunch though.

Having been a frequent customer of the truck on 6th Avenue in NYC, I was so excited to see a local Halal Guys here in AZ!  It took me quite a while to finally get there.  I was very happy with my to go containers.   Very tasty, very good, I will go back.  However, there is such a huge distinction between the food truck, which is so much better than the storefront.  I think the food truck is better because the food is served directly off the flat top grill.  At the store, apparently, the food is cooked and then served out of warming trays.  That makes it lose texture a bit, as well as temperature.  But I'm still a happy customer.  Thank you Halal Guys!
combo platter very good. first fine eating and very impressed. would definitely come back again for the amazing chicken and beef

Im debating between 2 or 3 stars. But since the place provides a great customer service, which is one of the essentials for a customer to come back, I will do 3. Thats one positive thing. Another thing to consider is the good flavor/taste of the chicken and beef gyro. The white sauce compliments it, big time. The platter was good too.

Now, comes the Hummus, the Baklava, the Fries. I get it, not the main menu entry but I don't get how you can make Hummus so simple and bland. The Fries was even the same. Simple and bland. The Baklava - the only dessert they have yet tasted like it was old. I can get a better baklava at a middle eastern store. Dont waste your money buying one! Unless they improve it. As you can see, few other yelpers said the same thing about baklava.

UPDATED:

Wow! I thought there would be an improvement after seeing reviews of how bland, tasting like cardboard and old the BAKLAVA is! But no, its the same piece. Such a waste of my money! I gave it another try thinking my review and other customers would change a thing but this place can care less.
Just like home in NYC. So happy they're here in Vegas! Super friendly staff and the food was awesome as expected.
Perfection topped with loads of white sauce.

I love this place. I order delivery from them all the time. However, they are so SKIMPY. 

If you want extra hot sauce. Don't bother. Even if you pay the $.49 for the extra hot sauce. You only get one per order.  It is the one thing that constantly annoys me about this place

Other than that. The portions are good and the meat is extremely flavorful one platter can last me two meals.

Happy Eating!

Had a food poisoning after eating their stuff, we were working late in the office and ordered 3 platters from foodora, we all experienced different level of food poisoning reaction later that night and the next day. Avoid this restaurant. :x :x :x

Probably one of the better food choices inside Caesar's Palace. The service was really fast despite a line of about 10 people. (Next door Smash Burger customers seemed to be waiting for a while.) All the food is pre-prepared and assembled in front of the customer. The plate was very large and definitely worth the extra cost. I requested a bunch of sauces on my plate and they were included in the price. Friendly service.

So disappointed. I see people hype Halal guys on Facebook. I decided to try. The menu offers like 2 or 3 choices and that's it's. Food had no special unique taste. I prolly could have gone to any gyros place and get same or better. I was not happy with my food. Left me wondering why I ate this. Don't buy into the hype.

I was super excited to hear about this place opening up finally in AZ. After going there tho I changed my mind real quick. The rice was flavorless, the falafel was hard and dry, the salad was just lettuce and tomato and the only thing they had was hot sauce and a mayo sauce which barley had any flavor. I was super disappointed. If you want good Mediterranean check out Princess Market...
Reminded me the first time I ate Halal Guy at the street of New York. It is a shame that they don't offer lamb gyro anymore but the beef is still pretty good. Will be back for sure.

Oh, dear. I'm afraid I don't have much good to say here. Well, I'll preface my review with this: a few days ago I had the opportunity to sample some of the food, given that employees were going around with small meals to let people try what they had. I liked what I tasted. It was a small platter with chicken and gyro over a bed of rice and a side of salad. It wasn't the best I'd ever tasted, but it was good. I planned to go there when I wanted something quick and reasonably priced. 

Today I tried their sandwich (by the way, why call it a sandwich when really "pita" better describes it?) with a side of fries. I was excited because it looked good, and heavens, was I let down. The meat was a bit crunchy and chewy and there was something wrong with the seasoning. Too much salt? Too oily? Both, maybe? I'm sorry I can't exactly put my finger on it, but I just couldn't finish it. Usually I'll still eat the pita bread if I can't eat the meat, but it was covered in oil and I couldn't even finish that! Sadly the word that comes to mind when thinking of the gyro sandwich is "gross," I'm sorry to say. The fries were far too salty. Period. I got a third of the way through them, had to give up, then downed a full bottle of water after to dilute the saltiness. I've got a big appetite and was still hungry, but I just did not want to touch anything else. Then I started feeling nauseous. BAD. Nausea's never a good feeling, but when you're about to start a shift at work like I was, that's particularly worrisome. Thankfully I didn't throw up, but I was damn close. I'm not sure if I'll be able to eat a full dinner tonight since my stomach is now quite mad with what I just put into it. I mean, hell, the only other fast food restaurant that can make me that sick is Taco Bell! 

The service was quite good, though, hence the two stars instead of one. People were very accommodating, friendly, and helpful. One could tell that they hadn't worked out a sort of teamwork groove, as there was some confusion about where some orders of fries were going, but that's to be expected in a new place, and they tried their best to make sure they got it right in the end. It's a shame the food did not match their level of service. I will not be stepping foot inside this place again. Sorry, guys!

Service 4* Food 3.5* Ambiance 4*
Waited 20 minutes to find out about all the rage about THG. Overall, service was good all things considered. Ordered chicken & beef sandwiches and the beef/chicken platter. Everything's fresh it was pretty good, but not worth the hype. 
Hot sauce is extremely hot. White sauce is good but gets to be too much. Clean dine in area. 
It's worth going to if convenient or in the city. 
Best sandwich place -  Pita and Grill on Derry/Hurontario. It's a 4 because I think there's better places then this.

I was so hyped about this for months before it opened and it def lived up to my expectations. Been quite a few (a lot of) times since the opening and the food is incredibly amazing. What it lacks in variety, it makes up for in taste. This is definitely the new go-to shawarma place for me. However, the price is a bit more than other places. I recommend the sandwich over the plate cuz in my opinion, the plates are quite small and not worth the price difference from the sandwich!

Disclosure: never went to the original Halal Guys in NYC so idk how it compares to that, but it is amazing all the same.

This place had So much hype upon opening and I was pretty excited because I love Mediterranean food. I'm actually pretty bummed to say this but I was not impressed in the least bit. I did order from UberEATS which came within 20 minutes of ordering and the food was still warm so that wasn't the issue. The issue was the food had zero flavor. I ordered a regular combo platter and half the platter was lettuce....... the rice was undercooked, still hard and had no flavor. The portion of chicken and beef was really small so I was left with undercooked rice and an ton of lettuce. The best part of the meal was the white sauce which was what made this meal edible. However I will warn you the hot sauce is HOT. I'm someone who eats hot sauce on everything and this sauce Is almost unbearable, good but really spicy! Sadly The Halal guys did not live up to my expectations and was seriously overpriced for what your given. I'm willing to try them again and hoping it was a fluke night but damn I'm disappointed!

This is definitely real deal middle eastern type food on the quickness. The portions are more than enough to satisfy your hunger, even the small is pretty damn big. The combo, is the best bet to try just about everything they have.. and the sauces are superb. I especially enjoyed the white sauce, the hot was hotter than expected and should be used in moderation. All employees were on point and helped us out alot with our questions being it our first time here. 2 thumbs up and I'm glad these are popping up more and more.

Halal Guys was decent. This chain sells basically fast food Middle Eastern dishes. The menu is limited to chicken, gyro and falafel as your base to go in either sandwich or platter form. 

I went with the small size falafel platter. Half of it was filled with iceberg lettuce salad, and the other half was filled with seasoned rice. 4 small falafel pieces were placed on top along with a few pieces of pita triangle. You have your choice of add ins (I added onion, jalapeno, and olive) and you will also have your choice of white, hot, or BBQ sauce. I went with white and hot sauce. 

Overall, I wasn't too impressed. For $8 I would have liked something additional to go with the pita triangles, such as a scoop of hummus or baba ganoush. The falafel pieces were pretty small, rock hard on the outside, with a slightly moist filling. The falafel looked mass-produced as if they came from a mold since they had more of a gumdrop rather than spherical shape. For a platter filled only with inexpensive salad+rice with tiny falafel and few pita triangles I think it was definitely overpriced. 

My husband had the gyro sandwich which he said was pretty good. The gyro meat didn't look like your typical thinly sliced meat from a spit. It was more like small chunks of meat, and he said it was well seasoned and tender.

As for the sauces, I liked the white sauce with its mild creamy flavor and the red hot sauce packed quite a punch! 

If I go here again I'll skip on getting the falafel and will probably try one of the sandwiches.

Never tried this type of food before ....was blown away by the flavors.  That white sauce ! We stayed at C 5 nights and ate here 3 times. So good and a good value for Vegas. I saw families share the platter.

I was super excited to try this place out. I got there and not 1 employee could be found it literally took like 8 mins until someone came out. That's alright I'm craving some middle eastern food and I can't wait to scarf this combination plate down (chicken and beef gyro with rice)...And than the let down the food has 0 flavor, the "world famous red and white sauce" which is watery Thani sauce and sarachi are the only flavor to mask the taste of the greasy grill that the chicken has taken on. Save your money, if you have never had middle eastern food this would make you hate it. Stay away. Too bad, perhaps my expectations far exceeded me....the only saving grace was the free baklava I got from yelp when I checked in.....

It was my first time coming here, (the day after Eid how ironic) and oh my it was definitely worth the drive! I came from Ajax. I'm a person that can't handle spice. If you're that type too, even one line killed me. Steam is coming out of my ears as I'm writing this. 5/5 for me!!

The food is really good so I'm sad to write this review. Really like the chicken. I have been here 3 times but this last time wasn't a good experience. They are really stingy now with the portions. $10 for rice and iceberg lettuce and when I asked for a touch more rice, they said no. Huh? I guess the nostalgia of them being newly opened is gone and it's time to cut portions. There wasn't a soul in the place at 7:30pm, u would think they would want to get rid of the huge pan of rice they still had there. Don't know if I'll be back.

The Chicken and Rice did not disappoint! 
The white sauce was so yummy.
I've never been to the halal cart in NYC so thank you for finally having one here in LV!!!!

Hadn't had Halal since my last trip to NYC so I was super excited to find this at Caesars Palace. I was not disappointed! Delicious food--I had the combo platter-- and great service. Take it easy on the hot sauce. I love spicy but totally underestimated it.

I'm from NY and have had it there a million times. So I'm ecstatic that this place finally opened in LV! I was so thrilled I came on grand opening day and the food is amazing still, thank goodness. Must go here as many times as you possibly can lol.
This place is great! I got the combo plate and oh man was it good! The hot sauce is no joke! Use it little by little!

I thought the falafel was excellent. It was light and not too greasy. The toppings were ok--I wish they had more options like Jerusalem pickles. I took issue with the service. I visited with my two children and they split a small chicken platter. They liked it very much but there was a lot of waste. I wish they had a small kids menu. Here's where I took issue: I asked for water for my kids and they gave me open plastic cups. I requested a paper cup like the one I had paid for and gotten for myself. They said no. I explained that my kids (2&3) would spill in the flimsy plastic cup. They still said no. So I gave my kids water and they spilled. The employee was exasperated with us and had a nasty attitude about having to mop it up--um, I tried to be proactive and prevent that exact situation but apparently saving 8 cents on a paper cup is more important. 

This isn't really a family friendly restaurant. Too bad though, the food is decent.

menu is nice and simple.  a few things to keep in mind:

this is not Boustan. it is different from Boustan. if you want Boustan, go there. don't go here and then be mad that it's not Boustan.

when they say the hot sauce is really hot --- believe it!!! 

the plates/assiettes come in two sizes: "small" and "regular."  This is confusing for some people, as it turns out: one guy was angry that he got a "large" when he asked for a "regular."  I found a small to be good for lunch.

1/3  to 1/2 your plate will be salad. this is good! salad is healthy.

I love going here, it's a great reminder of my New York travels, the flavor is very close to what I remember having in New York. The flavors on the beef are amazing, & the service is always amazing and friendly. I eat here at least once every two week & I've never had a bad experience here. I'm not sure where all these mediocre reviews tend to eat their food at but this is certainly worth the drive from my North Scottsdale location.

The combo platter was awesome. Topped it off with red & white sauce. Highly recommend to anyone looking for dank food. Angel was really fast making our plates and super friendly. Top notch service fosho.
If you're craving that NY Halal Guys, this is it. Just as good as the trucks in the city. It's a little greasy and heavy but if that's what you're looking for, it's great!

First time here so I was excited to taste what all the hype was about.  I ordered the combo platter so I can try the chicken and gyro.  It came with lettuce, rice and tomatoes.  Pretty good size meal for $10.  It comes with 2 packets of their white sauce and 1 hot sauce.  I also ordered baklava.. I love sweets!  The gyro meat was tender and flavorful without the white sauce.  Their hot sauce is definitely HOT. The chicken, for the most part was good, but it had dry chunks as well.  After a few bites without the white sauce, I decided to try some of it.  It was pretty good.  Added that "umph" to the meal.  I'd come back again.

I came here because of all the hype that's been going on throughout social media. And unfortunately, I am extremely disappointed. 

MENU:
Meats - chicken, gyro, combo (chicken and gyro), and falafel. 
Small or regular. Platter comes with rice and salad. Choice of onions or jalapeños. 
Sandwich options. 

PRICING:
8.99 for a small, 9.99 for a regular. 
7.99 for sandwiches. 

QUALITY/TASTE:
I ordered a regular combo with chicken, rice, salad, and jalapeño. And there was no flavor to anything. The rice and chicken tastes bland. Yes, I poured the white sauce and hot sauce (which is really spicy, btw) and nothing really helped. Also, the white sauce tasted more like ranch sauce with a million calories. The hummus was also nothing special. I've made better tasting hummus in the kitchen. My friend like the baklava. And the crinkled fries were literally the best tasting thing there because it was made to order and salted. 

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
The employees were nice and helpful. 

Overall, I would not come back here until they learn to season their food correctly.
Good food, pretty average. Didn't knock my socks off. Only thing is that it's very convenient

Ordered the combo platter without rice or salad- gyro and chicken meat only. Both meats are cooked to perfection! Highly recommend the white sauce; would skip the hot sauce, as the flavor stay in your mouth for a long time! The hummus is good- portion big enough to share with at least 2-3 people. I recommend ordering extra pita with the hummus, as they only give one piece. $8.99 for small, $9.99 for large. Sandwiches is also an option. Hummus $4.99. Bottled water expensive $2.49. Good food! Highly recommend!

An average place.  I got the sandwich.   The girl handling my sandwich didn't even know how to wrap it.  Nothing really special that you can't get at other pita places.   Overpriced food and nothing great about it.  Will not be going back.

First time I went had a decent experience.  Good portions and tasted relatively good.  Second time I went they skimped on the meat, gave me hard pita bread.   

No consistency with these guys

I'm a big fan of Gyros, Hummus...etc.
I'm a bit disappointed with the halal guys, 
I ordered the small combo ...
My entire combo consisted of salad and rice and maybe I would say a fourth a cup or less of the meat on top of the rice and it was very small pieces and bits. I also ordered tahini on the side didn't taste like tahini.  
The salad was fresh tasted good. 
The rice ..hard and tasteless , didn't eat it.

Overpriced, low-quality food, not-knowing anything staff

The food is not authentic at all! The food doesn't look fresh either or clean.

You can get more tasteful food even from McDonald's steps away.


This place won't last.

Never had halal guys in NYC, so going in with no expectations. There was a 20 minute line but wasn't too bad. Food was good, mainly from the sauces. Meats were just about like every other place, nothing too special. The white sauce was very creamy, nothing like other shawarma places I've been to. Overall good experience.

The first time we came here was when they first opened. We loved it! (Especially their white sauce) but today, it was a little different. Idk if it's because it's not as busy anymore but their meat doesn't taste as fresh. As I was biting into a few bites, I would encounter a very dry hard piece. The flavor is still there though so I still finished my small platter. 
I'm totally down to give it another try (3rd time's the charm).

Its great that they're open late but their gyro tastes mostly of bread crumbs with hardly amy flavor, their 'white sauce' really needs to taste more like tzatziki than mayonnaise, their rice is okay(can't mess rice up...), something I did like was their hot sauce. Great flavor BUT stupid spicy. Proceed with caution on the hot sauce... And their food in general. 

They also have bbq sauce... Wutthef@kchuck... Not exactly traditional. Their condiment choices are white sauce... Bbq sauce... And hot sauce.

Even when I ate here drunk, their food is seriously sub-par. Save yourself the trip is your looking for middle eastern/Mediterranean cuisine.

@Halal Guys - Averrose N

I have just picked up 3 platter last week and i was charged for additional pouches of white souse. So, if giving 2 free pouch per platter is recently implemented policy within a week than i am happy.

You have not addressed the quality of the chopping of chicken. They are way larger pieces so I would highly recommend that if you can improvise in that direction as well. I also felt that Toronto location has recently started to GRILL the chicken pieces, it certainly add the flavor but large pieces ruin the taste. 

I Love Halal guys more than anything and i definitely would like you to be more successful , hence suggested my opinions. Please know that i am not UNHAPPY CUSTOMER who writes bad review , i am HAPPY CUSTOMER who would like to be MORE HAPPY If you can meet the expectation. 

Thanks,

After a long day of travel the last thing I wanted to do was find something to eat. After purusing Uber Eats I came across Halal Guys and was looking forward to trying ever since I saw them on Munchies. I ordered the Chicken and Combo plates. The rice and chicken were definitely different than any halal plate I've had plus the white sauce helped kick some of the dryness. I'd steer away from having pita in the to go containers as they were very soggy by the time it was delivered. It just so happened that I ordered a side and they were very warm and delicious.

I usually love to eat at halal guys because the food is good and the service is quick. However, tonight's service was just not on point. It took us over 30 minutes to order and the line look unorganized and chaotic. Will I come back next time? It depends on how bad of a craving I have.

Update: right after I finished my post, we were compensated for the long wait. We received free drinks and extra items.

I have been to Halal Guys twice. I did nit review it the first time because I wanted to try more than one dish. I tried the beef bowl first. It was okay. 

They are not reluctant to pile on the food, but overall it was rather bland. They lost a star for the quality and flavor of the beef bowl. The rice was average. The white sauce was nothing yo rave about. 

The second time I went, I tried the Gyros. Again, the meat was bland. They put their white sauce on it instead of Tatziki sauce. That is not acceptable. They piled on the lettuce, very little tomato , onion, or cucumber. They lost a star for a second poor dish. 

Finally, the restaurant itself has very limited seating, the sauces are left out, exposed, and the tables are dirty. They lost s star for that. 

I will not be going back nor will I recommend it to anyone else. The food is just not quality.

My only other comparison is to the location in Long Beach, however, I actually think the food here was better. The portions seemed a little less than the one in LGB but they hook it up with two white sauce and let me tell you... the hot sauce is HOT - just a couple drops was good for me. I highly recommend a chicken or combo plate! The baklava here is also hella bomb. We got this postmated so we I have no idea how the service is but we placed the order at like 5pm and it didn't leave the restaurant til 6:30 so I am assuming they were a little slow. Other than that, portions are cool even though it's less than LGB and the rice was bomb. I'll definitely be back again when I need my Halal guys fix.
The bowl is tasty but the sauce is so amazing and unhealthy. Don't eat the hot sauce if you're not into spicy food.

I don't understand the low reviews and hate. Halal guys is delicious and my numbed one guilty pleasure food. Everything is fresh, tasty, and the portions are huge! Also, I'm always pleasantly surprised with how nice and friendly the staff is... and always accommodate requests for more if that spectacular white sauce. I'm actually writing this review while eating halal guys because I love it so much.

Couldn't  wait for them to open. What a disappointment. Unbelievably small menu. Ordered a gyro. The gyro meat was cut up like I had not seen before, the pita bread broke the minute it was folded, the white sauce they use is not like tzaziki sauce you've had before-it's this artificial al oily, ranch glop that was horrible. I can name 10 authentic places for middle eastern food that beat this bland menu on every front.

Great food. Almost tastes identical to their street cart in NYC. Definitely the best shawarma in Las Vegas. Service was excellent, weekend day staff was very friendly and the restaurant was clean. I will definitely come back.

This was my first time trying Halal guys. I wanted something different and this place seemed hyped up by friends. 

We wanted to eat inside but since their a/c was broke we took it to go. My boyfriend & I both ordered a combo plate with chicken and beef gyro. I ordered 2 falafels on the side. 

The chicken was sort of dry and tasteless. The beef was really good. I loved the rice and veggies on the side. And the pita bread wasn't dry at all. The falafel had a good taste but it was definitely dry inside and probably needed some sauce. 

Speaking of sauce, the white sauce is a must !!! And if you like spicy, I recommend adding a couple drops of the red sauce. I loved the kick that it gave to my meal even though my mouth was burning at the end. 

Overall, the food was good but wasn't anything special or too particular. Would go back if I crave that food.

This place was nothing special.  The hype has already died down and there is no need to worry about waiting in a line.  Don't get me wrong, the food is good but its nothing special.  I won't be begging to come back but if a group of friends want to go I won't resist.

Halal Guys has a reward program that I laughed at when I read the details, you need to get 50 sandwiches to get one free.  Ummm whats the point?  Also the employees don't seem humble when they are working, management will need to figure something out to keep them afloat when they lose the new restaurant traffic.      

Return factor 50%
Nothing authentic middle eastern food. Falafal was rock hard and found a hair in my platter

I haven't tried the original in NY and after my visit to this location, I hope its a lot better than what we got in Toronto. 
I went for the combo platter since its their most popular dish. Waiting in line gives you a good view of their cooking process and I have to say, it wasn't the most appetizing thing to look at, with all the oil accumulating below and splashing around the flat top. Their logo is a turning spit but it appears the chicken and gyro are cooked using a different method (?). They were devoid of any flavour from spices or even grilling with the gyro tasting meat-like but with fillers and additives. 
The rice was fluorescent orange but had even less flavour than the meat. The platter comes with a side of "salad" - meaning just iceberg lettuce and a few pieces of tomato. The white sauce they squeeze onto the top tasted watered down but added the most flavour to the meal. I've heard the red sauce is insanely spicy and only asked for a little bit but actually wished for more while I was eating since everything was so bland. 
Portions are definitely small and you don't get what you pay for at all. There are so many better options just down the street charging way less where you can grab something in a fraction of the time you'll spend in line here.

The gyro and chicken combo platter we ordered was good. Portion size is good.

Staffs Jasmine and another girl are genuinely friendly. They pay attention to what you need or want. She asked if we're locals so I can get a discount. Appreciate that.

I'm sorry but this place is no where near middle eastern type food. I'm not trying to be mean but the so called sauce they use for the gyros is freakin mayo! Disgusting! It actually gave me a stomachache and made my boyfriends stomach a bit achy too. The meat beef gyro is ok and rice is so so. I honestly wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. I guess After having the authentic stuff back home in San Diego and the real stuff cooked for me by my boyfriend.. I guess I just have a spoiled pallet. I really was hoping it was good. Although the falafel was pretty good and so was the sauce it came with.So my two stars are for that. I really recommend you guys change that Mayo sauce, that's a heart attack waiting to happen. Very unhealthy:-/

As for the staff they were really helpful and friendly. But yeah it's not worth the money or my health. I'll be sticking to Niros. They are amazing!

I really wanted to like this place, especially after hearing such good reviews from it's NY location. The staff here is very friendly and the portion size is pretty good. Food wise, I was expecting more but it tasted pretty average to me (even with their white sauce).

I have had many regrets in life- not saying 'I'm sorry' to my loved ones, not talking to my first love after we broke up in 8th grade, the major I chose in college, moving out of WA state later in my 30's...but the worst regret I have is going to this restaurant. I will never go back to this restaurant chain EVER again. I was hurt after eating here. I've been to MANY Middle Eastern/Mediterranean/Greek restaurants and this restaurant chain is at the bottom of my list... at least I can say I TRIED this place (even a small sprig of cilantro on top of my platter would have given my review two more stars).

Service was great, very friendly staff. Food was mediocre, didn't meet expectations. Their famous white sauce wasn't all that special. Portions weren't large for the price. The beef was too salty and the chicken tasted like it was boiled instead of grilled. The pita part of the sandwich isn't toasted (for those who like it crunchy).
Similar to other reviews, the gyro was a bit mushy, the hot sauce was very hot, and the white sauce although tasty was kind of just smothered everywhere.

I've been here a couple times & always have gotten it delivered.  The service was really friendly but it is loud in there, so they have to talk extra loud to get/hear your order.  I've tried the combo with chicken & gyro but I usually just get the chicken platter.  The chicken isn't dry & it's flavored well.  I'm the platter comes lettuce, tomatoes, rice & meat.  They also give you their white sauce and hot sauce.

Now, their white sauce is really good, it brings the platter together.  But their hot sauce is some next level spicy.  It's not like a Tabasco hot, it's like a Siracha hot x 10.  I literally take it put a little on a napkin put the smallest amount on the tip of my fork with each bite. Serious props to those who put it directly in their food!

Not sure what all the hype is about but when I came here to try some Mediterranean food. It wasn't really mind blowing to me. 

It seemed really basic with only a few items to choose from. I ordered a small combo which came with rice, vegetables, chicken and beef. For a dollar more you could get your money's worth for a bigger plate but I wasn't really hungry for that.

There was a few sauces you could put on your plate which be careful, the hot sauce is really hot and i also added the white sauce to blend the hot sauce to make my meal mild.

There was not really that many tables to sit and eat. The workers there was genuinely helpful and it did not take long to get our food. 

I wanna mention though there was a lady that was cleaning the table was very friendly and gave great customer service. When we was in line, she gave some recommendations and every time someone left the table she cleaned it up immediately and after we were done eating she asked how our experience was. 

Food was okay but the customer service was great.

First time we went here the line to get in was too long, so we decided to go back a week later. I don't know why people were going crazy about it. 

We had our food to go since there was only a few tables and it was full. 

The food was mediocre. For me it was too salty. I've had much better Mediterranean food in Vegas. The white sauce was like ranch dressing, but not as creamy. It was good though. 

Just a heads up the spicy sauce is spicy HOT!!! My husband and I can eat spicy, but I gave up. My husband ate his entire plate but he said the top of his had was itchy. I don't know what that meant but I know he can eat spicy. 

Service was very good, staff was very helpful and friendly.

3.5 stars rounding up to 4.  While I've never been to the NY version, this one did the job on a Saturday afternoon.  I got the combo with no tomatoes, and was pleasantly surprised with the flavor of the rice and the meat.  At first glance the chicken looks boiled and kind of grey, but upon tasting it, was surprised by how flavorful it was.  The hot sauce tastes kind of generic, but the white sauce was delicious, being that I am a fan of any and all yogurt type sauces.  

The shop was clean and the sauces were in bottles on the side for your application convenience.

Clean and employee nice. The platter is a waste of money. Half of the tin is salad the other Mexican style rice. Then you get a couple spoons of what seemed to be processed Sysco cheap beef on top. No Lamb at all!? They had no onion, how can you have Gyro anything without onion? When he told me that there was no onion I said ok I need to wash my hands I'll be back. I thought that they needed to cut some onion but when I got the food there was no onion. Sauce in packets are basically poison, it has soy, high in sodium and other chemicals which I assume their entire menu does. Hot Sauce is no joke, like Thai food make your head sweat hot goodness. $2.69 for their 16oz soda? They need to check their food quality and prices.

This is absolutely the best halal restaurant in town. Gyro Time,  held the standard for their gyros, but the location has always been an issue.  Along with the question - "is it halal?" In spite of the lack of lamb, the gyros at Halal Guys is fresh, tasty and huge.  The abundance of white sauce is the reason to dine on location.  I've noticed the number of take-out orders going out the door doing my visits, a sign that this must be a place to be. The food staff is extremely friendly and cheerful. Too bad they aren't allowed tips. I think that I'm going to make them all some cookies for the holidays.  The Women's bathroom is clean and spacious.  Enough room for my dog's stroller and my wide end. The dining area is another issue, obviously most people don't know how to eat gyros. Especially,  the crowd that comes in from the competition,  they are slobs. I hope no one else is in the store when they come in, it's a nasty scene.  No shade on Halal Guys or staff.

I've eaten here a few times now. The first time was really good but every time since then I got sick. Managers are oblivious to customer complaints. I got a combo meal with 2 big bones in them (the size of quarters) when I paid $27.00 for 2 combo plates and 2 small drinks. Nobody answers the phone, and you can't leave a message. 

I can't believe this place was allowed to open without AC in July and August in Vegas! Now they have signs up saying they will replace AC units next week! Signs have been up longer than that! Employees are not getting breaks and I heard a manager - Rene screaming at employees! I saw 4 quit at once. Not cool! Get it together! Employees are friendly despite the hostile, HOT work environment. Customers pay attention to how you treat your employees! This is why I refuse to shop at Walmart. 

I don't like the china town location either. Hot and too small so getting food to go is the only logical option. I have to agree with Rachel F.'s review. 

Maybe I'll try again in the future but there are so many other places I will go first that have AC!
Whether in Cali or Nevada, Halal Guys is the way to go. Here in Nevada, they let you squirt all those sauces yourself to your heart content!

I loved it and I feel addicted.  This is not the typical white sauce from the usual Mediterranean places, so it is a different taste than what you may expect.  However, it is delicious.  I prefer to dine in so I can have as much as I want.  

Heed the other reviews, that tell you the HOT SAUCE is HOT..  Did I say HOT..  One little tiny dab is deadly.  

Somebody please take me back to Halal Guys today and everyday. 

Don't forget the Yelp check in for the free Baklava

Come here sorta often, probably too often, but I just can't seem to get enough of this place.  I have only ever had the gyro platter, or the combo chicken and gyro platter and they are STRAIGHT UP AWESOME!  I think they put a chemical in their hot sauce cause I can't seem to get enough of that either.  BTW, their hot sauce is no joke, it will hurt you if you're not careful. 

Reason for 4 stars and not 5 is based on two reasons. The first and most important is that I drove 50 miles from home round trip to come here for takeout so my wife could try it, and once I got home and started eating, I found a big nasty gross pubic hair in my chow. I showed my wife and she confirmed this is what it was. It did put a bad taste in my mouth for awhile, and I don't think she'll ever come back. The second reason is because for there itty-bitty ketchup-sized sauce packets are like $0.61.

Overall one of my favorite places, even though it's a bit expensive.

Finaly made it but really was not satisfied, maybe my expectations were too high ? Maybe if I expected the same food as @ Halal Guys in NYC then i truly was not at the right location .. Having visited the location on a friday night the meat and chicken was just rewarmed and very dry .. Tooo much rice compared to the amount of protein, i was just left eating rice and hot sauce at the end :(! Would i go back ? For sure in NYC :)! But glad i went myself to try it out

I ordered the combo plate with gyro and chicken, I've never had Halal guys before and didn't know what to expect but the flavors were on point. Both chicken and gyro were juicy. The white sauce that goes on top, compliments the veggies and rice. I even like the burn-your-face-off-level hot sauce. 

Didn't have to wait in line since I came on a slow day, overall it's a decent place to grab a quick bite.

Phenomenal food every single time! The hot sauce is seriously nothing to mess around with and it's rather addictive. Absolutely love this place. Regardless of the location you go to you get fast and friendly service. And the food is consistently excellent.
Great portion of food and amazing quality! The chicken platter is the way to go. Decent food for the price. I could eat this everyday
Idk why it has 3.5 stars, this place satisfies man. Been a fan of the halal guys since I tried it in NYC back in 2012

This is one of those looks better than it is restaurants... made me sick. it could have been that it was hotter inside the restaurant than it was outside.. and so eating hot food.. plus the hot sauce that is doesn't taste Mediterranean at all.. its just hot! and I like spicy but I've had Habanero sauces that aren't as hot as this sauce.. the tiny water cups didnt help either.. its like 4 ounces.. luckily the only food that was even a little hot was the rice.. the pita bread was cold.. falafels were cold.. wasn't worth 10 bucks.. not even close.. I am so sad i spent 10 bucks on this food.. although I'm not hungry, my craving for good food is still there... so..

also be advised seating is almost non existent.. if you have a party with more than 4 people you will have to get it to go.. there was only 12 or so customers and some of them were wating for a spot to open up. if you just have to eat here i suggest you call in an order and get it to go... if you want far superior mediterranean food i would suggest you go to Philly Steak Express on Fort Apache.. they make the food fresh there.. Halal guys make it before hand and it sits... and gets cold... won't be going back.
This is one of my fast food places to go. Quality and taste is absolutely perfect. Everything is flavorful plus the staff is fast and friendly. I am never dissapointed.

We've only ever ordered through Uber eats, and the delivery package is always garbage.  They forget sauces and don't close lids properly. Which is unfortunate because the food is to die for! 
 I wouldn't say the takeout part is ubers fault mainly because the establishment wraps everything up for them prior to pick up. I find they just aren't careful. See picture. 

This little resto is based off the NYC food truck, which is one of my favorites when I visit. That being said I was so excited when they opened a location in Montreal and it's just as good! 

I haven't been to the restaurant yet but my boyfriend and I order delivery from there far to often. 

If you like spicy food, you need to try one of their mixed plates! SOOO GOOD! 

Will attach pictures on next order!

Just had my first halal guys experience. Meh. Not sure what the hype is all about. Mzaar down the street is way better in my opinion. Or ghazale, or many other shawarma type places all over the city. When I first heard halal guys was opening here, I had doubts, since we already have awesome shawarma and greek joints here. My intuition was right. Just goes to show how good our ethnic food in Toronto is, compared to most cities. Maybe the NY original is better than this one, but whatever.

Service was basic but employees were nice. Very simple menu and decor to match it's food cart roots Layout similar to a Quiznos. Food was nothing thrilling though, I've had much better gyros for better prices. The food was cold and the meat was cut up in small pieces instead of strips as typical which made it more difficult to eat. I won't go there again, spent $35 on two gyros and some rice with beef and a side of baba ganoush and it just wasn't even close to worth it. Baba ganoush was inedible, took one bite and had to spit it out.
This place is really good if you love mediterranean food. The service here is also amazing!!!

What was the most memorable part of this expedition to Halal Guys? Actually it was their hot sauce! Somehow they made it actually kind of hot! I was thankful for that. 

Pricing is a bit more than I would have liked it to be. It's $8 plus tax for any of the entrées. There are some solid toppings to add as well: onions, olives, bellpeppers, jalapeños, lettuce, tomato--all making a full spread that can combo off of each other in some way (minus the onions because I feel they overpower the others). I didn't go with any of the regular sauce as I wanted to really sample the gyro and chicken meat as I got a combination in what they strangely call a sandwich. Clearly going for a more deep-pocketed demographic, promoting taste before volume in a competitive market.

Overall: service was solid; portions were small; hot sauce was wonderful; inside was clean--overpriced by $2 for the portion size.  

*I'd go back to try a few other items on their menu .*

Been here a few times after since my first visit. . 
Last time I came the rice tasted old.  Texture was off.  I asked for white sauce and the girl working covered the whole bowl with sauce. I had to tell her to stop because it was just too much!  
Also,  I've been getting it without the salad because its just cheap filler.

I had leftovers from my last visit which I never got around to eating because I was grossed out by the old rice and the sauciness. 

I think next time I'll go to chickpeas..They have better quality meat,  rice and salad and the portions are double for the price.
Very good chicken, but the meat was alright! Very small menu but overall good chicken.

Location was in a unit complex just outside a Walmart on the corner of a major intersection just south of the 60 at Stapley. There's a lot of other restaurants and shopping around the area, which makes it a convenient stop. 

It was more chain restaurant than I initially though. I thought it would be more independent or authentic but felt it had a "Five Guys" meets Middle eastern food. 

Inside, the menu is pretty straight forward. It's either chicken, gyro, or falafel in a Pita or a bowl with toppings and sauce. I got a bowl with half gyro and half chicken. The bowl comes with rice, lettuce, tomatoe, and a few pita slices. I added the onion and olive with EXTRA white sauce. 

The food was pretty good! It wasn't dry and I thought the portions were a good size. I enjoyed it a bit more after I mixed everything together and enjoyed it that way versus separately. I think having it in a pita would have been the best choice (although you get more in a bowl) maybe adding a whole pita to the side instead of the pita slices. 

Overall, I enjoyed the food. I wouldn't be begging to go back everyday but it was a good, different stop and I would return again!

There's only so much rice and chicken that I can actually eat, until I get sick of it. 

I was super excited about going to Halal Guys! I've heard about this chain based off in New York and how people were raving about how good the chicken and rice combo is. When I got there, it was clean and kinda set up like a fusion between Chipotle and Five Guys. 

I got the Large chicken and gyro combo and they definitely give you pretty reasonable portions here! You are able to choose some additional condiments to add to your rice plate, as well as if you want to add a sauce to it. Of course they recommended to add the white sauce, which is a fusion between a plain yogurt and ranch dressing. 

The plate I got was good. There wasn't anything to "rave" about when it came to their chicken though. You can seriously get some more flavorful chicken at places like let's say Panda Express of Yogi Grill. The basmati rice was good, however by itself is a little bland. That's what the sauce is for. 

Overall, I'm most likely not gonna come back here for awhile. Service was excellent, however the kind of Mediterranean/Greek influenced style food was alright. I feel I can get better tastes of gyros and stuff at actual Greek restaurants etc. But then again, maybe I just don't crave this kind of food!

Tips
1) Dont get too much of that red hot sauce!!!! It's super spicy! You will suffer if you put too much on your rice
2) get a normal rice plate, should definitely be enough to fill you up

Someday when I'm taken as a war criminal in Greece for daring to love the daughter of a Spanish Lord, before they line me up against the wall to face the firing squad I will make but one request.... a regular combo platter with no rice, loaded with white and red sauce. Come to think of it I think that was the plot of the movie Our Fault in the Stars. Either way, if this was my last meal on earth I would be just fine with whatever. i cant recommend this place to anyone enough. Avoid around noon.

I guess if I were to get this food from a truck on a street in New York I'd rave about it (either that or New Yorkers are easily impressed - which may be the case.  They do like the Jets).  But the food I had was at best OK. Limited menu (reflecting their food truck roots).  The set up is similar to Chipotle (but without the food poisoning ;)).  Very limited seating, but the counter seats have several outlets for charging phones and tablets (that's a nice feature).  Parking is kind of tight, but that's nothing new in any of the shopping centers on Spring Mountain.  

Would I go back?  Only if a friend wanted to try it.  Would I recommend it?  Sure, it's not bad, just not great.

The Halal Guys came to Montreal! Of course, this was a big deal and I had to try it ASAP. I had the large chicken and gyro plate for $13.50, which is $3 more than the Boustan's chicken shawarma plate. The flavours were on par with Boustan's and the meat was slightly better seasoned. To be honest, I'm not sure if I'd come back here because I'm having trouble justifying the fact that I'm paying 14 bucks for a shawarma plate.

Service was fast and friendly and the place is clean other wise I'd give a star less for the food. The gyro sandwich had the worst gyro meat. It must have been sitting in that steamer basket for two days and I came at a normal time of 12:30 for lunch. It just wasn't fresh. It seemed like it was left over from the night before then refrigerated then reheated. Just terrible. I actually felt sick after eating it and had the worst aftertaste in my mouth. I should have sent it back but I hate wasting food and just ate it. Regretfully...

It's not bad, but just not what I was expecting. The shawarma and gyro both have an inherent fast-food quality to them. I was hoping for a wrap that would be fresher, lighter and  less oily. The food is tasty, but the sandwiches are a little overdone, too much sauce, to fatty and really heavy. All that being said, it's pretty tasty stuff.

I really wanted to like this location, stopped by around 6:15 pm and got a beef gyro. The employees were great, quick and efficient which I appreciated. The first few bites were good but then I experienced what a few other reviews mentioned: rock hard pieces of beef. I picked it out and took another couple of bites only to experience more hard pieces. If they didn't have those hard pieces the food would be great, the flavor was good and their sauces are good. I'm not sure if getting chicken will help you avoid the issue, but as of right now proceed with caution when getting beef.

Finally came here after the hype died down.. Food was ok, thought it would be better. It wasn't as great as the original location in New York, but the helpings are good and the service was quick so that's why I'm giving it 4 stars. I had the combo platter which is the go to order in my opinion! Tip: ask for extra white sauce!
Went for a quick lunch today. Had my favorite platter half chicken & beef was delicious as usual... always a great place to eat....

The dishes are not described so it's impossible to know what comes with the order. For $11 I ended up with a platter of mostly lettuce and tomato, 3 pieces of falafel, small pita, and hummus. No rice included with this plate. I guess I should have ordered falafel platter but how was I supposed to know? Not a good value.

Bad costumer service at this location been to a few ones 

One time they didn't have no chicken for about a hour 

Anther time the manager messed up on my order and blamed it on me 

Smh

Ordered the combo platter with chicken and gyro and I was not disappointed! Love their white sauce! Be careful of the hot sauce because it's pretty dang spicy. So use it sparingly. Honestly our whole group has been ordering this everyday on our trip in Vegas. We are now on our fourth day lol So I'm pretty halal guy'd out, but that goes to show that it's pretty tasty. Whether you're eating it fresh or microwaving it later, it still tastes really good. I know we have to stop by again before leaving to take some togo to our friends and family. Definitely a must try if you're in Vegas! We've ordered from the restaurant as well as ordering from Uber eats and have been satisfied with the food ordering from both.

I honestly can say I was not impressed what so ever. I was so hyped by hearing word of mouth but damn what a disappointment ......the meat wasn't fresh off the gyro rotisserie and instead is was cooked in oil on a stove top. The floor in the kitchen was freaking dirty and disgusting....there was food all over the counter tops where the separation was suppose to be.....the only thing fresh was the tomatoes and lettuce. The gyro meat was sitting in oil and the chicken was chewy.....the white sauce was good but other than that something was missing, like spices wise.

Was very disappointed with food, unfortunately they have nothing going for them when it comes to food flavor. They have great location in an area that is saturated with middle eastern restaurants and in my opinion they rank the lowest among the rest. coming from NY I expected a lot more.
Food here is subpar, the beef is minced unlike the meat in NYC. Wanted to like this place as much as I like the NYC location, no bueno, garbage...

I have been here several times and I enjoy the food. Price is right too. I always visit Halal Guys in NY so very pleased they're open here now. There is often a line up which moves slowly. Not nearly as fast as the NY locations but I suppose it will speed up as staff get the routine down. Limited seating but I usually manage to find a spot. On Yonge just north of Wellesley (look for the line up!).

Did this live up to the hype? Slightly...
-meat is good well seasoned
-rice is cooked nicely
-white sauce is amazing
However, I believe that their meat was overcooked. Some bits were too dry just like their pita bread. This location is tiny and can barely fit anyone inside the place. You'll have squeeze through everything. ALSO, BEWARE THE RED SAUCE. I underestimated it by added toooo much and lowkey died.

Love going here to remind me of when I would eat chicken and rice in New York City. I get the combo plate with gyro and chicken with white sauce and just a couple strips of hot sauce. 

Remember the hot sauce is HOT!! So start off with a little and add more if you need it. If you have too much, it might be too hot and you won't be able to enjoy the food.

Not a fan.
Did not have good service.
Not a fav of this fast food Mediteranean restaurant.

I'd been to a few Places  before, which have been great, always good food and fun. Went along to this one with some family friends, to lunch . The place had a buzzing atmosphere and busy, probbably what you'd expect from a Strip casino 

The food was perfect, modest portions and speedy service which always makes for a better evening.

All 6 of us had chicken and gyros  and were very impressed, will definitely be going again.

Been to the New York and Costa Mesa location and it's a personal favorite. Decided to visit this one and noticed a huge difference: no line! Odd...  so I got the combo plate and while the beef gyro was fresh they pulled the chicken from the back that was already cooked. And of course it tasted old and stale...it would be nice if we had fresh chicken. Anyway no wonder it's empty here
Awesome stuff. Just like NYC!! Can't believe I could find the same taste of  New York in Phoenix! The chicken and gyro meat combo with the hot sauce and white sauce just amazing!!

I'm a long-time vegetarian & love falafel sandwiches, which I've had dozens of times from restaurants around the country.

In the area already, I stopped by around 4:30PM on their grand opening day.   

They're located in a small strip-mall, and I was lucky to find a parking spot quickly -- I think after some of the "buzz" about this place ends, parking should be a problem, other than the lot being kind of narrow.

As expected for their opening day, the place was pretty busy, but thanks to their rather limited menu, I was in & out of there in about 10 minutes.   All the staff was very friendly, and I expect by now, they're probably better at knowing what's what.

I ordered two falafels, one with "white sauce" & the other with their hot sauce.   They were cautioning everyone that the hot sauce really is hot, and I'm very glad they suggested that they just give me a packet of it instead of them putting it on my second falafel!  

The falafel sandwich consists of 3 or 4 meatball-sized falafels on a bed of chopped lettuce & diced tomatoes, wrapped up taco-like by pita bread, and then with a small drizzle of whatever sauce you want (packets of extra sauce are 99 cents).

Not liking tomatoes, I got mine without.

The price for two was $17 something.  No drink or anything else is included.   It's not a scenic location, no ambience or anything else special inside the place, so maybe I'm just an old, cheap-bastard, but I find the pricing to be very high.   Remember, it's a falafel -- mostly ground chick-peas & lettuce (in fact. I think they put a little too much lettuce in, as a cheap 'filler' for the sandwich.  The pricing might be normal for NYC & would be for the LV Strip, but not the location that they are at.

Falafels have very little flavor.  Most places season them with paprika, garlic, onions or something, but this place doesn't.     Most of the other places I've gotten falafels at have onions that they add with the lettuce & tomato -- obviously, onions add a lot to the flavor.   This place doesn't, and seemed not to have onions at all.   The white sauce that came in my one falafel sandwich was just a very light drizzle, probably the equivalent of half a teaspoon-full.  Not enough, especially when the "white sauce" doesn't really have a lot of flavor to it...

Thankfully, as part of their grand opening, they have me two packets of the white sauce, and one of the hot sauce.    To give the falafel any sort of flavor, I used a whole packet of the white sauce, and it's just dumb that the white sauce packet is a 99 cent option, when the reality is it's a requirement to give the sandwich even a modicum of flavor.

Sadly, even then, the falafel sandwich from The Halal Guys was just OK.  Part of the reason it was even OK was simply because I hadn't had a falafel sandwich in a while.

Later on, I opened the hot sauce packet.  Many of us foodies are accustomed to sauces described as "hot" or "spicy" really being neither, but not only is the hot sauce here truly very hot, but it's also somewhat of a different flavor to it.  I'm glad I sampled the hot sauce via a drop in my finger instead of pouring it on my second falafel sandwich, because I don't really like the flavor (yeah, I know, but at least I'm being consistent...) & even if I did, it would have been a little too hot to eat when you've got to go back to work for a couple hours...


So the bottom-line for me is that due to lack of flavor, and also a lack of value for the price, I doubt I'll be back unless I have a falafel sandwich craving late at night -- it is AWESOME this place is apparently open until 4AM!!!   Hopefully that will last.

For the owner: I doubt you'll lower your pricing, so after the initial buzz dies, if the profits aren't matching your business plan, please think about including a small drink or bag of chips to bring better value to at least the falafel sandwiches!    Also how about more vegetable options (onions), to give some actual flavor to the falafel sandwiches.

Your lamb dishes might taste great & be a good value, but the falafels don't & aren't.  

I'm not happy to write such a review -- I was really hoping to find a great new falafel place that's open late, but for the aforementioned reasons, you currently aren't it for me.

It's the best place in Toronto for chicken and rice the pitas are super soft it's the softest pitas you'll have. The staff are really friendly and also hard working,epically during the open weekend. I hope there are more locations to come across Toronto like (Scarborough). I would perches a franchise if possible (If the price is right). If you do get a chance tho try the original in NYC it's worth it.

This is by far the best in its genre in the city.  Mops the floor with nasty-ass "conditional pass" Ali Baba or Villa Madina. Paramount is alright but grossly overpriced. Unless Montreal's Amir or Boustan come to town this is the place to beat.
Oh this PLACE!! Yeeeessss puulleeeaasssee! Delicious to a fault! Leaves you full & craving more!

Edit: I now know why they do this - they are slammed! It wouldn't be fair to take an online order that would trump the long line of people out on the sidewalk! The GM, Nidal, was so helpful and let me know that they do offer Uber Eats, Yelp 24, Postmates and Door Dash. 

Food was fresh and my clients (I ordered for 12 people) were absolutely thrilled. 

I WILL BE BACK! 

First review: Two Stars- I am trying to get food from here but they don't allow you to order online or over the phone. You can either come in or use another ordering site. Seems crazy. Hopefully the food is worth the effort.

This place is phenominal.  I was hesitant about the food at first but so glad I decided to try it. I ordered a sandwich but couldn't choose between chicken or gyro the lady's at the counter put both for me and didn't charge me extra. The sandwich was packed with so much meat that two people could have eaten it. I was happy with my choice to try this place.

I just found this place off of post mates and decided to come in instead!! I'm so glad I did!! Everything was amazing from the greeting all the way to the food. Johnnie is so welcoming and kind! I'll for sure be back! Thank you for making my night !

I ate the original from NYC branch (when they had lamb) and the taste and experience isn't the same. Even if there is a line up on the street or people eating on the side it just adds to the experience. 

There will be a line up (unless you go early) but service is fast. Although they offer a sandwich and a plate option, they are flexible with the sides (eg: no salad more rice or vice versa)

In terms of taste, i didnt actually enjoy the beef plate. The beef felt dry, the rice felt old, and the salad...tasted like salad lol. The chicken sandwich though did taste yummy. If anything I would probably stop by for th3 sandwich

If you havent tried this place then sure go ahead, but definitly try their branch in nyc as well

Good food, always busy. The white sauce will kill you, but it's so good and the hot sauce will make you regret eating it the next day but can't have halal guys without it. Get the protein combo. The hummus is also pretty good. The meat tastes good but may be a little too greasy for some people. Line up moves pretty quick.

Came to try this place out after we were on our way back from vacation.. it was around 7:30 when we got there so we got there after the dinner rush.. I ended up getting the chicken/gyro combo which was pretty good.. I got the white sauce on top and put a little hot sauce on top.. the hot sauce was pretty hot and my mouth felt like it was on fire but it was still good..

Simple menu, simple food.. I usually get the combo platter (rice,lettuce, tomatoes and ur choice of falafel or two of their meats) you can also add green peppers, onions, jalapeños, olives and they give you two small pieces of pita.. they have a white sauce and super spicy red sauce.. both delicious and goes well together.. just beware for the red sauce it's super spicy..
The Halal Gurs have great gyros! Generous portions. good flavor and good service! This was my first time here but I'll be back!

Went in for the food, came out with great service! I was rushing to work ,stopped at Halal Guys then was meet with  Linda, who  served me with speed and efficiency while still composing a smile..thank you Linda for your service... will become a regular customer as-long as people like her work there ...also the food is great remembers me of my time in New York City

So happy we stumbled upon this new location in the Caesar food court. Haven't had it since NYC and it was a pleasant surprise to see this. The line was long but totally worth it! I was concerned that it wouldn't taste the same as NY but fear not, it's just as amazing! 
The food court itself was always dirty so good luck finding a clean spot.

This place was busy with a line out the door but it moved real fast and we were able to get a seat inside.  Very good food though and very nice portions..i got the chicken and gyro platter with rice which was filling.  The gyro didn't have that punch seasoning that I'm use to on a gyro but it was still tasty.  Its worth a second trip though for sure..parking is a bit tight too with Dutch brothers next door

Best customer service tonight by Johnnie! 
Locals get discount on your order! 
Also check in for free baklava!

Pretty good but there are better placed for gyro in vegas. Very small and hot inside, so many people working but still somehow takes forever. Seems expensive for what it is. The late night hours are cool but honestly not the area I am looking to be in at 2am. Check out Sultan Grill in Summerlin or the Great Greek in Henderson for better gyro.

I've been wanting to try The Halal Guys for ages but was hesitant because of the average reviews and I did not want to line up. Yesterday, I finally got the chance to.

What can I say about the experience except it was average. I ordered the small chicken platter and it wasn't terrible but it wasn't fantastic either. The chicken was a bit dry and bland. 

I felt it was a bit pricey for the portion size - $10 for the small platter.  For $1 extra you can get hummus or baba ganoush. Will I return?  Maybe.

My friend and I heard that this place opened up in LV and because there was so much hype about it.. We decided to try it out yesterday. We walked in and were greeted by very friendly staff. Because it was our first time.. The staff were extremely helpful with their recommendations especially warning us that their hot sauce is really hot. We had to get our food to go because the restaurant was extremely small and there were no available tables open. As for the food.. We were not too impressed with it. The small bowl I ordered came with chicken, rice, lettuce, tomatoes, and 4 pieces of pita bread. The chicken was dry and had no flavor. The white sauce helped with the dryness but it was just ok. The pita bread was thin and soggy. I love Mediterranean food so it was extremely disappointing after hearing the hype about this place. I probably won't be coming back again. There are much better Mediterranean restaurants in LV.  I gave this place three stars only for the friendly staff.

So I heard for a while this crazy awesome place The Halal guys was opening here in Vegas so I was interested, hearing so much about it over the years but never have been to New York to try it was finally  my chance to try when they opened here in Vegas yesterday. I wasn't even going to go on opening day having my son with me and all but I just so happened to have to go the that area of town so I decided to stop by and see how crazy the line was. The line wasn't bad at all and was shaded so I didn't mind. I guess the swag was gone coming 3 hours from opening at 1 pm but they had cases of ice cold water to cool you down in the heat. One of the promoters who was working the event even helped me with getting a room temperature water to make my son a bottle who later also helped me inside! Once we got inside it was another line but was pretty quick and they had tons of meat cooking and staff ready to serve up the large crowds. The line was wrapped around the tent once I got in so I was lucky to beat the crowd again. 

I chose the combo gyro platter to try both meats. Seating is limited and was taken anyways to I took it to go. Each order serves you two packets of the famous white sauce and one small but mighty hot sauce. I had cold water in my bag so I skipped the soft drink and didn't plan to stay and eat because tables and chairs were taken like I said but by the time I paid a table opened up for me and my son so we were able to sit down and enjoy our lunch instead of in the car which gave me a chance to feed my son to get a seal of approval. 

The rice didn't have too much flavor but was tender and soft. Of the beef and chicken, the beef was my favorite of the two but the chicken was very tender. Smother it in the white sauce and you're in heaven but be very careful of the hot sauce. I like spicy but it was super hot and I put a small amount on the side and tried before I poured all over my food. I'm so glad I did because man that sauce is no joke! Luckily I put some chicken aside for my son along with pita bread which he loved. Luckily one of the girls who opened the store asked me how I was doing (same one who helped me outside and helped me bring the high chair to the table) and I said I wasn't expecting the hot sauce to be so hot and had wished I ordered a drink but the line was just so Long and I didn't want to be rude and cut and she gave me her lemonade. As a mom with a child you appreciate the small things especially not making me wait in line again for a drink because when you have children everything is a tad more complicated. I don't know your name but if you're reading this I appreciate you helping me more than you know from helping me outside and helping me sit and bringing me a high chair in the midst of craziness and the busy store I appreciate more than you know! 

Staff was super nice and kept a great attitude through the busy chaos all day. Seating and parking is limited so I would recommend taking it to go or stay if you're lucky enough to score a table or barstool!

I heard a few people say on social that the beef was too minced and the original New York stand is way better but I can't compare as I've never tried. When the OG Halal guys is halfway across the country beggars can't be choosers and I'm sure this will satisfy your craving. They're open late and I'm sure will be a hip spot for all the party people as it's close to the strip but I'm sure they would've done great anywhere. Welcome to Vegas Halal guys!

Since I didn't want to read the reviews and instead come to my own conclusions about Halal Guys, I did not see all the warnings about the hot sauce. We ordered a chicken platter and a gyro platter and proceeded to drizzle a pouch of hot sauce on each. WOW, our mouths were on fire.

Overall, the gyro (beef) platter was WAYYY better than the chicken one. The chicken was a bit dry and didn't have very much flavour. (This might have been the fact that I lost a handful of nerves in my mouth from the hot sauce by this point, but even then, beef all the way!)
