So I work in Chandler and today I drove 46 minutes to and from The Halal Guys to satisfy my craving, okay? I'm Halal-ed out now though but I'm glad I went. I went for the first time on Friday night and it was everything. I ordered a regular size chicken platter with extra white sauce and a DOLLOP of red sauce. That red sauce is nothing - NOTHING - to play with. My mouth was on fire but it was so good. It's an intense burn but it fades out quickly so I guess that's the silver lining to it being so hot, lol. My husband tried some while we were driving and he almost wrecked the car, he couldn't comprehend how people enjoy it! I also ordered one piece of baklava and a fountain drink. Side note: did you know Fanta made ginger ale? It's a faint ginger flavor but it was great. Also, it was my first time having baklava and it's so good. I was looking up recipes today to try to make it sometime soon. Anyway, I enrolled in the rewards program and when I went today, I got a free drink. If you ever forget to have them add your reward points to your account in store, you can always do it online. I actually preferred my meal more Friday than I did today. I don't know if it's because it was later at night and maybe the chicken had been marinating longer but I just felt like it had more flavor. I asked for extra white sauce but it wasn't nearly enough because ¾ of the way through my platter, it was pretty dry. And of course, it isn't the same as the authentic NY Halal Guys but it's worth the 45 minute drive from my apartment in Arizona!

Meh. The beef was salty, dry and chopped so small it fell out of the pita . I'm from LA, where Middle Eastern food choices are plentiful - and this was not authentic and quite overrated. Gyros are traditionally served with a yogurt based cucumber sauce. Greeks call it Tzatziki, while Persian restraints call it by another name. Halal Guys have some "white sauce" that was some bland mayonnaise based stuff. I guess everyone has their own preferences for taste but to me - both taste and quality were severely lacking at Halal Guys. Issa no for me.

I drove by this place one night and saw a long line out the door. Pulled it up on Yelp expecting it to have 16 stars or something. Surprised it was only 3.  One review read really positive and it ends with, "meh, 3 stars."  (What?)
I am giving this place five stars because the food is good and so is the service. I had the platter with the beef. Being on the keto diet it's basically salad bowls at most places I go. Chipotle, Cafe Rio, etc. I don't enjoy them, I eat them in a pinch. But this I enjoyed. The beef was really flavorful and the sauce made the dish. The hot sauce is actually hot. I'm talking army of one hot. Not like those places where you order their spicy dish, then they warn you that it's spicy, and it's literally tomato sauce with a pinch of pepper.

Well, I have mixed feelings about this place. 

I was definitely looking forward to trying it after all the hype. We got to the place on a Monday at about 9pm. We thought it was closed because there was literally no one in there except for the two girls working. The interior is kind of dull and flat with yellow and red as the main colors. Kind of like a depressing McDonald's for adults. 

The menu is pretty basic. We shared a platter with half chicken/ half gyro. The girl working pronounced the gyro with a hard g which was surprising because gyro is their main menu item so clearly the training was lacking?! The platter is very basic- comes with lettuce, tomato and rice. The chicken was really dry and not at all "seasoned to perfection" like their website states. Once we sat down, we obviously grabbed the squeeze bottles of hot sauce, "white sauce" and tahini. It was actually really tasty  with the white sauce all over it, but let's be honest, that "white sauce" would be good all over anything! Once all the flavors of the sauces were mixed in, I all of a sudden had a change of heart and thought, ok maybeee I'll come back ;). The hummus was good but 4.99 seemed pricey given it comes w 1 piece of pita bread for an entire container. 

I saw on their website that they are the #1 yelped business in NYC. I'm not sure if their food tastes different on a bustling New York City street but it certainly wasn't that exciting last night.
The customer service was great, the service was fast, the sauces were good, and the menu wasn't overwhelming.

The grand opening is August 12th, but I'm so glad because I was able to go before then. I expect it will be nonstop busy after it opens. Spring mountain is far for me as well as a lot of Las vegas natives but perfect if you are visiting and staying on the strip. As soon as you walk in you can see how small it is. There are maybe 4 tables? However, the food was great. I have never had halal guys on the east coast so i do not have much to compare to but I really loved it. THE WHITE SAUCE. GAWWWWD YES. I am so glad one of the workers warned us about the red sauce, because that shit is not playing!! Its so spicy legit be careful fam. 

I got a regular platter & the chicken and gyro were really flavorful.  My favorite thing was the baklava!! Im definitely willing to go back just for the baklava. The service was great and I think this is a great addition to the Las Vegas food game!

Not what I expected. They had an abundance of everything already pre-cooked. Looked and tasted like it had been sitting there for a while.the hummus is packaged they just open it for you and sprinkle the chilli over the top. Staff looked like they disliked their job. the food was ok.

Below average halal food and overpriced. Would not come back. Employees were nice, though. I paid eight bucks for a chicken sandwich consisting of lettuce, tomato, white sauce, and bread. What a rip off, especially since it didn't taste good. Apparently they charged lower prices in New York but now they expanded and raised their prices. Take your food chain money to chipotle where you at least get onions in your burrito.

it's definitely good for what it is, middle eastern food truck food. However, it did not live up to the hype that it had prior to opening. It's a little bit pricy for the portions and I feel like they're a little stingy with the sauce and meat. The meat is a little dry (chicken). Overall, pretty tasty with the sauces. Haji baba is better and more bang for your buck in my opinion

I want to give 5 stars as the halal guys in NYC got me hooked. This place is decent, but lacks consistency in the amount of their serving. Been to this place couple times,  but today I got a stingy share from one of their employees on a regular size all beef platter. The plate looks like there's a reserved spot for the chicken. Life can be unfair, but I hope to get a fair consistent share on what I pay for... consistency pls

This restaurant is located on Spring Mountain & Valley View.  $31.86 got me a fountain drink, a small falafel platter, a regular combo platter, and a chicken sandwich. Visited on Saturday 8-13-16 at 11AM.  

I had to google what halal means...apparently it literally means "permissible" and describes food which is prepared in accordance with Islamic rules.  For animals, the whole throat must be slit at once including the windpipe, arteries, and veins.  Thank goodness they are allowed to stun the animal first because it seems unnecessarily cruel to let them bleed out while conscious.  

ANYHOO....back to the review.  The first thing that struck me about this place was the air conditioner was broken.  WHY OH WHY would you have a grand opening with no A/C when it's 110 outside?  Seems like bad planning.  

Inside it's set up kind of like a chipotle assembly line where you order at one end and pay at the other end.  It was much smaller than I expected with only 5-6 tables.   There were about 20 employees behind the counter and it was just mass chaos.  People bumping into each other, having to repeat myself several times, and they tried to short me a falafel. 

The combo plate consisted of a spiced red rice, lettuce, diced tomatoes, slices of pita bread, diced chicken, and beef gyro meat.  It kinda threw me off that the beef looked more like ground beef than the flat shawarma-type meat I'm used to.  The bowl came with two pouches of their "white sauce" which tastes exactly like a really weak ranch dressing and one packet of hot sauce.  The hot sauce reminded me of sriracha...I'm glad I tried a little dab on my finger first cuz this stuff is hotter than Satan's ballsack.  The rice and meat were both not warm but not cold. They have a condiment bar with jalapenos, hummus, olives, onions, etc. but it is hidden from view and I didn't find out about it until today from checking their website.  

This was my first time trying a falafel and I think maybe I don't like them.  The one I had was bland, room temperature, and hard as a rock.  I looked up a recipe for them and I think I received perhaps a bad example of a falafel.  They are made from ground chick peas and deep fried and I believe they are supposed to be crispy on the outside and moist on the inside....but again I'm not really sure.  

This food was not cheap, the parking situation was horrendous, they had no air conditioning, and the food was incredibly forgettable.  The portions were very generous but the food was so bad I ended up throwing it all out instead of eating the leftovers.  

  It's a "one and done" for me.

What's the deal about this place? I've eaten Mediterranean in the past and enjoyed it, so when I've seen billboards and commericals around town hyping up the grand opening of Halal Guys, I thought I'd give it a try. 

When we walked in, my immediate thought was, this place is tiny! The MMA fight store, the previous business, was four or five times the size of the common area. The other tiny thing is the selection on the menu: Sandwich or Platter. Then choose your protein: chicken, beef, chicken/beef combination, or falafel. 

Ironically, what's not tiny is the number of their staff. There must've been nearly ten employees including the owner/manager type dudes that came out to ask about our experience - nice touch. 

I went with the Sandwich Combo while she had the Platter Combo. They make it right in front of you Subway style, so you can customize your sandwich of three items: lettuce, tomato, and white sauce.  The amount of meat was great, but unfortunately, very bland.  Her platter didn't sit well - she ended up having diarrhea and encouraged me to mention it in this review. 

Overall, the experience was like being on New York City street coughing up nine bucks for below mediocre grub - I guess they nailed it. 

Halal Guys prides itself for founding it's success as street food but it's like they chose not to elevate it when as a brick & mortar. Since they're now in Vegas, they should find a way to put a cart outside the clubs. I'd eat it then, but not before.

Well I was I was just all around disappointed. The pita was old and so hard it was inedible. The falafel was mediocre at best. Hummus didn't taste better than anything I could have gotten at a grocery store. They just generally made my plate wrong on top of everything. I will say that the gyro meat was good an flavorful but that is no where near enough to bring me to get food from here again. I had heard good things about them before so when I saw they opened up I was excited but it was just a huge let down.

I walked by for about a month seeing massive line ups and always wanted to eat here.  I'd heard amazing things about them from NYC.   Not sure I would return.  The food was okay, way better gyro in the area for much better price.

My biggest issue was the staff, I get how it's busy and you only make minimum wage but the majority of the staff looked like they hated life.  There was a short line but only because the staff couldn't move slower.  I grew up in restaurants and I never would have hired the majority of these people.

I got my food to go, had to tell the person three times.  Cutlery by the fountain pop was totally empty, had to tell the cashier more was needed, ordered a fountain and and had to ask for the cup.  Where is the Manager????  Is no one interested in the client experience?  My guess is the manager was doing some menial job "in the back".

These sad people couldn't wait to leave, and it was only dinner time.   

To offer an area to improve, it is in management.  All these issues relate to having very low quality or inexperienced managers.

Managers, get involved.  Talk to your guests, get involved in the dining experience and train your people or this will be a short stay in Toronto.



After the very poor experience I had originally i decided to give it another shot.  It seemed more organized.  But still lots of staff not focussed on customers but focussed on random conversations between themselves.  I don't mind waiting in line if the staff are working on fulfilling the customers orders but for over 5 minutes there were 9 of us in line and the staff was not taking any orders they were fulfilling the web orders.  That seems totally counter intuitive, the people who come to your restaurant get less prompt service than the customers who stay home.  If your web orders are going is well create a station where you fulfill those but give the customers priority service if they walk into your restaurant.

I hope they figure it out but judging by my continued experience with very low customer service I don't have much hope.  This sort of service issue starts with the managers and boss figuring out what they want to offer their customers.  At this point I'd say the are making poor decisions.

Mention to the guy on the counter my first time here and local so far I'm not impressed !!! The fact that this guy is so horrible at the food beef/chicken portion I got half of scoop on the beef and chicken ordered a combo platter what the guy at the counter told me to get. He keep banging the cook top nonstop while we eating then he mention if I want to sign up for a rewards card and register it to get a free drink, so I did when I ask him question how to register he simply said I don't know how go to the website and read the instruction(I was like ok???) Them while I'm sitting here eating and saw the bottom right of the menu said (ask about our locals offer!) ask him about the offer he said u suppose to told me your local to get the 10% discount, but I told him I did mention it when I first got in store he obviously doesn't care I'm done with this place HORRIBLE SERVICE AND FOOD TASTE OK

Ask for a manager this guy that been at the counter said he is the manager he won't be able to adjust my receipt for the local 10% offer he said I never mention I was local at the beginning of the order when I got to this place I told him I was local and he stand here and have the guts to tell me that I never mention I was local this guy ANGEL G is a joke, he said the discount only $1.10 it is not the discount it is the principle of this whole thing for manager arguing with me over a $1.10 discount is simply a JOKE!!! I WILL NEVER EVER COME BACK HERE!!!
Apparently they got rid of the 50% off military discount. Now it's like 10% off. Not really worth it anymore. And the person who made my bowl barely put any meat or rice. Probably never coming back

Watch out for the red sauce! It's like surface of the sun hot! It has an amazing flavor but it'll literally set your insides on fire.

I went here in between Uber rides as I do a lot of Uber Eats pickups from this spot and I love Mediterranean food. Upon walking in, I noticed that you can either order a platter or a pita wrap. In an effort to maintain my hourglass figure, I went for the platter without rice (too many carbs and it's cooked in chicken stock). Basically I ended up with three or four falafels on top of a bed of shredded lettuce with some pita wedges. The falafels aren't made in house...they come in frozen in a big bag and then are dropped in the frier. They taste just ok. 

The staff that works here is awesome...so friendly and helpful. They asked if I wanted tahini on top of the falafel, which is awesome...and then they cautioned me about the red sauce. I feel a proper expectation was set for how hot that stuff is. 

I think next time I'll try a wrap because there are other things you can add to it such as olives, cucumbers, etc.

Ordered this via Door Dash and I gotta say, this was pretty good. We ordered the chicken sandwich, fries, combo platter and baklava.  All of the food was great and the price was just right when comparing to portion size. The amount that comes in a regular size combo platter is enough for 2 people. Will definitely order again!

Unfortunately they didn't have rice when I went so I settled on a chicken sandwich. Pretty good, with fresh-tasting bread and plenty of fillings. It's almost twice as expensive as a food truck in nyc would be, but oh well. Good enough to get again.

Egh. I ahv heard good things and one opened up by the house. I would say that the consistent complaints about dry meat were spot on. The magic white sauce wasn't very magical. Somewhere between sour cream and tzatziki. Wasn't bad, wasn't good. Likely will go somewhere else but if I am in a hurry and in area I wouldn't be against going for a quick bite if I'm strapped for time
First time coming to this place or trying Mediterranean food in general besides a gyro here and there. The white sauce was as awesome as advertised. Put tons all over it and the hot sauce

This place is the worst compare to the other halal guys i've been to. When we got back to our hotel, hubby and I got diarrhea. Something was wrong with the food. They did not put the white sauce in the freezer! The employees don't look happy working there. The chef banging here and there. Oh my, if you dont like your job, just quit! Don't ruined people having dinner!
The food is hit and miss. Service is terrible and they are overpriced. The hot sauce is good and menu limited.
Doesn't taste as good as the one in NYC or SF. Rice is tougher. Meat too dry but Spicy sauce is still consistently spicy :)

I have been to the original Halal Guys street cart in NYC many times and to my surprise I was driving on Stapely near Baseline and saw the familiar yellow and red sign in my neighborhood and was so excited, I had to go that night! 

Came in around 6pm and I ordered 4 combos to-go from a very friendly young lady with a great smile. The combos were assembled just the same way as in NYC with a lettuce and tomato salad the amazing rice and the the two meats on top with fresh pita. Oh and don't forget the white sauce and hot sauce packets. That white sauce brings it all together. Hot sauce is very flavorful and hot (which I love), so go easy at first. 

I get home and we all dig in... amazing!!! Tasted just like I expected. Spot on to the original in NYC. Sooo good. Put the white sauce and a little hot sauce on and stirred it up, lettuce and all, and it was perfect. 

The menu is simple and it's all about the food so don't expect some big menu with all these options. It's the Halal Guys and they do it great. 

Open on the weekdays until 12am and the weekend until 2am. Perfect for those late night cravings but it's awesome anytime. 

Easy to find off Stapely and the 60 so please go by and check it out. Have an open mind and know it's a fast casual, simple, and very tasty place to eat in or to-go. 

I will be back many times and looking forward to spreading the word anytime I can. 

Best of luck Halal Guys!

Came here to try for first time after hearing the hype. Friends gave us a 25$ gift card for as birthday gift. Cashier did not know about gift card and called manager. Manager flat out denied gift card even though the card clearly has their own logo on it! After explaining the card was purchased on their own website, and presenting with a email confirmation from Halal guys, they back tracked and said they were not set up. It's fine if it's not set up. But don't treat your customer with a disrespectful response. Attitude was unacceptable. Very disappointed.

I think I was expecting something more from all the hype that was built up on this place. The portion was big, after taste left my mouth tasting of grease. I guess this is a good place to go after a bar since it is open late. Pet peeve of mine was that they ran out of forks. That's like running out of meat but still charging for it. If I come back again, I would order the gyro sandwich.

This is such a simple concept! 

The menu has only a few options and it really makes the service fast. 

BEWARE of the hot sauce. I have never tasted sauce so hot. I think some people must get it just to feel the ridiculous heat. Nevermind that though because the platters are great with just the white sauce. 

If you watch the video running on the screen you'll see the meat over French fries. That's not on the menu but definitely a cool "secret" menu item.

Loved their gyros, their fries, and the free baklava (with yelp check-in)!

I wish they had a closer location to the LV strip because that UBER trip wasn't $ friendly back and forth.

Is this some kind of joke? I'm sure this place is tasty in New York, but it missed the mark for me here. The food was sitting out, cold, the bread soggy. The famous "white sauce" is just mayonnaise! I was shocked there was no tzaziki sauce (YOGURT BASED; TRADITIONAL). The hot sauce is bitter and unpleasantly hot. I'd never come back. But then again, I know good middle eastern food. This place is just Americanized. Like the Taco Bell of middle eastern fare. #thumbsdown

I've been meaning to try the Halal Guys since they opened up in Toronto last month but wanted to wait until the hype wore off to avoid the lines. There was no wait when I went in early June and I was able to find a seat almost immediately. Since I wanted to compare it to the original food truck in NYC, I got the Chicken Platter again. The price here is $9.99 for a small platter and $12.49 for a regular platter. Even when taking into consideration the exchange rate, the $8 platter in NYC is a much better deal. For those meat lovers out there, you may be disappointed since the platter here has a much larger proportion of orange rice, lettuce & diced tomatoes than meat but since I like my veggies, I was ok with it. Tastewise, I found both locations to be the same since the secret is honestly in their white sauce. I'm very much a sauce person and therefore, halfway through the dish, I went up to the counter to ask for more sauce (it's the only way to eat it!) and the nice ppl there happily obliged.
I loved the concept of coming in and getting the food quickly. Food is pretty good! And employees are super friendly!

My expectations were pretty low after reading the reviews here, but to my delight this place exceeded my expectations! To be sure, it's not gourmet food or the best dining experience of your life, but it's good hearty and healthy food. I disagree with others who said the meat was bland. I got the combo platter and I was wary of the chicken being bland, but I found it to have a nice flavor and it was NOT dry which was most important of all. Also the lettuce did not take up 1/2 my platter, it was 1/3 at most. I couldn't finish the entire platter in one meal so I feel that it's a fair amount of food for the price. I really liked the rice and the gyro meat.

I ordered from uber eats and my platter came with 2 huge white sauce packets and spicy sauce. It was more than enough white sauce, I didn't even use 1 whole packet and I felt like it was more than enough white sauce. FYI the white sauce is their version of a tangy mayo. That spicy sauce is no joke! But I liked it. 1 spicy sauce is waaayy more than enough for an entire platter. If you can eat more spicy sauce than that, my hat's off to you! 

Overall I would definitely order from here again!

Oh, but pass on the baklava - it's not great.

Sorry the picture is a bit cut off, I was so excited to eat!

Overall had a good experience at halal guys. Finally got a chance to try it after hearing a lot of good things over the past few years. I had the chicken and gyro combo platter. Personally I thought they could've put more sauce and that the gyro was significantly tastier than the chicken. 

I would definitely recommend giving this place a try.

Food with fresh and tasty. I'd compare it to a Chipotle or a Fired Pie of the Mediterranean. Fresh meats and good sides. Friendly attentive staff. They also have falafel and their sauces are very tasty.
Awful!! Save your money and drive north on 19th ave to the Albertsons Shopping center.  Twice the quality for the half the price.  This place will be closed before you know it!!

3 because the staff was nice. They don't have lamb. I paid extra for white sauce that they had for free by the soda fountain. And we paid $34 for a meal that would have been $14 with tip in NYC. I'm not saying it's bad. It's just a lot for a cheap imposter.

"I like it a little spicy but not too spicy... like J-Lo in pajamas." ? Craig Ferguson, on The Chew

Any leftover, residue, stubborn, clingy germs from my cold a few weeks ago sprang back to life with the bit of red sauce I used.  I'm still coughing up a lung a few hours after eating!  Whoa!  Be careful with that red sauce, folks!

From a humble street cart in 1990 to becoming an international eatery, The Halal Guys have made it.  We ordered a side order of falafel, a Combo Platter [chicken & beef gyro], and a Falafel Platter.  I must admit that the falafel was a let down.  They were a bit dry and bland but a splash of White Sauce and a drop of Red Sauce fixed that up.  But when you're trying to not get an ass like Nicki Minaj, using excess White Sauce [seems like the love-child of mayo and Greek yogurt] to save your food is upsetting.  I would say the Combo Platter is the way to go.  Platters are a filling and simple dish of iceberg lettuce, tomatoes, and some rice.

3.5 stars!  At $9 for the large "regular" platter [I couldn't even finish half] combined with the late hours, I'm sure I'll be back.

Is the hype real? That's what I wanted to know... I had in the streets of the city over ten years ago and I can still remember it. Yeah it might have been three in the morning and I may have been toasted but I do remember even eating the leftovers for lunch the next day. That's how you know it was good. This on the other hand wasnt horrible but just ehh avg. Portion size is generous for $9-10. Half the plate is lettuce half is rice with Indian spice and coloring so it truly is orange. The chicken was cooked right and not dry but all I could taste was salt and pepper. The beef cooked gyro style was pretty good. Decent portion of meats. The two sauces are white and red. The white would've been yogurt and onions combo on the cart in NYC... This I could barely taste  the red is the chili sauce and they ask how many lines you want of each (is this coke they sellin?). I got 5 white 7 red mouth was on fire! I happened to have tzatiki in the car (no lie) but it was still burning my mouth. Glad I got baklava to offset but wasn't enough. Like some other reviews said there are handful of middle eastern joints around asu that you wouldn't have to wait in line for and like even better.... Haji baba comes to mind but I've been away from that area for ten years. Either way glad I tried it.... Not in a rush to go back but it was edible.
One of the best things that happened here in Las Vegas is the recent opening of The Halal Guys!!! It surely is the best Mediterranean food! You have to try it guys!!!

So sad this place doesn't live up to what I expected. Being to the one in New York, it wasn't the same. The meat didn't have a good flavor and it just lacked. When I got there it was late about 11pm, but he didn't heat up the pita bread, there was a pile sitting there and that's where mine came from. I definitely won't come back again.

Glad I finally got to try Halal Guys! Since this was opening weekend, there was a line to get in but it moved fairly quickly. I also appreciated the convenient parking in the back. 

I ordered the small bowl with mixed beef and chicken which was a good size in my opinion. Overall, it was a nice and quick meal...I think the sauces are really what give this place their name, otherwise the food itself is pretty bland.
Great food for reals! If you go do not pass up the opportunity to get some of their hummus, because it is to die for!!! The baklava is pretty good too!

WARNING, FOOD POISON ALERT, Really bad experience I was there on the second day they were open, I should have known just by the way the food looked, cafeteria style fast food, food court gyro shop, but I was wrong it tasted worse than that, I would not even leave this review had  I not got terrible food poisoning, u have been warned, being sick sucked, and I know it was this place as it was my only meal of the day.

Love this place! Every time I go there they have fast service and the food is always amazing. I have tried the combo bowl and the falafel bowl... the falafel was tasty but the lamb and chicken is the best one. They have delicious fries as well. The white sauce here is the best sauce I have had and I am not just saying that, I would put it on everything if I had the recipe. Their hot sauce is hot and a little goes a long ways. Will for sure be going back more

I had been meaning to try Halal Guys for a while, so when I heard that they had a location in Vegas, I couldn't pass up on trying it. Like others, I found that the food did not live up to the hype that the New York locations boast. 

The location is a little ways out from the Strip, and the interior of the restaurant is a slightly cramped and dreary. The workers were really friendly though. The food didn't blow me away; again, my expectations were probably too high. The plates come with your choice of protein - gyro, chicken or falafel. They also throw in some rice, lettuce, tomatoes, pita and some other condiments like onion and olives. I will warn you now, the hot sauce they have is POTENT. I had just a little bit and my mouth was on fire for a good 10 minutes. And the white sauce was delicious and probably the highlight of the meal. 

Food is affordable at $10, but I look forward to trying their New York locations someday in the hope that they might live up to the hype.

Wack meat, wack pita, TERRIBLE babaganouj, wack workers, wack place. 
I don't know what the hype is about ? unless you have no taste buds. 
Will never go back.
Never.
I ordered the gyro platter and the meat was well-seasoned and tender. The salad was fresh and the sauces were delicious. Will definitely be back for more!

It's very understandable why this place received 3 stars. I'm not new to halal guys, the beef and chicken are very soft and tender and the white sauce compliments them both very well. This is me explaining my experience at other halal establishments.

If you check my yelp you can see I'm very generous with stars for great service and food. But I have had nothing but anger for this specific establishment. I ordered through the app for delivery and wrote no rice and tomatoes which they gave me as well as missing white sauce. That is not that bad, I've had mistakes happen before no big deal. I've called them for the past day receiving nothing but a voicemail. You guys open from 10-4, as you can see  you don't care enough for your customers who just wanted to switch for a different dish. I didn't want credit or free food, but no one cares about customer satisfaction. Go elsewhere. The stars say it all.
I hate that I did not get her name but the girl with the blonde hair and gorgeous eyelashes customer service was beyond awesome!!
Interesting concept; have heard bout it & wanted to try it. Very ltd menu, reasonable prices & healthy. Not sure I see all the fuss, prob wouldn't go outta my way but will go back...

Great prices... very tasty, authentic.... the variety of sauces are amazing...portion to price ratio GREAT leave full!!! Service is great will be back! If you're in the area it's definitely a must stop
Service was friendly and very fast. Expect the place to be busy. It is located at the busy food court. Easy in and out for a fast bite.

Very disappointed with the food.  Was so excited to try it.  The pita bread tasted stale with a weird after taste.  There was too much lettuce on the sandwich but generous amount of meat.  I would have preferred slices of the gyro meat.  The baklava was inedible.

No good.  Stick to Pita jungle.  Iceberg lettuce salads, over cooked gyro meat, mayo based sauce thats nothing close to a tzatziki.  I've had better gyros at Arbys. Not sure what New Yorkers are standing in line for.

This place is terrible, I ordered the beef shawarma, and was instead given a substitute of ground beef. The ground beef was salty and dry. The wrap was full of lettuce with some sort of white disgusting mayo sauce. Completely not what I was expecting in a Shawarma wrap.  For a garden-variety fastfood restaurant, this place is a disappointment and deserves a one star review.

To be honest, the last time I had the original in NYC was years and years ago, and I can't actually remember how it tastes, so I may have romanticized the memory...but I feel like the original tasted much better. Which was to be expected, but I was hoping for more.

I came here at about 11:15am or so on a Saturday and there was no wait at all!

The orange rice didn't have much of a distinct flavour. The chicken tasted quite lean, like chicken breast, which means it was a little dry - it was also quite peppery. The beef tasted a little gamey, even though I was told there was no lamb in it, and it was also quite dry. The white sauce tasted fine, though kind of chalky and it was thicker than I expected. For some reason I remember the original to be thinner, more savoury, with more complex flavours, and much more delicious in general. And the hot sauce was hot but not as killer as the original, which I didn't mind. And as with the original cart, I didn't like the pita very much - I prefer mine to be thin and chewy, as opposed to thick and pillowy.

The price seems like a lot compared to the original, but if you translate the USD price to Canadian dollars, it's not that crazy, lol. For $11-12 though, I'd rather have a bowl of ramen or something.

I'm glad I tried it, but I probably won't be craving this. Which is too bad, because the people were super nice!

Honestly, I was very disappointed by this place....the hype was ridiculous. Talk about no seating, dry meat, frozen falafel, and the platters don't come with hummus (which is what you would expect in a Mediterranian platter). Also, if you don't like soda, bring your own drink...no iced tea. The hot sauce should have a disclaimer on it because it's blow-your-butthole-out hot. Overall, the quality doesn't match up to the price. I don't think I'll be returning.

I think I came here with anticipation of it being a Greek or Mediterranean style restaurant. It was not. The chicken was flavorful, the beef was nothing like a gyro. I was not a fan of their white sauce however their barbecue sauce was very good. I only had to take one bite of the hot sauce and knew it was too too too hot for me! The staff was very helpful and courteous.

This is my second time eating halal guys. Unfortunately each time I was really hungry and the food was so good I could not take a pic for food presentation...my bad. Ok the first trip it was packed on a Saturday night! But the line moved very swiftly. I ordered the combo chicken and gyro platter with white and hot sauce, 2 falafel, baklava, and a fountain drink for a reasonable price imo. Then as I am paying the card demon hit and bam my card was declined! So in this packed establishment my card wouldn't go through and I knew I had the money! So I sit in a corner embarrassed and on hold with my financial institution. So as I'm holding and my bank is trying to get my card working during their maintenance / update, the Halal Guys manager comes up to me with my order and a fountain cup and said "this one is on us tonight," *my mouth dropped. "Oh no sir it's ok I really have the money!" And then he said "well I already entered it comped so you couldn't pay if you wanted to." And then he smiled. My card eventually worked that night but the kindness has one this place a new long time customer! Now to the food...I know ya'll didn't think just cause the manager was so nice I'd let the food review slide. No worries the food was excellent! I enjoy just mixing the whole platter together and have the flavors dance in harmony on my palate. Very tender meat, very very good baklava, and the hot sauce!... some may want to use sparingly, but if you like spicy I suggest a nickel size portion of it is fine. We'll gotta go finish my platter

The Halal Guys in Toronto has been open for three days, so the first few reviews seem a little bit harsh. I get it, you waited in the rain, the grand opening didn't have the freebies you wanted, whatever. Cut the new kid on the block some slack, and let's talk about their delicious, delicious white sauce. You could put this sauce on cardboard and I'd seriously consider giving it three stars. Luckily, they put it on delicious meats, veggies and firm, orange rice. Get a combo plate, and beware the red sauce.

Welcome to town, Halal Guys. My husband is weeping with joy over your arrival.

got this delivered with Uber eats to my hotel... pretty cool. not as cool as walking to the cart on the corner in NYC but pretty close. the food here is just about as good but the meat was a bit drier than NYC. I feel like the food cart locations there just put more love and effort into the food. still, this hit the spot and awesome that they are open almost all night!
Just at soft opening! Soo good as usual! Super friendly staff! Im so glad this location is open its so close to my home & work!!
I LOVE their food! I ALWAYS stop in to get a platter and some hummus (my fave!) whenever Im in the area! And everytime I go in the staff is always so friendly and helpful!!

Some people LOVE this place....some people just think it's alright...I fall on the side of LOVE!!  I have already been to the Vegas location 5 different times since they have opened, and will definitely continue!  Been to the NYC location a few years back, and very happy to have them here in Las Vegas.  Happy Halal!
Halal Guys is one of my all time favorite spots, at least back in New York. While this location doesn't have the same charm, it's still good enough to satiate the cravings.

I have heard that this place in New York City in the bomb and that the white sauce is to die for. There was a lot of hype with the opening of the Toronto location. I wanted to wait a little bit before I gave them ago. 

Today, I finally got to experience Halal Guys! I just got the small chicken & gyros platter. You get some salad, loads of orange rice, hearty serving of meat smothered with their signature white sauce and some pieces of pits. It was a good enough serving for one and could easily be split into two meals. I opted to not get any hot sauce because my friend had warned me about how spicy it is. So I took the safe route. I would definitely only do one or two dots to see how you fancy the hot sauce. 

I went for dinner and we were in and out within 10 minutes. It does get hot in there from all the cooking plus the sun shining in, so we ate outside. But the warmth would be great on a frigid winter day! 

I can't wait to go again. Maybe even pick up some on the way home when I'm downtown. Seriously though, I need more of that garlic sauce in my life.
Deliver for them a lot! Always smells sooo good. I've only gotten the chance to try their baklava tho which is the perfect pastry and so delicious.
Grand local avec terrasse arriere, bcp de tables, fast food, ca depanne ! Gyros, pita, poutine etc etc..

Had a great experience with one particular employee Johnnie who not only recommended great food but had a great attitude.  Totally made our night awesome. Food was great and baklava is a staple. Hands down the best I have ever had.

There are a couple good things about this place, none of which are the food.

The staff was friendly. The place is decently clean. The food though? The food was mediocre at best. I ordered a small falafel plate. It took 4 minutes to come out and they brought it to my table. It came with four falafel pieces on a bed of rice pilaf, a side of iceberg lettuce and chopped tomatoes with quarters of pita.

The falafel was burnt and when I tried to pierce a piece with my plastic fork, it nearly broke. The rice was bland. The lettuce and tomato was sad because I could tell the lettuce was old. The pita was hard and chewy and the hummus was too acidic. As for the sauces, their famous white sauce was basically mayo and their tahini was tasteless. It was actually all pretty tasteless. And for the price? It's an awful value for a mediocre meal. 

Overall, I would not recommend this place. The food isn't completely inedible, but for the price and quality, you're better off going somewhere else. Almost anywhere else.

Side notes, they don't offer tzatziki sauce and we overhead an employee pronounce gyro as "jie-row." If you were looking for an authentic Greek place, keep looking. This is not the place.
Everything i'm in NYC I have to get The Halah Guys so when it opened up in Vegas, I couldn't be happier! So good!

My first time trying gyro was an awesome experience! I heard this place was the bomb in Cali, and seeing the stars level here in Vegas I'm quite surprised. I actually really enjoyed everything from the minute I walked in to the minute I walked out.

Service- 5/5. Super nice and helpful. Very friendly and talkative!

Food- 4/5 Well obviously it's my first time having gyro so I can't compare it to anything else. It was delicious and filling and a great serving size seeing that it filled both the honey and I up. The white sauce is soooo yummy, whatever it is. And I really liked the flavor the jalapeños gave the meat. Pita bread all the way too, give me more of that!!!!

Price- 3/5 A little more on the pricey side. I mean it's just $1 more to get the large so why not get the large and save it for later if you can't finish it.

Location- 3/5 Seeing that it's located in Spring Mtn is good and bad. Bad cause it's far away from home!!!! And near the strip. But it's good because everything on that street is pretty much open late and they're open til 4am!!! WOW!

Overall, I like halal guys. Thank you for opening my eyes up to new things.

Excited try the Halal Guys from New York.
All employees are very cheerful. Was not disappointed - good food. Be careful about the hot sauce. It is HOT!!
Not enough dining area, parking was very difficult.
Wish they have a dress code. Several girls were there only bikini thong swimsuits. Not too classy.

I really liked the halal guys but I also went to their opening so service was on point!!

I tried the classic combo platter obviously and it was fantastic. The white sauce made it even better. I didn't try the hot sauce but heard it was was HOT HOT HOT!! It was delicious and filling!

I see a lot of people comparing it to the truck in NYC. Ive never had it but  now I want to try it to compare!!

They also gave us a piece of baklava afterwards. Key to my heart much??

I loved it there and would totally return although it's kind of far from me so I don't think I'd go out of my way.

Not worth it. We came here a week after their grand opening and waited almost an hour to try Halal Guys. The service here is good and the portions are decent but the food itself? Pretty underwhelming to say the least. We got a few platters to share and while the beef was solid the chicken was dry. Not too impressed by the falafel balls either. They were on the small side and also dry. The infamous white sauce was great but the spicy sauce? Man, is that spicy! I would recommend mixing it with the white sauce to create more of a spicy mayo or avoiding it all together. 

All in all, even without the long wait time I don't think I would come back. I can get the same dish at any other middle eastern restaurant for the fraction of the price. Or shell out money to get a great meal at Tabule.

The hype train that is Halal guys has finally arrived in Toronto. The food here comes in hearty portions but the star will always be their signature white sauce-make sure to ask for extra sauce! Otherwise, the flavour of the food is fairly bland without it...

This is one of those meals that you'd probably crave for once in a while, but it's not something you'd want to eat all the time. Worth checking out though Imo.
Excellent choice of meats and combinations. Never dry, always a nice tender juicy flavors. My favorite is the baklava. Prepared just the right sweetness and crunch!

Coming from Southeast Michigan, the Arab capital of North America, I am a bit of a Middle Eastern food snob. This place was aight but definitely not as good or fresh as the food back home. 

I took the Yelp tips seriously and ordered extra extra sauce on my mixed falafel and chicken bowl. I also opted against the supposedly super duper hot sauce. I think the extra sauce helped moisten the (somewhat dry) chicken and the (not so great) falafels. In the bowl, there was shredded taco-like lettuce and tomatoes that didn't add much to the flavor. The pita bread was dry and definitely wasn't fresh. Bowl toppings were limited and the kalamata olives added the most flavor. The small side of hummus ($1) wasn't the best and I actually ended up throwing it away. All in all, the food seemed a bit prefabricated and didn't seem as authentic or homemade as what I'm used to. 

I am sure this place is a nice, convenient option for some folks. The service was pleasant and efficient. I am glad I gave it a shot but I think I'd opt for another spot for my next Middle Eastern cuisine fix.
Great food, portions were decent. Spicy hummus, is very spicy. Usually spicy isn't spicy enough. We come often and plan to return.

I came here on my lunch break when i was attending a seminar at the Rio. This place was very close and I knew would be cheaper than the hotel's restaurants. The place was not busy at all so service was quick. Not to mention really friendly and helpful. I ordered the combo platter and that was more than enough for me. I couldn't finish it honestly. It was flavorful and that white sauce was a nice addition to my dish. Prices were not bad and I got a free baklava dessert with my yelp check in.

Finally had the opportunity to eat at Halal Guys.

Ordered the Beef Gyro and Chicken Platter, Chicken Gyro Sandwich and Beef Gyro Sandwich along with the Falafel. Both the Beef and Chicken are pretty good and we selected the white sauce over the meats. I am more a beef gyro person, but the chicken was also good and juicy considering it was mainly white meat and I prefer dark meat.

The combo platter comes in two sizes and includes a salad with slices of pita. 

Could really do without the Falafel which is a deep fried ball of peas.

The menu is simple and the counter is quick with prices geared more for lunch style prices. 

This restaurant was very hiped up coming to Tempe next to ASU and is in a nice small strip mall just North of the Dutch Bros. The good thing is the strip mall has not only Halal Guys but Even Stevens Sandwich Shop and Ahipoki getting ready to open soon.

Will definitely be back when I am around ASU.

Awesome! I've read bas reviews here and I can only imagine that it's coming from their Halal competition. I've been to the New York Cart several times..

Things I've read that are completely lies:

-Red sauce is not the same
correction: it's the same and it's damn hot and awesome if you like spicy

-they charge for extra sauce
correction: they never charged me for extra sauce and I ask for a lot on it plus extra packets

-They are twice the price
correction: their large platter is 12.99+tax (just a little under $15). The NYC cart is $7 USD (with the exchange rate that's $9.25 CAD). That's only a few $ more than in the US + you have to consider that we have much higher taxes and that the location is not in a food cart but an actual restaurant). When I heard Halal Guys was coming to Montreal, I expected it to be AT LEAST 2X  more and was more than willing to pay for it so I am pleasantly surprised about the current pricing.

-They doesn't taste like the other Halal restaurants in Montreal
Affirmation: You are absolutely right! And it's Soon much better than any other place in MTL, it beat all others I've tried and I can tell you that after living in Montreal for over 15 years.
Amazing staff and service! I've had better falafel here then in Jerusalem! Efficient assembly line style and a great price for excellent food!
I didnt like the gyro beef, it was too oily! I was comparing it to the beef ive tried in cali and ny. Too slow servers but great customer service. I would go back again to give it another try.

Great local Mediterranean and Middle Eastern restaurant... The food was cooked fresh to order and the portions were huge! The most delicious halal meat I've ever eaten in Las Vegas! The service was excellent and the prices were reasonable too. I would definitely recommend The Halal Guys to all my family and friends!
Ayeee for being the 500th review. I like it here becuase its a nice balanced meal. Good source of protein with nice flavor. A go to when in the area for lunch

Ive been to the Tempe location as well but this one is by far better! The staff knows what they are doing and my food was prepared quickly and accurately. I liked the addition of the veggies on top of the platters if you want them. They didn't have this the last time I ate her. The white sauce is really good and adds a nice flavor to the platters. The hot sauce is HOT! Proceed with caution! I add it myself by using a few drops and mixing it in. I can handle a good amount of spice but this hot sauce really is fire

I've been waiting for this place to open for over a month now! I love that it's open late on thurs fri and sats- 4 am! That's awesome. Seems like they are still working some kinks out with the new employees but the food was great! I ordered the regular platter with gyro. Next time I'll get the small I think. The hot sauce is freaking hot!!!!! Let this be a warning to you. It is not your average hot sauce. I used half of a packet and that was more than enough for me, it was soooo spicy and I can handle spicy pretty well. No wonder they only gave me 1 packet when I asked for the hot sauce on the side. The service was below average but I'll let that slide since they are brand new. They forgot my pita bread, which I didn't realize I was supposed to get until I heard someone else ask about it. The girl at the registered seemed to need a bit of help. But other than that I had a good dinner. Solid 4 stars. Wish there was better parking though, I parked behind the building and walked around front. Not sure if that's allowed?

I was super excited when I found out that they were finally going to open a Halal guys out here in Vegas. My husband kept talking about how good it was in New York so we were glad they decided to come out here. 

It's not the same as the original one in New York but the food was still delicious. The restaurant it self is very small inside with limited seating. We've never had the chance to dine in since there's never usually a table to sit at. I've personally been back a few times since they've opened and always get the combo, but will most likely try other things in the future.
